enum.name: GstAllocTraceFlags
enum.description: Flags indicating which tracing feature to enable.

enum.name: GstAllocatorFlags
enum.description: Flags for allocators.

parameter.name: GST_ALLOCATOR_FLAG_CUSTOM_ALLOC
parameter.parameter_description: The allocator has a custom alloc function.

parameter.name: GST_ALLOCATOR_FLAG_LAST
parameter.parameter_description: first flag that can be used for custom purposes

signal.name: GstAppSink::eos
signal.description: Signal that the end-of-stream has been reached. This signal is emitted from the streaming thread.

parameter.name: appsink
parameter.parameter_description: the appsink element that emitted the signal

signal.name: GstAppSink::new-preroll
signal.description:
Signal that a new preroll sample is available.
This signal is emitted from the streaming thread and only when the "emit-signals" property is %TRUE.
The new preroll sample can be retrieved with the "pull-preroll" action signal or gst_app_sink_pull_preroll() either from this signal callback or from any other thread.
Note that this signal is only emitted when the "emit-signals" property is set to %TRUE, which it is not by default for performance reasons.

parameter.name: appsink
parameter.parameter_description: the appsink element that emitted the signal

signal.name: GstAppSink::new-sample
signal.description:
Signal that a new sample is available.
This signal is emitted from the streaming thread and only when the "emit-signals" property is %TRUE.
The new sample can be retrieved with the "pull-sample" action signal or gst_app_sink_pull_sample() either from this signal callback or from any other thread.
Note that this signal is only emitted when the "emit-signals" property is set to %TRUE, which it is not by default for performance reasons.

parameter.name: appsink
parameter.parameter_description: the appsink element that emited the signal

signal.name: GstAppSink::pull-preroll
signal.description:
Get the last preroll sample in @appsink. This was the sample that caused the appsink to preroll in the PAUSED state. This sample can be pulled many times and remains available to the application even after EOS.
This function is typically used when dealing with a pipeline in the PAUSED state. Calling this function after doing a seek will give the sample right after the seek position.
Note that the preroll sample will also be returned as the first sample when calling gst_app_sink_pull_sample() or the "pull-sample" action signal.
If an EOS event was received before any buffers, this function returns %NULL. Use gst_app_sink_is_eos () to check for the EOS condition.
This function blocks until a preroll sample or EOS is received or the appsink element is set to the READY/NULL state.

parameter.name: appsink
parameter.parameter_description: the appsink element to emit this signal on

signal.return: a #GstSample or NULL when the appsink is stopped or EOS.

signal.name: GstAppSink::pull-sample
signal.description:
This function blocks until a sample or EOS becomes available or the appsink element is set to the READY/NULL state.
This function will only return samples when the appsink is in the PLAYING state. All rendered samples will be put in a queue so that the application can pull samples at its own rate.
Note that when the application does not pull samples fast enough, the queued samples could consume a lot of memory, especially when dealing with raw video frames. It's possible to control the behaviour of the queue with the "drop" and "max-buffers" properties.
If an EOS event was received before any buffers, this function returns %NULL. Use gst_app_sink_is_eos () to check for the EOS condition.

parameter.name: appsink
parameter.parameter_description: the appsink element to emit this signal on

signal.return: a #GstSample or NULL when the appsink is stopped or EOS.

signal.name: GstAppSink::wait-on-eos
signal.description:
Wait for all buffers to be processed after receiving an EOS.
In cases where it is uncertain if an @appsink will have a consumer for its buffers when it receives an EOS, set to %FALSE to ensure that the @appsink will not hang.

signal.name: GstAppSrc::block
signal.description: When max-bytes are queued and after the enough-data signal has been emitted, block any further push-buffer calls until the amount of queued bytes drops below the max-bytes limit.

signal.name: GstAppSrc::caps
signal.description: The GstCaps that will negotiated downstream and will be put on outgoing buffers.

signal.name: GstAppSrc::current-level-bytes
signal.description: The number of currently queued bytes inside appsrc.

signal.name: GstAppSrc::emit-signals
signal.description: Make appsrc emit the "need-data", "enough-data" and "seek-data" signals. This option is by default enabled for backwards compatibility reasons but can disabled when needed because signal emission is expensive.

signal.name: GstAppSrc::empty-percent
signal.description: Make appsrc emit the "need-data" signal when the amount of bytes in the queue drops below this percentage of max-bytes.

signal.name: GstAppSrc::end-of-stream
signal.description: Notify @appsrc that no more buffer are available.

signal.name: GstAppSrc::enough-data
signal.description: Signal that the source has enough data. It is recommended that the application stops calling push-buffer until the need-data signal is emitted again to avoid excessive buffer queueing.

parameter.name: appsrc
parameter.parameter_description: the appsrc element that emitted the signal

signal.name: GstAppSrc::format
signal.description: The format to use for segment events. When the source is producing timestamped buffers this property should be set to GST_FORMAT_TIME.

signal.name: GstAppSrc::is-live
signal.description: Instruct the source to behave like a live source. This includes that it will only push out buffers in the PLAYING state.

signal.name: GstAppSrc::max-bytes
signal.description: The maximum amount of bytes that can be queued internally. After the maximum amount of bytes are queued, appsrc will emit the "enough-data" signal.

signal.name: GstAppSrc::max-latency
signal.description: The maximum latency of the source. A value of -1 means an unlimited amout of latency.

signal.name: GstAppSrc::min-latency
signal.description: The minimum latency of the source. A value of -1 will use the default latency calculations of #GstBaseSrc.

signal.name: GstAppSrc::need-data

parameter.name: appsrc
parameter.parameter_description: the appsrc element that emitted the signal

signal.name: GstAppSrc::push-buffer
signal.description:
Adds a buffer to the queue of buffers that the appsrc element will push to its source pad. This function does not take ownership of the buffer so the buffer needs to be unreffed after calling this function.
When the block property is TRUE, this function can block until free space becomes available in the queue.

signal.name: GstAppSrc::push-sample
signal.description:
Extract a buffer from the provided sample and adds the extracted buffer to the queue of buffers that the appsrc element will push to its source pad. This function set the appsrc caps based on the caps in the sample and reset the caps if they change. Only the caps and the buffer of the provided sample are used and not for example the segment in the sample. This function does not take ownership of the sample so the sample needs to be unreffed after calling this function.
When the block property is TRUE, this function can block until free space becomes available in the queue.

parameter.name: sample
parameter.parameter_description: a sample from which extract buffer to push

signal.name: GstAppSrc::seek-data
signal.description: Seek to the given offset. The next push-buffer should produce buffers from the new @offset. This callback is only called for seekable stream types.

parameter.name: appsrc
parameter.parameter_description: the appsrc element that emitted the signal

signal.name: GstAppSrc::size
signal.description: The total size in bytes of the data stream. If the total size is known, it is recommended to configure it with this property.

signal.name: GstAppSrc::stream-type
signal.description: The type of stream that this source is producing. For seekable streams the application should connect to the seek-data signal.

enum.name: GstAppStreamType
enum.description: The stream type.

parameter.name: GST_APP_STREAM_TYPE_STREAM
parameter.parameter_description: No seeking is supported in the stream, such as a live stream.

parameter.name: GST_APP_STREAM_TYPE_SEEKABLE
parameter.parameter_description: The stream is seekable but seeking might not be very fast, such as data from a webserver.

parameter.name: GST_APP_STREAM_TYPE_RANDOM_ACCESS
parameter.parameter_description: The stream is seekable and seeking is fast, such as in a local file.

enum.name: GstAudioBaseSinkDiscontReason
enum.description: Different possible reasons for discontinuities. This enum is useful for the custom slave method.

parameter.name: GST_AUDIO_BASE_SINK_DISCONT_REASON_NEW_CAPS
parameter.parameter_description: New caps are set, causing renegotiotion

parameter.name: GST_AUDIO_BASE_SINK_DISCONT_REASON_SYNC_LATENCY
parameter.parameter_description: Sink was synchronized to the estimated latency (occurs during initialization)

parameter.name: GST_AUDIO_BASE_SINK_DISCONT_REASON_ALIGNMENT
parameter.parameter_description: Aligning buffers failed because the timestamps are too discontinuous

parameter.name: GST_AUDIO_BASE_SINK_DISCONT_REASON_DEVICE_FAILURE
parameter.parameter_description: Audio output device experienced and recovered from an error but introduced latency in the process (see also @gst_audio_base_sink_report_device_failure())

enum.name: GstAudioBaseSinkSlaveMethod
enum.description: Different possible clock slaving algorithms used when the internal audio clock is not selected as the pipeline master clock.

parameter.name: GST_AUDIO_BASE_SINK_SLAVE_RESAMPLE
parameter.parameter_description: Resample to match the master clock

parameter.name: GST_AUDIO_BASE_SINK_SLAVE_SKEW
parameter.parameter_description: Adjust playout pointer when master clock drifts too much.

enum.name: GstAudioBaseSrcSlaveMethod
enum.description: Different possible clock slaving algorithms when the internal audio clock was not selected as the pipeline clock.

parameter.name: GST_AUDIO_BASE_SRC_SLAVE_RESAMPLE
parameter.parameter_description: Resample to match the master clock.

parameter.name: GST_AUDIO_BASE_SRC_SLAVE_RETIMESTAMP
parameter.parameter_description: Retimestamp output buffers with master clock time.

parameter.name: GST_AUDIO_BASE_SRC_SLAVE_SKEW
parameter.parameter_description: Adjust capture pointer when master clock drifts too much.

enum.name: GstAudioCdSrcMode
enum.description: Mode in which the CD audio source operates. Influences timestamping, EOS handling and seeking.

parameter.name: GST_AUDIO_CD_SRC_MODE_NORMAL
parameter.parameter_description: each single track is a stream

parameter.name: GST_AUDIO_CD_SRC_MODE_CONTINUOUS

parameter.name: GST_AUDIO_CHANNEL_POSITION_MONO

parameter.name: GST_AUDIO_CHANNEL_POSITION_WIDE_LEFT

parameter.name: GST_AUDIO_CHANNEL_POSITION_WIDE_RIGHT

parameter.name: GST_AUDIO_CHANNEL_POSITION_SURROUND_LEFT

parameter.parameter_description: used for position-less channels, e.g. from a sound card that records 1024 channels; mutually exclusive with any other channel position

enum.description: Layout of the audio samples for the different channels.

enum.description: Set of available noise shaping methods

enum.description: The different flags that can be used when packing and unpacking.

parameter.name: GST_AUDIO_PACK_FLAG_TRUNCATE_RANGE
parameter.parameter_description: When the source has a smaller depth than the target format, set the least significant bits of the target to 0. This is likely sightly faster but less accurate. When this flag is not specified, the most significant bits of the source are duplicated in the least significant bits of the destination.

enum.description: Extra flags that can be passed to gst_audio_quantize_new()

enum.description: The format of the samples in the ringbuffer.

enum.name: GstAudioVisualizerShader

enum.name: GstBaseParseFrameFlags
enum.description: Flags to be used in a #GstBaseParseFrame.

parameter.name: GST_BASE_PARSE_FRAME_FLAG_NEW_FRAME
parameter.parameter_description: set by baseclass if current frame is passed for processing to the subclass for the first time (and not set on subsequent calls with same data).

parameter.name: GST_BASE_PARSE_FRAME_FLAG_NO_FRAME
parameter.parameter_description: set to indicate this buffer should not be counted as frame, e.g. if this frame is dependent on a previous one. As it is not counted as a frame, bitrate increases but frame to time conversions are maintained.

parameter.name: GST_BASE_PARSE_FRAME_FLAG_CLIP
GST_BASE_PARSE_FRAME_FLAG_DROP
parameter.parameter_description: indicates to @finish_frame that the the frame should be dropped (and might be handled internally by subclass)

parameter.name: GST_BASE_PARSE_FRAME_FLAG_QUEUE
parameter.parameter_description: indicates to @finish_frame that the the frame should be queued for now and processed fully later when the first non-queued frame is finished

enum.name: GstBaseSrcFlags
enum.description: The #GstElement flags that a basesrc element may have.

signal.name: GstBin::do-latency
signal.description:
Will be emitted when the bin needs to perform latency calculations. This signal is only emitted for toplevel bins or when async-handling is enabled.
Only one signal handler is invoked. If no signals are connected, the default handler is invoked, which will query and distribute the lowest possible latency to all sinks.
Connect to this signal if the default latency calculations are not sufficient, like when you need different latencies for different sinks in the same pipeline.

signal.name: GstBin::element-added
signal.description: Will be emitted after the element was added to the bin.

parameter.name: element
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstElement that was added to the bin

signal.name: GstBin::element-removed
signal.description: Will be emitted after the element was removed from the bin.

parameter.name: element
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstElement that was removed from the bin

enum.name: GstBinFlags
enum.description: GstBinFlags are a set of flags specific to bins. Most are set/used internally. They can be checked using the GST_OBJECT_FLAG_IS_SET () macro, and (un)set using GST_OBJECT_FLAG_SET () and GST_OBJECT_FLAG_UNSET ().

parameter.name: GST_BIN_FLAG_NO_RESYNC
parameter.parameter_description: don't resync a state change when elements are added or linked in the bin (Since 1.0.5)

parameter.name: GST_BIN_FLAG_LAST
parameter.parameter_description: the last enum in the series of flags for bins. Derived classes can use this as first value in a list of flags.

enum.name: GstBufferCopyFlags
enum.description: A set of flags that can be provided to the gst_buffer_copy_into() function to specify which items should be copied.

parameter.name: GST_BUFFER_COPY_FLAGS
parameter.parameter_description: flag indicating that buffer flags should be copied

parameter.name: GST_BUFFER_COPY_TIMESTAMPS
parameter.parameter_description: flag indicating that buffer pts, dts, duration, offset and offset_end should be copied

parameter.name: GST_BUFFER_COPY_MEMORY
parameter.parameter_description: flag indicating that buffer memory should be reffed and appended to already existing memory. Unless the memory is marked as NO_SHARE, no actual copy of the memory is made but it is simply reffed. Add @GST_BUFFER_COPY_DEEP to force a real copy.

parameter.name: GST_BUFFER_COPY_MERGE
parameter.parameter_description: flag indicating that buffer memory should be merged

parameter.name: GST_BUFFER_COPY_META
parameter.parameter_description: flag indicating that buffer meta should be copied

parameter.name: GST_BUFFER_COPY_DEEP
parameter.parameter_description: flag indicating that memory should always be copied instead of reffed (Since 1.2)

enum.name: GstBufferFlags
enum.description: A set of buffer flags used to describe properties of a #GstBuffer.

parameter.name: GST_BUFFER_FLAG_LIVE
parameter.parameter_description: the buffer is live data and should be discarded in the PAUSED state.

parameter.name: GST_BUFFER_FLAG_DECODE_ONLY
parameter.parameter_description: the buffer contains data that should be dropped because it will be clipped against the segment boundaries or because it does not contain data that should be shown to the user.

parameter.name: GST_BUFFER_FLAG_DISCONT
parameter.parameter_description: the buffer marks a data discontinuity in the stream. This typically occurs after a seek or a dropped buffer from a live or network source.

parameter.name: GST_BUFFER_FLAG_RESYNC
parameter.parameter_description: the buffer timestamps might have a discontinuity and this buffer is a good point to resynchronize.

parameter.name: GST_BUFFER_FLAG_MARKER
parameter.parameter_description: the buffer contains a media specific marker. for video this is typically the end of a frame boundary, for audio this is usually the start of a talkspurt.

parameter.name: GST_BUFFER_FLAG_HEADER
parameter.parameter_description: the buffer contains header information that is needed to decode the following data.

parameter.name: GST_BUFFER_FLAG_GAP
parameter.parameter_description: the buffer has been created to fill a gap in the stream and contains media neutral data (elements can switch to optimized code path that ignores the buffer content).

parameter.name: GST_BUFFER_FLAG_DROPPABLE
parameter.parameter_description: the buffer can be dropped without breaking the stream, for example to reduce bandwidth.

parameter.name: GST_BUFFER_FLAG_DELTA_UNIT
parameter.parameter_description: this unit cannot be decoded independently.

parameter.name: GST_BUFFER_FLAG_TAG_MEMORY
parameter.parameter_description: this flag is set when memory of the buffer is added/removed

parameter.name: GST_BUFFER_FLAG_SYNC_AFTER
parameter.parameter_description: Elements which write to disk or permanent storage should ensure the data is synced after writing the contents of this buffer. (Since 1.6)

parameter.name: GST_BUFFER_FLAG_LAST
parameter.parameter_description: additional media specific flags can be added starting from this flag.

enum.name: GstBufferPoolAcquireFlags
enum.description: Additional flags to control the allocation of a buffer

parameter.name: GST_BUFFER_POOL_ACQUIRE_FLAG_DONTWAIT
parameter.parameter_description: when the bufferpool is empty, acquire_buffer will by default block until a buffer is released into the pool again. Setting this flag makes acquire_buffer return #GST_FLOW_EOS instead of blocking.

parameter.name: GST_BUFFER_POOL_ACQUIRE_FLAG_LAST
parameter.parameter_description: last flag, subclasses can use private flags starting from this value.

enum.name: GstBufferingMode
enum.description: The different types of buffering methods.

parameter.name: GST_BUFFERING_STREAM
parameter.parameter_description: a small amount of data is buffered

parameter.name: GST_BUFFERING_TIMESHIFT
parameter.parameter_description: the stream is being downloaded in a ringbuffer

parameter.name: GST_BUFFERING_LIVE
parameter.parameter_description: the stream is a live stream

signal.name: GstBus::enable-async
signal.description:
Enable async message delivery support for bus watches, gst_bus_pop() and similar API. Without this only the synchronous message handlers are called.
This property is used to create the child element buses in #GstBin.

signal.name: GstBus::message
signal.description: A message has been posted on the bus. This signal is emitted from a GSource added to the mainloop. this signal will only be emitted when there is a mainloop running.

parameter.name: bus
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

parameter.name: message
parameter.parameter_description: the message that has been posted asynchronously

signal.name: GstBus::sync-message
signal.description:
A message has been posted on the bus. This signal is emitted from the thread that posted the message so one has to be careful with locking.
This signal will not be emitted by default, you have to call gst_bus_enable_sync_message_emission() before.

parameter.name: bus
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

parameter.name: message
parameter.parameter_description: the message that has been posted synchronously

enum.name: GstBusFlags
enum.description: The standard flags that a bus may have.

parameter.name: GST_BUS_FLUSHING
parameter.parameter_description: The bus is currently dropping all messages

enum.name: GstBusSyncReply
enum.description: The result values for a GstBusSyncHandler.

parameter.name: GST_BUS_PASS
parameter.parameter_description: pass the message to the async queue

parameter.name: GST_BUS_ASYNC
parameter.parameter_description: pass message to async queue, continue if message is handled

enum.name: GstCapsFlags
enum.description: Extra flags for a caps.

parameter.name: GST_CAPS_FLAG_ANY
parameter.parameter_description: Caps has no specific content, but can contain anything.

enum.name: GstCapsIntersectMode

signal.name: GstChildProxy::child-added
signal.description: Will be emitted after the @object was added to the @child_proxy.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the new child

signal.name: GstChildProxy::child-removed
signal.description: Will be emitted after the @object was removed from the @child_proxy.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the old child

signal.name: GstClock::synced
signal.description:
Signaled on clocks with GST_CLOCK_FLAG_NEEDS_STARTUP_SYNC set once the clock is synchronized, or when it completely lost synchronization. This signal will not be emitted on clocks without the flag.
This signal will be emitted from an arbitrary thread, most likely not the application's main thread.

parameter.name: synced
parameter.parameter_description: if the clock is synced now

enum.name: GstClockEntryType
enum.description: The type of the clock entry

enum.name: GstClockFlags
enum.description: The capabilities of this clock

parameter.name: GST_CLOCK_FLAG_CAN_DO_SINGLE_SYNC
parameter.parameter_description: clock can do a single sync timeout request

parameter.name: GST_CLOCK_FLAG_CAN_DO_SINGLE_ASYNC
parameter.parameter_description: clock can do a single async timeout request

parameter.name: GST_CLOCK_FLAG_CAN_DO_PERIODIC_SYNC
parameter.parameter_description: clock can do sync periodic timeout requests

parameter.name: GST_CLOCK_FLAG_CAN_DO_PERIODIC_ASYNC
parameter.parameter_description: clock can do async periodic timeout callbacks

parameter.name: GST_CLOCK_FLAG_CAN_SET_MASTER
parameter.parameter_description: clock can be slaved to a master clock

parameter.name: GST_CLOCK_FLAG_NEEDS_STARTUP_SYNC
parameter.parameter_description: clock needs to be synced before it can be used (Since 1.6)

parameter.name: GST_CLOCK_FLAG_LAST
parameter.parameter_description: subclasses can add additional flags starting from this flag

enum.name: GstClockReturn
enum.description: The return value of a clock operation.

parameter.name: GST_CLOCK_EARLY
parameter.parameter_description: The operation was scheduled too late.

parameter.name: GST_CLOCK_BADTIME
parameter.parameter_description: A bad time was provided to a function.

enum.name: GstClockType
enum.description: The different kind of clocks.

parameter.name: GST_CLOCK_TYPE_MONOTONIC
parameter.parameter_description: monotonic time since some unspecified starting point

parameter.name: GST_CLOCK_TYPE_OTHER
parameter.parameter_description: some other time source is used (Since 1.0.5)

parameter.name: GST_COLLECT_PADS_STATE_EOS
parameter.parameter_description: Set if collectdata's pad is EOS.

parameter.name: GST_COLLECT_PADS_STATE_FLUSHING
parameter.parameter_description: Set if collectdata's pad is flushing.

parameter.name: GST_COLLECT_PADS_STATE_NEW_SEGMENT
parameter.parameter_description: Set if collectdata's pad received a new_segment event.

parameter.name: GST_COLLECT_PADS_STATE_WAITING
parameter.parameter_description: Set if collectdata's pad must be waited for when collecting.

parameter.name: GST_COLLECT_PADS_STATE_LOCKED
parameter.parameter_description: Set collectdata's pad WAITING state must not be changed. #GstCollectPadsStateFlags indicate private state of a collectdata('s pad).

signal.name: GstColorBalance::value-changed
signal.description: Fired when the value of the indicated channel has changed.

signal.name: GstColorBalanceChannel::value-changed
signal.description: Fired when the value of the indicated channel has changed.

enum.name: GstColorBalanceType
enum.description: An enumeration indicating whether an element implements color balancing operations in software or in dedicated hardware. In general, dedicated hardware implementations (such as those provided by xvimagesink) are preferred.

parameter.name: GST_COLOR_BALANCE_HARDWARE
parameter.parameter_description: Color balance is implemented with dedicated hardware.

parameter.name: GST_COLOR_BALANCE_SOFTWARE
parameter.parameter_description: Color balance is implemented via software processing.

enum.name: GstCoreError
enum.description: Core errors are errors inside the core GStreamer library.

parameter.name: GST_CORE_ERROR_FAILED
parameter.parameter_description: a general error which doesn't fit in any other category. Make sure you add a custom message to the error call.

parameter.name: GST_CORE_ERROR_TOO_LAZY
parameter.parameter_description: do not use this except as a placeholder for deciding where to go while developing code.

parameter.name: GST_CORE_ERROR_NOT_IMPLEMENTED
parameter.parameter_description: use this when you do not want to implement this functionality yet.

parameter.name: GST_CORE_ERROR_MISSING_PLUGIN
parameter.parameter_description: used if a plugin is missing.

parameter.name: GST_CORE_ERROR_DISABLED
parameter.parameter_description: used if functionality has been disabled at compile time.

parameter.name: GST_CORE_ERROR_NUM_ERRORS
parameter.parameter_description: the number of core error types.

signal.name: GstDataQueue::empty
signal.description: Reports that the queue became empty (empty). A queue is empty if the total amount of visible items inside it (num-visible, time, size) is lower than the boundary values which can be set through the GObject properties.

signal.name: GstDataQueue::full
signal.description: Reports that the queue became full (full). A queue is full if the total amount of data inside it (num-visible, time, size) is higher than the boundary values which can be set through the GObject properties.

enum.name: GstDebugColorFlags
enum.description: These are some terminal style flags you can use when creating your debugging categories to make them stand out in debugging output.

parameter.name: GST_DEBUG_COLOR_MODE_OFF
parameter.parameter_description: Do not use colors in logs.

parameter.name: GST_DEBUG_COLOR_MODE_ON
parameter.parameter_description: Paint logs in a platform-specific way.

parameter.name: GST_DEBUG_COLOR_MODE_UNIX
parameter.parameter_description: Paint logs with UNIX terminal color codes no matter what platform GStreamer is running on.

enum.name: GstDebugGraphDetails
enum.description: Available details for pipeline graphs produced by GST_DEBUG_BIN_TO_DOT_FILE() and GST_DEBUG_BIN_TO_DOT_FILE_WITH_TS().

parameter.name: GST_DEBUG_GRAPH_SHOW_FULL_PARAMS
parameter.parameter_description: show full element parameter values even if they are very long

parameter.name: GST_DEBUG_GRAPH_SHOW_ALL
parameter.parameter_description: show all the typical details that one might want

parameter.name: GST_DEBUG_GRAPH_SHOW_VERBOSE
parameter.parameter_description: show all details regardless of how large or verbose they make the resulting output

enum.name: GstDebugLevel
enum.description: The level defines the importance of a debugging message. The more important a message is, the greater the probability that the debugging system outputs it.

parameter.name: GST_LEVEL_NONE
parameter.parameter_description: No debugging level specified or desired. Used to deactivate debugging output.

parameter.name: GST_LEVEL_ERROR
parameter.parameter_description: Error messages are to be used only when an error occurred that stops the application from keeping working correctly. An examples is gst_element_error, which outputs a message with this priority. It does not mean that the application is terminating as with g_error.

parameter.name: GST_LEVEL_WARNING
parameter.parameter_description: Warning messages are to inform about abnormal behaviour that could lead to problems or weird behaviour later on. An example of this would be clocking issues ("your computer is pretty slow") or broken input data ("Can't synchronize to stream.")

parameter.name: GST_LEVEL_FIXME
parameter.parameter_description: Fixme messages are messages that indicate that something in the executed code path is not fully implemented or handled yet. Note that this does not replace proper error handling in any way, the purpose of this message is to make it easier to spot incomplete/unfinished pieces of code when reading the debug log.

parameter.name: GST_LEVEL_INFO
parameter.parameter_description: Informational messages should be used to keep the developer updated about what is happening. Examples where this should be used are when a typefind function has successfully determined the type of the stream or when an mp3 plugin detects the format to be used. ("This file has mono sound.")

parameter.name: GST_LEVEL_DEBUG
parameter.parameter_description: Debugging messages should be used when something common happens that is not the expected default behavior, or something that's useful to know but doesn't happen all the time (ie. per loop iteration or buffer processed or event handled). An example would be notifications about state changes or receiving/sending of events.

parameter.name: GST_LEVEL_LOG
parameter.parameter_description: Log messages are messages that are very common but might be useful to know. As a rule of thumb a pipeline that is running as expected should never output anything else but LOG messages whilst processing data. Use this log level to log recurring information in chain functions and loop functions, for example.

parameter.name: GST_LEVEL_TRACE
parameter.parameter_description: Tracing-related messages. Examples for this are referencing/dereferencing of objects.

parameter.name: GST_LEVEL_MEMDUMP
parameter.parameter_description: memory dump messages are used to log (small) chunks of data as memory dumps in the log. They will be displayed as hexdump with ASCII characters.

parameter.name: GST_LEVEL_COUNT
parameter.parameter_description: The number of defined debugging levels.

signal.name: GstDiscoverer::discovered
signal.description:
Will be emitted in async mode when all information on a URI could be discovered, or an error occurred.
When an error occurs, @info might still contain some partial information, depending on the circumstances of the error.

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: #GError, which will be non-NULL if an error occurred during discovery. You must not free this #GError, it will be freed by the discoverer.

signal.name: GstDiscoverer::finished
signal.description: Will be emitted in async mode when all pending URIs have been processed.

signal.name: GstDiscoverer::source-setup
signal.description:
This signal is emitted after the source element has been created for, so the URI being discovered, so it can be configured by setting additional properties (e.g. set a proxy server for an http source, or set the device and read speed for an audio cd source).
This signal is usually emitted from the context of a GStreamer streaming thread.

signal.name: GstDiscoverer::starting
signal.description: Will be emitted when the discover starts analyzing the pending URIs

enum.name: GstDiscovererResult
enum.description: Result values for the discovery process.

parameter.name: GST_DISCOVERER_ERROR
parameter.parameter_description: an error happened and the GError is set

parameter.name: GST_DISCOVERER_BUSY
parameter.parameter_description: the discoverer was already discovering a file

parameter.name: GST_DISCOVERER_MISSING_PLUGINS
parameter.parameter_description: Some plugins are missing for full discovery

enum.name: GstDiscovererSerializeFlags
enum.description: You can use these flags to control what is serialized by gst_discoverer_info_to_variant()

parameter.name: GST_DISCOVERER_SERIALIZE_BASIC
parameter.parameter_description: Serialize only basic information, excluding caps, tags and miscellaneous information

parameter.name: GST_DISCOVERER_SERIALIZE_CAPS
parameter.parameter_description: Serialize the caps for each stream

parameter.name: GST_DISCOVERER_SERIALIZE_TAGS
parameter.parameter_description: Serialize the tags for each stream

parameter.name: GST_DISCOVERER_SERIALIZE_MISC
parameter.parameter_description: Serialize miscellaneous information for each stream

parameter.name: GST_DISCOVERER_SERIALIZE_ALL
parameter.parameter_description: Serialize all the available info, including caps, tags and miscellaneous information

signal.name: GstElement::no-more-pads
signal.description: This signals that the element will not generate more dynamic pads. Note that this signal will usually be emitted from the context of the streaming thread.

parameter.name: gstelement
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GstElement::pad-added
signal.description: a new #GstPad has been added to the element. Note that this signal will usually be emitted from the context of the streaming thread. Also keep in mind that if you add new elements to the pipeline in the signal handler you will need to set them to the desired target state with gst_element_set_state() or gst_element_sync_state_with_parent().

parameter.name: gstelement
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

parameter.name: new_pad
parameter.parameter_description: the pad that has been added

signal.name: GstElement::pad-removed
signal.description: a #GstPad has been removed from the element

parameter.name: gstelement
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

parameter.name: old_pad
parameter.parameter_description: the pad that has been removed

enum.name: GstElementFlags
enum.description: The standard flags that an element may have.

parameter.name: GST_ELEMENT_FLAG_PROVIDE_CLOCK
parameter.parameter_description: the element can provide a clock

parameter.name: GST_ELEMENT_FLAG_INDEXABLE
parameter.parameter_description: the element can use an index

enum.name: GstEventType
enum.description:
#GstEventType lists the standard event types that can be sent in a pipeline.
The custom event types can be used for private messages between elements that can't be expressed using normal GStreamer buffer passing semantics. Custom events carry an arbitrary #GstStructure. Specific custom events are distinguished by the name of the structure.

parameter.name: GST_EVENT_FLUSH_START
parameter.parameter_description: Start a flush operation. This event clears all data from the pipeline and unblock all streaming threads.

parameter.name: GST_EVENT_FLUSH_STOP
parameter.parameter_description: Stop a flush operation. This event resets the running-time of the pipeline.

parameter.name: GST_EVENT_STREAM_START
parameter.parameter_description: Event to mark the start of a new stream. Sent before any other serialized event and only sent at the start of a new stream, not after flushing seeks.

parameter.name: GST_EVENT_CAPS
parameter.parameter_description: #GstCaps event. Notify the pad of a new media type.

parameter.name: GST_EVENT_SEGMENT
parameter.parameter_description: A new media segment follows in the dataflow. The segment events contains information for clipping buffers and converting buffer timestamps to running-time and stream-time.

parameter.name: GST_EVENT_TAG
parameter.parameter_description: A new set of metadata tags has been found in the stream.

parameter.name: GST_EVENT_BUFFERSIZE
parameter.parameter_description: Notification of buffering requirements. Currently not used yet.

parameter.name: GST_EVENT_SINK_MESSAGE
parameter.parameter_description: An event that sinks turn into a message. Used to send messages that should be emitted in sync with rendering.

parameter.name: GST_EVENT_EOS
parameter.parameter_description: End-Of-Stream. No more data is to be expected to follow without a SEGMENT event.

parameter.name: GST_EVENT_SEGMENT_DONE
parameter.parameter_description: Marks the end of a segment playback.

parameter.name: GST_EVENT_GAP
parameter.parameter_description: Marks a gap in the datastream.

parameter.name: GST_EVENT_TOC
parameter.parameter_description: An event which indicates that a new table of contents (TOC) was found or updated.

parameter.name: GST_EVENT_PROTECTION
parameter.parameter_description: An event which indicates that new or updated encryption information has been found in the stream.

parameter.name: GST_EVENT_QOS
parameter.parameter_description: A quality message. Used to indicate to upstream elements that the downstream elements should adjust their processing rate.

parameter.name: GST_EVENT_SEEK
parameter.parameter_description: A request for a new playback position and rate.

parameter.name: GST_EVENT_NAVIGATION
parameter.parameter_description: Navigation events are usually used for communicating user requests, such as mouse or keyboard movements, to upstream elements.

parameter.name: GST_EVENT_LATENCY
parameter.parameter_description: Notification of new latency adjustment. Sinks will use the latency information to adjust their synchronisation.

parameter.name: GST_EVENT_STEP
parameter.parameter_description: A request for stepping through the media. Sinks will usually execute the step operation.

parameter.name: GST_EVENT_RECONFIGURE
parameter.parameter_description: A request for upstream renegotiating caps and reconfiguring.

parameter.name: GST_EVENT_TOC_SELECT
parameter.parameter_description: A request for a new playback position based on TOC entry's UID.

parameter.name: GST_EVENT_CUSTOM_DOWNSTREAM
parameter.parameter_description: Downstream custom event that travels in the data flow.

parameter.name: GST_EVENT_CUSTOM_BOTH
parameter.parameter_description: Custom upstream or downstream event. In-band when travelling downstream.

parameter.name: GST_EVENT_CUSTOM_BOTH_OOB
parameter.parameter_description: Custom upstream or downstream out-of-band event.

enum.name: GstEventTypeFlags
enum.description: #GstEventTypeFlags indicate the aspects of the different #GstEventType values. You can get the type flags of a #GstEventType with the gst_event_type_get_flags() function.

parameter.name: GST_EVENT_TYPE_UPSTREAM
parameter.parameter_description: Set if the event can travel upstream.

parameter.name: GST_EVENT_TYPE_DOWNSTREAM
parameter.parameter_description: Set if the event can travel downstream.

parameter.name: GST_EVENT_TYPE_SERIALIZED
parameter.parameter_description: Set if the event should be serialized with data flow.

parameter.name: GST_EVENT_TYPE_STICKY
parameter.parameter_description: Set if the event is sticky on the pads.

parameter.name: GST_EVENT_TYPE_STICKY_MULTI
parameter.parameter_description: Multiple sticky events can be on a pad, each identified by the event name.

enum.name: GstFFTWindow
enum.description: The various window functions available.

enum.name: GstFactoryListType
enum.description:
The type of #GstElementFactory to filter.
All @GstFactoryListType up to @GST_ELEMENT_FACTORY_TYPE_MAX_ELEMENTS are exclusive.
If one or more of the MEDIA types are specified, then only elements matching the specified media types will be selected.

enum.name: GstFdMemoryFlags
enum.description: Various flags to control the operation of the fd backed memory.

parameter.name: GST_FD_MEMORY_FLAG_KEEP_MAPPED
parameter.parameter_description: once the memory is mapped, keep it mapped until the memory is destroyed.

parameter.name: GST_FD_MEMORY_FLAG_MAP_PRIVATE
parameter.parameter_description: do a private mapping instead of the default shared mapping.

enum.name: GstFlowReturn
enum.description:
The result of passing data to a pad.
Note that the custom return values should not be exposed outside of the element scope.

parameter.name: GST_FLOW_ERROR
parameter.parameter_description: Some (fatal) error occurred. Element generating this error should post an error message with more details.

parameter.name: GST_FLOW_CUSTOM_SUCCESS
parameter.parameter_description: Elements can use values starting from this (and higher) to define custom success codes.

parameter.name: GST_FLOW_CUSTOM_SUCCESS_1
parameter.parameter_description: Pre-defined custom success code (define your custom success code to this to avoid compiler warnings).

parameter.name: GST_FLOW_CUSTOM_ERROR
parameter.parameter_description: Elements can use values starting from this (and lower) to define custom error codes.

parameter.name: GST_FLOW_CUSTOM_ERROR_1
parameter.parameter_description: Pre-defined custom error code (define your custom error code to this to avoid compiler warnings).

enum.name: GstFormat
enum.description: Standard predefined formats

parameter.name: GST_FORMAT_DEFAULT
parameter.parameter_description: the default format of the pad/element. This can be samples for raw audio, frames/fields for raw video (some, but not all, elements support this; use @GST_FORMAT_TIME if you don't have a good reason to query for samples/frames)

parameter.name: GST_FORMAT_BUFFERS
parameter.parameter_description: buffers (few, if any, elements implement this as of May 2009)

parameter.name: GST_FORMAT_PERCENT
parameter.parameter_description: percentage of stream (few, if any, elements implement this as of May 2009)

signal.name: GstIndex::entry-added
signal.description: Is emitted when a new entry is added to the index.

parameter.name: gstindex
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

parameter.name: arg1
parameter.parameter_description: The entry added to the index.

enum.name: GstIndexAssociationFlags
enum.description: Flags for an association entry.

parameter.name: GST_INDEX_ASSOCIATION_FLAG_KEY_UNIT
parameter.parameter_description: the entry marks a key unit, a key unit is one that marks a place where one can randomly seek to.

parameter.name: GST_INDEX_ASSOCIATION_FLAG_DELTA_UNIT
parameter.parameter_description: the entry marks a delta unit, a delta unit is one that marks a place where one can relatively seek to.

parameter.name: GST_INDEX_ASSOCIATION_FLAG_LAST
parameter.parameter_description: extra user defined flags should start here.

enum.name: GstIndexCertainty
enum.description: The certainty of a group in the index.

enum.name: GstIndexEntryType
enum.description: The different types of entries in the index.

parameter.name: GST_INDEX_ENTRY_ID
parameter.parameter_description: This entry is an id that maps an index id to its owner object

parameter.name: GST_INDEX_ENTRY_ASSOCIATION
parameter.parameter_description: This entry is an association between formats

enum.name: GstIndexFlags
enum.description: Flags for this index

parameter.name: GST_INDEX_FLAG_LAST
parameter.parameter_description: First flag that can be used by subclasses

enum.name: GstIndexLookupMethod
enum.description: Specify the method to find an index entry in the index.

parameter.name: GST_INDEX_LOOKUP_EXACT
parameter.parameter_description: There has to be an exact indexentry with the given format/value

parameter.name: GST_INDEX_LOOKUP_BEFORE
parameter.parameter_description: The exact entry or the one before it

parameter.name: GST_INDEX_LOOKUP_AFTER
parameter.parameter_description: The exact entry or the one after it

enum.name: GstIndexResolverMethod
enum.description: The method used to resolve index writers

parameter.name: GST_INDEX_RESOLVER_GTYPE
parameter.parameter_description: Resolve based on the GType of the object

parameter.name: GST_INDEX_RESOLVER_PATH
parameter.parameter_description: Resolve on the path in graph

enum.name: GstInstallPluginsReturn
enum.description:
Result codes returned by gst_install_plugins_async() and gst_install_plugins_sync(), and also the result code passed to the #GstInstallPluginsResultFunc specified with gst_install_plugins_async().
These codes indicate success or failure of starting an external installer program and to what extent the requested plugins could be installed.

parameter.name: GST_INSTALL_PLUGINS_SUCCESS
parameter.parameter_description: all of the requested plugins could be installed

parameter.name: GST_INSTALL_PLUGINS_NOT_FOUND
parameter.parameter_description: no appropriate installation candidate for any of the requested plugins could be found. Only return this if nothing has been installed. Return #GST_INSTALL_PLUGINS_PARTIAL_SUCCESS if some (but not all) of the requested plugins could be installed.

parameter.name: GST_INSTALL_PLUGINS_ERROR
parameter.parameter_description: an error occured during the installation. If this happens, the user has already seen an error message and another one should not be displayed

parameter.name: GST_INSTALL_PLUGINS_CRASHED
parameter.parameter_description: the installer had an unclean exit code (ie. death by signal)

parameter.name: GST_INSTALL_PLUGINS_PARTIAL_SUCCESS
parameter.parameter_description: some of the requested plugins could be installed, but not all

parameter.name: GST_INSTALL_PLUGINS_USER_ABORT
parameter.parameter_description: the user has aborted the installation

parameter.name: GST_INSTALL_PLUGINS_INVALID
parameter.parameter_description: the helper returned an invalid status code

parameter.name: GST_INSTALL_PLUGINS_STARTED_OK
parameter.parameter_description: returned by gst_install_plugins_async() to indicate that everything went fine so far and the provided callback will be called with the result of the installation later

parameter.name: GST_INSTALL_PLUGINS_INTERNAL_FAILURE
parameter.parameter_description: some internal failure has occured when trying to start the installer

parameter.name: GST_INSTALL_PLUGINS_HELPER_MISSING
parameter.parameter_description: the helper script to call the actual installer is not installed

parameter.name: GST_INSTALL_PLUGINS_INSTALL_IN_PROGRESS
parameter.parameter_description: a previously-started plugin installation is still in progress, try again later

enum.name: GstInterpolationMode
enum.description: The various interpolation modes available.

parameter.name: GST_INTERPOLATION_MODE_CUBIC
parameter.parameter_description: cubic interpolation (natural), may overshoot the min or max values set by the control point, but is more 'curvy'

parameter.name: GST_INTERPOLATION_MODE_CUBIC_MONOTONIC
parameter.parameter_description: monotonic cubic interpolation, will not produce any values outside of the min-max range set by the control points (Since 1.8)

enum.name: GstIteratorItem
enum.description: The result of a #GstIteratorItemFunction.

enum.name: GstIteratorResult
enum.description: The result of gst_iterator_next().

parameter.name: GST_ITERATOR_DONE
parameter.parameter_description: No more items in the iterator

enum.name: GstLFOWaveform
enum.description: The various waveform modes available.

enum.name: GstLibraryError
enum.description: Library errors are for errors from the library being used by elements (initializing, finalizing, settings, ...)

parameter.name: GST_LIBRARY_ERROR_FAILED
parameter.parameter_description: a general error which doesn't fit in any other category. Make sure you add a custom message to the error call.

parameter.name: GST_LIBRARY_ERROR_TOO_LAZY
parameter.parameter_description: do not use this except as a placeholder for deciding where to go while developing code.

parameter.name: GST_LIBRARY_ERROR_INIT
parameter.parameter_description: used when the library could not be opened.

parameter.name: GST_LIBRARY_ERROR_SHUTDOWN
parameter.parameter_description: used when the library could not be closed.

parameter.name: GST_LIBRARY_ERROR_SETTINGS
parameter.parameter_description: used when the library doesn't accept settings.

parameter.name: GST_LIBRARY_ERROR_ENCODE
parameter.parameter_description: used when the library generated an encoding error.

parameter.name: GST_LIBRARY_ERROR_NUM_ERRORS
parameter.parameter_description: the number of library error types.

enum.name: GstLockFlags
enum.description: Flags used when locking miniobjects

parameter.name: GST_LOCK_FLAG_LAST
parameter.parameter_description: first flag that can be used for custom purposes

enum.name: GstMIKEYCacheType
enum.description: The different cache types

parameter.name: GST_MIKEY_CACHE_NONE
parameter.parameter_description: The envelope key MUST NOT be cached

parameter.name: GST_MIKEY_CACHE_ALWAYS
parameter.parameter_description: The envelope key MUST be cached

parameter.name: GST_MIKEY_CACHE_FOR_CSB
parameter.parameter_description: The envelope key MUST be cached, but only to be used for the specific CSB.

enum.name: GstMIKEYEncAlg
enum.description: The encryption algorithm used to encrypt the Encr data field

parameter.name: GST_MIKEY_ENC_AES_KW_128
parameter.parameter_description: AES Key Wrap using a 128-bit key

enum.name: GstMIKEYKVType
enum.description: The key validity type

parameter.name: GST_MIKEY_KV_SPI
parameter.parameter_description: The key is associated with the SPI/MKI

parameter.name: GST_MIKEY_KV_INTERVAL
parameter.parameter_description: The key has a start and expiration time

enum.name: GstMIKEYKeyDataType
enum.description: The type of key.

enum.name: GstMIKEYMacAlg
enum.description: Specifies the authentication algorithm used

enum.name: GstMIKEYMapType
enum.description: Specifies the method of uniquely mapping Crypto Sessions to the security protocol sessions.

enum.name: GstMIKEYPRFFunc
enum.description: The PRF function that has been/will be used for key derivation

enum.name: GstMIKEYPayloadType
enum.description: Different MIKEY Payload types.

enum.name: GstMIKEYSecProto
enum.description: Specifies the security protocol

enum.name: GstMIKEYSecSRTP
enum.description: This policy specifies the parameters for SRTP and SRTCP

parameter.name: GST_MIKEY_SP_SRTP_SRTP_ENC
parameter.parameter_description: SRTP encryption off/on, 0 if off, 1 if on

parameter.name: GST_MIKEY_SP_SRTP_SRTCP_ENC
parameter.parameter_description: SRTCP encryption off/on, 0 if off, 1 if on

parameter.name: GST_MIKEY_SP_SRTP_SRTP_AUTH
parameter.parameter_description: SRTP authentication off/on, 0 if off, 1 if on

enum.name: GstMIKEYTSType
enum.description: Specifies the timestamp type.

parameter.name: GST_MIKEY_TS_TYPE_NTP_UTC
parameter.parameter_description: an NTP time in UTC timezone

enum.name: GstMIKEYType
enum.description: Different MIKEY data types.

parameter.name: GST_MIKEY_TYPE_PSK_VERIFY
parameter.parameter_description: Verification message of a Pre-shared key message

parameter.name: GST_MIKEY_TYPE_PK_VERIFY
parameter.parameter_description: Verification message of a public-key message

enum.name: GstMapFlags
enum.description: Flags used when mapping memory

parameter.name: GST_MAP_FLAG_LAST
parameter.parameter_description: first flag that can be used for custom purposes

enum.name: GstMemoryFlags
enum.description: Flags for wrapped memory.

parameter.name: GST_MEMORY_FLAG_READONLY
parameter.parameter_description: memory is readonly. It is not allowed to map the memory with #GST_MAP_WRITE.

parameter.name: GST_MEMORY_FLAG_NO_SHARE
parameter.parameter_description: memory must not be shared. Copies will have to be made when this memory needs to be shared between buffers.

parameter.name: GST_MEMORY_FLAG_ZERO_PREFIXED
parameter.parameter_description: the memory prefix is filled with 0 bytes

parameter.name: GST_MEMORY_FLAG_ZERO_PADDED
parameter.parameter_description: the memory padding is filled with 0 bytes

parameter.name: GST_MEMORY_FLAG_NOT_MAPPABLE
parameter.parameter_description: the memory can't be mapped via gst_memory_map() without any preconditions. (Since 1.2)

parameter.name: GST_MEMORY_FLAG_LAST
parameter.parameter_description: first flag that can be used for custom purposes

enum.name: GstMessageType
enum.description: The different message types that are available.

parameter.name: GST_MESSAGE_EOS
parameter.parameter_description: end-of-stream reached in a pipeline. The application will only receive this message in the PLAYING state and every time it sets a pipeline to PLAYING that is in the EOS state. The application can perform a flushing seek in the pipeline, which will undo the EOS state again.

parameter.name: GST_MESSAGE_ERROR
parameter.parameter_description: an error occurred. When the application receives an error message it should stop playback of the pipeline and not assume that more data will be played.

parameter.name: GST_MESSAGE_BUFFERING
parameter.parameter_description: the pipeline is buffering. When the application receives a buffering message in the PLAYING state for a non-live pipeline it must PAUSE the pipeline until the buffering completes, when the percentage field in the message is 100%. For live pipelines, no action must be performed and the buffering percentage can be used to inform the user about the progress.

parameter.name: GST_MESSAGE_STATE_DIRTY
parameter.parameter_description: an element changed state in a streaming thread. This message is deprecated.

parameter.name: GST_MESSAGE_CLOCK_PROVIDE
parameter.parameter_description: an element notifies its capability of providing a clock. This message is used internally and never forwarded to the application.

parameter.name: GST_MESSAGE_CLOCK_LOST
parameter.parameter_description: The current clock as selected by the pipeline became unusable. The pipeline will select a new clock on the next PLAYING state change. The application should set the pipeline to PAUSED and back to PLAYING when this message is received.

parameter.name: GST_MESSAGE_NEW_CLOCK
parameter.parameter_description: a new clock was selected in the pipeline.

parameter.name: GST_MESSAGE_STRUCTURE_CHANGE
parameter.parameter_description: the structure of the pipeline changed. This message is used internally and never forwarded to the application.

parameter.name: GST_MESSAGE_STREAM_STATUS
parameter.parameter_description: status about a stream, emitted when it starts, stops, errors, etc..

parameter.name: GST_MESSAGE_APPLICATION
parameter.parameter_description: message posted by the application, possibly via an application-specific element.

parameter.name: GST_MESSAGE_ELEMENT
parameter.parameter_description: element-specific message, see the specific element's documentation

parameter.name: GST_MESSAGE_SEGMENT_START
parameter.parameter_description: pipeline started playback of a segment. This message is used internally and never forwarded to the application.

parameter.name: GST_MESSAGE_SEGMENT_DONE
GST_MESSAGE_DURATION_CHANGED
parameter.parameter_description: The duration of a pipeline changed. The application can get the new duration with a duration query.

parameter.name: GST_MESSAGE_ASYNC_START
parameter.parameter_description: Posted by elements when they start an ASYNC #GstStateChange. This message is not forwarded to the application but is used internally.

parameter.name: GST_MESSAGE_ASYNC_DONE
parameter.parameter_description: Posted by elements when they complete an ASYNC #GstStateChange. The application will only receive this message from the toplevel pipeline.

parameter.name: GST_MESSAGE_LATENCY
parameter.parameter_description: Posted by elements when their latency changes. The application should recalculate and distribute a new latency.

parameter.name: GST_MESSAGE_REQUEST_STATE
parameter.parameter_description: Posted by elements when they want the pipeline to change state. This message is a suggestion to the application which can decide to perform the state change on (part of) the pipeline.

parameter.name: GST_MESSAGE_QOS
parameter.parameter_description: A buffer was dropped or an element changed its processing strategy for Quality of Service reasons.

parameter.name: GST_MESSAGE_TOC
parameter.parameter_description: A new table of contents (TOC) was found or previously found TOC was updated.

parameter.name: GST_MESSAGE_RESET_TIME
parameter.parameter_description: Message to request resetting the pipeline's running time from the pipeline. This is an internal message which applications will likely never receive.

parameter.name: GST_MESSAGE_STREAM_START
parameter.parameter_description: Message indicating start of a new stream. Useful e.g. when using playbin in gapless playback mode, to get notified when the next title actually starts playing (which will be some time after the URI for the next title has been set).

parameter.name: GST_MESSAGE_NEED_CONTEXT
parameter.parameter_description: Message indicating that an element wants a specific context (Since 1.2)

parameter.name: GST_MESSAGE_HAVE_CONTEXT
parameter.parameter_description: Message indicating that an element created a context (Since 1.2)

parameter.name: GST_MESSAGE_EXTENDED
parameter.parameter_description: Message is an extended message type (see below). These extended message IDs can't be used directly with mask-based API like gst_bus_poll() or gst_bus_timed_pop_filtered(), but you can still filter for GST_MESSAGE_EXTENDED and then check the result for the specific type. (Since 1.4)

parameter.name: GST_MESSAGE_DEVICE_ADDED
parameter.parameter_description: Message indicating a #GstDevice was added to a #GstDeviceProvider (Since 1.4)

parameter.name: GST_MESSAGE_DEVICE_REMOVED
parameter.parameter_description: Message indicating a #GstDevice was removed from a #GstDeviceProvider (Since 1.4)

parameter.name: GST_MESSAGE_ANY
parameter.parameter_description: mask for all of the above messages.

enum.name: GstMetaFlags
enum.description: Extra metadata flags.

parameter.name: GST_META_FLAG_POOLED
parameter.parameter_description: metadata is managed by a bufferpool

parameter.name: GST_META_FLAG_LAST
parameter.parameter_description: additional flags can be added starting from this flag.

enum.name: GstMiniObjectFlags
enum.description: Flags for the mini object

parameter.name: GST_MINI_OBJECT_FLAG_LOCKABLE
parameter.parameter_description: the object can be locked and unlocked with gst_mini_object_lock() and gst_mini_object_unlock().

parameter.name: GST_MINI_OBJECT_FLAG_LOCK_READONLY
parameter.parameter_description: the object is permanently locked in READONLY mode. Only read locks can be performed on the object.

parameter.name: GST_MINI_OBJECT_FLAG_LAST

enum.name: GstNavigationCommand
enum.description:
A set of commands that may be issued to an element providing the #GstNavigation interface. The available commands can be queried via the gst_navigation_query_new_commands() query.
For convenience in handling DVD navigation, the MENU commands are aliased as: GST_NAVIGATION_COMMAND_DVD_MENU = @GST_NAVIGATION_COMMAND_MENU1 GST_NAVIGATION_COMMAND_DVD_TITLE_MENU = @GST_NAVIGATION_COMMAND_MENU2 GST_NAVIGATION_COMMAND_DVD_ROOT_MENU = @GST_NAVIGATION_COMMAND_MENU3 GST_NAVIGATION_COMMAND_DVD_SUBPICTURE_MENU = @GST_NAVIGATION_COMMAND_MENU4 GST_NAVIGATION_COMMAND_DVD_AUDIO_MENU = @GST_NAVIGATION_COMMAND_MENU5 GST_NAVIGATION_COMMAND_DVD_ANGLE_MENU = @GST_NAVIGATION_COMMAND_MENU6 GST_NAVIGATION_COMMAND_DVD_CHAPTER_MENU = @GST_NAVIGATION_COMMAND_MENU7

parameter.name: GST_NAVIGATION_COMMAND_MENU1
parameter.parameter_description: Execute navigation menu command 1. For DVD, this enters the DVD root menu, or exits back to the title from the menu.

parameter.name: GST_NAVIGATION_COMMAND_MENU2
parameter.parameter_description: Execute navigation menu command 2. For DVD, this jumps to the DVD title menu.

parameter.name: GST_NAVIGATION_COMMAND_MENU3
parameter.parameter_description: Execute navigation menu command 3. For DVD, this jumps into the DVD root menu.

parameter.name: GST_NAVIGATION_COMMAND_MENU4
parameter.parameter_description: Execute navigation menu command 4. For DVD, this jumps to the Subpicture menu.

parameter.name: GST_NAVIGATION_COMMAND_MENU5
parameter.parameter_description: Execute navigation menu command 5. For DVD, the jumps to the audio menu.

parameter.name: GST_NAVIGATION_COMMAND_MENU6
parameter.parameter_description: Execute navigation menu command 6. For DVD, this jumps to the angles menu.

parameter.name: GST_NAVIGATION_COMMAND_MENU7
parameter.parameter_description: Execute navigation menu command 7. For DVD, this jumps to the chapter menu.

parameter.name: GST_NAVIGATION_COMMAND_LEFT
parameter.parameter_description: Select the next button to the left in a menu, if such a button exists.

parameter.name: GST_NAVIGATION_COMMAND_RIGHT
parameter.parameter_description: Select the next button to the right in a menu, if such a button exists.

parameter.name: GST_NAVIGATION_COMMAND_UP
parameter.parameter_description: Select the button above the current one in a menu, if such a button exists.

parameter.name: GST_NAVIGATION_COMMAND_DOWN
parameter.parameter_description: Select the button below the current one in a menu, if such a button exists.

parameter.name: GST_NAVIGATION_COMMAND_ACTIVATE
parameter.parameter_description: Activate (click) the currently selected button in a menu, if such a button exists.

parameter.name: GST_NAVIGATION_COMMAND_PREV_ANGLE
parameter.parameter_description: Switch to the previous angle in a multiangle feature.

parameter.name: GST_NAVIGATION_COMMAND_NEXT_ANGLE
parameter.parameter_description: Switch to the next angle in a multiangle feature.

enum.name: GstNavigationEventType
enum.description: Enum values for the various events that an element implementing the GstNavigation interface might send up the pipeline.

parameter.name: GST_NAVIGATION_EVENT_INVALID
parameter.parameter_description: Returned from gst_navigation_event_get_type() when the passed event is not a navigation event.

parameter.name: GST_NAVIGATION_EVENT_KEY_PRESS
parameter.parameter_description: A key press event. Use gst_navigation_event_parse_key_event() to extract the details from the event.

parameter.name: GST_NAVIGATION_EVENT_KEY_RELEASE
parameter.parameter_description: A key release event. Use gst_navigation_event_parse_key_event() to extract the details from the event.

parameter.name: GST_NAVIGATION_EVENT_MOUSE_BUTTON_PRESS
parameter.parameter_description: A mouse button press event. Use gst_navigation_event_parse_mouse_button_event() to extract the details from the event.

parameter.name: GST_NAVIGATION_EVENT_MOUSE_BUTTON_RELEASE
parameter.parameter_description: A mouse button release event. Use gst_navigation_event_parse_mouse_button_event() to extract the details from the event.

parameter.name: GST_NAVIGATION_EVENT_MOUSE_MOVE
parameter.parameter_description: A mouse movement event. Use gst_navigation_event_parse_mouse_move_event() to extract the details from the event.

parameter.name: GST_NAVIGATION_EVENT_COMMAND
parameter.parameter_description: A navigation command event. Use gst_navigation_event_parse_command() to extract the details from the event.

enum.name: GstNavigationMessageType
enum.description: A set of notifications that may be received on the bus when navigation related status changes.

parameter.name: GST_NAVIGATION_MESSAGE_INVALID
parameter.parameter_description: Returned from gst_navigation_message_get_type() when the passed message is not a navigation message.

parameter.name: GST_NAVIGATION_MESSAGE_MOUSE_OVER
parameter.parameter_description: Sent when the mouse moves over or leaves a clickable region of the output, such as a DVD menu button.

parameter.name: GST_NAVIGATION_MESSAGE_COMMANDS_CHANGED
parameter.parameter_description: Sent when the set of available commands changes and should re-queried by interested applications.

parameter.name: GST_NAVIGATION_MESSAGE_ANGLES_CHANGED
parameter.parameter_description: Sent when display angles in a multi-angle feature (such as a multiangle DVD) change - either angles have appeared or disappeared.

parameter.name: GST_NAVIGATION_MESSAGE_EVENT
parameter.parameter_description: Sent when a navigation event was not handled by any element in the pipeline (Since 1.6)

enum.name: GstNavigationQueryType
enum.description: Tyoes of navigation interface queries.

signal.name: GstNetClientInternalClock::round-trip-limit
signal.description: Maximum allowed round-trip for packets. If this property is set to a nonzero value, all packets with a round-trip interval larger than this limit will be ignored. This is useful for networks with severe and fluctuating transport delays. Filtering out these packets increases stability of the synchronization. On the other hand, the lower the limit, the higher the amount of filtered packets. Empirical tests are typically necessary to estimate a good value for the limit. If the property is set to zero, the limit is disabled.

signal.name: GstObject::deep-notify
signal.description: The deep notify signal is used to be notified of property changes. It is typically attached to the toplevel bin to receive notifications from all the elements contained in that bin.

parameter.name: prop_object
parameter.parameter_description: the object that originated the signal

enum.name: GstObjectFlags
enum.description: The standard flags that an gstobject may have.

parameter.name: GST_OBJECT_FLAG_LAST
parameter.parameter_description: subclasses can add additional flags starting from this flag

signal.name: GstPad::linked
signal.description: Signals that a pad has been linked to the peer pad.

parameter.name: pad

parameter.name: peer

signal.description: Signals that a pad has been unlinked from the peer pad.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: the pad that emitted the signal

parameter.name: peer

enum.name: GstPadDirection
enum.description: The direction of a pad.

parameter.name: GST_PAD_SRC
parameter.parameter_description: the pad is a source pad.

parameter.name: GST_PAD_SINK
parameter.parameter_description: the pad is a sink pad.

enum.name: GstPadFlags
enum.description: Pad state flags

parameter.name: GST_PAD_FLAG_BLOCKED
parameter.parameter_description: is dataflow on a pad blocked

parameter.name: GST_PAD_FLAG_BLOCKING
parameter.parameter_description: is pad currently blocking on a buffer or event

parameter.name: GST_PAD_FLAG_NEED_PARENT
parameter.parameter_description: ensure that there is a parent object before calling into the pad callbacks.

parameter.name: GST_PAD_FLAG_NEED_RECONFIGURE
parameter.parameter_description: the pad should be reconfigured/renegotiated. The flag has to be unset manually after reconfiguration happened.

parameter.name: GST_PAD_FLAG_FIXED_CAPS
parameter.parameter_description: the pad is using fixed caps. This means that once the caps are set on the pad, the default caps query function will only return those caps.

parameter.name: GST_PAD_FLAG_PROXY_CAPS
parameter.parameter_description: the default event and query handler will forward all events and queries to the internally linked pads instead of discarding them.

parameter.name: GST_PAD_FLAG_PROXY_ALLOCATION
parameter.parameter_description: the default query handler will forward allocation queries to the internally linked pads instead of discarding them.

parameter.name: GST_PAD_FLAG_PROXY_SCHEDULING
parameter.parameter_description: the default query handler will forward scheduling queries to the internally linked pads instead of discarding them.

parameter.name: GST_PAD_FLAG_ACCEPT_INTERSECT
parameter.parameter_description: the default accept-caps handler will check it the caps intersect the query-caps result instead of checking for a subset. This is interesting for parsers that can accept incompletely specified caps.

parameter.name: GST_PAD_FLAG_ACCEPT_TEMPLATE
parameter.parameter_description: the default accept-caps handler will use the template pad caps instead of query caps to compare with the accept caps. Use this in combination with %GST_PAD_FLAG_ACCEPT_INTERSECT. (Since 1.6)

enum.name: GstPadLinkCheck
enum.description:
The amount of checking to be done when linking pads. @GST_PAD_LINK_CHECK_CAPS and @GST_PAD_LINK_CHECK_TEMPLATE_CAPS are mutually exclusive. If both are specified, expensive but safe @GST_PAD_LINK_CHECK_CAPS are performed.
<warning><para> Only disable some of the checks if you are 100% certain you know the link will not fail because of hierarchy/caps compatibility failures. If uncertain, use the default checks (%GST_PAD_LINK_CHECK_DEFAULT) or the regular methods for linking the pads. </para></warning>

parameter.name: GST_PAD_LINK_CHECK_NOTHING
parameter.parameter_description: Don't check hierarchy or caps compatibility.

parameter.name: GST_PAD_LINK_CHECK_HIERARCHY
parameter.parameter_description: Check the pads have same parents/grandparents. Could be omitted if it is already known that the two elements that own the pads are in the same bin.

parameter.name: GST_PAD_LINK_CHECK_TEMPLATE_CAPS
parameter.parameter_description: Check if the pads are compatible by using their template caps. This is much faster than @GST_PAD_LINK_CHECK_CAPS, but would be unsafe e.g. if one pad has %GST_CAPS_ANY.

parameter.name: GST_PAD_LINK_CHECK_CAPS
parameter.parameter_description: Check if the pads are compatible by comparing the caps returned by gst_pad_query_caps().

parameter.name: GST_PAD_LINK_CHECK_DEFAULT
parameter.parameter_description: The default checks done when linking pads (i.e. the ones used by gst_pad_link()).

enum.name: GstPadLinkReturn
enum.description: Result values from gst_pad_link and friends.

parameter.name: GST_PAD_LINK_NOFORMAT
parameter.parameter_description: pads do not have common format

enum.name: GstPadMode
enum.description: The status of a GstPad. After activating a pad, which usually happens when the parent element goes from READY to PAUSED, the GstPadMode defines if the pad operates in push or pull mode.

parameter.name: GST_PAD_MODE_PUSH
parameter.parameter_description: Pad handles dataflow in downstream push mode

parameter.name: GST_PAD_MODE_PULL
parameter.parameter_description: Pad handles dataflow in upstream pull mode

enum.name: GstPadPresence
enum.description: Indicates when this pad will become available.

parameter.name: GST_PAD_SOMETIMES
parameter.parameter_description: the pad will become available depending on the media stream

parameter.name: GST_PAD_REQUEST
parameter.parameter_description: the pad is only available on request with gst_element_request_pad().

enum.name: GstPadProbeReturn
enum.description: Different return values for the #GstPadProbeCallback.

parameter.name: GST_PAD_PROBE_OK
parameter.parameter_description: normal probe return value. This leaves the probe in place, and defers decisions about dropping or passing data to other probes, if any. If there are no other probes, the default behaviour for the probe type applies (block for blocking probes, and pass for non-blocking probes).

parameter.name: GST_PAD_PROBE_DROP
parameter.parameter_description: drop data in data probes. For push mode this means that the data item is not sent downstream. For pull mode, it means that the data item is not passed upstream. In both cases, no more probes are called and #GST_FLOW_OK or %TRUE is returned to the caller.

parameter.name: GST_PAD_PROBE_PASS
parameter.parameter_description: pass the data item in the block probe and block on the next item.

parameter.name: GST_PAD_PROBE_HANDLED
parameter.parameter_description: Data has been handled in the probe and will not be forwarded further. For events and buffers this is the same behaviour as @GST_PAD_PROBE_DROP (except that in this case you need to unref the buffer or event yourself). For queries it will also return %TRUE to the caller. The probe can also modify the #GstFlowReturn value by using the #GST_PAD_PROBE_INFO_FLOW_RETURN() accessor. Note that the resulting query must contain valid entries. Since: 1.6

enum.name: GstPadProbeType

parameter.name: GST_PAD_PROBE_TYPE_EVENT_FLUSH
parameter.parameter_description: probe flush events. This probe has to be explicitly enabled and is not included in the @@GST_PAD_PROBE_TYPE_EVENT_DOWNSTREAM or @@GST_PAD_PROBE_TYPE_EVENT_UPSTREAM probe types.

parameter.name: GST_PAD_PROBE_TYPE_BLOCKING
parameter.parameter_description: probe and block at the next opportunity, at data flow or when idle

parameter.name: GST_PAD_PROBE_TYPE_DATA_DOWNSTREAM
parameter.parameter_description: probe downstream data (buffers, buffer lists, and events)

parameter.name: GST_PAD_PROBE_TYPE_DATA_BOTH
parameter.parameter_description: probe upstream and downstream data (buffers, buffer lists, and events)

parameter.name: GST_PAD_PROBE_TYPE_BLOCK_DOWNSTREAM
parameter.parameter_description: probe and block downstream data (buffers, buffer lists, and events)

parameter.name: GST_PAD_PROBE_TYPE_ALL_BOTH
parameter.parameter_description: probe upstream events and queries and downstream buffers, buffer lists, events and queries

enum.name: GstRank
enum.description:
Element priority ranks. Defines the order in which the autoplugger (or similar rank-picking mechanisms, such as e.g. gst_element_make_from_uri()) will choose this element over an alternative one with the same function.
These constants serve as a rough guidance for defining the rank of a #GstPluginFeature. Any value is valid, including values bigger than @GST_RANK_PRIMARY.

enum.description: Resource errors are for any resource used by an element: memory, files, network connections, process space, ... They're typically used by source and sink elements.

parameter.name: GST_RESOURCE_ERROR_FAILED
parameter.parameter_description: a general error which doesn't fit in any other category. Make sure you add a custom message to the error call.
