parameter.name: GST_RESOURCE_ERROR_WRITE
parameter.parameter_description: used when the resource can't be written to.

parameter.name: GST_RESOURCE_ERROR_SEEK
parameter.parameter_description: used when a seek on the resource fails.

parameter.name: GST_RESOURCE_ERROR_SYNC
parameter.parameter_description: used when a synchronize on the resource fails.

parameter.name: GST_RESOURCE_ERROR_SETTINGS
parameter.parameter_description: used when settings can't be manipulated on.

parameter.name: GST_RESOURCE_ERROR_NO_SPACE_LEFT
parameter.parameter_description: used when the resource has no space left.

parameter.name: GST_RESOURCE_ERROR_NOT_AUTHORIZED
parameter.parameter_description: used when the resource can't be opened due to missing authorization. (Since 1.2.4)

parameter.name: GST_RESOURCE_ERROR_NUM_ERRORS
parameter.parameter_description: the number of resource error types.

enum.name: GstSDPResult
enum.description: Return values for the SDP functions.

parameter.name: GST_SDP_EINVAL
parameter.parameter_description: a function was given invalid parameters

enum.name: GstSchedulingFlags
enum.description: The different scheduling flags.

parameter.name: GST_SCHEDULING_FLAG_BANDWIDTH_LIMITED
parameter.parameter_description: if bandwidth is limited and buffering possible (since 1.2)

enum.name: GstSearchMode
enum.description: The different search modes.

parameter.name: GST_SEARCH_MODE_BEFORE
parameter.parameter_description: Search for an exact match or the element just before.

parameter.name: GST_SEARCH_MODE_AFTER
parameter.parameter_description: Search for an exact match or the element just after.

enum.name: GstSeekFlags
enum.description:
Flags to be used with gst_element_seek() or gst_event_new_seek(). All flags can be used together.
A non flushing seek might take some time to perform as the currently playing data in the pipeline will not be cleared.
An accurate seek might be slower for formats that don't have any indexes or timestamp markers in the stream. Specifying this flag might require a complete scan of the file in those cases.
When performing a segment seek: after the playback of the segment completes, no EOS will be emitted by the element that performed the seek, but a %GST_MESSAGE_SEGMENT_DONE message will be posted on the bus by the element. When this message is posted, it is possible to send a new seek event to continue playback. With this seek method it is possible to perform seamless looping or simple linear editing.
When doing fast forward (rate > 1.0) or fast reverse (rate < -1.0) trickmode playback, the %GST_SEEK_FLAG_TRICKMODE flag can be used to instruct decoders and demuxers to adjust the playback rate by skipping frames. This can improve performance and decrease CPU usage because not all frames need to be decoded.
Beyond that, the %GST_SEEK_FLAG_TRICKMODE_KEY_UNITS flag can be used to request that decoders skip all frames except key units, and %GST_SEEK_FLAG_TRICKMODE_NO_AUDIO flags can be used to request that audio decoders do no decoding at all, and simple output silence.
The %GST_SEEK_FLAG_SNAP_BEFORE flag can be used to snap to the previous relevant location, and the %GST_SEEK_FLAG_SNAP_AFTER flag can be used to select the next relevant location. If %GST_SEEK_FLAG_KEY_UNIT is specified, the relevant location is a keyframe. If both flags are specified, the nearest of these locations will be selected. If none are specified, the implementation is free to select whichever it wants.
The before and after here are in running time, so when playing backwards, the next location refers to the one that will played in next, and not the one that is located after in the actual source stream.
Also see part-seeking.txt in the GStreamer design documentation for more details on the meaning of these flags and the behaviour expected of elements that handle them.

parameter.name: GST_SEEK_FLAG_ACCURATE
parameter.parameter_description: accurate position is requested, this might be considerably slower for some formats.

parameter.name: GST_SEEK_FLAG_KEY_UNIT
parameter.parameter_description: seek to the nearest keyframe. This might be faster but less accurate.

parameter.name: GST_SEEK_FLAG_TRICKMODE
parameter.parameter_description: when doing fast forward or fast reverse playback, allow elements to skip frames instead of generating all frames. (Since 1.6)

parameter.name: GST_SEEK_FLAG_SNAP_BEFORE
parameter.parameter_description: go to a location before the requested position, if %GST_SEEK_FLAG_KEY_UNIT this means the keyframe at or before the requested position the one at or before the seek target.

parameter.name: GST_SEEK_FLAG_SNAP_AFTER
parameter.parameter_description: go to a location after the requested position, if %GST_SEEK_FLAG_KEY_UNIT this means the keyframe at of after the requested position.

parameter.name: GST_SEEK_FLAG_SNAP_NEAREST
parameter.parameter_description: go to a position near the requested position, if %GST_SEEK_FLAG_KEY_UNIT this means the keyframe closest to the requested position, if both keyframes are at an equal distance, behaves like %GST_SEEK_FLAG_SNAP_BEFORE.

parameter.name: GST_SEEK_FLAG_TRICKMODE_KEY_UNITS
parameter.parameter_description: when doing fast forward or fast reverse playback, request that elements only decode keyframes and skip all other content, for formats that have keyframes. (Since 1.6)

parameter.name: GST_SEEK_FLAG_TRICKMODE_NO_AUDIO
parameter.parameter_description: when doing fast forward or fast reverse playback, request that audio decoder elements skip decoding and output only gap events or silence. (Since 1.6)

parameter.name: GST_SEEK_FLAG_SKIP
parameter.parameter_description: Deprecated backward compatibility flag, replaced by %GST_SEEK_FLAG_TRICKMODE

enum.name: GstSeekType
enum.description: The different types of seek events. When constructing a seek event with gst_event_new_seek() or when doing gst_segment_do_seek ().

parameter.name: GST_SEEK_TYPE_NONE
parameter.parameter_description: no change in position is required

parameter.name: GST_SEEK_TYPE_END
parameter.parameter_description: relative position to duration is requested

enum.name: GstSegmentFlags
enum.description: Flags for the GstSegment structure. Currently mapped to the corresponding values of the seek flags.

parameter.name: GST_SEGMENT_FLAG_RESET
parameter.parameter_description: reset the pipeline running_time to the segment running_time

parameter.name: GST_SEGMENT_FLAG_TRICKMODE_NO_AUDIO
parameter.parameter_description: Do not decode any audio, where possible (Since 1.6)

parameter.name: GST_SEGMENT_FLAG_SKIP
parameter.parameter_description: Deprecated backward compatibility flag, replaced by @GST_SEGMENT_FLAG_TRICKMODE

enum.name: GstState
enum.description: The possible states an element can be in. States can be changed using gst_element_set_state() and checked using gst_element_get_state().

parameter.name: GST_STATE_NULL
parameter.parameter_description: the NULL state or initial state of an element.

parameter.name: GST_STATE_READY
parameter.parameter_description: the element is ready to go to PAUSED.

parameter.name: GST_STATE_PAUSED
parameter.parameter_description: the element is PAUSED, it is ready to accept and process data. Sink elements however only accept one buffer and then block.

parameter.name: GST_STATE_PLAYING
parameter.parameter_description: the element is PLAYING, the #GstClock is running and the data is flowing.

enum.name: GstStateChange
enum.description: These are the different state changes an element goes through. %GST_STATE_NULL ⇒ %GST_STATE_PLAYING is called an upwards state change and %GST_STATE_PLAYING ⇒ %GST_STATE_NULL a downwards state change.

parameter.name: GST_STATE_CHANGE_NULL_TO_READY
parameter.parameter_description: state change from NULL to READY. <itemizedlist> <listitem><para> The element must check if the resources it needs are available. Device sinks and -sources typically try to probe the device to constrain their caps. </para></listitem> <listitem><para> The element opens the device (in case feature need to be probed). </para></listitem> </itemizedlist>

parameter.name: GST_STATE_CHANGE_READY_TO_PAUSED
parameter.parameter_description: state change from READY to PAUSED. <itemizedlist> <listitem><para> The element pads are activated in order to receive data in PAUSED. Streaming threads are started. </para></listitem> <listitem><para> Some elements might need to return %GST_STATE_CHANGE_ASYNC and complete the state change when they have enough information. It is a requirement for sinks to return %GST_STATE_CHANGE_ASYNC and complete the state change when they receive the first buffer or %GST_EVENT_EOS (preroll). Sinks also block the dataflow when in PAUSED. </para></listitem> <listitem><para> A pipeline resets the running_time to 0. </para></listitem> <listitem><para> Live sources return %GST_STATE_CHANGE_NO_PREROLL and don't generate data. </para></listitem> </itemizedlist>

parameter.name: GST_STATE_CHANGE_PAUSED_TO_PLAYING
parameter.parameter_description: state change from PAUSED to PLAYING. <itemizedlist> <listitem><para> Most elements ignore this state change. </para></listitem> <listitem><para> The pipeline selects a #GstClock and distributes this to all the children before setting them to PLAYING. This means that it is only allowed to synchronize on the #GstClock in the PLAYING state. </para></listitem> <listitem><para> The pipeline uses the #GstClock and the running_time to calculate the base_time. The base_time is distributed to all children when performing the state change. </para></listitem> <listitem><para> Sink elements stop blocking on the preroll buffer or event and start rendering the data. </para></listitem> <listitem><para> Sinks can post %GST_MESSAGE_EOS in the PLAYING state. It is not allowed to post %GST_MESSAGE_EOS when not in the PLAYING state. </para></listitem> <listitem><para> While streaming in PAUSED or PLAYING elements can create and remove sometimes pads. </para></listitem> <listitem><para> Live sources start generating data and return %GST_STATE_CHANGE_SUCCESS. </para></listitem> </itemizedlist>

parameter.name: GST_STATE_CHANGE_PLAYING_TO_PAUSED
parameter.parameter_description: state change from PLAYING to PAUSED. <itemizedlist> <listitem><para> Most elements ignore this state change. </para></listitem> <listitem><para> The pipeline calculates the running_time based on the last selected #GstClock and the base_time. It stores this information to continue playback when going back to the PLAYING state. </para></listitem> <listitem><para> Sinks unblock any #GstClock wait calls. </para></listitem> <listitem><para> When a sink does not have a pending buffer to play, it returns %GST_STATE_CHANGE_ASYNC from this state change and completes the state change when it receives a new buffer or an %GST_EVENT_EOS. </para></listitem> <listitem><para> Any queued %GST_MESSAGE_EOS items are removed since they will be reposted when going back to the PLAYING state. The EOS messages are queued in #GstBin containers. </para></listitem> <listitem><para> Live sources stop generating data and return %GST_STATE_CHANGE_NO_PREROLL. </para></listitem> </itemizedlist>

parameter.name: GST_STATE_CHANGE_PAUSED_TO_READY
parameter.parameter_description: state change from PAUSED to READY. <itemizedlist> <listitem><para> Sinks unblock any waits in the preroll. </para></listitem> <listitem><para> Elements unblock any waits on devices </para></listitem> <listitem><para> Chain or get_range functions return %GST_FLOW_FLUSHING. </para></listitem> <listitem><para> The element pads are deactivated so that streaming becomes impossible and all streaming threads are stopped. </para></listitem> <listitem><para> The sink forgets all negotiated formats </para></listitem> <listitem><para> Elements remove all sometimes pads </para></listitem> </itemizedlist>

parameter.name: GST_STATE_CHANGE_READY_TO_NULL
parameter.parameter_description: state change from READY to NULL. <itemizedlist> <listitem><para> Elements close devices </para></listitem> <listitem><para> Elements reset any internal state. </para></listitem> </itemizedlist>

enum.name: GstStateChangeReturn
enum.description: The possible return values from a state change function such as gst_element_set_state(). Only @GST_STATE_CHANGE_FAILURE is a real failure.

parameter.name: GST_STATE_CHANGE_ASYNC
parameter.parameter_description: the state change will happen asynchronously

parameter.name: GST_STATE_CHANGE_NO_PREROLL
parameter.parameter_description: the state change succeeded but the element cannot produce data in %GST_STATE_PAUSED. This typically happens with live sources.

enum.name: GstStreamError
enum.description: Stream errors are for anything related to the stream being processed: format errors, media type errors, ... They're typically used by decoders, demuxers, converters, ...

parameter.name: GST_STREAM_ERROR_FAILED
parameter.parameter_description: a general error which doesn't fit in any other category. Make sure you add a custom message to the error call.

parameter.name: GST_STREAM_ERROR_TOO_LAZY
parameter.parameter_description: do not use this except as a placeholder for deciding where to go while developing code.

parameter.name: GST_STREAM_ERROR_NOT_IMPLEMENTED
parameter.parameter_description: use this when you do not want to implement this functionality yet.

parameter.name: GST_STREAM_ERROR_TYPE_NOT_FOUND
parameter.parameter_description: used when the element doesn't know the stream's type.

parameter.name: GST_STREAM_ERROR_WRONG_TYPE
parameter.parameter_description: used when the element doesn't handle this type of stream.

parameter.name: GST_STREAM_ERROR_CODEC_NOT_FOUND
parameter.parameter_description: used when there's no codec to handle the stream's type.

parameter.name: GST_STREAM_ERROR_FORMAT
parameter.parameter_description: used when the stream is of the wrong format (for example, wrong caps).

parameter.name: GST_STREAM_ERROR_DECRYPT
parameter.parameter_description: used when the stream is encrypted and can't be decrypted because this is not supported by the element.

parameter.name: GST_STREAM_ERROR_DECRYPT_NOKEY
parameter.parameter_description: used when the stream is encrypted and can't be decrypted because no suitable key is available.

parameter.name: GST_STREAM_ERROR_NUM_ERRORS
parameter.parameter_description: the number of stream error types.

parameter.name: GST_STREAM_FLAG_NONE
parameter.parameter_description: This stream has no special attributes

parameter.name: GST_STREAM_FLAG_SPARSE
parameter.parameter_description: This stream is a sparse stream (e.g. a subtitle stream), data may flow only in irregular intervals with large gaps in between.

parameter.name: GST_STREAM_FLAG_SELECT
parameter.parameter_description: This stream should be selected by default. This flag may be used by demuxers to signal that a stream should be selected by default in a playback scenario.

parameter.name: GST_STREAM_FLAG_UNSELECT
parameter.parameter_description: This stream should not be selected by default. This flag may be used by demuxers to signal that a stream should not be selected by default in a playback scenario, but only if explicitly selected by the user (e.g. an audio track for the hard of hearing or a director's commentary track).

enum.name: GstStreamStatusType
enum.description: The type of a %GST_MESSAGE_STREAM_STATUS. The stream status messages inform the application of new streaming threads and their status.

parameter.name: GST_STREAM_STATUS_TYPE_CREATE
parameter.parameter_description: A new thread need to be created.

parameter.name: GST_STREAM_STATUS_TYPE_ENTER
parameter.parameter_description: a thread entered its loop function

parameter.name: GST_STREAM_STATUS_TYPE_LEAVE
parameter.parameter_description: a thread left its loop function

enum.name: GstStreamVolumeFormat
enum.description:
Different representations of a stream volume. gst_stream_volume_convert_volume() allows to convert between the different representations.
Formulas to convert from a linear to a cubic or dB volume are cbrt(val) and 20 * log10 (val).

parameter.name: GST_STREAM_VOLUME_FORMAT_DB
parameter.parameter_description: Logarithmic volume scale (dB, amplitude not power)

enum.name: GstStructureChangeType
enum.description: The type of a %GST_MESSAGE_STRUCTURE_CHANGE.

parameter.name: GST_STRUCTURE_CHANGE_TYPE_PAD_LINK
parameter.parameter_description: Pad linking is starting or done.

parameter.name: GST_STRUCTURE_CHANGE_TYPE_PAD_UNLINK
parameter.parameter_description: Pad unlinking is starting or done.

enum.name: GstTagDemuxResult
enum.description: Result values from the parse_tag virtual function.

parameter.name: GST_TAG_DEMUX_RESULT_BROKEN_TAG
parameter.parameter_description: cannot parse tag, just skip it

parameter.name: GST_TAG_DEMUX_RESULT_AGAIN
parameter.parameter_description: call again with less or more data

enum.name: GstTagFlag
enum.description: Extra tag flags used when registering tags.

enum.name: GstTagImageType
enum.description: Type of image contained in an image tag (specified as "image-type" field in the info structure in the image's #GstSample)

parameter.name: GST_TAG_IMAGE_TYPE_NONE
parameter.parameter_description: No image type. Can be used to tell functions such as gst_tag_image_data_to_image_sample() that no image type should be set.

parameter.name: GST_TAG_IMAGE_TYPE_FISH
parameter.parameter_description: A fish as funny as the ID3v2 spec

enum.name: GstTagLicenseFlags
enum.description: See http://creativecommons.org/ns for more information.

parameter.name: GST_TAG_LICENSE_PERMITS_DISTRIBUTION
parameter.parameter_description: distribution, public display and public performance are allowed

parameter.name: GST_TAG_LICENSE_PERMITS_DERIVATIVE_WORKS
parameter.parameter_description: distribution of derivative works is allowed

parameter.name: GST_TAG_LICENSE_PERMITS_SHARING
parameter.parameter_description: commercial derivatives are allowed, but only non-commercial distribution is allowed

parameter.name: GST_TAG_LICENSE_REQUIRES_NOTICE
parameter.parameter_description: copyright and license notices must be kept intact

parameter.name: GST_TAG_LICENSE_REQUIRES_ATTRIBUTION
parameter.parameter_description: credit must be given to copyright holder and/or author

parameter.name: GST_TAG_LICENSE_REQUIRES_SHARE_ALIKE
parameter.parameter_description: derivative works must be licensed under the same terms or compatible terms as the original work

parameter.name: GST_TAG_LICENSE_REQUIRES_SOURCE_CODE
parameter.parameter_description: source code (the preferred form for making modifications) must be provided when exercising some rights granted by the license

parameter.name: GST_TAG_LICENSE_REQUIRES_COPYLEFT
parameter.parameter_description: derivative and combined works must be licensed under specified terms, similar to those of the original work

parameter.name: GST_TAG_LICENSE_REQUIRES_LESSER_COPYLEFT
parameter.parameter_description: derivative works must be licensed under specified terms, with at least the same conditions as the original work; combinations with the work may be licensed under different terms

parameter.name: GST_TAG_LICENSE_PROHIBITS_COMMERCIAL_USE
parameter.parameter_description: exercising rights for commercial purposes is prohibited

parameter.name: GST_TAG_LICENSE_PROHIBITS_HIGH_INCOME_NATION_USE
parameter.parameter_description: use in a non-developing country is prohibited

parameter.name: GST_TAG_LICENSE_CREATIVE_COMMONS_LICENSE
parameter.parameter_description: this license was created by the Creative Commons project

parameter.name: GST_TAG_LICENSE_FREE_SOFTWARE_FOUNDATION_LICENSE
parameter.parameter_description: this license was created by the Free Software Foundation (FSF)

enum.name: GstTagMergeMode
enum.description: The different tag merging modes are basically replace, overwrite and append, but they can be seen from two directions. Given two taglists: (A) the tags already in the element and (B) the ones that are supplied to the element ( e.g. via gst_tag_setter_merge_tags() / gst_tag_setter_add_tags() or a %GST_EVENT_TAG), how are these tags merged? In the table below this is shown for the cases that a tag exists in the list (A) or does not exists (!A) and combinations thereof. merge mode merge mode A + B A + !B !A + B !A + !B REPLACE_ALL B - B - REPLACE B A B - APPEND A, B A B - PREPEND B, A A B - KEEP A A B - KEEP_ALL A A - -

parameter.name: GST_TAG_MERGE_REPLACE_ALL
parameter.parameter_description: replace all tags (clear list and append)

enum.name: GstTagScope
enum.description: GstTagScope specifies if a taglist applies to the complete medium or only to one single stream.

parameter.name: GST_TAG_SCOPE_STREAM
parameter.parameter_description: tags specific to this single stream

parameter.name: GST_TAG_SCOPE_GLOBAL
parameter.parameter_description: global tags for the complete medium

enum.name: GstTaskState
enum.description: The different states a task can be in

parameter.name: GST_TASK_STARTED
parameter.parameter_description: the task is started and running

signal.name: GstTimedValueControlSource::value-added
signal.description: Emited right after the new value has been added to @self

parameter.name: self
parameter.parameter_description: The #GstTimedValueControlSource into which a #GstTimedValue has been added

signal.name: GstTimedValueControlSource::value-changed
signal.description: Emited right after the new value has been set on @timed_signals

parameter.name: self
parameter.parameter_description: The #GstTimedValueControlSource on which a #GstTimedValue has changed

signal.name: GstTimedValueControlSource::value-removed
signal.description: Emited when @timed_value is removed from @self

parameter.name: self
parameter.parameter_description: The #GstTimedValueControlSource from which a #GstTimedValue has been removed

enum.name: GstTocEntryType
enum.description:
The different types of TOC entries (see #GstTocEntry).
There are two types of TOC entries: alternatives or parts in a sequence.

parameter.name: GST_TOC_ENTRY_TYPE_ANGLE
parameter.parameter_description: entry is an angle (i.e. an alternative)

parameter.name: GST_TOC_ENTRY_TYPE_TITLE
parameter.parameter_description: entry is a title (i.e. a part of a sequence)

parameter.name: GST_TOC_ENTRY_TYPE_TRACK
parameter.parameter_description: entry is a track (i.e. a part of a sequence)

parameter.name: GST_TOC_ENTRY_TYPE_CHAPTER
parameter.parameter_description: entry is a chapter (i.e. a part of a sequence)

enum.name: GstTocLoopType
enum.description: How a #GstTocEntry should be repeated. By default, entries are played a single time.

enum.name: GstTocScope
enum.description: The scope of a TOC.

parameter.name: GST_TOC_SCOPE_GLOBAL
parameter.parameter_description: global TOC representing all selectable options (this is what applications are usually interested in)

parameter.name: GST_TOC_SCOPE_CURRENT
parameter.parameter_description: TOC for the currently active/selected stream (this is a TOC representing the current stream from start to EOS, and is what a TOC writer / muxer is usually interested in; it will usually be a subset of the global TOC, e.g. just the chapters of the current title, or the chapters selected for playback from the current title)

enum.name: GstTracerValueFlags
enum.description: Flag that describe the value. These flags help applications processing the logs to understand the values.

parameter.name: GST_TRACER_VALUE_FLAGS_OPTIONAL
parameter.parameter_description: the value is optional. When using this flag one need to have an additional boolean arg before this value in the var-args list passed to gst_tracer_record_log().

parameter.name: GST_TRACER_VALUE_FLAGS_AGGREGATED
parameter.parameter_description: the value is combined since the start of tracing

enum.name: GstTracerValueScope
enum.description: Tracing record will contain fields that contain a meassured value or extra meta-data. One such meta data are values that tell where a measurement was taken. This enumerating declares to which scope such a meta data field relates to. If it is e.g. %GST_TRACER_VALUE_SCOPE_PAD, then each of the log events may contain values for different #GstPads.

parameter.name: GST_TRACER_VALUE_SCOPE_PROCESS
parameter.parameter_description: the value is related to the process

parameter.name: GST_TRACER_VALUE_SCOPE_THREAD
parameter.parameter_description: the value is related to a thread

parameter.name: GST_TRACER_VALUE_SCOPE_ELEMENT
parameter.parameter_description: the value is related to an #GstElement

parameter.name: GST_TRACER_VALUE_SCOPE_PAD
parameter.parameter_description: the value is related to a #GstPad

enum.name: GstTypeFindProbability
enum.description: The probability of the typefind function. Higher values have more certainty in doing a reliable typefind.

parameter.name: GST_TYPE_FIND_NEARLY_CERTAIN
parameter.parameter_description: nearly certain that a type was detected.

parameter.name: GST_TYPE_FIND_MAXIMUM
parameter.parameter_description: very certain a type was detected.

enum.name: GstURIError
enum.description: Different URI-related errors that can occur.

parameter.name: GST_URI_ERROR_BAD_URI
parameter.parameter_description: There was a problem with the URI

parameter.name: GST_URI_ERROR_BAD_STATE
parameter.parameter_description: Could not set or change the URI because the URI handler was in a state where that is not possible or not permitted

parameter.name: GST_URI_ERROR_BAD_REFERENCE
parameter.parameter_description: There was a problem with the entity that the URI references

enum.name: GstURIType
enum.description: The different types of URI direction.

enum.name: GstVideoAlphaMode
enum.description: Different alpha modes.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_ALPHA_MODE_COPY
parameter.parameter_description: When input and output have alpha, it will be copied. When the input has no alpha, alpha will be set to #GST_VIDEO_CONVERTER_OPT_ALPHA_VALUE

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_ALPHA_MODE_MULT
parameter.parameter_description: multiply all alpha with #GST_VIDEO_CONVERTER_OPT_ALPHA_VALUE. When the input format has no alpha but the output format has, the alpha value will be set to #GST_VIDEO_CONVERTER_OPT_ALPHA_VALUE

enum.name: GstVideoBufferFlags
enum.description: Additional video buffer flags. These flags can potentially be used on any buffers carrying video data - even encoded data.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_BUFFER_FLAG_INTERLACED
parameter.parameter_description: If the #GstBuffer is interlaced. In mixed interlace-mode, this flags specifies if the frame is interlaced or progressive.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_BUFFER_FLAG_TFF
parameter.parameter_description: If the #GstBuffer is interlaced, then the first field in the video frame is the top field. If unset, the bottom field is first.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_BUFFER_FLAG_RFF
parameter.parameter_description: If the #GstBuffer is interlaced, then the first field (as defined by the %GST_VIDEO_BUFFER_TFF flag setting) is repeated.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_BUFFER_FLAG_ONEFIELD
parameter.parameter_description: If the #GstBuffer is interlaced, then only the first field (as defined by the %GST_VIDEO_BUFFER_TFF flag setting) is to be displayed.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_BUFFER_FLAG_MULTIPLE_VIEW
parameter.parameter_description: The #GstBuffer contains one or more specific views, such as left or right eye view. This flags is set on any buffer that contains non-mono content - even for streams that contain only a single viewpoint. In mixed mono / non-mono streams, the absense of the flag marks mono buffers.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_BUFFER_FLAG_FIRST_IN_BUNDLE
parameter.parameter_description: When conveying stereo/multiview content with frame-by-frame methods, this flag marks the first buffer in a bundle of frames that belong together.

enum.name: GstVideoChromaFlags
enum.description: Extra flags that influence the result from gst_video_chroma_resample_new().

enum.name: GstVideoChromaMethod
enum.description: Different subsampling and upsampling methods

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_CHROMA_METHOD_NEAREST
parameter.parameter_description: Duplicates the chroma samples when upsampling and drops when subsampling

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_CHROMA_METHOD_LINEAR
parameter.parameter_description: Uses linear interpolation to reconstruct missing chroma and averaging to subsample

enum.name: GstVideoChromaMode
enum.description: Different chroma downsampling and upsampling modes

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_CHROMA_MODE_FULL
parameter.parameter_description: do full chroma up and down sampling

enum.name: GstVideoChromaSite
enum.description: Various Chroma sitings.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_CHROMA_SITE_ALT_LINE
parameter.parameter_description: choma samples are sited on alternate lines

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_CHROMA_SITE_COSITED
parameter.parameter_description: chroma samples cosited with luma samples

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_CHROMA_SITE_JPEG
parameter.parameter_description: jpeg style cositing, also for mpeg1 and mjpeg

enum.name: GstVideoCodecFrameFlags
enum.description: Flags for #GstVideoCodecFrame

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_CODEC_FRAME_FLAG_DECODE_ONLY
parameter.parameter_description: is the frame only meant to be decoded

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_CODEC_FRAME_FLAG_SYNC_POINT
parameter.parameter_description: is the frame a synchronization point (keyframe)

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_CODEC_FRAME_FLAG_FORCE_KEYFRAME
parameter.parameter_description: should the output frame be made a keyframe

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_CODEC_FRAME_FLAG_FORCE_KEYFRAME_HEADERS
parameter.parameter_description: should the encoder output stream headers

enum.name: GstVideoColorMatrix
enum.description: The color matrix is used to convert between Y'PbPr and non-linear RGB (R'G'B')

enum.name: GstVideoColorPrimaries
enum.description: The color primaries define the how to transform linear RGB values to and from the CIE XYZ colorspace.

enum.name: GstVideoColorRange
enum.description: Possible color range values. These constants are defined for 8 bit color values and can be scaled for other bit depths.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_COLOR_RANGE_16_235
parameter.parameter_description: [16..235] for 8 bit components. Chroma has [16..240] range.

enum.name: GstVideoDitherFlags
enum.description: Extra flags that influence the result from gst_video_chroma_resample_new().

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_DITHER_FLAG_QUANTIZE
parameter.parameter_description: quantize values in addition to adding dither.

enum.name: GstVideoDitherMethod
enum.description: Different dithering methods to use.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_DITHER_SIERRA_LITE
parameter.parameter_description: Dither with Sierra Lite error diffusion

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_DITHER_BAYER
parameter.parameter_description: ordered dither using a bayer pattern

enum.name: GstVideoFlags
enum.description: Extra video flags

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_FLAG_VARIABLE_FPS
parameter.parameter_description: a variable fps is selected, fps_n and fps_d denote the maximum fps of the video

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_FLAG_PREMULTIPLIED_ALPHA
parameter.parameter_description: Each color has been scaled by the alpha value.

enum.name: GstVideoFormatFlags
enum.description: The different video flags that a format info can have.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_FORMAT_FLAG_YUV
parameter.parameter_description: The video format is YUV, components are numbered 0=Y, 1=U, 2=V.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_FORMAT_FLAG_RGB
parameter.parameter_description: The video format is RGB, components are numbered 0=R, 1=G, 2=B.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_FORMAT_FLAG_GRAY
parameter.parameter_description: The video is gray, there is one gray component with index 0.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_FORMAT_FLAG_ALPHA
parameter.parameter_description: The video format has an alpha components with the number 3.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_FORMAT_FLAG_LE
parameter.parameter_description: The video format has data stored in little endianness.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_FORMAT_FLAG_PALETTE
parameter.parameter_description: The video format has a palette. The palette is stored in the second plane and indexes are stored in the first plane.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_FORMAT_FLAG_COMPLEX
parameter.parameter_description: The video format has a complex layout that can't be described with the usual information in the #GstVideoFormatInfo.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_FORMAT_FLAG_UNPACK
parameter.parameter_description: This format can be used in a #GstVideoFormatUnpack and #GstVideoFormatPack function.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_FORMAT_FLAG_TILED
parameter.parameter_description: The format is tiled, there is tiling information in the last plane.

enum.name: GstVideoFrameFlags
enum.description: Extra video frame flags

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_FRAME_FLAG_INTERLACED
parameter.parameter_description: The video frame is interlaced. In mixed interlace-mode, this flag specifies if the frame is interlaced or progressive.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_FRAME_FLAG_TFF
parameter.parameter_description: The video frame has the top field first

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_FRAME_FLAG_RFF
parameter.parameter_description: The video frame has the repeat flag

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_FRAME_FLAG_ONEFIELD
parameter.parameter_description: The video frame has one field

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_FRAME_FLAG_MULTIPLE_VIEW
parameter.parameter_description: The video contains one or more non-mono views

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_FRAME_FLAG_FIRST_IN_BUNDLE
parameter.parameter_description: The video frame is the first in a set of corresponding views provided as sequential frames.

enum.name: GstVideoFrameMapFlags
enum.description: Additional mapping flags for gst_video_frame_map().

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_FRAME_MAP_FLAG_NO_REF
parameter.parameter_description: Don't take another reference of the buffer and store it in the GstVideoFrame. This makes sure that the buffer stays writable while the frame is mapped, but requires that the buffer reference stays valid until the frame is unmapped again.

enum.name: GstVideoGLTextureOrientation
enum.description: The orientation of the GL texture.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_GL_TEXTURE_ORIENTATION_X_NORMAL_Y_NORMAL
parameter.parameter_description: Top line first in memory, left row first

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_GL_TEXTURE_ORIENTATION_X_NORMAL_Y_FLIP
parameter.parameter_description: Bottom line first in memory, left row first

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_GL_TEXTURE_ORIENTATION_X_FLIP_Y_NORMAL
parameter.parameter_description: Top line first in memory, right row first

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_GL_TEXTURE_ORIENTATION_X_FLIP_Y_FLIP
parameter.parameter_description: Bottom line first in memory, right row first

enum.name: GstVideoGLTextureType
enum.description: The GL texture type.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_GAMMA_MODE_REMAP
parameter.parameter_description: convert between input and output gamma Different gamma conversion modes

enum.name: GstVideoInterlaceMode
enum.description: The possible values of the #GstVideoInterlaceMode describing the interlace mode of the stream.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_INTERLACE_MODE_INTERLEAVED
parameter.parameter_description: 2 fields are interleaved in one video frame. Extra buffer flags describe the field order.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_INTERLACE_MODE_MIXED
parameter.parameter_description: frames contains both interlaced and progressive video, the buffer flags describe the frame and fields.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_INTERLACE_MODE_FIELDS
parameter.parameter_description: 2 fields are stored in one buffer, use the frame ID to get access to the required field. For multiview (the 'views' property > 1) the fields of view N can be found at frame ID (N * 2) and (N * 2) + 1. Each field has only half the amount of lines as noted in the height property. This mode requires multiple GstVideoMeta metadata to describe the fields.

enum.name: GstVideoMatrixMode
enum.description: Different color matrix conversion modes

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_MATRIX_MODE_INPUT_ONLY
parameter.parameter_description: use the input color matrix to convert to and from R'G'B

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_MATRIX_MODE_OUTPUT_ONLY
parameter.parameter_description: use the output color matrix to convert to and from R'G'B

enum.name: GstVideoMultiviewFlags
enum.description: GstVideoMultiviewFlags are used to indicate extra properties of a stereo/multiview stream beyond the frame layout and buffer mapping that is conveyed in the #GstMultiviewMode.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_MULTIVIEW_FLAGS_RIGHT_VIEW_FIRST
parameter.parameter_description: For stereo streams, the normal arrangement of left and right views is reversed.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_MULTIVIEW_FLAGS_LEFT_FLIPPED
parameter.parameter_description: The left view is vertically mirrored.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_MULTIVIEW_FLAGS_LEFT_FLOPPED
parameter.parameter_description: The left view is horizontally mirrored.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_MULTIVIEW_FLAGS_RIGHT_FLIPPED
parameter.parameter_description: The right view is vertically mirrored.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_MULTIVIEW_FLAGS_RIGHT_FLOPPED
parameter.parameter_description: The right view is horizontally mirrored.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_MULTIVIEW_FLAGS_HALF_ASPECT
parameter.parameter_description: For frame-packed multiview modes, indicates that the individual views have been encoded with half the true width or height and should be scaled back up for display. This flag is used for overriding input layout interpretation by adjusting pixel-aspect-ratio. For side-by-side, column interleaved or checkerboard packings, the pixel width will be doubled. For row interleaved and top-bottom encodings, pixel height will be doubled.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_MULTIVIEW_FLAGS_MIXED_MONO
parameter.parameter_description: The video stream contains both mono and multiview portions, signalled on each buffer by the absence or presence of the @GST_VIDEO_BUFFER_FLAG_MULTIPLE_VIEW buffer flag.

enum.name: GstVideoMultiviewFramePacking
enum.description:
#GstVideoMultiviewFramePacking represents the subset of #GstVideoMultiviewMode values that can be applied to any video frame without needing extra metadata. It can be used by elements that provide a property to override the multiview interpretation of a video stream when the video doesn't contain any markers.
This enum is used (for example) on playbin, to re-interpret a played video stream as a stereoscopic video. The individual enum values are equivalent to and have the same value as the matching #GstVideoMultiviewMode.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_MULTIVIEW_FRAME_PACKING_NONE
parameter.parameter_description: A special value indicating no frame packing info.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_MULTIVIEW_FRAME_PACKING_LEFT
parameter.parameter_description: All frames represent a left-eye view.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_MULTIVIEW_FRAME_PACKING_RIGHT
parameter.parameter_description: All frames represent a right-eye view.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_MULTIVIEW_FRAME_PACKING_SIDE_BY_SIDE
parameter.parameter_description: Left and right eye views are provided in the left and right half of the frame respectively.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_MULTIVIEW_FRAME_PACKING_SIDE_BY_SIDE_QUINCUNX
parameter.parameter_description: Left and right eye views are provided in the left and right half of the frame, but have been sampled using quincunx method, with half-pixel offset between the 2 views.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_MULTIVIEW_FRAME_PACKING_COLUMN_INTERLEAVED
parameter.parameter_description: Alternating vertical columns of pixels represent the left and right eye view respectively.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_MULTIVIEW_FRAME_PACKING_ROW_INTERLEAVED
parameter.parameter_description: Alternating horizontal rows of pixels represent the left and right eye view respectively.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_MULTIVIEW_FRAME_PACKING_TOP_BOTTOM
parameter.parameter_description: The top half of the frame contains the left eye, and the bottom half the right eye.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_MULTIVIEW_FRAME_PACKING_CHECKERBOARD
parameter.parameter_description: Pixels are arranged with alternating pixels representing left and right eye views in a checkerboard fashion.

enum.name: GstVideoMultiviewMode
enum.description: All possible stereoscopic 3D and multiview representations. In conjunction with #GstVideoMultiviewFlags, describes how multiview content is being transported in the stream.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_MULTIVIEW_MODE_NONE
parameter.parameter_description: A special value indicating no multiview information. Used in GstVideoInfo and other places to indicate that no specific multiview handling has been requested or provided. This value is never carried on caps.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_MULTIVIEW_MODE_LEFT
parameter.parameter_description: All frames represent a left-eye view.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_MULTIVIEW_MODE_RIGHT
parameter.parameter_description: All frames represent a right-eye view.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_MULTIVIEW_MODE_SIDE_BY_SIDE
parameter.parameter_description: Left and right eye views are provided in the left and right half of the frame respectively.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_MULTIVIEW_MODE_SIDE_BY_SIDE_QUINCUNX
parameter.parameter_description: Left and right eye views are provided in the left and right half of the frame, but have been sampled using quincunx method, with half-pixel offset between the 2 views.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_MULTIVIEW_MODE_COLUMN_INTERLEAVED
parameter.parameter_description: Alternating vertical columns of pixels represent the left and right eye view respectively.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_MULTIVIEW_MODE_ROW_INTERLEAVED
parameter.parameter_description: Alternating horizontal rows of pixels represent the left and right eye view respectively.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_MULTIVIEW_MODE_TOP_BOTTOM
parameter.parameter_description: The top half of the frame contains the left eye, and the bottom half the right eye.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_MULTIVIEW_MODE_CHECKERBOARD
parameter.parameter_description: Pixels are arranged with alternating pixels representing left and right eye views in a checkerboard fashion.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_MULTIVIEW_MODE_FRAME_BY_FRAME
parameter.parameter_description: Left and right eye views are provided in separate frames alternately.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_MULTIVIEW_MODE_MULTIVIEW_FRAME_BY_FRAME
parameter.parameter_description: Multiple independent views are provided in separate frames in sequence. This method only applies to raw video buffers at the moment. Specific view identification is via the #GstVideoMultiviewMeta and #GstVideoMeta(s) on raw video buffers.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_MULTIVIEW_MODE_SEPARATED
parameter.parameter_description: Multiple views are provided as separate #GstMemory framebuffers attached to each #GstBuffer, described by the #GstVideoMultiviewMeta and #GstVideoMeta(s)

enum.name: GstVideoOverlayFormatFlags
enum.description: Overlay format flags.

enum.name: GstVideoPackFlags
enum.description: The different flags that can be used when packing and unpacking.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_PACK_FLAG_TRUNCATE_RANGE
parameter.parameter_description: When the source has a smaller depth than the target format, set the least significant bits of the target to 0. This is likely sightly faster but less accurate. When this flag is not specified, the most significant bits of the source are duplicated in the least significant bits of the destination.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_PACK_FLAG_INTERLACED
parameter.parameter_description: The source is interlaced. The unpacked format will be interlaced as well with each line containing information from alternating fields. (Since 1.2)

enum.name: GstVideoPrimariesMode
enum.description: Different primaries conversion modes

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_PRIMARIES_MODE_MERGE_ONLY
parameter.parameter_description: do conversion between primaries only when it can be merged with color matrix conversion.

enum.name: GstVideoResamplerFlags
enum.description: Different resampler flags.

enum.name: GstVideoResamplerMethod
enum.description: Different subsampling and upsampling methods

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_RESAMPLER_METHOD_NEAREST
parameter.parameter_description: Duplicates the samples when upsampling and drops when downsampling

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_RESAMPLER_METHOD_LINEAR
parameter.parameter_description: Uses linear interpolation to reconstruct missing samples and averaging to downsample

enum.name: GstVideoScalerFlags
enum.description: Different scale flags.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_SCALER_FLAG_INTERLACED
parameter.parameter_description: Set up a scaler for interlaced content

enum.name: GstVideoTileMode
enum.description: Enum value describing the available tiling modes.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_TILE_MODE_ZFLIPZ_2X2
parameter.parameter_description: Every four adjacent blocks - two horizontally and two vertically are grouped together and are located in memory in Z or flipped Z order. In case of odd rows, the last row of blocks is arranged in linear order.

enum.name: GstVideoTileType
enum.description: Enum value describing the most common tiling types.

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_TILE_TYPE_INDEXED
parameter.parameter_description: Tiles are indexed. Use gst_video_tile_get_index () to retrieve the tile at the requested coordinates.

enum.name: GstVideoTransferFunction
enum.description: The video transfer function defines the formula for converting between non-linear RGB (R'G'B') and linear RGB

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_TRANSFER_BT709
parameter.parameter_description: Gamma 2.2 curve with a linear segment in the lower range

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_TRANSFER_SMPTE240M
parameter.parameter_description: Gamma 2.2 curve with a linear segment in the lower range

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_TRANSFER_SRGB
parameter.parameter_description: Gamma 2.4 curve with a linear segment in the lower range

parameter.name: GST_VIDEO_TRANSFER_BT2020_12
parameter.parameter_description: Gamma 2.2 curve with a linear segment in the lower range. Used for BT.2020 with 12 bits per component. Since: 1.6.

function.name: assert_equals_float
function.description: This macro checks that @a and @b are (almost) equal and aborts if this is not the case, printing both expressions and the values they evaluated to. This macro is for use in unit tests.

function.name: assert_equals_int
function.description: This macro checks that @a and @b are equal and aborts if this is not the case, printing both expressions and the values they evaluated to. This macro is for use in unit tests.

function.name: assert_equals_int64
function.description: This macro checks that @a and @b are equal and aborts if this is not the case, printing both expressions and the values they evaluated to. This macro is for use in unit tests.

function.name: assert_equals_int64_hex

function.name: assert_equals_int_hex
function.description: This macro checks that @a and @b are equal and aborts if this is not the case, printing both expressions and the values they evaluated to in hexadecimal format. This macro is for use in unit tests.

function.name: assert_equals_pointer
function.description: This macro checks that @a and @b are equal and aborts if this is not the case, printing both expressions and the values they evaluated to. This macro is for use in unit tests.

function.name: assert_equals_string
function.description: This macro checks that @a and @b are equal (as per strcmp) and aborts if this is not the case, printing both expressions and the values they evaluated to. This macro is for use in unit tests.

function.name: assert_equals_uint64
function.description: This macro checks that @a and @b are equal and aborts if this is not the case, printing both expressions and the values they evaluated to. This macro is for use in unit tests.

function.name: assert_equals_uint64_hex
function.description: This macro checks that @a and @b are equal and aborts if this is not the case, printing both expressions and the values they evaluated to in hexadecimal format. This macro is for use in unit tests.

function.description: This macro checks that @a and @b are (almost) equal and aborts if this is not the case, printing both expressions and the values they evaluated to. This macro is for use in unit tests.

function.description: This macro checks that @a and @b are equal and aborts if this is not the case, printing both expressions and the values they evaluated to in hexadecimal format. This macro is for use in unit tests.

function.description: This macro checks that @a and @b are equal and aborts if this is not the case, printing both expressions and the values they evaluated to in hexadecimal format. This macro is for use in unit tests.

function.name: fail_unless_equals_pointer
function.description: This macro checks that @a and @b are equal and aborts if this is not the case, printing both expressions and the values they evaluated to. This macro is for use in unit tests.

function.description: This macro checks that @a and @b are equal (as per strcmp) and aborts if this is not the case, printing both expressions and the values they evaluated to. This macro is for use in unit tests.

function.name: fail_unless_equals_uint64
function.description: This macro checks that @a and @b are equal and aborts if this is not the case, printing both expressions and the values they evaluated to. This macro is for use in unit tests.

function.name: fail_unless_equals_uint64_hex
function.description: This macro checks that @a and @b are equal and aborts if this is not the case, printing both expressions and the values they evaluated to in hexadecimal format. This macro is for use in unit tests.

function.name: gst_adapter_available
function.description: Gets the maximum amount of bytes available, that is it returns the maximum value that can be supplied to gst_adapter_map() without that function returning %NULL.
function.return: number of bytes available in @adapter

function.name: gst_adapter_available_fast
function.description: Gets the maximum number of bytes that are immediately available without requiring any expensive operations (like copying the data into a temporary buffer).
function.return: number of bytes that are available in @adapter without expensive operations

function.name: gst_adapter_clear
function.description: Removes all buffers from @adapter.

function.name: gst_adapter_copy
function.description:
Copies @size bytes of data starting at @offset out of the buffers contained in #GstAdapter into an array @dest provided by the caller.
The array @dest should be large enough to contain @size bytes. The user should check that the adapter has (@offset + @size) bytes available before calling this function.

parameter.name: offset
parameter.parameter_description: the bytes offset in the adapter to start from

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: the number of bytes to copy

function.name: gst_adapter_copy_bytes
function.description: Similar to gst_adapter_copy, but more suitable for language bindings. @size bytes of data starting at @offset will be copied out of the buffers contained in @adapter and into a new #GBytes structure which is returned. Depending on the value of the @size argument an empty #GBytes structure may be returned.

parameter.name: offset
parameter.parameter_description: the bytes offset in the adapter to start from

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: the number of bytes to copy

function.return: A new #GBytes structure containing the copied data.

function.name: gst_adapter_flush
function.description:
Flushes the first @flush bytes in the @adapter. The caller must ensure that at least this many bytes are available.
See also: gst_adapter_map(), gst_adapter_unmap()

parameter.name: flush
parameter.parameter_description: the number of bytes to flush

function.name: gst_adapter_get_buffer
function.description:
Returns a #GstBuffer containing the first @nbytes of the @adapter, but does not flush them from the adapter. See gst_adapter_take_buffer() for details.
Caller owns a reference to the returned buffer. gst_buffer_unref() after usage.
Free-function: gst_buffer_unref

parameter.name: nbytes
parameter.parameter_description: the number of bytes to get

function.name: gst_adapter_get_buffer_fast
function.description:
Returns a #GstBuffer containing the first @nbytes of the @adapter, but does not flush them from the adapter. See gst_adapter_take_buffer_fast() for details.
Caller owns a reference to the returned buffer. gst_buffer_unref() after usage.
Free-function: gst_buffer_unref

parameter.name: nbytes
parameter.parameter_description: the number of bytes to get

function.name: gst_adapter_get_buffer_list
function.description:
Returns a #GstBufferList of buffers containing the first @nbytes bytes of the @adapter but does not flush them from the adapter. See gst_adapter_take_buffer_list() for details.
Caller owns the returned list. Call gst_buffer_list_unref() to free the list after usage.

parameter.name: nbytes
parameter.parameter_description: the number of bytes to get

function.return: a #GstBufferList of buffers containing the first @nbytes of the adapter, or %NULL if @nbytes bytes are not available

function.name: gst_adapter_get_list
function.description:
Returns a #GList of buffers containing the first @nbytes bytes of the @adapter, but does not flush them from the adapter. See gst_adapter_take_list() for details.
Caller owns returned list and contained buffers. gst_buffer_unref() each buffer in the list before freeing the list after usage.

parameter.name: nbytes
parameter.parameter_description: the number of bytes to get

function.return: a #GList of buffers containing the first @nbytes of the adapter, or %NULL if @nbytes bytes are not available

function.name: gst_adapter_map
function.description:
Gets the first @size bytes stored in the @adapter. The returned pointer is valid until the next function is called on the adapter.
Note that setting the returned pointer as the data of a #GstBuffer is incorrect for general-purpose plugins. The reason is that if a downstream element stores the buffer so that it has access to it outside of the bounds of its chain function, the buffer will have an invalid data pointer after your element flushes the bytes. In that case you should use gst_adapter_take(), which returns a freshly-allocated buffer that you can set as #GstBuffer memory or the potentially more performant gst_adapter_take_buffer().

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: the number of bytes to map/peek

function.return: a pointer to the first @size bytes of data, or %NULL

function.name: gst_adapter_masked_scan_uint32
function.description:
Scan for pattern @pattern with applied mask @mask in the adapter data, starting from offset @offset.
The bytes in @pattern and @mask are interpreted left-to-right, regardless of endianness. All four bytes of the pattern must be present in the adapter for it to match, even if the first or last bytes are masked out.
It is an error to call this function without making sure that there is enough data (offset+size bytes) in the adapter.
This function calls gst_adapter_masked_scan_uint32_peek() passing %NULL for value.

parameter.name: mask
parameter.parameter_description: mask to apply to data before matching against @pattern

parameter.name: pattern
parameter.parameter_description: pattern to match (after mask is applied)

parameter.name: offset
parameter.parameter_description: offset into the adapter data from which to start scanning, returns the last scanned position.

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: number of bytes to scan from offset

function.name: gst_adapter_masked_scan_uint32_peek
function.description:
Scan for pattern @pattern with applied mask @mask in the adapter data, starting from offset @offset. If a match is found, the value that matched is returned through @value, otherwise @value is left untouched.
The bytes in @pattern and @mask are interpreted left-to-right, regardless of endianness. All four bytes of the pattern must be present in the adapter for it to match, even if the first or last bytes are masked out.
It is an error to call this function without making sure that there is enough data (offset+size bytes) in the adapter.

parameter.name: mask
parameter.parameter_description: mask to apply to data before matching against @pattern

parameter.name: pattern
parameter.parameter_description: pattern to match (after mask is applied)

parameter.name: offset
parameter.parameter_description: offset into the adapter data from which to start scanning, returns the last scanned position.

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: number of bytes to scan from offset

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to uint32 to return matching data

function.return: offset of the first match, or -1 if no match was found.

function.name: gst_adapter_new
function.description: Creates a new #GstAdapter. Free with g_object_unref().
function.return: a new #GstAdapter

function.name: gst_adapter_prev_dts
function.description:
Get the dts that was before the current byte in the adapter. When @distance is given, the amount of bytes between the dts and the current position is returned.
The dts is reset to GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE and the distance is set to 0 when the adapter is first created or when it is cleared. This also means that before the first byte with a dts is removed from the adapter, the dts and distance returned are GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE and 0 respectively.

parameter.name: distance
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to location for distance, or %NULL

function.return: The previously seen dts.

function.name: gst_adapter_prev_dts_at_offset
function.description:
Get the dts that was before the byte at offset @offset in the adapter. When @distance is given, the amount of bytes between the dts and the current position is returned.
The dts is reset to GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE and the distance is set to 0 when the adapter is first created or when it is cleared. This also means that before the first byte with a dts is removed from the adapter, the dts and distance returned are GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE and 0 respectively.

parameter.name: offset
parameter.parameter_description: the offset in the adapter at which to get timestamp

parameter.name: distance
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to location for distance, or %NULL

function.return: The previously seen dts at given offset.

function.name: gst_adapter_prev_pts
function.description:
Get the pts that was before the current byte in the adapter. When @distance is given, the amount of bytes between the pts and the current position is returned.
The pts is reset to GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE and the distance is set to 0 when the adapter is first created or when it is cleared. This also means that before the first byte with a pts is removed from the adapter, the pts and distance returned are GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE and 0 respectively.

parameter.name: distance
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to location for distance, or %NULL

function.return: The previously seen pts.

function.name: gst_adapter_prev_pts_at_offset
function.description:
Get the pts that was before the byte at offset @offset in the adapter. When @distance is given, the amount of bytes between the pts and the current position is returned.
The pts is reset to GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE and the distance is set to 0 when the adapter is first created or when it is cleared. This also means that before the first byte with a pts is removed from the adapter, the pts and distance returned are GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE and 0 respectively.

parameter.name: offset
parameter.parameter_description: the offset in the adapter at which to get timestamp

parameter.name: distance
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to location for distance, or %NULL

function.return: The previously seen pts at given offset.

function.name: gst_adapter_push
function.description: Adds the data from @buf to the data stored inside @adapter and takes ownership of the buffer.

parameter.name: buf
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstBuffer to add to queue in the adapter

function.name: gst_adapter_take
function.description:
Returns a freshly allocated buffer containing the first @nbytes bytes of the @adapter. The returned bytes will be flushed from the adapter.
Caller owns returned value. g_free after usage.
Free-function: g_free

parameter.name: nbytes
parameter.parameter_description: the number of bytes to take

function.return: oven-fresh hot data, or %NULL if @nbytes bytes are not available

function.name: gst_adapter_take_buffer
function.description:
Returns a #GstBuffer containing the first @nbytes bytes of the @adapter. The returned bytes will be flushed from the adapter. This function is potentially more performant than gst_adapter_take() since it can reuse the memory in pushed buffers by subbuffering or merging. This function will always return a buffer with a single memory region.
Note that no assumptions should be made as to whether certain buffer flags such as the DISCONT flag are set on the returned buffer, or not. The caller needs to explicitly set or unset flags that should be set or unset.
Since 1.6 this will also copy over all GstMeta of the input buffers except for meta with the %GST_META_FLAG_POOLED flag or with the "memory" tag.
Caller owns a reference to the returned buffer. gst_buffer_unref() after usage.
Free-function: gst_buffer_unref

parameter.name: nbytes
parameter.parameter_description: the number of bytes to take

function.name: gst_adapter_take_buffer_fast
function.description:
Returns a #GstBuffer containing the first @nbytes of the @adapter. The returned bytes will be flushed from the adapter. This function is potentially more performant than gst_adapter_take_buffer() since it can reuse the memory in pushed buffers by subbuffering or merging. Unlike gst_adapter_take_buffer(), the returned buffer may be composed of multiple non-contiguous #GstMemory objects, no copies are made.
Note that no assumptions should be made as to whether certain buffer flags such as the DISCONT flag are set on the returned buffer, or not. The caller needs to explicitly set or unset flags that should be set or unset.
This will also copy over all GstMeta of the input buffers except for meta with the %GST_META_FLAG_POOLED flag or with the "memory" tag.
This function can return buffer up to the return value of gst_adapter_available() without making copies if possible.
Caller owns a reference to the returned buffer. gst_buffer_unref() after usage.
Free-function: gst_buffer_unref

parameter.name: nbytes
parameter.parameter_description: the number of bytes to take

function.name: gst_adapter_take_buffer_list
function.description:
Returns a #GstBufferList of buffers containing the first @nbytes bytes of the @adapter. The returned bytes will be flushed from the adapter. When the caller can deal with individual buffers, this function is more performant because no memory should be copied.
Caller owns the returned list. Call gst_buffer_list_unref() to free the list after usage.

parameter.name: nbytes
parameter.parameter_description: the number of bytes to take

function.return: a #GstBufferList of buffers containing the first @nbytes of the adapter, or %NULL if @nbytes bytes are not available

function.name: gst_adapter_take_list
function.description:
Returns a #GList of buffers containing the first @nbytes bytes of the @adapter. The returned bytes will be flushed from the adapter. When the caller can deal with individual buffers, this function is more performant because no memory should be copied.
Caller owns returned list and contained buffers. gst_buffer_unref() each buffer in the list before freeing the list after usage.

parameter.name: nbytes
parameter.parameter_description: the number of bytes to take

function.return: a #GList of buffers containing the first @nbytes of the adapter, or %NULL if @nbytes bytes are not available

function.name: gst_adapter_unmap
function.description: Releases the memory obtained with the last gst_adapter_map().

function.name: gst_alloc_trace_free
function.description: Trace a memory free operation

function.name: gst_alloc_trace_new
function.description: Use the tracer to trace a new memory allocation

function.name: gst_alloc_trace_register
function.description: Register a new alloc tracer with the given name

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: The name of the tracer object

function.name: gst_allocation_params_copy
function.description:
Create a copy of @params.
Free-function: gst_allocation_params_free
function.return: a new ##GstAllocationParams, free with gst_allocation_params_free().

function.name: gst_allocation_params_free
function.description: Free @params

function.name: gst_allocation_params_init
function.description: Initialize @params to its default values

function.name: gst_allocator_alloc
function.description:
Use @allocator to allocate a new memory block with memory that is at least @size big.
The optional @params can specify the prefix and padding for the memory. If %NULL is passed, no flags, no extra prefix/padding and a default alignment is used.
The prefix/padding will be filled with 0 if flags contains #GST_MEMORY_FLAG_ZERO_PREFIXED and #GST_MEMORY_FLAG_ZERO_PADDED respectively.
When @allocator is %NULL, the default allocator will be used.
The alignment in @params is given as a bitmask so that @align + 1 equals the amount of bytes to align to. For example, to align to 8 bytes, use an alignment of 7.

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: size of the visible memory area

function.return: a new #GstMemory.

function.name: gst_allocator_find
function.description: Find a previously registered allocator with @name. When @name is %NULL, the default allocator will be returned.
function.return: a #GstAllocator or %NULL when the allocator with @name was not registered. Use gst_object_unref() to release the allocator after usage.

function.name: gst_allocator_free
function.description: Free @memory that was previously allocated with gst_allocator_alloc().

function.name: gst_allocator_register
function.description: Registers the memory @allocator with @name. This function takes ownership of @allocator.

function.name: gst_allocator_set_default
function.description: Set the default allocator. This function takes ownership of @allocator.

function.name: gst_app_sink_get_caps
function.description: Get the configured caps on @appsink.
function.return: the #GstCaps accepted by the sink. gst_caps_unref() after usage.

function.name: gst_app_sink_get_drop
function.description: Check if @appsink will drop old buffers when the maximum amount of queued buffers is reached.
function.return: %TRUE if @appsink is dropping old buffers when the queue is filled.

function.name: gst_app_sink_get_emit_signals
function.description: Check if appsink will emit the "new-preroll" and "new-sample" signals.
function.return: %TRUE if @appsink is emiting the "new-preroll" and "new-sample" signals.

function.name: gst_app_sink_get_max_buffers
function.description: Get the maximum amount of buffers that can be queued in @appsink.
function.return: The maximum amount of buffers that can be queued.

function.name: gst_app_sink_get_wait_on_eos
function.description: Check if @appsink will wait for all buffers to be consumed when an EOS is received.
function.return: %TRUE if @appsink will wait for all buffers to be consumed when an EOS is received.

function.name: gst_app_sink_is_eos
function.description:
Check if @appsink is EOS, which is when no more samples can be pulled because an EOS event was received.
This function also returns %TRUE when the appsink is not in the PAUSED or PLAYING state.
function.return: %TRUE if no more samples can be pulled and the appsink is EOS.

function.name: gst_app_sink_pull_preroll
function.description:
Get the last preroll sample in @appsink. This was the sample that caused the appsink to preroll in the PAUSED state. This sample can be pulled many times and remains available to the application even after EOS.
This function is typically used when dealing with a pipeline in the PAUSED state. Calling this function after doing a seek will give the sample right after the seek position.
Note that the preroll sample will also be returned as the first sample when calling gst_app_sink_pull_sample().
If an EOS event was received before any buffers, this function returns %NULL. Use gst_app_sink_is_eos () to check for the EOS condition.
This function blocks until a preroll sample or EOS is received or the appsink element is set to the READY/NULL state.
function.return: a #GstSample or NULL when the appsink is stopped or EOS. Call gst_sample_unref() after usage.

function.name: gst_app_sink_pull_sample
function.description:
This function blocks until a sample or EOS becomes available or the appsink element is set to the READY/NULL state.
This function will only return samples when the appsink is in the PLAYING state. All rendered buffers will be put in a queue so that the application can pull samples at its own rate. Note that when the application does not pull samples fast enough, the queued buffers could consume a lot of memory, especially when dealing with raw video frames.
If an EOS event was received before any buffers, this function returns %NULL. Use gst_app_sink_is_eos () to check for the EOS condition.
function.return: a #GstSample or NULL when the appsink is stopped or EOS. Call gst_sample_unref() after usage.

function.name: gst_app_sink_set_callbacks
function.description:
Set callbacks which will be executed for each new preroll, new sample and eos. This is an alternative to using the signals, it has lower overhead and is thus less expensive, but also less flexible.
If callbacks are installed, no signals will be emitted for performance reasons.

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: a user_data argument for the callbacks

function.name: gst_app_sink_set_caps
function.description: Set the capabilities on the appsink element. This function takes a copy of the caps structure. After calling this method, the sink will only accept caps that match @caps. If @caps is non-fixed, or incomplete, you must check the caps on the samples to get the actual used caps.

function.name: gst_app_sink_set_drop
function.description: Instruct @appsink to drop old buffers when the maximum amount of queued buffers is reached.

function.name: gst_app_sink_set_emit_signals
function.description: Make appsink emit the "new-preroll" and "new-sample" signals. This option is by default disabled because signal emission is expensive and unneeded when the application prefers to operate in pull mode.

function.name: gst_app_sink_set_max_buffers
function.description: Set the maximum amount of buffers that can be queued in @appsink. After this amount of buffers are queued in appsink, any more buffers will block upstream elements until a sample is pulled from @appsink.

parameter.name: max
parameter.parameter_description: the maximum number of buffers to queue

function.name: gst_app_sink_set_wait_on_eos
function.description: Instruct @appsink to wait for all buffers to be consumed when an EOS is received.

function.name: gst_app_src_end_of_stream
function.description: Indicates to the appsrc element that the last buffer queued in the element is the last buffer of the stream.
function.return: #GST_FLOW_OK when the EOS was successfuly queued. #GST_FLOW_FLUSHING when @appsrc is not PAUSED or PLAYING.

function.name: gst_app_src_get_caps
function.description: Get the configured caps on @appsrc.
function.return: the #GstCaps produced by the source. gst_caps_unref() after usage.

function.name: gst_app_src_get_current_level_bytes
function.description: Get the number of currently queued bytes inside @appsrc.
function.return: The number of currently queued bytes.

function.name: gst_app_src_get_emit_signals
function.description: Check if appsrc will emit the "new-preroll" and "new-buffer" signals.
function.return: %TRUE if @appsrc is emitting the "new-preroll" and "new-buffer" signals.

function.name: gst_app_src_get_latency
function.description: Retrieve the min and max latencies in @min and @max respectively.

function.name: gst_app_src_get_max_bytes
function.description: Get the maximum amount of bytes that can be queued in @appsrc.
function.return: The maximum amount of bytes that can be queued.

function.name: gst_app_src_get_size
function.description: Get the size of the stream in bytes. A value of -1 means that the size is not known.
function.return: the size of the stream previously set with gst_app_src_set_size();

function.name: gst_app_src_get_stream_type
function.description: Get the stream type. Control the stream type of @appsrc with gst_app_src_set_stream_type().
function.return: the stream type.

function.name: gst_app_src_push_buffer
function.description:
Adds a buffer to the queue of buffers that the appsrc element will push to its source pad. This function takes ownership of the buffer.
When the block property is TRUE, this function can block until free space becomes available in the queue.
function.return: #GST_FLOW_OK when the buffer was successfuly queued. #GST_FLOW_FLUSHING when @appsrc is not PAUSED or PLAYING. #GST_FLOW_EOS when EOS occured.

function.name: gst_app_src_push_sample
function.description:
Extract a buffer from the provided sample and adds it to the queue of buffers that the appsrc element will push to its source pad. Any previous caps that were set on appsrc will be replaced by the caps associated with the sample if not equal.
When the block property is TRUE, this function can block until free space becomes available in the queue.

parameter.name: sample
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstSample from which buffer and caps may be extracted

function.return: #GST_FLOW_OK when the buffer was successfuly queued. #GST_FLOW_FLUSHING when @appsrc is not PAUSED or PLAYING. #GST_FLOW_EOS when EOS occured.

function.name: gst_app_src_set_callbacks
function.description:
Set callbacks which will be executed when data is needed, enough data has been collected or when a seek should be performed. This is an alternative to using the signals, it has lower overhead and is thus less expensive, but also less flexible.
If callbacks are installed, no signals will be emitted for performance reasons.

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: a user_data argument for the callbacks

function.name: gst_app_src_set_caps
function.description: Set the capabilities on the appsrc element. This function takes a copy of the caps structure. After calling this method, the source will only produce caps that match @caps. @caps must be fixed and the caps on the buffers must match the caps or left NULL.

function.name: gst_app_src_set_emit_signals
function.description: Make appsrc emit the "new-preroll" and "new-buffer" signals. This option is by default disabled because signal emission is expensive and unneeded when the application prefers to operate in pull mode.

function.name: gst_app_src_set_latency
function.description: Configure the @min and @max latency in @src. If @min is set to -1, the default latency calculations for pseudo-live sources will be used.

function.name: gst_app_src_set_max_bytes
function.description: Set the maximum amount of bytes that can be queued in @appsrc. After the maximum amount of bytes are queued, @appsrc will emit the "enough-data" signal.

parameter.name: max
parameter.parameter_description: the maximum number of bytes to queue

function.name: gst_app_src_set_size
function.description: Set the size of the stream in bytes. A value of -1 means that the size is not known.

function.name: gst_app_src_set_stream_type
function.description:
Set the stream type on @appsrc. For seekable streams, the "seek" signal must be connected to.
A stream_type stream

function.name: gst_argb_control_binding_new
function.description: Create a new control-binding that attaches the given #GstControlSource to the #GObject property.

parameter.name: property_name
parameter.parameter_description: the property-name to attach the control source

parameter.name: cs_a
parameter.parameter_description: the control source for the alpha channel

parameter.name: cs_r
parameter.parameter_description: the control source for the red channel

parameter.name: cs_g
parameter.parameter_description: the control source for the green channel

parameter.name: cs_b
parameter.parameter_description: the control source for the blue channel

function.return: the new #GstARGBControlBinding

function.name: gst_atomic_queue_length
function.description: Get the amount of items in the queue.
function.return: the number of elements in the queue.

function.name: gst_atomic_queue_new
function.description: Create a new atomic queue instance. @initial_size will be rounded up to the nearest power of 2 and used as the initial size of the queue.
function.return: a new #GstAtomicQueue

function.name: gst_atomic_queue_peek
function.description: Peek the head element of the queue without removing it from the queue.
