function.name: gst_atomic_queue_pop
function.description: Get the head element of the queue.
function.return: the head element of @queue or %NULL when the queue is empty.

function.name: gst_atomic_queue_push
function.description: Append @data to the tail of the queue.

function.name: gst_atomic_queue_ref
function.description: Increase the refcount of @queue.

function.name: gst_atomic_queue_unref
function.description: Unref @queue and free the memory when the refcount reaches 0.

function.name: gst_audio_base_sink_create_ringbuffer
function.description: Create and return the #GstAudioRingBuffer for @sink. This function will call the ::create_ringbuffer vmethod and will set @sink as the parent of the returned buffer (see gst_object_set_parent()).
function.return: The new ringbuffer of @sink.

function.name: gst_audio_base_sink_get_alignment_threshold
function.description: Get the current alignment threshold, in nanoseconds, used by @sink.
function.return: The current alignment threshold used by @sink.

function.name: gst_audio_base_sink_get_discont_wait
function.description: Get the current discont wait, in nanoseconds, used by @sink.
function.return: The current discont wait used by @sink.

function.name: gst_audio_base_sink_get_drift_tolerance
function.description: Get the current drift tolerance, in microseconds, used by @sink.
function.return: The current drift tolerance used by @sink.

function.name: gst_audio_base_sink_get_provide_clock
function.description: Queries whether @sink will provide a clock or not. See also gst_audio_base_sink_set_provide_clock.
function.return: %TRUE if @sink will provide a clock.

function.name: gst_audio_base_sink_get_slave_method
function.description: Get the current slave method used by @sink.
function.return: The current slave method used by @sink.

function.name: gst_audio_base_sink_report_device_failure
function.description: Informs this base class that the audio output device has failed for some reason, causing a discontinuity (for example, because the device recovered from the error, but lost all contents of its ring buffer). This function is typically called by derived classes, and is useful for the custom slave method.

function.name: gst_audio_base_sink_set_alignment_threshold
function.description: Controls the sink's alignment threshold.

parameter.name: alignment_threshold
parameter.parameter_description: the new alignment threshold in nanoseconds

function.name: gst_audio_base_sink_set_custom_slaving_callback
function.description:
Sets the custom slaving callback. This callback will be invoked if the slave-method property is set to GST_AUDIO_BASE_SINK_SLAVE_CUSTOM and the audio sink receives and plays samples.
Setting the callback to NULL causes the sink to behave as if the GST_AUDIO_BASE_SINK_SLAVE_NONE method were used.

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: user data passed to the callback

function.name: gst_audio_base_sink_set_discont_wait
function.description: Controls how long the sink will wait before creating a discontinuity.

parameter.name: discont_wait
parameter.parameter_description: the new discont wait in nanoseconds

function.name: gst_audio_base_sink_set_drift_tolerance
function.description: Controls the sink's drift tolerance.

parameter.name: drift_tolerance
parameter.parameter_description: the new drift tolerance in microseconds

function.name: gst_audio_base_sink_set_provide_clock
function.description: Controls whether @sink will provide a clock or not. If @provide is %TRUE, gst_element_provide_clock() will return a clock that reflects the datarate of @sink. If @provide is %FALSE, gst_element_provide_clock() will return NULL.

function.name: gst_audio_base_sink_set_slave_method
function.description: Controls how clock slaving will be performed in @sink.

function.name: gst_audio_base_src_create_ringbuffer
function.description: Create and return the #GstAudioRingBuffer for @src. This function will call the ::create_ringbuffer vmethod and will set @src as the parent of the returned buffer (see gst_object_set_parent()).
function.return: The new ringbuffer of @src.

function.name: gst_audio_base_src_get_provide_clock
function.description: Queries whether @src will provide a clock or not. See also gst_audio_base_src_set_provide_clock.
function.return: %TRUE if @src will provide a clock.

function.name: gst_audio_base_src_get_slave_method
function.description: Get the current slave method used by @src.
function.return: The current slave method used by @src.

function.name: gst_audio_base_src_set_provide_clock
function.description: Controls whether @src will provide a clock or not. If @provide is %TRUE, gst_element_provide_clock() will return a clock that reflects the datarate of @src. If @provide is %FALSE, gst_element_provide_clock() will return NULL.

function.name: gst_audio_base_src_set_slave_method
function.description: Controls how clock slaving will be performed in @src.

function.name: gst_audio_buffer_clip

parameter.name: segment
parameter.parameter_description: Segment in %GST_FORMAT_TIME or %GST_FORMAT_DEFAULT to which the buffer should be clipped.

parameter.name: bpf
parameter.parameter_description: size of one audio frame in bytes. This is the size of one sample * channels.

function.return:
%NULL if the buffer is completely outside the configured segment, otherwise the clipped buffer is returned.
If the buffer has no timestamp, it is assumed to be inside the segment and is not clipped

function.name: gst_audio_buffer_reorder_channels
function.description: Reorders @buffer from the channel positions @from to the channel positions @to. @from and @to must contain the same number of positions and the same positions, only in a different order. @buffer must be writable.

parameter.name: from
parameter.parameter_description: The channel positions in the buffer.

parameter.name: to
parameter.parameter_description: The channel positions to convert to.

function.return: %TRUE if the reordering was possible.

function.name: gst_audio_cd_src_add_track
function.description: CDDA sources use this function from their start vfunc to announce the available data and audio tracks to the base source class. The caller should allocate @track on the stack, the base source will do a shallow copy of the structure (and take ownership of the taglist if there is one).
function.return: FALSE on error, otherwise TRUE.

function.name: gst_audio_channel_get_fallback_mask
function.description:
Get the fallback channel-mask for the given number of channels.
This function returns a reasonable fallback channel-mask and should be called as a last resort when the specific channel map is unknown.
function.return: a fallback channel-mask for @channels or 0 when there is no mask.

function.name: gst_audio_channel_mixer_free
function.description: Free memory allocated by @mix.

function.name: gst_audio_channel_mixer_is_passthrough
function.description: Check if @mix is in passthrough.
function.return: %TRUE is @mix is passthrough.

function.name: gst_audio_channel_mixer_samples
function.description:
In case the samples are interleaved, @in and @out must point to an array with a single element pointing to a block of interleaved samples.
If non-interleaved samples are used, @in and @out must point to an array with pointers to memory blocks, one for each channel.
Perform channel mixing on @in_data and write the result to @out_data. @in_data and @out_data need to be in @format and @layout.

function.name: gst_audio_channel_positions_from_mask
function.description: Convert the @channels present in @channel_mask to a @position array (which should have at least @channels entries ensured by caller). If @channel_mask is set to 0, it is considered as 'not present' for purpose of conversion. A partially valid @channel_mask with less bits set than the number of channels is considered valid.
function.return: %TRUE if channel and channel mask are valid and could be converted

function.name: gst_audio_channel_positions_to_mask
function.description:
Convert the @position array of @channels channels to a bitmask.
If @force_order is %TRUE it additionally checks if the channels are in the order required by GStreamer.

parameter.name: force_order
parameter.parameter_description: Only consider the GStreamer channel order.

function.return: %TRUE if the channel positions are valid and could be converted.

function.name: gst_audio_channel_positions_to_valid_order
function.description: Reorders the channel positions in @position from any order to the GStreamer channel order.

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: The channel positions to reorder to.

function.return: %TRUE if the channel positions are valid and reordering was successful.

function.name: gst_audio_check_valid_channel_positions

parameter.name: force_order
parameter.parameter_description: Only consider the GStreamer channel order.

function.return: %TRUE if the channel positions are valid.

function.name: gst_audio_clock_adjust
function.description: Adjust @time with the internal offset of the audio clock.
function.return: @time adjusted with the internal offset.

function.name: gst_audio_clock_get_time
function.description: Report the time as returned by the #GstAudioClockGetTimeFunc without applying any offsets.
function.return: the time as reported by the time function of the audio clock

function.name: gst_audio_clock_invalidate
function.description:
Invalidate the clock function. Call this function when the provided #GstAudioClockGetTimeFunc cannot be called anymore, for example, when the user_data becomes invalid.
After calling this function, @clock will return the last returned time for the rest of its lifetime.

function.name: gst_audio_clock_new
function.description: Create a new #GstAudioClock instance. Whenever the clock time should be calculated it will call @func with @user_data. When @func returns #GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE, the clock will return the last reported time.
function.return: a new #GstAudioClock casted to a #GstClock.

function.name: gst_audio_clock_reset
function.description: Inform @clock that future calls to #GstAudioClockGetTimeFunc will return values starting from @time. The clock will update an internal offset to make sure that future calls to internal_time will return an increasing result as required by the #GstClock object.

function.name: gst_audio_converter_free
function.description: Free a previously allocated @convert instance.

function.name: gst_audio_converter_get_config
function.description: Get the current configuration of @convert.
function.return: a #GstStructure that remains valid for as long as @convert is valid or until gst_audio_converter_update_config() is called.

function.name: gst_audio_converter_get_in_frames
function.description: Calculate how many input frames are currently needed by @convert to produce @out_frames of output frames.
function.return: the number of input frames

function.name: gst_audio_converter_get_max_latency
function.description: Get the maximum number of input frames that the converter would need before producing output.
function.return: the latency of @convert as expressed in the number of frames.

function.name: gst_audio_converter_get_out_frames
function.description: Calculate how many output frames can be produced when @in_frames input frames are given to @convert.
function.return: the number of output frames

function.name: gst_audio_converter_new
function.description:
Create a new #GstAudioConverter that is able to convert between @in and @out audio formats.
@config contains extra configuration options, see #GST_VIDEO_CONVERTER_OPT_* parameters for details about the options and values.
function.return: a #GstAudioConverter or %NULL if conversion is not possible.

function.name: gst_audio_converter_reset
function.description: Reset @convert to the state it was when it was first created, clearing any history it might currently have.

function.name: gst_audio_converter_samples
function.description:
Perform the conversion with @in_frames in @in to @out_frames in @out using @convert.
In case the samples are interleaved, @in and @out must point to an array with a single element pointing to a block of interleaved samples.
If non-interleaved samples are used, @in and @out must point to an array with pointers to memory blocks, one for each channel.
@in may be %NULL, in which case @in_frames of silence samples are processed by the converter.
This function always produces @out_frames of output and consumes @in_frames of input. Use gst_audio_converter_get_out_frames() and gst_audio_converter_get_in_frames() to make sure @in_frames and @out_frames are matching and @in and @out point to enough memory.
function.return: %TRUE is the conversion could be performed.

function.name: gst_audio_converter_update_config
function.description:
Set @in_rate, @out_rate and @config as extra configuration for @convert.
in_rate and @out_rate specify the new sample rates of input and output formats. A value of 0 leaves the sample rate unchanged.
@config can be %NULL, in which case, the current configuration is not changed.
If the parameters in @config can not be set exactly, this function returns %FALSE and will try to update as much state as possible. The new state can then be retrieved and refined with gst_audio_converter_get_config().
Look at the #GST_AUDIO_CONVERTER_OPT_* fields to check valid configuration option and values.
function.return: %TRUE when the new parameters could be set

function.name: gst_audio_decoder_allocate_output_buffer
function.description: Helper function that allocates a buffer to hold an audio frame for @dec's current output format.
function.return: allocated buffer

function.name: gst_audio_decoder_finish_frame

parameter.name: frames
parameter.parameter_description: number of decoded frames represented by decoded data

function.return: a #GstFlowReturn that should be escalated to caller (of caller)

function.name: gst_audio_decoder_negotiate

function.return: #TRUE if the negotiation succeeded, else #FALSE.

function.description: Returns caps that express @caps (or sink template caps if @caps == NULL) restricted to rate/channels/... combinations supported by downstream elements.
function.return: a #GstCaps owned by caller

function.name: gst_audio_decoder_set_drainable
function.description:
Configures decoder drain handling. If drainable, subclass might be handed a NULL buffer to have it return any leftover decoded data. Otherwise, it is not considered so capable and will only ever be passed real data.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_audio_decoder_set_estimate_rate
function.description: Allows baseclass to perform byte to time estimated conversion.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.parameter_description: whether to enable byte to time conversion

function.name: gst_audio_decoder_set_latency
function.description: Sets decoder latency.

function.name: gst_audio_decoder_set_max_errors
function.description: Sets numbers of tolerated decoder errors, where a tolerated one is then only warned about, but more than tolerated will lead to fatal error. You can set -1 for never returning fatal errors. Default is set to GST_AUDIO_DECODER_MAX_ERRORS.

function.name: gst_audio_decoder_set_min_latency
function.description:
Sets decoder minimum aggregation latency.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_audio_decoder_set_needs_format
function.description:
Configures decoder format needs. If enabled, subclass needs to be negotiated with format caps before it can process any data. It will then never be handed any data before it has been configured. Otherwise, it might be handed data without having been configured and is then expected being able to do so either by default or based on the input data.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_audio_decoder_set_output_format
function.description: Configure output info on the srcpad of @dec.
function.return: %TRUE on success.

function.name: gst_audio_decoder_set_plc

Enable or disable decoder packet loss concealment, provided subclass and codec are capable and allow handling plc.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_audio_decoder_set_plc_aware

function.name: gst_audio_decoder_set_tolerance

Configures decoder audio jitter tolerance threshold.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_audio_decoder_set_use_default_pad_acceptcaps
function.description:
Lets #GstAudioDecoder sub-classes decide if they want the sink pad to use the default pad query handler to reply to accept-caps queries.
By setting this to true it is possible to further customize the default handler with %GST_PAD_SET_ACCEPT_INTERSECT and %GST_PAD_SET_ACCEPT_TEMPLATE

parameter.name: use
parameter.parameter_description: if the default pad accept-caps query handling should be used

function.return: allocated buffer

function.name: gst_audio_encoder_finish_frame
function.description:
Collects encoded data and pushes encoded data downstream. Source pad caps must be set when this is called.
If @samples < 0, then best estimate is all samples provided to encoder (subclass) so far. @buf may be NULL, in which case next number of @samples are considered discarded, e.g. as a result of discontinuous transmission, and a discontinuity is marked.
Note that samples received in gst_audio_encoder_handle_frame() may be invalidated by a call to this function.

parameter.name: samples
parameter.parameter_description: number of samples (per channel) represented by encoded data

function.return: a #GstFlowReturn that should be escalated to caller (of caller)

function.name: gst_audio_encoder_get_allocator
function.description:
Lets #GstAudioEncoder sub-classes to know the memory @allocator used by the base class and its @params.
Unref the @allocator after use it.

function.name: gst_audio_encoder_negotiate
function.description: Negotiate with downstream elements to currently configured #GstCaps. Unmark GST_PAD_FLAG_NEED_RECONFIGURE in any case. But mark it again if negotiate fails.
function.return: #TRUE if the negotiation succeeded, else #FALSE.

function.name: gst_audio_encoder_proxy_getcaps
function.description: Returns caps that express @caps (or sink template caps if @caps == NULL) restricted to channel/rate combinations supported by downstream elements (e.g. muxers).
function.return: a #GstCaps owned by caller

function.name: gst_audio_encoder_set_drainable
function.description:
Configures encoder drain handling. If drainable, subclass might be handed a NULL buffer to have it return any leftover encoded data. Otherwise, it is not considered so capable and will only ever be passed real data.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_audio_encoder_set_frame_max
function.description:
Sets max number of frames accepted at once (assumed minimally 1). Requires @frame_samples_min and @frame_samples_max to be the equal.
Note: This value will be reset to 0 every time before GstAudioEncoder::set_format() is called.

function.name: gst_audio_encoder_set_frame_samples_max
function.description:
Sets number of samples (per channel) subclass needs to be handed, at most or will be handed all available if 0.
If an exact number of samples is required, gst_audio_encoder_set_frame_samples_min() must be called with the same number.
Note: This value will be reset to 0 every time before GstAudioEncoder::set_format() is called.

function.name: gst_audio_encoder_set_frame_samples_min
function.description:
Sets number of samples (per channel) subclass needs to be handed, at least or will be handed all available if 0.
If an exact number of samples is required, gst_audio_encoder_set_frame_samples_max() must be called with the same number.
Note: This value will be reset to 0 every time before GstAudioEncoder::set_format() is called.

function.name: gst_audio_encoder_set_hard_min
function.description:
Configures encoder hard minimum handling. If enabled, subclass will never be handed less samples than it configured, which otherwise might occur near end-of-data handling. Instead, the leftover samples will simply be discarded.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_audio_encoder_set_hard_sync
function.description:
Sets encoder hard resync handling.
MT safe.

parameter.name: headers
parameter.parameter_description: a list of #GstBuffer containing the codec header

function.name: gst_audio_encoder_set_latency
function.description: Sets encoder latency.

function.name: gst_audio_encoder_set_lookahead
function.description:
Sets encoder lookahead (in units of input rate samples)
Note: This value will be reset to 0 every time before GstAudioEncoder::set_format() is called.

function.name: gst_audio_encoder_set_mark_granule
function.description:
Enable or disable encoder granule handling.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_audio_encoder_set_perfect_timestamp
function.description:
Enable or disable encoder perfect output timestamp preference.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_audio_encoder_set_tolerance
function.description:
Configures encoder audio jitter tolerance threshold.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_audio_format_from_string
function.description: Convert the @format string to its #GstAudioFormat.

function.return: The #GstAudioFormatInfo for @format.

function.name: gst_audio_get_channel_reorder_map
function.description:
Returns a reorder map for @from to @to that can be used in custom channel reordering code, e.g. to convert from or to the GStreamer channel order. @from and @to must contain the same number of positions and the same positions, only in a different order.
The resulting @reorder_map can be used for reordering by assigning channel i of the input to channel reorder_map[i] of the output.

parameter.name: from
parameter.parameter_description: The channel positions to reorder from.

parameter.name: to
parameter.parameter_description: The channel positions to reorder to.

function.return: %TRUE if the channel positions are valid and reordering is possible.

function.name: gst_audio_iec61937_frame_size
function.description: Calculated the size of the buffer expected by gst_audio_iec61937_payload() for payloading type from @spec.
function.return: the size or 0 if the given @type is not supported or cannot be payloaded.

function.name: gst_audio_iec61937_payload
function.description: Payloads @src in the form specified by IEC 61937 for the type from @spec and stores the result in @dst. @src must contain exactly one frame of data and the frame is not checked for errors.

parameter.name: src
parameter.parameter_description: a buffer containing the data to payload

parameter.name: dst
parameter.parameter_description: the destination buffer to store the payloaded contents in. Should not overlap with @src

parameter.name: endianness
parameter.parameter_description: the expected byte order of the payloaded data

function.return: transfer-full: %TRUE if the payloading was successful, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_audio_info_convert
function.description: Converts among various #GstFormat types. This function handles GST_FORMAT_BYTES, GST_FORMAT_TIME, and GST_FORMAT_DEFAULT. For raw audio, GST_FORMAT_DEFAULT corresponds to audio frames. This function can be used to handle pad queries of the type GST_QUERY_CONVERT.
function.return: TRUE if the conversion was successful.

function.name: gst_audio_info_copy
function.description: Copy a GstAudioInfo structure.
function.return: a new #GstAudioInfo. free with gst_audio_info_free.

function.name: gst_audio_info_free
function.description: Free a GstAudioInfo structure previously allocated with gst_audio_info_new() or gst_audio_info_copy().

function.name: gst_audio_info_from_caps
function.description: Parse @caps and update @info.
function.return: TRUE if @caps could be parsed

function.name: gst_audio_info_init
function.description: Initialize @info with default values.

function.name: gst_audio_info_is_equal
function.description: Compares two #GstAudioInfo and returns whether they are equal or not
function.return: %TRUE if @info and @other are equal, else %FALSE.

function.name: gst_audio_info_new
function.description: Allocate a new #GstAudioInfo that is also initialized with gst_audio_info_init().
function.return: a new #GstAudioInfo. free with gst_audio_info_free().

function.name: gst_audio_info_set_format
function.description:
Set the default info for the audio info of @format and @rate and @channels.
Note: This initializes @info first, no values are preserved.

function.name: gst_audio_info_to_caps
function.description: Convert the values of @info into a #GstCaps.
function.return: the new #GstCaps containing the info of @info.

function.name: gst_audio_quantize_free
function.description: Free a #GstAudioQuantize.

function.name: gst_audio_quantize_reset
function.description: Reset @quant to the state is was when created, clearing any history it might have.

function.name: gst_audio_quantize_samples
function.description:
Perform quantization on @samples in @in and write the result to @out.
In case the samples are interleaved, @in and @out must point to an array with a single element pointing to a block of interleaved samples.
If non-interleaved samples are used, @in and @out must point to an array with pointers to memory blocks, one for each channel.
@in and @out may point to the same memory location, in which case samples will be modified in-place.

function.name: gst_audio_reorder_channels
function.description: Reorders @data from the channel positions @from to the channel positions @to. @from and @to must contain the same number of positions and the same positions, only in a different order.

parameter.name: from
parameter.parameter_description: The channel positions in the buffer.

parameter.name: to
parameter.parameter_description: The channel positions to convert to.

function.return: %TRUE if the reordering was possible.

function.name: gst_audio_ring_buffer_acquire
function.description: Allocate the resources for the ringbuffer. This function fills in the data pointer of the ring buffer with a valid #GstBuffer to which samples can be written.
function.return:
TRUE if the device could be acquired, FALSE on error.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_audio_ring_buffer_activate
function.description:
Activate @buf to start or stop pulling data.
MT safe.
function.return: TRUE if the device could be activated in the requested mode, FALSE on error.

function.name: gst_audio_ring_buffer_advance
gst_audio_ring_buffer_clear
function.description:
Clear the given segment of the buffer with silence samples. This function is used by subclasses.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_audio_ring_buffer_clear_all
function.description:
Fill the ringbuffer with silence.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_audio_ring_buffer_close_device
function.description: Close the audio device associated with the ring buffer. The ring buffer should already have been released via gst_audio_ring_buffer_release().
function.return:
TRUE if the device could be closed, FALSE on error.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_audio_ring_buffer_commit

parameter.name: sample
parameter.parameter_description: the sample position of the data

parameter.name: in_samples
parameter.parameter_description: the number of samples in the data to commit

parameter.name: out_samples
parameter.parameter_description: the number of samples to write to the ringbuffer

function.return: The number of samples written to the ringbuffer or -1 on error. The number of samples written can be less than @out_samples when @buf was interrupted with a flush or stop.

function.name: gst_audio_ring_buffer_convert
function.description: Convert @src_val in @src_fmt to the equivalent value in @dest_fmt. The result will be put in @dest_val.

parameter.name: dest_val
parameter.parameter_description: a location to store the converted value

function.return: TRUE if the conversion succeeded.

function.name: gst_audio_ring_buffer_debug_spec_buff
function.description: Print debug info about the buffer sized in @spec to the debug log.

function.name: gst_audio_ring_buffer_debug_spec_caps
function.description: Print debug info about the parsed caps in @spec to the debug log.

function.name: gst_audio_ring_buffer_delay
function.description:
Get the number of samples queued in the audio device. This is usually less than the segment size but can be bigger when the implementation uses another internal buffer between the audio device.
For playback ringbuffers this is the amount of samples transfered from the ringbuffer to the device but still not played.
For capture ringbuffers this is the amount of samples in the device that are not yet transfered to the ringbuffer.
function.return:
The number of samples queued in the audio device.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_audio_ring_buffer_device_is_open
function.description: Checks the status of the device associated with the ring buffer.

TRUE if the device was open, FALSE if it was closed.

function.name: gst_audio_ring_buffer_is_acquired

TRUE if the ringbuffer is acquired, FALSE on error.

function.name: gst_audio_ring_buffer_is_active

Check if @buf is activated.

function.name: gst_audio_ring_buffer_is_flushing

Check if @buf is flushing.

Tell the ringbuffer that it is allowed to start playback when the ringbuffer is filled with samples.

TRUE if the device could be opened, FALSE on error.
MT safe.

The number of samples processed by the ringbuffer.

Sets the given callback function on the buffer. This function will be called every time a segment has been written to a device.

function.description:
Make sure that the next sample written to the device is accounted for as being the @sample sample written to the device. This value will be used in reporting the current sample position of the ringbuffer.

function.name: gst_base_parse_add_index_entry
function.description: Adds an entry to the index associating @offset to @ts. It is recommended to only add keyframe entries. @force allows to bypass checks, such as whether the stream is (upstream) seekable, another entry is already "close" to the new entry, etc.
function.return: #gboolean indicating whether entry was added

function.name: gst_base_parse_convert_default
function.description: Default implementation of "convert" vmethod in #GstBaseParse class.

parameter.name: dest_value
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer where the conversion result will be put.

function.return: %TRUE if conversion was successful.

function.name: gst_base_parse_finish_frame
function.description:
Collects parsed data and pushes this downstream. Source pad caps must be set when this is called.
If @frame's out_buffer is set, that will be used as subsequent frame data. Otherwise, @size samples will be taken from the input and used for output, and the output's metadata (timestamps etc) will be taken as (optionally) set by the subclass on @frame's (input) buffer (which is otherwise ignored for any but the above purpose/information).
Note that the latter buffer is invalidated by this call, whereas the caller retains ownership of @frame.

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: consumed input data represented by frame

function.return: a #GstFlowReturn that should be escalated to caller (of caller)

function.name: gst_base_parse_frame_init
function.description: Sets a #GstBaseParseFrame to initial state. Currently this means all public fields are zero-ed and a private flag is set to make sure gst_base_parse_frame_free() only frees the contents but not the actual frame. Use this function to initialise a #GstBaseParseFrame allocated on the stack.

function.name: gst_base_parse_frame_new
function.description: Allocates a new #GstBaseParseFrame. This function is mainly for bindings, elements written in C should usually allocate the frame on the stack and then use gst_base_parse_frame_init() to initialise it.

parameter.name: overhead
parameter.parameter_description: number of bytes in this frame which should be counted as metadata overhead, ie. not used to calculate the average bitrate. Set to -1 to mark the entire frame as metadata. If in doubt, set to 0.

function.return: a newly-allocated #GstBaseParseFrame. Free with gst_base_parse_frame_free() when no longer needed.

function.name: gst_base_parse_merge_tags
function.description:
Sets the parser subclass's tags and how they should be merged with any upstream stream tags. This will override any tags previously-set with gst_base_parse_merge_tags().
Note that this is provided for convenience, and the subclass is not required to use this and can still do tag handling on its own.

parameter.name: tags
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstTagList to merge, or NULL to unset previously-set tags

function.name: gst_base_parse_push_frame
function.description:
Pushes the frame's buffer downstream, sends any pending events and does some timestamp and segment handling. Takes ownership of frame's buffer, though caller retains ownership of @frame.
This must be called with sinkpad STREAM_LOCK held.
function.return: #GstFlowReturn

function.name: gst_base_parse_set_average_bitrate
function.description:
Optionally sets the average bitrate detected in media (if non-zero), e.g. based on metadata, as it will be posted to the application.
By default, announced average bitrate is estimated. The average bitrate is used to estimate the total duration of the stream and to estimate a seek position, if there's no index and the format is syncable (see gst_base_parse_set_syncable()).

function.name: gst_base_parse_set_duration
function.description: Sets the duration of the currently playing media. Subclass can use this when it is able to determine duration and/or notices a change in the media duration. Alternatively, if @interval is non-zero (default), then stream duration is determined based on estimated bitrate, and updated every @interval frames.

parameter.name: interval
parameter.parameter_description: how often to update the duration estimate based on bitrate, or 0.

function.name: gst_base_parse_set_frame_rate
function.description: If frames per second is configured, parser can take care of buffer duration and timestamping. When performing segment clipping, or seeking to a specific location, a corresponding decoder might need an initial @lead_in and a following @lead_out number of frames to ensure the desired segment is entirely filled upon decoding.

parameter.name: lead_in
parameter.parameter_description: frames needed before a segment for subsequent decode

function.name: gst_base_parse_set_has_timing_info
function.description: Set if frames carry timing information which the subclass can (generally) parse and provide. In particular, intrinsic (rather than estimated) time can be obtained following a seek.

function.name: gst_base_parse_set_infer_ts
function.description: By default, the base class might try to infer PTS from DTS and vice versa. While this is generally correct for audio data, it may not be otherwise. Sub-classes implementing such formats should disable timestamp inferring.

parameter.name: infer_ts
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if parser should infer DTS/PTS from each other

function.name: gst_base_parse_set_latency
function.description: Sets the minimum and maximum (which may likely be equal) latency introduced by the parsing process. If there is such a latency, which depends on the particular parsing of the format, it typically corresponds to 1 frame duration.

function.name: gst_base_parse_set_min_frame_size
function.description: Subclass can use this function to tell the base class that it needs to give at least #min_size buffers.

parameter.name: min_size
parameter.parameter_description: Minimum size of the data that this base class should give to subclass.

function.name: gst_base_parse_set_passthrough
function.description: Set if the nature of the format or configuration does not allow (much) parsing, and the parser should operate in passthrough mode (which only applies when operating in push mode). That is, incoming buffers are pushed through unmodified, i.e. no @check_valid_frame or @parse_frame callbacks will be invoked, but @pre_push_frame will still be invoked, so subclass can perform as much or as little is appropriate for passthrough semantics in @pre_push_frame.

parameter.name: passthrough
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if parser should run in passthrough mode

function.name: gst_base_parse_set_pts_interpolation
function.description: By default, the base class will guess PTS timestamps using a simple interpolation (previous timestamp + duration), which is incorrect for data streams with reordering, where PTS can go backward. Sub-classes implementing such formats should disable PTS interpolation.

parameter.name: pts_interpolate
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if parser should interpolate PTS timestamps

function.name: gst_base_parse_set_syncable
function.description: Set if frame starts can be identified. This is set by default and determines whether seeking based on bitrate averages is possible for a format/stream.

parameter.name: syncable
parameter.parameter_description: set if frame starts can be identified

function.name: gst_base_parse_set_ts_at_offset
function.description:
This function should only be called from a @handle_frame implementation.
#GstBaseParse creates initial timestamps for frames by using the last timestamp seen in the stream before the frame starts. In certain cases, the correct timestamps will occur in the stream after the start of the frame, but before the start of the actual picture data. This function can be used to set the timestamps based on the offset into the frame data that the picture starts.

function.name: gst_base_sink_do_preroll
function.description:
If the @sink spawns its own thread for pulling buffers from upstream it should call this method after it has pulled a buffer. If the element needed to preroll, this function will perform the preroll and will then block until the element state is changed.
This function should be called with the PREROLL_LOCK held.

parameter.name: obj
parameter.parameter_description: the mini object that caused the preroll

function.return: %GST_FLOW_OK if the preroll completed and processing can continue. Any other return value should be returned from the render vmethod.

function.name: gst_base_sink_get_blocksize
function.description: Get the number of bytes that the sink will pull when it is operating in pull mode.
function.return: the number of bytes @sink will pull in pull mode.

function.name: gst_base_sink_get_last_sample
function.description:
Get the last sample that arrived in the sink and was used for preroll or for rendering. This property can be used to generate thumbnails.
The #GstCaps on the sample can be used to determine the type of the buffer.
Free-function: gst_sample_unref
function.return: a #GstSample. gst_sample_unref() after usage. This function returns %NULL when no buffer has arrived in the sink yet or when the sink is not in PAUSED or PLAYING.

function.name: gst_base_sink_get_latency
function.description: Get the currently configured latency.
function.return: The configured latency.

function.name: gst_base_sink_get_max_bitrate
function.description: Get the maximum amount of bits per second that the sink will render.
function.return: the maximum number of bits per second @sink will render.

function.name: gst_base_sink_get_max_lateness
function.description: Gets the max lateness value. See gst_base_sink_set_max_lateness for more details.
function.return: The maximum time in nanoseconds that a buffer can be late before it is dropped and not rendered. A value of -1 means an unlimited time.

function.name: gst_base_sink_get_render_delay
function.description: Get the render delay of @sink. see gst_base_sink_set_render_delay() for more information about the render delay.
function.return: the render delay of @sink.

function.name: gst_base_sink_get_sync
function.description: Checks if @sink is currently configured to synchronize against the clock.
function.return: %TRUE if the sink is configured to synchronize against the clock.

function.name: gst_base_sink_get_throttle_time
function.description: Get the time that will be inserted between frames to control the maximum buffers per second.
function.return: the number of nanoseconds @sink will put between frames.

function.name: gst_base_sink_get_ts_offset
function.description: Get the synchronisation offset of @sink.
function.return: The synchronisation offset.

function.name: gst_base_sink_is_async_enabled
function.description: Checks if @sink is currently configured to perform asynchronous state changes to PAUSED.
function.return: %TRUE if the sink is configured to perform asynchronous state changes.

function.name: gst_base_sink_is_last_sample_enabled
function.description: Checks if @sink is currently configured to store the last received sample in the last-sample property.
function.return: %TRUE if the sink is configured to store the last received sample.

function.name: gst_base_sink_is_qos_enabled
function.description: Checks if @sink is currently configured to send Quality-of-Service events upstream.
function.return: %TRUE if the sink is configured to perform Quality-of-Service.

function.name: gst_base_sink_query_latency
function.description:
Query the sink for the latency parameters. The latency will be queried from the upstream elements. @live will be %TRUE if @sink is configured to synchronize against the clock. @upstream_live will be %TRUE if an upstream element is live.
If both @live and @upstream_live are %TRUE, the sink will want to compensate for the latency introduced by the upstream elements by setting the @min_latency to a strictly positive value.
This function is mostly used by subclasses.

parameter.name: upstream_live
parameter.parameter_description: if an upstream element is live

parameter.name: min_latency
parameter.parameter_description: the min latency of the upstream elements

parameter.name: max_latency
parameter.parameter_description: the max latency of the upstream elements

function.return: %TRUE if the query succeeded.

function.name: gst_base_sink_set_async_enabled
function.description: Configures @sink to perform all state changes asynchronously. When async is disabled, the sink will immediately go to PAUSED instead of waiting for a preroll buffer. This feature is useful if the sink does not synchronize against the clock or when it is dealing with sparse streams.

function.name: gst_base_sink_set_blocksize
function.description: Set the number of bytes that the sink will pull when it is operating in pull mode.

function.name: gst_base_sink_set_last_sample_enabled
function.description: Configures @sink to store the last received sample in the last-sample property.

function.name: gst_base_sink_set_max_bitrate
function.description: Set the maximum amount of bits per second that the sink will render.

parameter.name: max_bitrate
parameter.parameter_description: the max_bitrate in bits per second

function.name: gst_base_sink_set_max_lateness
function.description: Sets the new max lateness value to @max_lateness. This value is used to decide if a buffer should be dropped or not based on the buffer timestamp and the current clock time. A value of -1 means an unlimited time.

function.name: gst_base_sink_set_qos_enabled
function.description: Configures @sink to send Quality-of-Service events upstream.

function.name: gst_base_sink_set_render_delay
function.description:
Set the render delay in @sink to @delay. The render delay is the time between actual rendering of a buffer and its synchronisation time. Some devices might delay media rendering which can be compensated for with this function.
After calling this function, this sink will report additional latency and other sinks will adjust their latency to delay the rendering of their media.
This function is usually called by subclasses.

function.name: gst_base_sink_set_sync
function.description: Configures @sink to synchronize on the clock or not. When @sync is %FALSE, incoming samples will be played as fast as possible. If @sync is %TRUE, the timestamps of the incoming buffers will be used to schedule the exact render time of its contents.

function.name: gst_base_sink_set_throttle_time
function.description: Set the time that will be inserted between rendered buffers. This can be used to control the maximum buffers per second that the sink will render.

function.name: gst_base_sink_set_ts_offset
function.description: Adjust the synchronisation of @sink with @offset. A negative value will render buffers earlier than their timestamp. A positive value will delay rendering. This function can be used to fix playback of badly timestamped buffers.

function.name: gst_base_sink_wait
function.description:
This function will wait for preroll to complete and will then block until @time is reached. It is usually called by subclasses that use their own internal synchronisation but want to let some synchronization (like EOS) be handled by the base class.
This function should only be called with the PREROLL_LOCK held (like when receiving an EOS event in the ::event vmethod or when handling buffers in ::render).
The @time argument should be the running_time of when the timeout should happen and will be adjusted with any latency and offset configured in the sink.

parameter.name: jitter
parameter.parameter_description: the jitter to be filled with time diff, or %NULL

function.return: #GstFlowReturn

function.name: gst_base_sink_wait_clock
function.description:
This function will block until @time is reached. It is usually called by subclasses that use their own internal synchronisation.
If @time is not valid, no synchronisation is done and %GST_CLOCK_BADTIME is returned. Likewise, if synchronisation is disabled in the element or there is no clock, no synchronisation is done and %GST_CLOCK_BADTIME is returned.
This function should only be called with the PREROLL_LOCK held, like when receiving an EOS event in the #GstBaseSinkClass.event() vmethod or when receiving a buffer in the #GstBaseSinkClass.render() vmethod.
The @time argument should be the running_time of when this method should return and is not adjusted with any latency or offset configured in the sink.

parameter.name: jitter
parameter.parameter_description: the jitter to be filled with time diff, or %NULL

function.return: #GstClockReturn

function.name: gst_base_sink_wait_preroll
function.description:
If the #GstBaseSinkClass.render() method performs its own synchronisation against the clock it must unblock when going from PLAYING to the PAUSED state and call this method before continuing to render the remaining data.
This function will block until a state change to PLAYING happens (in which case this function returns %GST_FLOW_OK) or the processing must be stopped due to a state change to READY or a FLUSH event (in which case this function returns %GST_FLOW_FLUSHING).
This function should only be called with the PREROLL_LOCK held, like in the render function.
function.return: %GST_FLOW_OK if the preroll completed and processing can continue. Any other return value should be returned from the render vmethod.

function.name: gst_base_src_get_allocator
function.description:
Lets #GstBaseSrc sub-classes to know the memory @allocator used by the base class and its @params.
Unref the @allocator after usage.

function.name: gst_base_src_get_blocksize
function.description: Get the number of bytes that @src will push out with each buffer.
function.return: the number of bytes pushed with each buffer.

function.name: gst_base_src_get_buffer_pool
function.return: the instance of the #GstBufferPool used by the src; unref it after usage.

function.name: gst_base_src_get_do_timestamp
function.description: Query if @src timestamps outgoing buffers based on the current running_time.
function.return: %TRUE if the base class will automatically timestamp outgoing buffers.

function.name: gst_base_src_is_async
function.description: Get the current async behaviour of @src. See also gst_base_src_set_async().
function.return: %TRUE if @src is operating in async mode.

function.name: gst_base_src_is_live
function.description: Check if an element is in live mode.
function.return: %TRUE if element is in live mode.

function.name: gst_base_src_new_seamless_segment
function.description:
Prepare a new seamless segment for emission downstream. This function must only be called by derived sub-classes, and only from the create() function, as the stream-lock needs to be held.
The format for the new segment will be the current format of the source, as configured with gst_base_src_set_format()

parameter.name: start
parameter.parameter_description: The new start value for the segment

parameter.name: stop
parameter.parameter_description: Stop value for the new segment

parameter.name: time
parameter.parameter_description: The new time value for the start of the new segment

function.return: %TRUE if preparation of the seamless segment succeeded.

function.name: gst_base_src_query_latency
function.description:
Query the source for the latency parameters. @live will be %TRUE when @src is configured as a live source. @min_latency and @max_latency will be set to the difference between the running time and the timestamp of the first buffer.
This function is mostly used by subclasses.

parameter.name: min_latency
parameter.parameter_description: the min latency of the source

parameter.name: max_latency
parameter.parameter_description: the max latency of the source

function.return: %TRUE if the query succeeded.

function.name: gst_base_src_set_async
function.description: Configure async behaviour in @src, no state change will block. The open, close, start, stop, play and pause virtual methods will be executed in a different thread and are thus allowed to perform blocking operations. Any blocking operation should be unblocked with the unlock vmethod.

function.name: gst_base_src_set_automatic_eos
function.description: If @automatic_eos is %TRUE, @src will automatically go EOS if a buffer after the total size is returned. By default this is %TRUE but sources that can't return an authoritative size and only know that they're EOS when trying to read more should set this to %FALSE.

function.name: gst_base_src_set_blocksize
function.description: Set the number of bytes that @src will push out with each buffer. When @blocksize is set to -1, a default length will be used.

function.name: gst_base_src_set_caps
function.description: Set new caps on the basesrc source pad.
function.return: %TRUE if the caps could be set

function.name: gst_base_src_set_do_timestamp
function.description: Configure @src to automatically timestamp outgoing buffers based on the current running_time of the pipeline. This property is mostly useful for live sources.

function.name: gst_base_src_set_dynamic_size
function.description: If not @dynamic, size is only updated when needed, such as when trying to read past current tracked size. Otherwise, size is checked for upon each read.

function.name: gst_base_src_set_format
function.description:
Sets the default format of the source. This will be the format used for sending SEGMENT events and for performing seeks.
If a format of GST_FORMAT_BYTES is set, the element will be able to operate in pull mode if the #GstBaseSrcClass.is_seekable() returns %TRUE.
This function must only be called in states < %GST_STATE_PAUSED.

function.name: gst_base_src_set_live
function.description:
If the element listens to a live source, @live should be set to %TRUE.
A live source will not produce data in the PAUSED state and will therefore not be able to participate in the PREROLL phase of a pipeline. To signal this fact to the application and the pipeline, the state change return value of the live source will be GST_STATE_CHANGE_NO_PREROLL.

function.name: gst_base_src_start_complete
function.description: Complete an asynchronous start operation. When the subclass overrides the start method, it should call gst_base_src_start_complete() when the start operation completes either from the same thread or from an asynchronous helper thread.

function.name: gst_base_src_start_wait
function.description: Wait until the start operation completes.
function.return: a #GstFlowReturn.

function.name: gst_base_src_wait_playing
function.description:
If the #GstBaseSrcClass.create() method performs its own synchronisation against the clock it must unblock when going from PLAYING to the PAUSED state and call this method before continuing to produce the remaining data.
This function will block until a state change to PLAYING happens (in which case this function returns %GST_FLOW_OK) or the processing must be stopped due to a state change to READY or a FLUSH event (in which case this function returns %GST_FLOW_FLUSHING).
function.return: %GST_FLOW_OK if @src is PLAYING and processing can continue. Any other return value should be returned from the create vmethod.

function.name: gst_base_transform_get_allocator
function.description:
Lets #GstBaseTransform sub-classes to know the memory @allocator used by the base class and its @params.
Unref the @allocator after use it.

function.name: gst_base_transform_get_buffer_pool
function.return: the instance of the #GstBufferPool used by @trans; free it after use it

function.name: gst_base_transform_is_in_place
function.description: See if @trans is configured as a in_place transform.
function.return:
%TRUE is the transform is configured in in_place mode.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_base_transform_is_passthrough
function.description: See if @trans is configured as a passthrough transform.
function.return:
%TRUE is the transform is configured in passthrough mode.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_base_transform_is_qos_enabled
function.description: Queries if the transform will handle QoS.
function.return:
%TRUE if QoS is enabled.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_base_transform_reconfigure_sink
function.description: Instructs @trans to request renegotiation upstream. This function is typically called after properties on the transform were set that influence the input format.

function.name: gst_base_transform_reconfigure_src
function.description: Instructs @trans to renegotiate a new downstream transform on the next buffer. This function is typically called after properties on the transform were set that influence the output format.

function.name: gst_base_transform_set_gap_aware
function.description:
If @gap_aware is %FALSE (the default), output buffers will have the %GST_BUFFER_FLAG_GAP flag unset.
If set to %TRUE, the element must handle output buffers with this flag set correctly, i.e. it can assume that the buffer contains neutral data but must unset the flag if the output is no neutral data.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_base_transform_set_in_place
function.description:
Determines whether a non-writable buffer will be copied before passing to the transform_ip function. <itemizedlist> <listitem>Always %TRUE if no transform function is implemented.</listitem> <listitem>Always %FALSE if ONLY transform function is implemented.</listitem> </itemizedlist>
MT safe.

parameter.name: in_place
parameter.parameter_description: Boolean value indicating that we would like to operate on in_place buffers.

function.name: gst_base_transform_set_passthrough
function.description:
Set passthrough mode for this filter by default. This is mostly useful for filters that do not care about negotiation.
Always %TRUE for filters which don't implement either a transform or transform_ip method.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_base_transform_set_prefer_passthrough
function.description:
If @prefer_passthrough is %TRUE (the default), @trans will check and prefer passthrough caps from the list of caps returned by the transform_caps vmethod.
If set to %FALSE, the element must order the caps returned from the transform_caps function in such a way that the preferred format is first in the list. This can be interesting for transforms that can do passthrough transforms but prefer to do something else, like a capsfilter.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_base_transform_set_qos_enabled
function.description:
Enable or disable QoS handling in the transform.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_base_transform_update_qos
function.description:
Set the QoS parameters in the transform. This function is called internally when a QOS event is received but subclasses can provide custom information when needed.
MT safe.

parameter.name: timestamp
parameter.parameter_description: the timestamp of the buffer generating the QoS expressed in running_time.

function.name: gst_base_transform_update_src_caps
function.description: Updates the srcpad caps and send the caps downstream. This function can be used by subclasses when they have already negotiated their caps but found a change in them (or computed new informations). This way, they can notify downstream about that change without loosing any buffer.

parameter.name: updated_caps
parameter.parameter_description: An updated version of the srcpad caps to be pushed downstream

function.return: %TRUE if the caps could be send downstream %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gst_bin_add
function.description:
Adds the given element to the bin. Sets the element's parent, and thus takes ownership of the element. An element can only be added to one bin.
If the element's pads are linked to other pads, the pads will be unlinked before the element is added to the bin.
<note> When you add an element to an already-running pipeline, you will have to take care to set the state of the newly-added element to the desired state (usually PLAYING or PAUSED, same you set the pipeline to originally) with gst_element_set_state(), or use gst_element_sync_state_with_parent(). The bin or pipeline will not take care of this for you. </note>
MT safe.
function.return: %TRUE if the element could be added, %FALSE if the bin does not want to accept the element.

function.name: gst_bin_add_many
function.description: Adds a %NULL-terminated list of elements to a bin. This function is equivalent to calling gst_bin_add() for each member of the list. The return value of each gst_bin_add() is ignored.

parameter.name: element_1
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstElement element to add to the bin

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: additional elements to add to the bin

function.name: gst_bin_find_unlinked_pad
function.description: Recursively looks for elements with an unlinked pad of the given direction within the specified bin and returns an unlinked pad if one is found, or %NULL otherwise. If a pad is found, the caller owns a reference to it and should use gst_object_unref() on the pad when it is not needed any longer.

parameter.name: bin
parameter.parameter_description: bin in which to look for elements with unlinked pads

parameter.name: direction
parameter.parameter_description: whether to look for an unlinked source or sink pad

function.return: unlinked pad of the given direction, %NULL.

function.name: gst_bin_get_by_interface
function.description:
Looks for an element inside the bin that implements the given interface. If such an element is found, it returns the element. You can cast this element to the given interface afterwards. If you want all elements that implement the interface, use gst_bin_iterate_all_by_interface(). This function recurses into child bins.
MT safe. Caller owns returned reference.
function.return: A #GstElement inside the bin implementing the interface

function.name: gst_bin_get_by_name
function.description: Gets the element with the given name from a bin. This function recurses into child bins.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the element name to search for

function.return: the #GstElement with the given name, or %NULL

function.name: gst_bin_get_by_name_recurse_up
function.description: Gets the element with the given name from this bin. If the element is not found, a recursion is performed on the parent bin.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the element name to search for

function.return: the #GstElement with the given name, or %NULL

function.name: gst_bin_iterate_all_by_interface
function.description:
Looks for all elements inside the bin that implements the given interface. You can safely cast all returned elements to the given interface. The function recurses inside child bins. The iterator will yield a series of #GstElement that should be unreffed after use.
MT safe. Caller owns returned value.

function.name: gst_bin_iterate_elements
function.description:
Gets an iterator for the elements in this bin.
MT safe. Caller owns returned value.
function.return: a #GstIterator of #GstElement, or %NULL

function.name: gst_bin_iterate_recurse
function.description:
Gets an iterator for the elements in this bin. This iterator recurses into GstBin children.
MT safe. Caller owns returned value.
function.return: a #GstIterator of #GstElement, or %NULL

function.name: gst_bin_iterate_sinks
function.description:
Gets an iterator for all elements in the bin that have the #GST_ELEMENT_FLAG_SINK flag set.
MT safe. Caller owns returned value.
function.return: a #GstIterator of #GstElement, or %NULL

function.name: gst_bin_iterate_sorted
function.description:
Gets an iterator for the elements in this bin in topologically sorted order. This means that the elements are returned from the most downstream elements (sinks) to the sources.
This function is used internally to perform the state changes of the bin elements and for clock selection.
MT safe. Caller owns returned value.
function.return: a #GstIterator of #GstElement, or %NULL

function.name: gst_bin_iterate_sources
function.description:
Gets an iterator for all elements in the bin that have the #GST_ELEMENT_FLAG_SOURCE flag set.
MT safe. Caller owns returned value.
function.return: a #GstIterator of #GstElement, or %NULL

function.name: gst_bin_new
function.description: Creates a new bin with the given name.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the new bin

function.return: a new #GstBin

function.name: gst_bin_recalculate_latency
function.description:
Query @bin for the current latency using and reconfigures this latency to all the elements with a LATENCY event.
This method is typically called on the pipeline when a #GST_MESSAGE_LATENCY is posted on the bus.
This function simply emits the 'do-latency' signal so any custom latency calculations will be performed.
function.return: %TRUE if the latency could be queried and reconfigured.

function.name: gst_bin_remove
function.description:
Removes the element from the bin, unparenting it as well. Unparenting the element means that the element will be dereferenced, so if the bin holds the only reference to the element, the element will be freed in the process of removing it from the bin. If you want the element to still exist after removing, you need to call gst_object_ref() before removing it from the bin.
If the element's pads are linked to other pads, the pads will be unlinked before the element is removed from the bin.
MT safe.
function.return: %TRUE if the element could be removed, %FALSE if the bin does not want to remove the element.

function.name: gst_bin_remove_many
function.description: Remove a list of elements from a bin. This function is equivalent to calling gst_bin_remove() with each member of the list.

parameter.name: element_1
parameter.parameter_description: the first #GstElement to remove from the bin

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: %NULL-terminated list of elements to remove from the bin

function.name: gst_bin_sync_children_states
function.description: Synchronizes the state of every child of @bin with the state of @bin. See also gst_element_sync_state_with_parent().
function.return: %TRUE if syncing the state was successful for all children, otherwise %FALSE.

function.name: gst_bit_reader_free
function.description: Frees a #GstBitReader instance, which was previously allocated by gst_bit_reader_new().

function.name: gst_bit_reader_get_bits_uint16
function.description: Read @nbits bits into @val and update the current position.

parameter.name: val
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to a #guint16 to store the result

function.return: %TRUE if successful, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_bit_reader_get_bits_uint16_unchecked
function.description: Read @nbits bits into @val and update the current position without checking if there are enough bits available in the bit reader.
function.return: unsigned 16 bit integer with the bits.

function.description: Read @nbits bits into @val and update the current position.

parameter.name: val
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to a #guint32 to store the result

function.return: %TRUE if successful, %FALSE otherwise.

function.description: Read @nbits bits into @val and update the current position without checking if there are enough bits available in the bit reader.
function.return: unsigned 32 bit integer with the bits.

function.description: Read @nbits bits into @val and update the current position.

parameter.name: val
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to a #guint64 to store the result

function.return: %TRUE if successful, %FALSE otherwise.

function.description: Read @nbits bits into @val and update the current position without checking if there are enough bits available in the bit reader.

function.name: gst_bit_reader_get_bits_uint8
function.description: Read @nbits bits into @val and update the current position.

parameter.name: val

function.return: %TRUE if successful, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_bit_reader_get_bits_uint8_unchecked
function.description: Read @nbits bits into @val and update the current position without checking if there are enough bits available in the bit reader.
function.return: unsigned 8 bit integer with the bits.

function.name: gst_bit_reader_get_pos
function.description: Returns the current position of a #GstBitReader instance in bits.
function.return: The current position of @reader in bits.

function.name: gst_bit_reader_get_remaining
function.description: Returns the remaining number of bits of a #GstBitReader instance.
function.return: The remaining number of bits of @reader instance.

function.name: gst_bit_reader_get_size
function.description: Returns the total number of bits of a #GstBitReader instance.
function.return: The total number of bits of @reader instance.

function.name: gst_bit_reader_init
function.description: Initializes a #GstBitReader instance to read from @data. This function can be called on already initialized instances.

parameter.name: data

function.name: gst_bit_reader_new
function.description:
Create a new #GstBitReader instance, which will read from @data.
Free-function: gst_bit_reader_free

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: Data from which the #GstBitReader should read

function.return: a new #GstBitReader instance

function.description: Read @nbits bits into @val but keep the current position.

parameter.name: val

function.return: %TRUE if successful, %FALSE otherwise.

function.description: Read @nbits bits into @val but keep the current position without checking if there are enough bits available in the bit reader
function.return: unsigned 32 bit integer with the bits.

function.name: gst_bit_reader_peek_bits_uint64
function.description: Read @nbits bits into @val but keep the current position.

parameter.name: val
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to a #guint64 to store the result

function.return: %TRUE if successful, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_bit_reader_peek_bits_uint64_unchecked
function.description: Read @nbits bits into @val but keep the current position without checking if there are enough bits available in the bit reader
function.return: unsigned 64 bit integer with the bits.

function.description: Read @nbits bits into @val but keep the current position.

function.description: Read @nbits bits into @val but keep the current position without checking if there are enough bits available in the bit reader
