function.name: gst_bit_reader_set_pos
function.description: Sets the new position of a #GstBitReader instance to @pos in bits.
function.return: %TRUE if the position could be set successfully, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_bit_reader_skip
function.description: Skips @nbits bits of the #GstBitReader instance.

parameter.name: nbits
parameter.parameter_description: the number of bits to skip

function.return: %TRUE if @nbits bits could be skipped, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_bit_reader_skip_to_byte
function.description: Skips until the next byte.
function.return: %TRUE if successful, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_bit_reader_skip_to_byte_unchecked
function.description: Skips until the next byte without checking if there are enough bits available in the bit reader.

function.name: gst_bit_reader_skip_unchecked
function.description: Skips @nbits bits of the #GstBitReader instance without checking if there are enough bits available in the bit reader.

parameter.name: nbits
parameter.parameter_description: the number of bits to skip

function.name: gst_buffer_add_audio_clipping_meta
function.description: Attaches #GstAudioClippingMeta metadata to @buffer with the given parameters.

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: GstFormat of @start and @stop, GST_FORMAT_DEFAULT is samples

parameter.name: start
parameter.parameter_description: Amount of audio to clip from start of buffer

parameter.name: end
parameter.parameter_description: Amount of to clip from end of buffer

function.return: the #GstAudioClippingMeta on @buffer.

function.name: gst_buffer_add_audio_downmix_meta
function.description:
Attaches #GstAudioDownmixMeta metadata to @buffer with the given parameters.
@matrix is an two-dimensional array of @to_channels times @from_channels coefficients, i.e. the i-th output channels is constructed by multiplicating the input channels with the coefficients in @matrix[i] and taking the sum of the results.

parameter.name: from_position
parameter.parameter_description: the channel positions of the source

parameter.name: from_channels
parameter.parameter_description: The number of channels of the source

parameter.name: to_position
parameter.parameter_description: the channel positions of the destination

parameter.name: to_channels
parameter.parameter_description: The number of channels of the destination

function.return: the #GstAudioDownmixMeta on @buffer.

function.name: gst_buffer_add_meta
function.description: Add metadata for @info to @buffer using the parameters in @params.
function.return: the metadata for the api in @info on @buffer.

function.name: gst_buffer_add_net_address_meta
function.description: Attaches @addr as metadata in a #GstNetAddressMeta to @buffer.
function.return: a #GstNetAddressMeta connected to @buffer

function.name: gst_buffer_add_net_control_message_meta
function.description: Attaches @message as metadata in a #GstNetControlMessageMeta to @buffer.
function.return: a #GstNetControlMessageMeta connected to @buffer

function.name: gst_buffer_add_parent_buffer_meta
function.description: Add a #GstParentBufferMeta to @buffer that holds a reference on @ref until the buffer is freed.
function.return: The #GstParentBufferMeta that was added to the buffer

function.name: gst_buffer_add_protection_meta
function.description: Attaches protection metadata to a #GstBuffer.

parameter.name: buffer
parameter.parameter_description: #GstBuffer holding an encrypted sample, to which protection metadata should be added.

parameter.name: info
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstStructure holding cryptographic information relating to the sample contained in @buffer. This function takes ownership of @info.

function.return: a pointer to the added #GstProtectionMeta if successful; %NULL if unsuccessful.

function.name: gst_buffer_add_video_affine_transformation_meta
function.description: Attaches GstVideoAffineTransformationMeta metadata to @buffer with the given parameters.
function.return: the #GstVideoAffineTransformationMeta on @buffer.

function.name: gst_buffer_add_video_gl_texture_upload_meta
function.description: Attaches GstVideoGLTextureUploadMeta metadata to @buffer with the given parameters.

parameter.name: upload
parameter.parameter_description: the function to upload the buffer to a specific texture ID

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: user data for the implementor of @upload

function.return: the #GstVideoGLTextureUploadMeta on @buffer.

function.name: gst_buffer_add_video_meta
function.description:
Attaches GstVideoMeta metadata to @buffer with the given parameters and the default offsets and strides for @format and @width x @height.
This function calculates the default offsets and strides and then calls gst_buffer_add_video_meta_full() with them.
function.return: the #GstVideoMeta on @buffer.

function.name: gst_buffer_add_video_meta_full
function.description: Attaches GstVideoMeta metadata to @buffer with the given parameters.
function.return: the #GstVideoMeta on @buffer.

function.name: gst_buffer_add_video_overlay_composition_meta
function.description: Sets an overlay composition on a buffer. The buffer will obtain its own reference to the composition, meaning this function does not take ownership of @comp.
function.return: a #GstVideoOverlayCompositionMeta

function.name: gst_buffer_add_video_region_of_interest_meta
function.description: Attaches #GstVideoRegionOfInterestMeta metadata to @buffer with the given parameters.

parameter.name: roi_type
parameter.parameter_description: Type of the region of interest (e.g. "face")

function.return: the #GstVideoRegionOfInterestMeta on @buffer.

function.name: gst_buffer_add_video_region_of_interest_meta_id
function.description: Attaches #GstVideoRegionOfInterestMeta metadata to @buffer with the given parameters.

parameter.name: roi_type
parameter.parameter_description: Type of the region of interest (e.g. "face")

function.return: the #GstVideoRegionOfInterestMeta on @buffer.

function.name: gst_buffer_append
function.description: Append all the memory from @buf2 to @buf1. The result buffer will contain a concatenation of the memory of @buf1 and @buf2.
function.return: the new #GstBuffer that contains the memory of the two source buffers.

function.name: gst_buffer_append_memory
function.description:
Append the memory block @mem to @buffer. This function takes ownership of @mem and thus doesn't increase its refcount.
This function is identical to gst_buffer_insert_memory() with an index of -1. See gst_buffer_insert_memory() for more details.

function.name: gst_buffer_append_region
function.return: the new #GstBuffer that contains the memory of the two source buffers.

function.name: gst_buffer_copy
function.description: Create a copy of the given buffer. This will only copy the buffer's data to a newly allocated memory if needed (if the type of memory requires it), otherwise the underlying data is just referenced. Check gst_buffer_copy_deep() if you want to force the data to be copied to newly allocated memory.
function.return: a new copy of @buf.

function.name: gst_buffer_copy_deep
function.description: Create a copy of the given buffer. This will make a newly allocated copy of the data the source buffer contains.
function.return: a new copy of @buf.

function.name: gst_buffer_copy_into

parameter.name: flags
parameter.parameter_description: flags indicating what metadata fields should be copied.

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: total size to copy. If -1, all data is copied.

function.return: %TRUE if the copying succeeded, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_buffer_copy_region
function.description:
Creates a sub-buffer from @parent at @offset and @size. This sub-buffer uses the actual memory space of the parent buffer. This function will copy the offset and timestamp fields when the offset is 0. If not, they will be set to #GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE and #GST_BUFFER_OFFSET_NONE. If @offset equals 0 and @size equals the total size of @buffer, the duration and offset end fields are also copied. If not they will be set to #GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE and #GST_BUFFER_OFFSET_NONE.
MT safe.

parameter.name: offset
parameter.parameter_description: the offset into parent #GstBuffer at which the new sub-buffer begins.

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: the size of the new #GstBuffer sub-buffer, in bytes. If -1, all data is copied.

function.return: the new #GstBuffer or %NULL if the arguments were invalid.

function.name: gst_buffer_extract
function.description: Copy @size bytes starting from @offset in @buffer to @dest.
function.return: The amount of bytes extracted. This value can be lower than @size when @buffer did not contain enough data.

function.name: gst_buffer_extract_dup
function.description: Extracts a copy of at most @size bytes the data at @offset into newly-allocated memory. @dest must be freed using g_free() when done.

parameter.name: dest
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer where the destination array will be written.

parameter.name: dest_size
parameter.parameter_description: A location where the size of @dest can be written

function.name: gst_buffer_fill
function.description: Copy @size bytes from @src to @buffer at @offset.
function.return: The amount of bytes copied. This value can be lower than @size when @buffer did not contain enough data.

function.name: gst_buffer_find_memory
function.return: %TRUE when @size bytes starting from @offset could be found in @buffer and @idx, @length and @skip will be filled.

function.name: gst_buffer_foreach_meta
function.description:
Call @func with @user_data for each meta in @buffer.
@func can modify the passed meta pointer or its contents. The return value of @func define if this function returns or if the remaining metadata items in the buffer should be skipped.
function.return: %FALSE when @func returned %FALSE for one of the metadata.

function.name: gst_buffer_get_all_memory
function.description: Get all the memory block in @buffer. The memory blocks will be merged into one large #GstMemory.
function.return: a #GstMemory that contains the merged memory. Use gst_memory_unref () after usage.

function.name: gst_buffer_get_audio_downmix_meta_for_channels
function.description: Find the #GstAudioDownmixMeta on @buffer for the given destination channel positions.

parameter.name: to_position
parameter.parameter_description: the channel positions of the destination

parameter.name: to_channels
parameter.parameter_description: The number of channels of the destination

function.return: the #GstAudioDownmixMeta on @buffer.

function.name: gst_buffer_get_max_memory
function.description:
Get the maximum amount of memory blocks that a buffer can hold. This is a compile time constant that can be queried with the function.
When more memory blocks are added, existing memory blocks will be merged together to make room for the new block.
function.return: the maximum amount of memory blocks that a buffer can hold.

function.name: gst_buffer_get_memory
function.description: Get the memory block at index @idx in @buffer.
function.return: a #GstMemory that contains the data of the memory block at @idx. Use gst_memory_unref () after usage.

function.name: gst_buffer_get_memory_range
function.description:
Get @length memory blocks in @buffer starting at @idx. The memory blocks will be merged into one large #GstMemory.
If @length is -1, all memory starting from @idx is merged.
function.return: a #GstMemory that contains the merged data of @length blocks starting at @idx. Use gst_memory_unref () after usage.

function.name: gst_buffer_get_meta
function.description: Get the metadata for @api on buffer. When there is no such metadata, %NULL is returned. If multiple metadata with the given @api are attached to this buffer only the first one is returned. To handle multiple metadata with a given API use gst_buffer_iterate_meta() or gst_buffer_foreach_meta() instead and check the meta->info.api member for the API type.
function.return: the metadata for @api on @buffer.

function.name: gst_buffer_get_net_address_meta
function.description: Find the #GstNetAddressMeta on @buffer.
function.return: the #GstNetAddressMeta or %NULL when there is no such metadata on @buffer.

function.name: gst_buffer_get_parent_buffer_meta
function.description: Find and return a #GstParentBufferMeta if one exists on the buffer

function.name: gst_buffer_get_size
function.description: Get the total size of the memory blocks in @buffer.
function.return: total size of the memory blocks in @buffer.

function.name: gst_buffer_get_sizes
function.description:
Get the total size of the memory blocks in @b.
When not %NULL, @offset will contain the offset of the data in the first memory block in @buffer and @maxsize will contain the sum of the size and @offset and the amount of extra padding on the last memory block. @offset and @maxsize can be used to resize the buffer memory blocks with gst_buffer_resize().
function.return: total size of the memory blocks in @buffer.

function.name: gst_buffer_get_sizes_range
function.description:
Get the total size of @length memory blocks stating from @idx in @buffer.
When not %NULL, @offset will contain the offset of the data in the memory block in @buffer at @idx and @maxsize will contain the sum of the size and @offset and the amount of extra padding on the memory block at @idx + @length -1. @offset and @maxsize can be used to resize the buffer memory blocks with gst_buffer_resize_range().
function.return: total size of @length memory blocks starting at @idx in @buffer.

function.name: gst_buffer_get_video_meta
function.description:
Find the #GstVideoMeta on @buffer with the lowest @id.
Buffers can contain multiple #GstVideoMeta metadata items when dealing with multiview buffers.
function.return: the #GstVideoMeta with lowest id (usually 0) or %NULL when there is no such metadata on @buffer.

function.name: gst_buffer_get_video_meta_id
function.description:
Find the #GstVideoMeta on @buffer with the given @id.
Buffers can contain multiple #GstVideoMeta metadata items when dealing with multiview buffers.
function.return: the #GstVideoMeta with @id or %NULL when there is no such metadata on @buffer.

function.name: gst_buffer_get_video_region_of_interest_meta_id
function.description:
Find the #GstVideoRegionOfInterestMeta on @buffer with the given @id.
Buffers can contain multiple #GstVideoRegionOfInterestMeta metadata items if multiple regions of interests are marked on a frame.
function.return: the #GstVideoRegionOfInterestMeta with @id or %NULL when there is no such metadata on @buffer.

function.name: gst_buffer_insert_memory
function.description:
Insert the memory block @mem to @buffer at @idx. This function takes ownership of @mem and thus doesn't increase its refcount.
Only gst_buffer_get_max_memory() can be added to a buffer. If more memory is added, existing memory blocks will automatically be merged to make room for the new memory.

parameter.name: idx
parameter.parameter_description: the index to add the memory at, or -1 to append it to the end

function.name: gst_buffer_is_all_memory_writable
function.description:
Check if all memory blocks in @buffer are writable.
Note that this function does not check if @buffer is writable, use gst_buffer_is_writable() to check that if needed.
function.return: %TRUE if all memory blocks in @buffer are writable

function.name: gst_buffer_is_memory_range_writable
function.return: %TRUE if the memory range is writable

function.name: gst_buffer_is_writable
function.description: Tests if you can safely write to a buffer's metadata or its memory array. It is only safe to change buffer metadata when the current reference is writable, i.e. nobody can see the modifications you will make.

function.name: gst_buffer_iterate_meta
function.return: The next #GstMeta or %NULL when there are no more items.

function.name: gst_buffer_list_add
function.description: Append @b at the end of @l.

function.name: gst_buffer_list_copy
function.description: Create a shallow copy of the given buffer list. This will make a newly allocated copy of the source list with copies of buffer pointers. The refcount of buffers pointed to will be increased by one.
function.return: a new copy of @list.

function.name: gst_buffer_list_copy_deep
function.description: Create a copy of the given buffer list. This will make a newly allocated copy of the buffer that the source buffer list contains.
function.return: a new copy of @list.

function.name: gst_buffer_list_foreach
function.description:
Call @func with @data for each buffer in @list.
@func can modify the passed buffer pointer or its contents. The return value of @func define if this function returns or if the remaining buffers in the list should be skipped.
function.return: %TRUE when @func returned %TRUE for each buffer in @list or when @list is empty.

function.name: gst_buffer_list_get
function.description: Get the buffer at @idx.
function.return: the buffer at @idx in @group or %NULL when there is no buffer. The buffer remains valid as long as @list is valid and buffer is not removed from the list.

function.name: gst_buffer_list_insert
function.description:
Insert @buffer at @idx in @list. Other buffers are moved to make room for this new buffer.
A -1 value for @idx will append the buffer at the end.

function.name: gst_buffer_list_is_writable
function.description: Tests if you can safely add buffers and groups into a buffer list.

function.name: gst_buffer_list_length
function.description: Returns the number of buffers in @list.
function.return: the number of buffers in the buffer list

function.name: gst_buffer_list_make_writable
function.description: Makes a writable buffer list from the given buffer list. If the source buffer list is already writable, this will simply return the same buffer list. A copy will otherwise be made using gst_buffer_list_copy().
function.return: a writable list, which may or may not be the same as @list

function.name: gst_buffer_list_new
function.description:
Creates a new, empty #GstBufferList. The caller is responsible for unreffing the returned #GstBufferList.
Free-function: gst_buffer_list_unref
function.return: the new #GstBufferList. gst_buffer_list_unref() after usage.

function.name: gst_buffer_list_new_sized
function.description:
Creates a new, empty #GstBufferList. The caller is responsible for unreffing the returned #GstBufferList. The list will have @size space preallocated so that memory reallocations can be avoided.
Free-function: gst_buffer_list_unref
function.return: the new #GstBufferList. gst_buffer_list_unref() after usage.

function.name: gst_buffer_list_ref
function.description:
Increases the refcount of the given buffer list by one.
Note that the refcount affects the writability of @list and its data, see gst_buffer_list_make_writable(). It is important to note that keeping additional references to GstBufferList instances can potentially increase the number of memcpy operations in a pipeline.
function.return: @list

function.name: gst_buffer_list_remove
function.description: Remove @length buffers starting from @idx in @list. The following buffers are moved to close the gap.

function.name: gst_buffer_list_unref
function.description: Decreases the refcount of the buffer list. If the refcount reaches 0, the buffer list will be freed.

function.name: gst_buffer_make_writable
function.description:
Returns a writable copy of @buf. If the source buffer is already writable, this will simply return the same buffer.
Use this function to ensure that a buffer can be safely modified before making changes to it, including changing the metadata such as PTS/DTS.
If the reference count of the source buffer @buf is exactly one, the caller is the sole owner and this function will return the buffer object unchanged.
If there is more than one reference on the object, a copy will be made using gst_buffer_copy(). The passed-in @buf will be unreffed in that case, and the caller will now own a reference to the new returned buffer object. Note that this just copies the buffer structure itself, the underlying memory is not copied if it can be shared amongst multiple buffers.
In short, this function unrefs the buf in the argument and refs the buffer that it returns. Don't access the argument after calling this function unless you have an additional reference to it.
function.return: a writable buffer which may or may not be the same as @buf

function.name: gst_buffer_map
function.description:
This function fills @info with the #GstMapInfo of all merged memory blocks in @buffer.
@flags describe the desired access of the memory. When @flags is #GST_MAP_WRITE, @buffer should be writable (as returned from gst_buffer_is_writable()).
When @buffer is writable but the memory isn't, a writable copy will automatically be created and returned. The readonly copy of the buffer memory will then also be replaced with this writable copy.
The memory in @info should be unmapped with gst_buffer_unmap() after usage.
function.return: %TRUE if the map succeeded and @info contains valid data.

function.name: gst_buffer_map_range
function.description:
This function fills @info with the #GstMapInfo of @length merged memory blocks starting at @idx in @buffer. When @length is -1, all memory blocks starting from @idx are merged and mapped.
@flags describe the desired access of the memory. When @flags is #GST_MAP_WRITE, @buffer should be writable (as returned from gst_buffer_is_writable()).
When @buffer is writable but the memory isn't, a writable copy will automatically be created and returned. The readonly copy of the buffer memory will then also be replaced with this writable copy.
The memory in @info should be unmapped with gst_buffer_unmap() after usage.
function.return: %TRUE if the map succeeded and @info contains valid data.

function.name: gst_buffer_memcmp
function.description: Compare @size bytes starting from @offset in @buffer with the memory in @mem.
function.return: 0 if the memory is equal.

function.name: gst_buffer_memset
function.description: Fill @buf with @size bytes with @val starting from @offset.
function.return: The amount of bytes filled. This value can be lower than @size when @buffer did not contain enough data.

function.name: gst_buffer_n_memory
function.description: Get the amount of memory blocks that this buffer has. This amount is never larger than what gst_buffer_get_max_memory() returns.
function.return: the amount of memory block in this buffer.

function.name: gst_buffer_new
function.description:
Creates a newly allocated buffer without any data.
MT safe.
function.return: the new #GstBuffer.

function.name: gst_buffer_new_allocate
function.description:
Tries to create a newly allocated buffer with data of the given size and extra parameters from @allocator. If the requested amount of memory can't be allocated, %NULL will be returned. The allocated buffer memory is not cleared.
When @allocator is %NULL, the default memory allocator will be used.
Note that when @size == 0, the buffer will not have memory associated with it.
MT safe.

parameter.name: allocator
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstAllocator to use, or %NULL to use the default allocator

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: the size in bytes of the new buffer's data.

function.return: a new #GstBuffer, or %NULL if the memory couldn't be allocated.

function.name: gst_buffer_new_wrapped
function.description:
Creates a new buffer that wraps the given @data. The memory will be freed with g_free and will be marked writable.
MT safe.
function.return: a new #GstBuffer

function.name: gst_buffer_new_wrapped_full

parameter.name: notify
parameter.parameter_description: called with @user_data when the memory is freed

function.return: a new #GstBuffer

function.name: gst_buffer_peek_memory
function.description: Get the memory block at @idx in @buffer. The memory block stays valid until the memory block in @buffer is removed, replaced or merged, typically with any call that modifies the memory in @buffer.
function.return: the #GstMemory at @idx.

function.name: gst_buffer_pool_acquire_buffer
function.description:
Acquire a buffer from @pool. @buffer should point to a memory location that can hold a pointer to the new buffer.
@params can be %NULL or contain optional parameters to influence the allocation.
function.return: a #GstFlowReturn such as %GST_FLOW_FLUSHING when the pool is inactive.

function.name: gst_buffer_pool_config_add_option
function.description:
Enabled the option in @config. This will instruct the @bufferpool to enable the specified option on the buffers that it allocates.
The supported options by @pool can be retrieved with gst_buffer_pool_get_options().

function.name: gst_buffer_pool_config_get_allocator
function.description: Get the @allocator and @params from @config.
function.return: %TRUE, if the values are set.

function.name: gst_buffer_pool_config_get_option
function.description: Parse an available @config and get the option at @index of the options API array.

parameter.name: index
parameter.parameter_description: position in the option array to read

function.return: a #gchar of the option at @index.

function.name: gst_buffer_pool_config_get_params
function.description: Get the configuration values from @config.

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: the size of each buffer, not including prefix and padding

parameter.name: min_buffers
parameter.parameter_description: the minimum amount of buffers to allocate.

parameter.name: max_buffers
parameter.parameter_description: the maximum amount of buffers to allocate or 0 for unlimited.

function.return: %TRUE if all parameters could be fetched.

function.name: gst_buffer_pool_config_get_video_alignment
function.description: Get the video alignment from the bufferpool configuration @config in in @align
function.return: #TRUE if @config could be parsed correctly.

function.name: gst_buffer_pool_config_has_option
function.description: Check if @config contains @option.
function.return: %TRUE if the options array contains @option.

function.name: gst_buffer_pool_config_n_options
function.description: Retrieve the number of values currently stored in the options array of the @config structure.
function.return: the options array size as a #guint.

function.name: gst_buffer_pool_config_set_allocator
function.description:
Set the @allocator and @params on @config.
One of @allocator and @params can be %NULL, but not both. When @allocator is %NULL, the default allocator of the pool will use the values in @param to perform its allocation. When @param is %NULL, the pool will use the provided @allocator with its default #GstAllocationParams.
A call to gst_buffer_pool_set_config() can update the allocator and params with the values that it is able to do. Some pools are, for example, not able to operate with different allocators or cannot allocate with the values specified in @params. Use gst_buffer_pool_get_config() to get the currently used values.

function.name: gst_buffer_pool_config_set_params
function.description: Configure @config with the given parameters.

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: the size of each buffer, not including prefix and padding

parameter.name: min_buffers
parameter.parameter_description: the minimum amount of buffers to allocate.

parameter.name: max_buffers
parameter.parameter_description: the maximum amount of buffers to allocate or 0 for unlimited.

function.name: gst_buffer_pool_config_set_video_alignment
function.description: Set the video alignment in @align to the bufferpool configuration @config

function.name: gst_buffer_pool_config_validate_params
function.description: Validate that changes made to @config are still valid in the context of the expected parameters. This function is a helper that can be used to validate changes made by a pool to a config when gst_buffer_pool_set_config() returns %FALSE. This expects that @caps haven't changed and that @min_buffers aren't lower then what we initially expected. This does not check if options or allocator parameters are still valid, won't check if size have changed, since changing the size is valid to adapt padding.

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: the expected size of each buffer, not including prefix and padding

parameter.name: min_buffers
parameter.parameter_description: the expected minimum amount of buffers to allocate.

parameter.name: max_buffers
parameter.parameter_description: the expect maximum amount of buffers to allocate or 0 for unlimited.

function.return: %TRUE, if the parameters are valid in this context.

function.name: gst_buffer_pool_get_config
function.description: Get a copy of the current configuration of the pool. This configuration can either be modified and used for the gst_buffer_pool_set_config() call or it must be freed after usage.
function.return: a copy of the current configuration of @pool. use gst_structure_free() after usage or gst_buffer_pool_set_config().

function.name: gst_buffer_pool_get_options
function.return: a %NULL terminated array of strings.

function.name: gst_buffer_pool_has_option
function.description: Check if the bufferpool supports @option.
function.return: %TRUE if the buffer pool contains @option.

function.name: gst_buffer_pool_is_active
function.description: Check if @pool is active. A pool can be activated with the gst_buffer_pool_set_active() call.
function.return: %TRUE when the pool is active.

function.name: gst_buffer_pool_new
function.description: Creates a new #GstBufferPool instance.
function.return: a new #GstBufferPool instance

function.name: gst_buffer_pool_release_buffer
function.description:
Release @buffer to @pool. @buffer should have previously been allocated from @pool with gst_buffer_pool_acquire_buffer().
This function is usually called automatically when the last ref on @buffer disappears.

function.name: gst_buffer_pool_set_active
function.description:
Control the active state of @pool. When the pool is inactive, new calls to gst_buffer_pool_acquire_buffer() will return with %GST_FLOW_FLUSHING.
Activating the bufferpool will preallocate all resources in the pool based on the configuration of the pool.
Deactivating will free the resources again when there are no outstanding buffers. When there are outstanding buffers, they will be freed as soon as they are all returned to the pool.
function.return: %FALSE when the pool was not configured or when preallocation of the buffers failed.

function.name: gst_buffer_pool_set_config
function.description:
Set the configuration of the pool. If the pool is already configured, and the configuration haven't change, this function will return %TRUE. If the pool is active, this method will return %FALSE and active configuration will remain. Buffers allocated form this pool must be returned or else this function will do nothing and return %FALSE.
@config is a #GstStructure that contains the configuration parameters for the pool. A default and mandatory set of parameters can be configured with gst_buffer_pool_config_set_params(), gst_buffer_pool_config_set_allocator() and gst_buffer_pool_config_add_option().
If the parameters in @config can not be set exactly, this function returns %FALSE and will try to update as much state as possible. The new state can then be retrieved and refined with gst_buffer_pool_get_config().
This function takes ownership of @config.
function.return: %TRUE when the configuration could be set.

function.name: gst_buffer_pool_set_flushing
function.description: Enable or disable the flushing state of a @pool without freeing or allocating buffers.

parameter.name: flushing
parameter.parameter_description: whether to start or stop flushing

function.name: gst_buffer_prepend_memory
function.description:
Prepend the memory block @mem to @buffer. This function takes ownership of @mem and thus doesn't increase its refcount.
This function is identical to gst_buffer_insert_memory() with an index of 0. See gst_buffer_insert_memory() for more details.

function.name: gst_buffer_ref
function.description:
Increases the refcount of the given buffer by one.
Note that the refcount affects the writability of @buf and its metadata, see gst_buffer_is_writable(). It is important to note that keeping additional references to GstBuffer instances can potentially increase the number of memcpy operations in a pipeline.
function.return: @buf

function.name: gst_buffer_remove_all_memory
function.description: Remove all the memory blocks in @buffer.

function.name: gst_buffer_remove_memory
function.description: Remove the memory block in @b at index @i.

function.name: gst_buffer_remove_memory_range
function.description:
Remove @length memory blocks in @buffer starting from @idx.
@length can be -1, in which case all memory starting from @idx is removed.

function.name: gst_buffer_remove_meta
function.description: Remove the metadata for @meta on @buffer.
function.return: %TRUE if the metadata existed and was removed, %FALSE if no such metadata was on @buffer.

function.name: gst_buffer_replace
function.description:
Modifies a pointer to a #GstBuffer to point to a different #GstBuffer. The modification is done atomically (so this is useful for ensuring thread safety in some cases), and the reference counts are updated appropriately (the old buffer is unreffed, the new is reffed).
Either @nbuf or the #GstBuffer pointed to by @obuf may be %NULL.

parameter.name: obuf
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a pointer to a #GstBuffer to be replaced.

parameter.name: nbuf
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a #GstBuffer that will replace the buffer pointed to by @obuf.

function.return: %TRUE when @obuf was different from @nbuf.

function.name: gst_buffer_replace_all_memory
function.description: Replaces all memory in @buffer with @mem.

function.name: gst_buffer_replace_memory
function.description: Replaces the memory block at index @idx in @buffer with @mem.

function.name: gst_buffer_replace_memory_range
gst_buffer_resize
function.description: Set the offset and total size of the memory blocks in @buffer.

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: the new size or -1 to just adjust the offset

function.name: gst_buffer_resize_range
function.description: Set the total size of the @length memory blocks starting at @idx in @buffer

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: the new size or -1 to just adjust the offset

function.return: %TRUE if resizing succeeded, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_buffer_set_size
function.description: Set the total size of the memory blocks in @buffer.

function.name: gst_buffer_straw_get_buffer
function.description:
Get one buffer from @pad. Implemented via buffer probes. This function will block until the pipeline passes a buffer over @pad, so for robust behavior in unit tests, you need to use check's timeout to fail out in the case that a buffer never arrives.
You must have previously called gst_buffer_straw_start_pipeline() on @pipeline and @pad.

parameter.name: bin
parameter.parameter_description: the pipeline previously started via gst_buffer_straw_start_pipeline()

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: the pad previously passed to gst_buffer_straw_start_pipeline()

function.return: the captured #GstBuffer.

function.name: gst_buffer_straw_start_pipeline
function.description:
Sets up a pipeline for buffer sucking. This will allow you to call gst_buffer_straw_get_buffer() to access buffers as they pass over @pad.
This function is normally used in unit tests that want to verify that a particular element is outputting correct buffers. For example, you would make a pipeline via gst_parse_launch(), pull out the pad you want to monitor, then call gst_buffer_straw_get_buffer() to get the buffers that pass through @pad. The pipeline will block until you have sucked off the buffers.
This function will set the state of @bin to PLAYING; to clean up, be sure to call gst_buffer_straw_stop_pipeline().
Note that you may not start two buffer straws at the same time. This function is intended for unit tests, not general API use. In fact it calls fail_if from libcheck, so you cannot use it outside unit tests.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a pad on an element in @bin

function.name: gst_buffer_straw_stop_pipeline
function.description:
Set @bin to #GST_STATE_NULL and release resource allocated in gst_buffer_straw_start_pipeline().
You must have previously called gst_buffer_straw_start_pipeline() on @pipeline and @pad.

parameter.name: bin
parameter.parameter_description: the pipeline previously started via gst_buffer_straw_start_pipeline()

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: the pad previously passed to gst_buffer_straw_start_pipeline()

function.name: gst_buffer_unmap
function.description: Release the memory previously mapped with gst_buffer_map().

function.name: gst_buffer_unref
function.description: Decreases the refcount of the buffer. If the refcount reaches 0, the buffer with the associated metadata and memory will be freed.

function.name: gst_bus_add_signal_watch
function.description:
Adds a bus signal watch to the default main context with the default priority (%G_PRIORITY_DEFAULT). It is also possible to use a non-default main context set up using g_main_context_push_thread_default() (before one had to create a bus watch source and attach it to the desired main context 'manually').
After calling this statement, the bus will emit the "message" signal for each message posted on the bus.
This function may be called multiple times. To clean up, the caller is responsible for calling gst_bus_remove_signal_watch() as many times as this function is called.
MT safe.

parameter.name: bus
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstBus on which you want to receive the "message" signal

function.name: gst_bus_add_signal_watch_full
function.description:
Adds a bus signal watch to the default main context with the given @priority (e.g. %G_PRIORITY_DEFAULT). It is also possible to use a non-default main context set up using g_main_context_push_thread_default() (before one had to create a bus watch source and attach it to the desired main context 'manually').
After calling this statement, the bus will emit the "message" signal for each message posted on the bus when the main loop is running.
This function may be called multiple times. To clean up, the caller is responsible for calling gst_bus_remove_signal_watch() as many times as this function is called.
There can only be a single bus watch per bus, you must remove any signal watch before you can set another type of watch.
MT safe.

parameter.name: bus
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstBus on which you want to receive the "message" signal

function.name: gst_bus_add_watch
function.description:
Adds a bus watch to the default main context with the default priority (%G_PRIORITY_DEFAULT). It is also possible to use a non-default main context set up using g_main_context_push_thread_default() (before one had to create a bus watch source and attach it to the desired main context 'manually').
This function is used to receive asynchronous messages in the main loop. There can only be a single bus watch per bus, you must remove it before you can set a new one.
The bus watch will only work if a GLib main loop is being run.
The watch can be removed using gst_bus_remove_watch() or by returning %FALSE from @func. If the watch was added to the default main context it is also possible to remove the watch using g_source_remove().

parameter.name: bus
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstBus to create the watch for

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: A function to call when a message is received.

function.return:
The event source id or 0 if @bus already got an event source.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_bus_add_watch_full
function.description:
Adds a bus watch to the default main context with the given @priority (e.g. %G_PRIORITY_DEFAULT). It is also possible to use a non-default main context set up using g_main_context_push_thread_default() (before one had to create a bus watch source and attach it to the desired main context 'manually').
This function is used to receive asynchronous messages in the main loop. There can only be a single bus watch per bus, you must remove it before you can set a new one.
The bus watch will only work if a GLib main loop is being run.
When @func is called, the message belongs to the caller; if you want to keep a copy of it, call gst_message_ref() before leaving @func.
The watch can be removed using gst_bus_remove_watch() or by returning %FALSE from @func. If the watch was added to the default main context it is also possible to remove the watch using g_source_remove().
MT safe.

parameter.name: bus
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstBus to create the watch for.

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: A function to call when a message is received.

parameter.name: notify
parameter.parameter_description: the function to call when the source is removed.

function.return: The event source id or 0 if @bus already got an event source.

function.name: gst_bus_async_signal_func
function.description: A helper #GstBusFunc that can be used to convert all asynchronous messages into signals.
function.return: %TRUE

function.name: gst_bus_create_watch
function.description: Create watch for this bus. The GSource will be dispatched whenever a message is on the bus. After the GSource is dispatched, the message is popped off the bus and unreffed.

parameter.name: bus
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstBus to create the watch for

function.return: a #GSource that can be added to a mainloop.

function.name: gst_bus_disable_sync_message_emission
function.description:
Instructs GStreamer to stop emitting the "sync-message" signal for this bus. See gst_bus_enable_sync_message_emission() for more information.
In the event that multiple pieces of code have called gst_bus_enable_sync_message_emission(), the sync-message emissions will only be stopped after all calls to gst_bus_enable_sync_message_emission() were "cancelled" by calling this function. In this way the semantics are exactly the same as gst_object_ref() that which calls enable should also call disable.
MT safe.

parameter.name: bus
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstBus on which you previously called gst_bus_enable_sync_message_emission()

function.name: gst_bus_enable_sync_message_emission
function.description:
Instructs GStreamer to emit the "sync-message" signal after running the bus's sync handler. This function is here so that code can ensure that they can synchronously receive messages without having to affect what the bin's sync handler is.
This function may be called multiple times. To clean up, the caller is responsible for calling gst_bus_disable_sync_message_emission() as many times as this function is called.
While this function looks similar to gst_bus_add_signal_watch(), it is not exactly the same -- this function enables <emphasis>synchronous</emphasis> emission of signals when messages arrive; gst_bus_add_signal_watch() adds an idle callback to pop messages off the bus <emphasis>asynchronously</emphasis>. The sync-message signal comes from the thread of whatever object posted the message; the "message" signal is marshalled to the main thread via the main loop.
MT safe.

parameter.name: bus
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstBus on which you want to receive the "sync-message" signal

function.name: gst_bus_have_pending
function.description: Check if there are pending messages on the bus that should be handled.
function.return:
%TRUE if there are messages on the bus to be handled, %FALSE otherwise.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_bus_new
function.description: Creates a new #GstBus instance.
function.return: a new #GstBus instance

function.name: gst_bus_peek
function.description: Peek the message on the top of the bus' queue. The message will remain on the bus' message queue. A reference is returned, and needs to be unreffed by the caller.
function.return:
the #GstMessage that is on the bus, or %NULL if the bus is empty.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_bus_poll
function.description:
Poll the bus for messages. Will block while waiting for messages to come. You can specify a maximum time to poll with the @timeout parameter. If @timeout is negative, this function will block indefinitely.
All messages not in @events will be popped off the bus and will be ignored. It is not possible to use message enums beyond #GST_MESSAGE_EXTENDED in the @events mask
Because poll is implemented using the "message" signal enabled by gst_bus_add_signal_watch(), calling gst_bus_poll() will cause the "message" signal to be emitted for every message that poll sees. Thus a "message" signal handler will see the same messages that this function sees -- neither will steal messages from the other.
This function will run a main loop from the default main context when polling.
You should never use this function, since it is pure evil. This is especially true for GUI applications based on Gtk+ or Qt, but also for any other non-trivial application that uses the GLib main loop. As this function runs a GLib main loop, any callback attached to the default GLib main context may be invoked. This could be timeouts, GUI events, I/O events etc.; even if gst_bus_poll() is called with a 0 timeout. Any of these callbacks may do things you do not expect, e.g. destroy the main application window or some other resource; change other application state; display a dialog and run another main loop until the user clicks it away. In short, using this function may add a lot of complexity to your code through unexpected re-entrancy and unexpected changes to your application's state.
For 0 timeouts use gst_bus_pop_filtered() instead of this function; for other short timeouts use gst_bus_timed_pop_filtered(); everything else is better handled by setting up an asynchronous bus watch and doing things from there.

parameter.name: events
parameter.parameter_description: a mask of #GstMessageType, representing the set of message types to poll for (note special handling of extended message types below)

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.parameter_description: the poll timeout, as a #GstClockTime, or #GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE to poll indefinitely.

function.return: the message that was received, or %NULL if the poll timed out. The message is taken from the bus and needs to be unreffed with gst_message_unref() after usage.

function.name: gst_bus_pop
function.description: Get a message from the bus.
function.return:
the #GstMessage that is on the bus, or %NULL if the bus is empty. The message is taken from the bus and needs to be unreffed with gst_message_unref() after usage.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_bus_pop_filtered
function.description: Get a message matching @type from the bus. Will discard all messages on the bus that do not match @type and that have been posted before the first message that does match @type. If there is no message matching @type on the bus, all messages will be discarded. It is not possible to use message enums beyond #GST_MESSAGE_EXTENDED in the @events mask.

parameter.name: types
parameter.parameter_description: message types to take into account

function.return:
the next #GstMessage matching @type that is on the bus, or %NULL if the bus is empty or there is no message matching @type. The message is taken from the bus and needs to be unreffed with gst_message_unref() after usage.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_bus_post
function.description: Post a message on the given bus. Ownership of the message is taken by the bus.
function.return:
%TRUE if the message could be posted, %FALSE if the bus is flushing.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_bus_remove_signal_watch
function.description:
Removes a signal watch previously added with gst_bus_add_signal_watch().
MT safe.

parameter.name: bus
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstBus you previously added a signal watch to

function.name: gst_bus_remove_watch
function.description: Removes an installed bus watch from @bus.

parameter.name: bus
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstBus to remove the watch from.

function.return: %TRUE on success or %FALSE if @bus has no event source.

function.name: gst_bus_set_flushing
function.description:
If @flushing, flush out and unref any messages queued in the bus. Releases references to the message origin objects. Will flush future messages until gst_bus_set_flushing() sets @flushing to %FALSE.
MT safe.

parameter.name: flushing
parameter.parameter_description: whether or not to flush the bus

function.name: gst_bus_set_sync_handler
function.description:
Sets the synchronous handler on the bus. The function will be called every time a new message is posted on the bus. Note that the function will be called in the same thread context as the posting object. This function is usually only called by the creator of the bus. Applications should handle messages asynchronously using the gst_bus watch and poll functions.
You cannot replace an existing sync_handler. You can pass %NULL to this function, which will clear the existing handler.

parameter.name: bus
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstBus to install the handler on

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: User data that will be sent to the handler function.

function.name: gst_bus_sync_signal_handler
function.description: A helper GstBusSyncHandler that can be used to convert all synchronous messages into signals.
function.return: GST_BUS_PASS

function.name: gst_bus_timed_pop
function.description:
Get a message from the bus, waiting up to the specified timeout.
If @timeout is 0, this function behaves like gst_bus_pop(). If @timeout is #GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE, this function will block forever until a message was posted on the bus.
function.return:
the #GstMessage that is on the bus after the specified timeout or %NULL if the bus is empty after the timeout expired. The message is taken from the bus and needs to be unreffed with gst_message_unref() after usage.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_bus_timed_pop_filtered
function.description:
Get a message from the bus whose type matches the message type mask @types, waiting up to the specified timeout (and discarding any messages that do not match the mask provided).
If @timeout is 0, this function behaves like gst_bus_pop_filtered(). If @timeout is #GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE, this function will block forever until a matching message was posted on the bus.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.parameter_description: a timeout in nanoseconds, or GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE to wait forever

parameter.name: types
parameter.parameter_description: message types to take into account, GST_MESSAGE_ANY for any type

function.return:
a #GstMessage matching the filter in @types, or %NULL if no matching message was found on the bus until the timeout expired. The message is taken from the bus and needs to be unreffed with gst_message_unref() after usage.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_byte_reader_dup_data
function.description: Free-function: g_free

parameter.name: val
parameter.parameter_description: address of a #guint8 pointer variable in which to store the result

function.return: %TRUE if successful, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_byte_reader_dup_data_unchecked
function.description:
Returns a newly-allocated copy of the data at the current data position without checking if at least @size bytes are left. Advances the current read position by @size bytes.
Free-function: g_free
function.return: a newly-allocated copy of the data @size bytes in size. Free with g_free() when no longer needed.

function.name: gst_byte_reader_dup_string_utf16
function.description: Free-function: g_free

parameter.name: str
parameter.parameter_description: address of a #guint16 pointer variable in which to store the result

function.return: %TRUE if a string could be read, %FALSE otherwise. The string put into @str must be freed with g_free() when no longer needed.

function.name: gst_byte_reader_dup_string_utf32
function.description: Free-function: g_free

parameter.name: str
parameter.parameter_description: address of a #guint32 pointer variable in which to store the result

function.return: %TRUE if a string could be read, %FALSE otherwise. The string put into @str must be freed with g_free() when no longer needed.

function.name: gst_byte_reader_dup_string_utf8
function.description:
Free-function: g_free
FIXME:Reads (copies) a NUL-terminated string in the #GstByteReader instance, advancing the current position to the byte after the string. This will work for any NUL-terminated string with a character width of 8 bits, so ASCII, UTF-8, ISO-8859-N etc. No input checking for valid UTF-8 is done.
This function will fail if no NUL-terminator was found in in the data.

parameter.name: str
parameter.parameter_description: address of a #gchar pointer variable in which to store the result

function.return: %TRUE if a string could be read into @str, %FALSE otherwise. The string put into @str must be freed with g_free() when no longer needed.

function.name: gst_byte_reader_free
function.description: Frees a #GstByteReader instance, which was previously allocated by gst_byte_reader_new().

function.name: gst_byte_reader_get_data
function.description: Returns a constant pointer to the current data position if at least @size bytes are left and updates the current position.

parameter.name: val
parameter.parameter_description: address of a #guint8 pointer variable in which to store the result

function.return: %TRUE if successful, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_byte_reader_get_data_unchecked
function.return: a constant pointer to the current data position.

function.name: gst_byte_reader_get_float32_be
function.description: Read a 32 bit big endian floating point value into @val and update the current position.

parameter.name: val

function.description: Returns the current position of a #GstByteReader instance in bytes.
function.return: The current position of @reader in bytes.

function.description: Returns the remaining number of bytes of a #GstByteReader instance.
function.return: The remaining number of bytes of @reader instance.

function.description: Returns the total number of bytes of a #GstByteReader instance.
function.return: The total number of bytes of @reader instance.

function.name: gst_byte_reader_get_string_utf8
function.description:
Returns a constant pointer to the current data position if there is a NUL-terminated string in the data (this could be just a NUL terminator), advancing the current position to the byte after the string. This will work for any NUL-terminated string with a character width of 8 bits, so ASCII, UTF-8, ISO-8859-N etc.
No input checking for valid UTF-8 is done.
This function will fail if no NUL-terminator was found in in the data.

parameter.name: str
parameter.parameter_description: address of a #gchar pointer variable in which to store the result

function.return: %TRUE if a string could be found, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_byte_reader_get_sub_reader
function.description:
Initializes a #GstByteReader sub-reader instance to contain @size bytes of data from the current position of @reader. This is useful to read chunked formats and make sure that one doesn't read beyond the size of the sub-chunk.
Unlike gst_byte_reader_peek_sub_reader(), this function also modifies the position of @reader and moves it forward by @size bytes.

parameter.name: sub_reader
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstByteReader instance to initialize as sub-reader

function.return: FALSE on error or if @reader does not contain @size more bytes from the current position, and otherwise TRUE

function.name: gst_byte_reader_init
function.description: Initializes a #GstByteReader instance to read from @data. This function can be called on already initialized instances.

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: data from which the #GstByteReader should read

function.name: gst_byte_reader_masked_scan_uint32
function.description:
Scan for pattern @pattern with applied mask @mask in the byte reader data, starting from offset @offset relative to the current position.
The bytes in @pattern and @mask are interpreted left-to-right, regardless of endianness. All four bytes of the pattern must be present in the byte reader data for it to match, even if the first or last bytes are masked out.
It is an error to call this function without making sure that there is enough data (offset+size bytes) in the byte reader.

parameter.name: mask
parameter.parameter_description: mask to apply to data before matching against @pattern

parameter.name: pattern
parameter.parameter_description: pattern to match (after mask is applied)

parameter.name: offset
parameter.parameter_description: offset from which to start scanning, relative to the current position

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: number of bytes to scan from offset

function.name: gst_byte_reader_masked_scan_uint32_peek
function.description:
Scan for pattern @pattern with applied mask @mask in the byte reader data, starting from offset @offset relative to the current position.
The bytes in @pattern and @mask are interpreted left-to-right, regardless of endianness. All four bytes of the pattern must be present in the byte reader data for it to match, even if the first or last bytes are masked out.
It is an error to call this function without making sure that there is enough data (offset+size bytes) in the byte reader.

parameter.name: mask
parameter.parameter_description: mask to apply to data before matching against @pattern

parameter.name: pattern
parameter.parameter_description: pattern to match (after mask is applied)

parameter.name: offset
parameter.parameter_description: offset from which to start scanning, relative to the current position

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: number of bytes to scan from offset

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to uint32 to return matching data

function.return: offset of the first match, or -1 if no match was found.

function.name: gst_byte_reader_new

function.return: a new #GstByteReader instance

function.name: gst_byte_reader_peek_string
function.description:
Returns a constant pointer to the current data position if there is a NUL-terminated string in the data (this could be just a NUL terminator). The current position will be maintained. This will work for any NUL-terminated string with a character width of 8 bits, so ASCII, UTF-8, ISO-8859-N etc.
This function will fail if no NUL-terminator was found in in the data.

parameter.name: str
parameter.parameter_description: address of a #gchar pointer variable in which to store the result

function.return: %TRUE if a string could be skipped, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_byte_reader_peek_string_utf8
function.description:
Returns a constant pointer to the current data position if there is a NUL-terminated string in the data (this could be just a NUL terminator). The current position will be maintained. This will work for any NUL-terminated string with a character width of 8 bits, so ASCII, UTF-8, ISO-8859-N etc.
No input checking for valid UTF-8 is done.
This function will fail if no NUL-terminator was found in in the data.

parameter.name: str
parameter.parameter_description: address of a #gchar pointer variable in which to store the result

function.return: %TRUE if a string could be skipped, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_byte_reader_peek_sub_reader
function.description:
Initializes a #GstByteReader sub-reader instance to contain @size bytes of data from the current position of @reader. This is useful to read chunked formats and make sure that one doesn't read beyond the size of the sub-chunk.
Unlike gst_byte_reader_get_sub_reader(), this function does not modify the current position of @reader.

parameter.name: sub_reader
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstByteReader instance to initialize as sub-reader

function.return: FALSE on error or if @reader does not contain @size more bytes from the current position, and otherwise TRUE

function.description: Read an unsigned 64 bit integer in big endian format without checking if there are enough bytes available in the byte reader, but do not advance the current position.
function.return: unsigned 64 bit integer.

function.name: gst_byte_reader_peek_uint64_le
function.description: Read an unsigned 64 bit little endian integer into @val but keep the current position.

parameter.name: val
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to a #guint64 to store the result

function.return: %TRUE if successful, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_byte_reader_peek_uint64_le_unchecked
function.description: Read an unsigned 64 bit integer in little endian format without checking if there are enough bytes available in the byte reader, but do not advance the current position.
function.return: unsigned 64 bit integer.

function.name: gst_byte_reader_peek_uint8
function.description: Read an unsigned 8 bit integer into @val but keep the current position.

parameter.name: val
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to a #guint8 to store the result

function.return: %TRUE if successful, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_byte_reader_peek_uint8_unchecked
function.description: Read an unsigned 8 bit integer without checking if there are enough bytes available in the byte reader, but do not advance the current read position.
function.return: unsigned 8 bit integer.

function.name: gst_byte_reader_set_pos
function.description: Sets the new position of a #GstByteReader instance to @pos in bytes.
function.return: %TRUE if the position could be set successfully, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_byte_reader_skip
function.description: Skips @nbytes bytes of the #GstByteReader instance.

parameter.name: nbytes
parameter.parameter_description: the number of bytes to skip

function.return: %TRUE if @nbytes bytes could be skipped, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_byte_reader_skip_string
function.description:
Skips a NUL-terminated string in the #GstByteReader instance, advancing the current position to the byte after the string. This will work for any NUL-terminated string with a character width of 8 bits, so ASCII, UTF-8, ISO-8859-N etc.
This function will fail if no NUL-terminator was found in in the data.
function.return: %TRUE if a string could be skipped, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_byte_reader_skip_string_utf16
function.description:
Skips a NUL-terminated UTF-16 string in the #GstByteReader instance, advancing the current position to the byte after the string.
No input checking for valid UTF-16 is done.
This function will fail if no NUL-terminator was found in in the data.
function.return: %TRUE if a string could be skipped, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_byte_reader_skip_string_utf32
function.description:
Skips a NUL-terminated UTF-32 string in the #GstByteReader instance, advancing the current position to the byte after the string.
No input checking for valid UTF-32 is done.
This function will fail if no NUL-terminator was found in in the data.
function.return: %TRUE if a string could be skipped, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_byte_reader_skip_string_utf8
function.description:
Skips a NUL-terminated string in the #GstByteReader instance, advancing the current position to the byte after the string. This will work for any NUL-terminated string with a character width of 8 bits, so ASCII, UTF-8, ISO-8859-N etc. No input checking for valid UTF-8 is done.
This function will fail if no NUL-terminator was found in in the data.
function.return: %TRUE if a string could be skipped, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_byte_reader_skip_unchecked
function.description: Skips @nbytes bytes of the #GstByteReader instance without checking if there are enough bytes available in the byte reader.

parameter.name: nbytes
parameter.parameter_description: the number of bytes to skip

function.name: gst_byte_writer_ensure_free_space
function.description: Checks if enough free space from the current write cursor is available and reallocates if necessary.

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: Number of bytes that should be available

function.return: %TRUE if at least @size bytes are still available

function.name: gst_byte_writer_fill
function.description: Writes @size bytes containing @value to @writer.

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: Number of bytes to be written

function.return: %TRUE if the value could be written

function.name: gst_byte_writer_fill_unchecked
function.description: Writes @size bytes containing @value to @writer without checking if there is enough free space available in the byte writer.

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: Number of bytes to be written

function.name: gst_byte_writer_free
function.description: Frees @writer and all memory allocated by it.

function.name: gst_byte_writer_free_and_get_buffer
function.description:
Frees @writer and all memory allocated by it except the current data, which is returned as #GstBuffer.
Free-function: gst_buffer_unref
function.return: the current data as buffer. gst_buffer_unref() after usage.

function.name: gst_byte_writer_free_and_get_data
function.description:
Frees @writer and all memory allocated by it except the current data, which is returned.
Free-function: g_free
function.return: the current data. g_free() after usage.

function.name: gst_byte_writer_get_pos
function.return: The current position of the read/write cursor

function.name: gst_byte_writer_get_remaining
function.description: Returns the remaining size of data that can still be written. If -1 is returned the remaining size is only limited by system resources.
function.return: the remaining size of data that can still be written

function.name: gst_byte_writer_get_size
function.return: The current, initialized size of the data

function.name: gst_byte_writer_init

function.name: gst_byte_writer_init_with_data

function.name: gst_byte_writer_init_with_size

parameter.name: fixed
parameter.parameter_description: If %TRUE the data can't be reallocated
