function.name: gst_byte_writer_reset
function.description: Resets @writer and frees the data if it's owned by @writer.

function.name: gst_byte_writer_reset_and_get_buffer
function.description:
Resets @writer and returns the current data as buffer.
Free-function: gst_buffer_unref
function.return: the current data as buffer. gst_buffer_unref() after usage.

function.name: gst_byte_writer_reset_and_get_data
function.description:
Resets @writer and returns the current data.
Free-function: g_free
function.return: the current data. g_free() after usage.

function.name: gst_byte_writer_set_pos
function.description: Sets the current read/write cursor of @writer. The new position can only be between 0 and the current size.
function.return: %TRUE if the new position could be set

function.name: gst_caps_append

parameter.name: caps1
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstCaps that will be appended to

function.name: gst_caps_append_structure
function.description: Appends @structure to @caps. The structure is not copied; @caps becomes the owner of @structure.

parameter.name: caps
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstCaps that will be appended to

function.name: gst_caps_append_structure_full
function.description: Appends @structure with @features to @caps. The structure is not copied; @caps becomes the owner of @structure.

parameter.name: caps
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstCaps that will be appended to

function.name: gst_caps_can_intersect
function.description: Tries intersecting @caps1 and @caps2 and reports whether the result would not be empty
function.return: %TRUE if intersection would be not empty

function.name: gst_caps_copy
function.description:
Creates a new #GstCaps as a copy of the old @caps. The new caps will have a refcount of 1, owned by the caller. The structures are copied as well.
Note that this function is the semantic equivalent of a gst_caps_ref() followed by a gst_caps_make_writable(). If you only want to hold on to a reference to the data, you should use gst_caps_ref().
When you are finished with the caps, call gst_caps_unref() on it.
function.return: the new #GstCaps

function.name: gst_caps_copy_nth
function.description: Creates a new #GstCaps and appends a copy of the nth structure contained in @caps.
function.return: the new #GstCaps

function.name: gst_caps_features_add
function.description: Adds @feature to @features.

function.name: gst_caps_features_add_id
function.description: Adds @feature to @features.

function.name: gst_caps_features_contains
function.description: Check if @features contains @feature.
function.return: %TRUE if @features contains @feature.

function.name: gst_caps_features_contains_id
function.description: Check if @features contains @feature.
function.return: %TRUE if @features contains @feature.

function.name: gst_caps_features_copy
function.description:
Duplicates a #GstCapsFeatures and all its values.
Free-function: gst_caps_features_free
function.return: a new #GstCapsFeatures.

function.name: gst_caps_features_free
function.description: Frees a #GstCapsFeatures and all its values. The caps features must not have a parent when this function is called.

function.name: gst_caps_features_from_string
function.description:
Creates a #GstCapsFeatures from a string representation.
Free-function: gst_caps_features_free
function.return: a new #GstCapsFeatures or %NULL when the string could not be parsed. Free with gst_caps_features_free() after use.

function.name: gst_caps_features_get_nth
function.description: Returns the @i-th feature of @features.
function.return: The @i-th feature of @features.

function.name: gst_caps_features_get_nth_id
function.description: Returns the @i-th feature of @features.
function.return: The @i-th feature of @features.

function.name: gst_caps_features_get_size
function.description: Returns the number of features in @features.
function.return: The number of features in @features.

function.name: gst_caps_features_is_any
function.description: Check if @features is %GST_CAPS_FEATURES_ANY.
function.return: %TRUE if @features is %GST_CAPS_FEATURES_ANY.

function.name: gst_caps_features_is_equal
function.description: Check if @features1 and @features2 are equal.
function.return: %TRUE if @features1 and @features2 are equal.

function.name: gst_caps_features_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GstCapsFeatures with the given features. The last argument must be %NULL.
Free-function: gst_caps_features_free

parameter.name: feature1
parameter.parameter_description: name of first feature to set

function.return: a new, empty #GstCapsFeatures

function.name: gst_caps_features_new_any
function.description:
Creates a new, ANY #GstCapsFeatures. This will be equal to any other #GstCapsFeatures but caps with these are unfixed.
Free-function: gst_caps_features_free
function.return: a new, ANY #GstCapsFeatures

function.name: gst_caps_features_new_empty
function.description:
Creates a new, empty #GstCapsFeatures.
Free-function: gst_caps_features_free
function.return: a new, empty #GstCapsFeatures

function.name: gst_caps_features_new_id
function.description:
Creates a new #GstCapsFeatures with the given features. The last argument must be 0.
Free-function: gst_caps_features_free

parameter.name: feature1
parameter.parameter_description: name of first feature to set

function.return: a new, empty #GstCapsFeatures

function.name: gst_caps_features_new_id_valist
function.description:
Creates a new #GstCapsFeatures with the given features.
Free-function: gst_caps_features_free

parameter.name: feature1
parameter.parameter_description: name of first feature to set

function.return: a new, empty #GstCapsFeatures

function.name: gst_caps_features_new_valist
function.description:
Creates a new #GstCapsFeatures with the given features.
Free-function: gst_caps_features_free

parameter.name: feature1
parameter.parameter_description: name of first feature to set

function.return: a new, empty #GstCapsFeatures

function.name: gst_caps_features_remove
function.description: Removes @feature from @features.

function.name: gst_caps_features_remove_id
function.description: Removes @feature from @features.

function.name: gst_caps_features_set_parent_refcount
function.description: Sets the parent_refcount field of #GstCapsFeatures. This field is used to determine whether a caps features is mutable or not. This function should only be called by code implementing parent objects of #GstCapsFeatures, as described in the MT Refcounting section of the design documents.

parameter.name: refcount
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to the parent's refcount

function.return: %TRUE if the parent refcount could be set.

function.name: gst_caps_features_to_string
function.description:
Converts @features to a human-readable string representation.
For debugging purposes its easier to do something like this: |[<!-- language="C" --> GST_LOG ("features is %" GST_PTR_FORMAT, features); ]| This prints the features in human readable form.
Free-function: g_free
function.return: a pointer to string allocated by g_malloc(). g_free() after usage.

function.name: gst_caps_filter_and_map_in_place
function.description: Calls the provided function once for each structure and caps feature in the #GstCaps. In contrast to gst_caps_foreach(), the function may modify the structure and features. In contrast to gst_caps_filter_and_map_in_place(), the structure and features are removed from the caps if %FALSE is returned from the function. The caps must be mutable.

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: a function to call for each field

function.name: gst_caps_fixate
function.description:
Modifies the given @caps into a representation with only fixed values. First the caps will be truncated and then the first structure will be fixated with gst_structure_fixate().
This function takes ownership of @caps and will call gst_caps_make_writable() on it so you must not use @caps afterwards unless you keep an additional reference to it with gst_caps_ref().
function.return: the fixated caps

function.name: gst_caps_foreach
function.description: Calls the provided function once for each structure and caps feature in the #GstCaps. The function must not modify the fields. Also see gst_caps_map_in_place() and gst_caps_filter_and_map_in_place().

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: a function to call for each field

function.return: %TRUE if the supplied function returns %TRUE for each call, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_caps_from_string
function.description:
Converts @caps from a string representation.
The current implementation of serialization will lead to unexpected results when there are nested #GstCaps / #GstStructure deeper than one level.
function.return: a newly allocated #GstCaps

function.name: gst_caps_get_features
function.description:
Finds the features in @caps that has the index @index, and returns it.
WARNING: This function takes a const GstCaps *, but returns a non-const GstCapsFeatures *. This is for programming convenience -- the caller should be aware that structures inside a constant #GstCaps should not be modified. However, if you know the caps are writable, either because you have just copied them or made them writable with gst_caps_make_writable(), you may modify the features returned in the usual way, e.g. with functions like gst_caps_features_add().
You do not need to free or unref the structure returned, it belongs to the #GstCaps.
function.return: a pointer to the #GstCapsFeatures corresponding to @index

function.name: gst_caps_get_size
function.description: Gets the number of structures contained in @caps.
function.return: the number of structures that @caps contains

function.name: gst_caps_get_structure
function.description:
Finds the structure in @caps that has the index @index, and returns it.
WARNING: This function takes a const GstCaps *, but returns a non-const GstStructure *. This is for programming convenience -- the caller should be aware that structures inside a constant #GstCaps should not be modified. However, if you know the caps are writable, either because you have just copied them or made them writable with gst_caps_make_writable(), you may modify the structure returned in the usual way, e.g. with functions like gst_structure_set().
You do not need to free or unref the structure returned, it belongs to the #GstCaps.
function.return: a pointer to the #GstStructure corresponding to @index

function.name: gst_caps_intersect
function.description: Creates a new #GstCaps that contains all the formats that are common to both @caps1 and @caps2. Defaults to %GST_CAPS_INTERSECT_ZIG_ZAG mode.
function.return: the new #GstCaps

function.name: gst_caps_intersect_first
function.description:
Creates a new #GstCaps that contains all the formats that are common to both @caps1 and @caps2.
Unlike @gst_caps_intersect, the returned caps will be ordered in a similar fashion as @caps1.
function.return: the new #GstCaps

function.name: gst_caps_intersect_full
function.description: Creates a new #GstCaps that contains all the formats that are common to both @caps1 and @caps2, the order is defined by the #GstCapsIntersectMode used.
function.return: the new #GstCaps

function.name: gst_caps_is_always_compatible
function.description: A given #GstCaps structure is always compatible with another if every media format that is in the first is also contained in the second. That is, @caps1 is a subset of @caps2.
function.return: %TRUE if @caps1 is a subset of @caps2.

function.name: gst_caps_is_any
function.description: Determines if @caps represents any media format.
function.return: %TRUE if @caps represents any format.

function.name: gst_caps_is_empty
function.description: Determines if @caps represents no media formats.
function.return: %TRUE if @caps represents no formats.

function.name: gst_caps_is_equal
function.description: Checks if the given caps represent the same set of caps.
function.return: %TRUE if both caps are equal.

function.name: gst_caps_is_equal_fixed
function.description: Tests if two #GstCaps are equal. This function only works on fixed #GstCaps.
function.return: %TRUE if the arguments represent the same format

function.name: gst_caps_is_fixed
function.description: Fixed #GstCaps describe exactly one format, that is, they have exactly one structure, and each field in the structure describes a fixed type. Examples of non-fixed types are GST_TYPE_INT_RANGE and GST_TYPE_LIST.
function.return: %TRUE if @caps is fixed

function.name: gst_caps_is_strictly_equal
function.description: Checks if the given caps are exactly the same set of caps.
function.return: %TRUE if both caps are strictly equal.

function.name: gst_caps_is_subset
function.description: Checks if all caps represented by @subset are also represented by @superset.
function.return: %TRUE if @subset is a subset of @superset

function.name: gst_caps_is_subset_structure
function.description: Checks if @structure is a subset of @caps. See gst_caps_is_subset() for more information.
function.return: %TRUE if @structure is a subset of @caps

function.name: gst_caps_is_subset_structure_full
function.description: Checks if @structure is a subset of @caps. See gst_caps_is_subset() for more information.
function.return: %TRUE if @structure is a subset of @caps

function.name: gst_caps_is_writable
function.description: Tests if you can safely modify @caps. It is only safe to modify caps when there is only one owner of the caps - ie, the object is writable.

function.name: gst_caps_make_writable
function.description:
Returns a writable copy of @caps.
If there is only one reference count on @caps, the caller must be the owner, and so this function will return the caps object unchanged. If on the other hand there is more than one reference on the object, a new caps object will be returned. The caller's reference on @caps will be removed, and instead the caller will own a reference to the returned object.
In short, this function unrefs the caps in the argument and refs the caps that it returns. Don't access the argument after calling this function. See also: gst_caps_ref().
function.return: a writable caps which may or may not be the same as @caps

function.name: gst_caps_map_in_place
function.description: Calls the provided function once for each structure and caps feature in the #GstCaps. In contrast to gst_caps_foreach(), the function may modify but not delete the structures and features. The caps must be mutable.

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: a function to call for each field

function.return: %TRUE if the supplied function returns %TRUE for each call, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_caps_merge
function.description: Appends the structures contained in @caps2 to @caps1 if they are not yet expressed by @caps1. The structures in @caps2 are not copied -- they are transferred to a writable copy of @caps1, and then @caps2 is freed. If either caps is ANY, the resulting caps will be ANY.

parameter.name: caps1
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstCaps that will take the new entries

function.return: the merged caps.

function.name: gst_caps_merge_structure
function.description: Appends @structure to @caps if its not already expressed by @caps.
function.return: the merged caps.

function.name: gst_caps_merge_structure_full
function.description: Appends @structure with @features to @caps if its not already expressed by @caps.
function.return: the merged caps.

function.name: gst_caps_new_any
function.description: Creates a new #GstCaps that indicates that it is compatible with any media format.
function.return: the new #GstCaps

function.name: gst_caps_new_empty
function.description: Creates a new #GstCaps that is empty. That is, the returned #GstCaps contains no media formats. The #GstCaps is guaranteed to be writable. Caller is responsible for unreffing the returned caps.
function.return: the new #GstCaps

function.name: gst_caps_new_empty_simple

parameter.name: media_type
parameter.parameter_description: the media type of the structure

function.return: the new #GstCaps

function.name: gst_caps_new_full
function.description: Creates a new #GstCaps and adds all the structures listed as arguments. The list must be %NULL-terminated. The structures are not copied; the returned #GstCaps owns the structures.
function.return: the new #GstCaps

function.name: gst_caps_new_full_valist
function.description: Creates a new #GstCaps and adds all the structures listed as arguments. The list must be %NULL-terminated. The structures are not copied; the returned #GstCaps owns the structures.
function.return: the new #GstCaps

function.name: gst_caps_new_simple
function.description: Creates a new #GstCaps that contains one #GstStructure. The structure is defined by the arguments, which have the same format as gst_structure_new(). Caller is responsible for unreffing the returned caps.

parameter.name: media_type
parameter.parameter_description: the media type of the structure

function.return: the new #GstCaps

function.name: gst_caps_normalize
function.return: the normalized #GstCaps

function.name: gst_caps_ref
function.description:
Add a reference to a #GstCaps object.
From this point on, until the caller calls gst_caps_unref() or gst_caps_make_writable(), it is guaranteed that the caps object will not change. This means its structures won't change, etc. To use a #GstCaps object, you must always have a refcount on it -- either the one made implicitly by e.g. gst_caps_new_simple(), or via taking one explicitly with this function.
function.return: the same #GstCaps object.

function.name: gst_caps_remove_structure
function.description: removes the structure with the given index from the list of structures contained in @caps.

parameter.name: idx
parameter.parameter_description: Index of the structure to remove

function.name: gst_caps_replace
function.description:
Modifies a pointer to a #GstCaps to point to a different #GstCaps. The modification is done atomically (so this is useful for ensuring thread safety in some cases), and the reference counts are updated appropriately (the old caps is unreffed, the new is reffed).
Either @new_caps or the #GstCaps pointed to by @old_caps may be %NULL.

parameter.name: old_caps
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a pointer to a #GstCaps to be replaced.

parameter.name: new_caps
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a #GstCaps that will replace the caps pointed to by @old_caps.

function.return: %TRUE if @new_caps was different from @old_caps

function.name: gst_caps_set_features
function.description: Sets the #GstCapsFeatures @features for the structure at @index.

function.name: gst_caps_set_simple
function.description: Sets fields in a #GstCaps. The arguments must be passed in the same manner as gst_structure_set(), and be %NULL-terminated.

function.name: gst_caps_set_simple_valist
function.description: Sets fields in a #GstCaps. The arguments must be passed in the same manner as gst_structure_set(), and be %NULL-terminated.

function.name: gst_caps_set_value
function.description: Sets the given @field on all structures of @caps to the given @value. This is a convenience function for calling gst_structure_set_value() on all structures of @caps.

parameter.name: field
parameter.parameter_description: name of the field to set

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: value to set the field to

function.name: gst_caps_simplify
function.description:
Converts the given @caps into a representation that represents the same set of formats, but in a simpler form. Component structures that are identical are merged. Component structures that have values that can be merged are also merged.
This function takes ownership of @caps and will call gst_caps_make_writable() on it if necessary, so you must not use @caps afterwards unless you keep an additional reference to it with gst_caps_ref().
This method does not preserve the original order of @caps.
function.return: The simplified caps.

function.name: gst_caps_steal_structure
function.description: Retrieves the structure with the given index from the list of structures contained in @caps. The caller becomes the owner of the returned structure.

parameter.name: index
parameter.parameter_description: Index of the structure to retrieve

function.return: a pointer to the #GstStructure corresponding to @index.

function.name: gst_caps_subtract
function.description: Subtracts the @subtrahend from the @minuend. <note>This function does not work reliably if optional properties for caps are included on one caps and omitted on the other.</note>
function.return: the resulting caps

function.name: gst_caps_take
function.description: Modifies a pointer to a #GstCaps to point to a different #GstCaps. This function is similar to gst_caps_replace() except that it takes ownership of @new_caps.

parameter.name: old_caps
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a pointer to a #GstCaps to be replaced.

parameter.name: new_caps
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a #GstCaps that will replace the caps pointed to by @old_caps.

function.return: %TRUE if @new_caps was different from @old_caps

function.name: gst_caps_to_string
function.description:
Converts @caps to a string representation. This string representation can be converted back to a #GstCaps by gst_caps_from_string().
For debugging purposes its easier to do something like this: |[<!-- language="C" --> GST_LOG ("caps are %" GST_PTR_FORMAT, caps); ]| This prints the caps in human readable form.
The current implementation of serialization will lead to unexpected results when there are nested #GstCaps / #GstStructure deeper than one level.
function.return: a newly allocated string representing @caps.

function.name: gst_caps_truncate
function.description:
Discard all but the first structure from @caps. Useful when fixating.
This function takes ownership of @caps and will call gst_caps_make_writable() on it if necessary, so you must not use @caps afterwards unless you keep an additional reference to it with gst_caps_ref().
function.return: truncated caps

function.name: gst_caps_unref
function.description: Unref a #GstCaps and and free all its structures and the structures' values when the refcount reaches 0.

function.name: gst_check_buffer_data
function.description: Compare the buffer contents with @data and @size.

function.name: gst_check_caps_equal
function.description: Compare two caps with gst_caps_is_equal and fail unless they are equal.

function.name: gst_check_drop_buffers
function.description: Unref and remove all buffers that are in the global @buffers GList, emptying the list.

function.name: gst_check_element_push_buffer
function.description: Create an element using the factory providing the @element_name and push the @buffer_in to this element. The element should create one buffer and this will be compared with @buffer_out. We only check the caps and the data of the buffers. This function unrefs the buffers.

parameter.name: element_name
parameter.parameter_description: name of the element that needs to be created

parameter.name: buffer_in
parameter.parameter_description: push this buffer to the element

parameter.name: caps_in
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstCaps expected of the sinkpad of the element

parameter.name: buffer_out
parameter.parameter_description: compare the result with this buffer

parameter.name: caps_out
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstCaps expected of the srcpad of the element

function.name: gst_check_element_push_buffer_list
function.description: Create an element using the factory providing the @element_name and push the buffers in @buffer_in to this element. The element should create the buffers equal to the buffers in @buffer_out. We only check the size and the data of the buffers. This function unrefs the buffers in the two lists. The last_flow_return parameter indicates the expected flow return value from pushing the final buffer in the list. This can be used to set up a test which pushes some buffers and then an invalid buffer, when the final buffer is expected to fail, for example.

parameter.name: element_name
parameter.parameter_description: name of the element that needs to be created

parameter.name: buffer_in
parameter.parameter_description: a list of buffers that needs to be pushed to the element

parameter.name: caps_in
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstCaps expected of the sinkpad of the element

parameter.name: buffer_out
parameter.parameter_description: a list of buffers that we expect from the element

parameter.name: caps_out
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstCaps expected of the srcpad of the element

parameter.name: last_flow_return
parameter.parameter_description: the last buffer push needs to give this GstFlowReturn

function.name: gst_check_object_destroyed_on_unref
function.description: Unrefs @object_to_unref and checks that is has properly been destroyed.

function.name: gst_check_objects_destroyed_on_unref
function.description: Unrefs @object_to_unref and checks that is has properly been destroyed, also checks that the other objects passed in parametter have been destroyed as a concequence of unrefing @object_to_unref. Last variable argument should be NULL.

parameter.name: first_object
parameter.parameter_description: The first object that should be destroyed as a concequence of unrefing @object_to_unref.

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: Additional object that should have been destroyed.

function.name: gst_check_setup_element
function.description: setup an element for a filter test with mysrcpad and mysinkpad
function.return: a new element

function.name: gst_check_setup_events
function.description: Push stream-start, caps and segment event, which consist of the minimum required events to allow streaming. Caps is optional to allow raw src testing. If @element has more than one src or sink pad, use gst_check_setup_events_with_stream_id() instead.

parameter.name: element
parameter.parameter_description: The #GstElement use to create the stream id

parameter.name: caps
parameter.parameter_description: #GstCaps in case caps event must be sent

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: The #GstFormat of the default segment to send

function.name: gst_check_setup_events_with_stream_id
function.description: Push stream-start, caps and segment event, which consist of the minimum required events to allow streaming. Caps is optional to allow raw src testing.

parameter.name: element
parameter.parameter_description: The #GstElement use to create the stream id

parameter.name: caps
parameter.parameter_description: #GstCaps in case caps event must be sent

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: The #GstFormat of the default segment to send

parameter.name: stream_id
parameter.parameter_description: A unique identifier for the stream

function.name: gst_check_setup_sink_pad
function.description: Does the same as #gst_check_setup_sink_pad_by_name with the <emphasis> name </emphasis> parameter equal to "src".
function.return: a new pad that can be used to check the output of @element

function.name: gst_check_setup_sink_pad_by_name
function.description: Creates a new sink pad (based on the given @tmpl) and links it to the given @element src pad (the pad that matches the given @name). You can set event/chain/query functions on this pad to check the output of the @element.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: Name of the @element src pad that will be linked to the sink pad that will be setup

function.return: a new pad that can be used to check the output of @element

function.name: gst_check_setup_sink_pad_by_name_from_template
function.return: a new pad

function.name: gst_check_setup_sink_pad_from_template
function.return: a new pad

function.name: gst_check_setup_src_pad
function.description: Does the same as #gst_check_setup_src_pad_by_name with the <emphasis> name </emphasis> parameter equal to "sink".
function.return: A new pad that can be used to inject data on @element

function.name: gst_check_setup_src_pad_by_name

parameter.name: element
parameter.parameter_description: element to setup src pad on

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: Name of the @element sink pad that will be linked to the src pad that will be setup

function.return: A new pad that can be used to inject data on @element

function.name: gst_check_setup_src_pad_by_name_from_template
function.return: a new pad

function.name: gst_check_setup_src_pad_from_template
function.return: a new pad

function.name: gst_child_proxy_child_added
function.description: Emits the "child-added" signal.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the new child

function.name: gst_child_proxy_child_removed
function.description: Emits the "child-removed" signal.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the old child

function.name: gst_child_proxy_get
function.description: Gets properties of the parent object and its children.

parameter.name: first_property_name
parameter.parameter_description: name of the first property to get

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the first property, followed optionally by more name/return location pairs, followed by %NULL

function.name: gst_child_proxy_get_child_by_index
function.description: Fetches a child by its number.

parameter.name: parent
parameter.parameter_description: the parent object to get the child from

parameter.name: index
parameter.parameter_description: the child's position in the child list

function.return:
the child object or %NULL if not found (index too high). Unref after usage.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_child_proxy_get_child_by_name
function.description:
Looks up a child element by the given name.
This virtual method has a default implementation that uses #GstObject together with gst_object_get_name(). If the interface is to be used with #GObjects, this methods needs to be overridden.

parameter.name: parent
parameter.parameter_description: the parent object to get the child from

function.return:
the child object or %NULL if not found. Unref after usage.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_child_proxy_get_children_count
function.description: Gets the number of child objects this parent contains.
function.return:
the number of child objects
MT safe.

function.name: gst_child_proxy_get_property
function.description: Gets a single property using the GstChildProxy mechanism. You are responsible for freeing it by calling g_value_unset()

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: a #GValue that should take the result.

function.name: gst_child_proxy_get_valist
function.description: Gets properties of the parent object and its children.

parameter.name: first_property_name
parameter.parameter_description: name of the first property to get

parameter.name: var_args
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the first property, followed optionally by more name/return location pairs, followed by %NULL

function.name: gst_child_proxy_lookup
function.description:
Looks up which object and #GParamSpec would be effected by the given @name.
MT safe.

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: child proxy object to lookup the property in

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: name of the property to look up

parameter.name: target
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a #GObject that takes the real object to set property on

parameter.name: pspec
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to take the #GParamSpec describing the property

function.return: %TRUE if @target and @pspec could be found. %FALSE otherwise. In that case the values for @pspec and @target are not modified. Unref @target after usage. For plain GObjects @target is the same as @object.

function.name: gst_child_proxy_set
function.description: Sets properties of the parent object and its children.

parameter.name: first_property_name
parameter.parameter_description: name of the first property to set

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: value for the first property, followed optionally by more name/value pairs, followed by %NULL

function.name: gst_child_proxy_set_property
function.description: Sets a single property using the GstChildProxy mechanism.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: name of the property to set

function.name: gst_child_proxy_set_valist
function.description: Sets properties of the parent object and its children.

parameter.name: first_property_name
parameter.parameter_description: name of the first property to set

parameter.name: var_args
parameter.parameter_description: value for the first property, followed optionally by more name/value pairs, followed by %NULL

function.name: gst_clock_add_observation
function.description:
The time @master of the master clock and the time @slave of the slave clock are added to the list of observations. If enough observations are available, a linear regression algorithm is run on the observations and @clock is recalibrated.
If this functions returns %TRUE, @r_squared will contain the correlation coefficient of the interpolation. A value of 1.0 means a perfect regression was performed. This value can be used to control the sampling frequency of the master and slave clocks.

parameter.name: r_squared
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to hold the result

function.return:
%TRUE if enough observations were added to run the regression algorithm.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_clock_add_observation_unapplied
function.description:
Add a clock observation to the internal slaving algorithm the same as gst_clock_add_observation(), and return the result of the master clock estimation, without updating the internal calibration.
The caller can then take the results and call gst_clock_set_calibration() with the values, or some modified version of them.

parameter.name: r_squared
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to hold the result

parameter.name: internal
parameter.parameter_description: a location to store the internal time

parameter.name: external
parameter.parameter_description: a location to store the external time

parameter.name: rate_num
parameter.parameter_description: a location to store the rate numerator

parameter.name: rate_denom
parameter.parameter_description: a location to store the rate denominator

function.name: gst_clock_adjust_unlocked
function.description:
Converts the given @internal clock time to the external time, adjusting for the rate and reference time set with gst_clock_set_calibration() and making sure that the returned time is increasing. This function should be called with the clock's OBJECT_LOCK held and is mainly used by clock subclasses.
This function is the reverse of gst_clock_unadjust_unlocked().
function.return: the converted time of the clock.

function.name: gst_clock_adjust_with_calibration
function.description:
Converts the given @internal_target clock time to the external time, using the passed calibration parameters. This function performs the same calculation as gst_clock_adjust_unlocked() when called using the current calibration parameters, but doesn't ensure a monotonically increasing result as gst_clock_adjust_unlocked() does.
Note: The @clock parameter is unused and can be NULL

parameter.name: cnum
parameter.parameter_description: the numerator of the rate of the clock relative to its internal time

parameter.name: cdenom
parameter.parameter_description: the denominator of the rate of the clock

function.return: the converted time of the clock.

function.name: gst_clock_get_calibration

parameter.name: internal
parameter.parameter_description: a location to store the internal time

parameter.name: external
parameter.parameter_description: a location to store the external time

parameter.name: rate_num
parameter.parameter_description: a location to store the rate numerator

parameter.name: rate_denom
parameter.parameter_description: a location to store the rate denominator

function.name: gst_clock_get_internal_time
function.description: Gets the current internal time of the given clock. The time is returned unadjusted for the offset and the rate.
function.return:
the internal time of the clock. Or GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE when given invalid input.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_clock_get_master
function.description: Get the master clock that @clock is slaved to or %NULL when the clock is not slaved to any master clock.
function.return:
a master #GstClock or %NULL when this clock is not slaved to a master clock. Unref after usage.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_clock_get_resolution
function.description: Get the accuracy of the clock. The accuracy of the clock is the granularity of the values returned by gst_clock_get_time().
function.return:
the resolution of the clock in units of #GstClockTime.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_clock_get_time
function.description: Gets the current time of the given clock. The time is always monotonically increasing and adjusted according to the current offset and rate.
function.return:
the time of the clock. Or GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE when given invalid input.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_clock_get_timeout
function.description: Get the amount of time that master and slave clocks are sampled.
function.return: the interval between samples.

function.name: gst_clock_id_compare_func
function.description: Compares the two #GstClockID instances. This function can be used as a GCompareFunc when sorting ids.
function.return:
negative value if a < b; zero if a = b; positive value if a > b
MT safe.

function.name: gst_clock_id_get_time
function.description: Get the time of the clock ID
function.return:
the time of the given clock id.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_clock_id_ref
function.description: Increase the refcount of given @id.
function.return:
The same #GstClockID with increased refcount.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_clock_id_unref
function.description:
Unref given @id. When the refcount reaches 0 the #GstClockID will be freed.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_clock_id_unschedule
function.description:
Cancel an outstanding request with @id. This can either be an outstanding async notification or a pending sync notification. After this call, @id cannot be used anymore to receive sync or async notifications, you need to create a new #GstClockID.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_clock_id_wait
function.description:
Perform a blocking wait on @id. @id should have been created with gst_clock_new_single_shot_id() or gst_clock_new_periodic_id() and should not have been unscheduled with a call to gst_clock_id_unschedule().
If the @jitter argument is not %NULL and this function returns #GST_CLOCK_OK or #GST_CLOCK_EARLY, it will contain the difference against the clock and the time of @id when this method was called. Positive values indicate how late @id was relative to the clock (in which case this function will return #GST_CLOCK_EARLY). Negative values indicate how much time was spent waiting on the clock before this function returned.

parameter.name: jitter
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer that will contain the jitter, can be %NULL.

function.return:
the result of the blocking wait. #GST_CLOCK_EARLY will be returned if the current clock time is past the time of @id, #GST_CLOCK_OK if @id was scheduled in time. #GST_CLOCK_UNSCHEDULED if @id was unscheduled with gst_clock_id_unschedule().
MT safe.

function.name: gst_clock_id_wait_async
function.description:
Register a callback on the given #GstClockID @id with the given function and user_data. When passing a #GstClockID with an invalid time to this function, the callback will be called immediately with a time set to GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE. The callback will be called when the time of @id has been reached.
The callback @func can be invoked from any thread, either provided by the core or from a streaming thread. The application should be prepared for this.

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: User data passed in the callback

function.return:
the result of the non blocking wait.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_clock_is_synced
function.description:
Checks if the clock is currently synced.
This returns if GST_CLOCK_FLAG_NEEDS_STARTUP_SYNC is not set on the clock.
function.return: %TRUE if the clock is currently synced

function.name: gst_clock_new_periodic_id
function.description:
Get an ID from @clock to trigger a periodic notification. The periodic notifications will start at time @start_time and will then be fired with the given @interval. @id should be unreffed after usage.
Free-function: gst_clock_id_unref

parameter.name: clock
parameter.parameter_description: The #GstClockID to get a periodic notification id from

function.return:
a #GstClockID that can be used to request the time notification.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_clock_new_single_shot_id
function.description:
Get a #GstClockID from @clock to trigger a single shot notification at the requested time. The single shot id should be unreffed after usage.
Free-function: gst_clock_id_unref

parameter.name: clock
parameter.parameter_description: The #GstClockID to get a single shot notification from

function.return:
a #GstClockID that can be used to request the time notification.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_clock_periodic_id_reinit
function.description: Reinitializes the provided periodic @id to the provided start time and interval. Does not modify the reference count.
function.return: %TRUE if the GstClockID could be reinitialized to the provided @time, else %FALSE.

function.name: gst_clock_set_calibration
function.description:
Adjusts the rate and time of @clock. A rate of 1/1 is the normal speed of the clock. Values bigger than 1/1 make the clock go faster.
@internal and @external are calibration parameters that arrange that gst_clock_get_time() should have been @external at internal time @internal. This internal time should not be in the future; that is, it should be less than the value of gst_clock_get_internal_time() when this function is called.
Subsequent calls to gst_clock_get_time() will return clock times computed as follows:
<programlisting> time = (internal_time - internal) * rate_num / rate_denom + external </programlisting>
This formula is implemented in gst_clock_adjust_unlocked(). Of course, it tries to do the integer arithmetic as precisely as possible.
Note that gst_clock_get_time() always returns increasing values so when you move the clock backwards, gst_clock_get_time() will report the previous value until the clock catches up.
MT safe.

parameter.name: rate_num
parameter.parameter_description: the numerator of the rate of the clock relative to its internal time

parameter.name: rate_denom
parameter.parameter_description: the denominator of the rate of the clock

function.name: gst_clock_set_master
function.return:
%TRUE if the clock is capable of being slaved to a master clock. Trying to set a master on a clock without the #GST_CLOCK_FLAG_CAN_SET_MASTER flag will make this function return %FALSE.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_clock_set_resolution
function.description: Set the accuracy of the clock. Some clocks have the possibility to operate with different accuracy at the expense of more resource usage. There is normally no need to change the default resolution of a clock. The resolution of a clock can only be changed if the clock has the #GST_CLOCK_FLAG_CAN_SET_RESOLUTION flag set.
function.return: the new resolution of the clock.

function.name: gst_clock_set_synced
function.description:
Sets @clock to synced and emits the GstClock::synced signal, and wakes up any thread waiting in gst_clock_wait_for_sync().
This function must only be called if GST_CLOCK_FLAG_NEEDS_STARTUP_SYNC is set on the clock, and is intended to be called by subclasses only.

function.name: gst_clock_set_timeout
function.description: Set the amount of time, in nanoseconds, to sample master and slave clocks

function.name: gst_clock_single_shot_id_reinit
function.description: Reinitializes the provided single shot @id to the provided time. Does not modify the reference count.
function.return: %TRUE if the GstClockID could be reinitialized to the provided @time, else %FALSE.

function.name: gst_clock_unadjust_unlocked
function.description:
Converts the given @external clock time to the internal time of @clock, using the rate and reference time set with gst_clock_set_calibration(). This function should be called with the clock's OBJECT_LOCK held and is mainly used by clock subclasses.
This function is the reverse of gst_clock_adjust_unlocked().
function.return: the internal time of the clock corresponding to @external.

function.name: gst_clock_unadjust_with_calibration
function.description:
Converts the given @external_target clock time to the internal time, using the passed calibration parameters. This function performs the same calculation as gst_clock_unadjust_unlocked() when called using the current calibration parameters.
Note: The @clock parameter is unused and can be NULL

parameter.name: cnum
parameter.parameter_description: the numerator of the rate of the clock relative to its internal time

parameter.name: cdenom
parameter.parameter_description: the denominator of the rate of the clock

function.return: the converted time of the clock.

function.name: gst_clock_wait_for_sync
function.description:
Waits until @clock is synced for reporting the current time. If @timeout is %GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE it will wait forever, otherwise it will time out after @timeout nanoseconds.
For asynchronous waiting, the GstClock::synced signal can be used.
This returns immediately with TRUE if GST_CLOCK_FLAG_NEEDS_STARTUP_SYNC is not set on the clock, or if the clock is already synced.
function.return: %TRUE if waiting was successful, or %FALSE on timeout

function.name: gst_codec_utils_aac_caps_set_level_and_profile

parameter.name: caps
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstCaps to which level and profile fields are to be added

parameter.name: audio_config
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to the AudioSpecificConfig as specified in the Elementary Stream Descriptor (esds) in ISO/IEC 14496-1 (see below for a more details).

function.return: %TRUE if the level and profile could be set, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_codec_utils_aac_get_index_from_sample_rate
function.description: Translates the sample rate to the index corresponding to it in AAC spec.
function.return: The AAC index for this sample rate, -1 if the rate is not a valid AAC sample rate.

function.name: gst_codec_utils_aac_get_level
function.description:
Determines the level of a stream as defined in ISO/IEC 14496-3. For AAC LC streams, the constraints from the AAC audio profile are applied. For AAC Main, LTP, SSR and others, the Main profile is used.
The @audio_config parameter follows the following format, starting from the most significant bit of the first byte:
<itemizedlist> <listitem><para> Bit 0:4 contains the AudioObjectType </para></listitem> <listitem><para> Bit 5:8 contains the sample frequency index (if this is 0xf, then the next 24 bits define the actual sample frequency, and subsequent fields are appropriately shifted). </para></listitem> <listitem><para> Bit 9:12 contains the channel configuration </para></listitem> </itemizedlist>
<note> HE-AAC support has not yet been implemented. </note>

parameter.name: audio_config
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to the AudioSpecificConfig as specified in the Elementary Stream Descriptor (esds) in ISO/IEC 14496-1.

function.return: The level as a const string and %NULL if the level could not be determined.

function.name: gst_codec_utils_aac_get_profile
function.description:
Returns the profile of the given AAC stream as a string. The profile is determined using the AudioObjectType field which is in the first 5 bits of @audio_config.
<note> HE-AAC support has not yet been implemented. </note>

parameter.name: audio_config
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to the AudioSpecificConfig as specified in the Elementary Stream Descriptor (esds) in ISO/IEC 14496-1 (see gst_codec_utils_aac_get_level() for a more details).

function.return: The profile as a const string and %NULL if the profile could not be determined.

function.name: gst_codec_utils_aac_get_sample_rate_from_index
function.description: Translates the sample rate index found in AAC headers to the actual sample rate.

parameter.name: sr_idx
parameter.parameter_description: Sample rate index as from the AudioSpecificConfig (MPEG-4 container) or ADTS frame header

function.return: The sample rate if @sr_idx is valid, 0 otherwise.

function.name: gst_codec_utils_h264_caps_set_level_and_profile
function.description: Sets the level and profile in @caps if it can be determined from @sps. See gst_codec_utils_h264_get_level() and gst_codec_utils_h264_get_profile() for more details on the parameters.

parameter.name: caps
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstCaps to which the level and profile are to be added

parameter.name: sps
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to the sequence parameter set for the stream.

parameter.name: len
parameter.parameter_description: Length of the data available in @sps.

function.return: %TRUE if the level and profile could be set, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_codec_utils_h264_get_level
function.description: Converts the level indication (level_idc) in the stream's sequence parameter set into a string. The SPS is expected to have the same format as for gst_codec_utils_h264_get_profile().

parameter.name: sps
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to the sequence parameter set for the stream.

parameter.name: len
parameter.parameter_description: Length of the data available in @sps.

function.return: The level as a const string, or %NULL if there is an error.

function.name: gst_codec_utils_h264_get_level_idc
function.description: Transform a level string from the caps into the level_idc
function.return: the level_idc or 0 if the level is unknown

function.name: gst_codec_utils_h264_get_profile
function.description:
Converts the profile indication (profile_idc) in the stream's sequence parameter set into a string. The SPS is expected to have the following format, as defined in the H.264 specification. The SPS is viewed as a bitstream here, with bit 0 being the most significant bit of the first byte.
<itemizedlist> <listitem><para>Bit 0:7 - Profile indication</para></listitem> <listitem><para>Bit 8 - constraint_set0_flag</para></listitem> <listitem><para>Bit 9 - constraint_set1_flag</para></listitem> <listitem><para>Bit 10 - constraint_set2_flag</para></listitem> <listitem><para>Bit 11 - constraint_set3_flag</para></listitem> <listitem><para>Bit 12 - constraint_set3_flag</para></listitem> <listitem><para>Bit 13:15 - Reserved</para></listitem> <listitem><para>Bit 16:24 - Level indication</para></listitem> </itemizedlist>

parameter.name: sps
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to the sequence parameter set for the stream.

parameter.name: len
parameter.parameter_description: Length of the data available in @sps.

function.return: The profile as a const string, or %NULL if there is an error.

function.name: gst_codec_utils_h265_caps_set_level_tier_and_profile
function.description: Sets the level, tier and profile in @caps if it can be determined from @profile_tier_level. See gst_codec_utils_h265_get_level(), gst_codec_utils_h265_get_tier() and gst_codec_utils_h265_get_profile() for more details on the parameters.

parameter.name: caps
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstCaps to which the level, tier and profile are to be added

parameter.name: len
parameter.parameter_description: Length of the data available in @profile_tier_level.

function.return: %TRUE if the level, tier, profile could be set, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_codec_utils_h265_get_level
function.description: Converts the level indication (general_level_idc) in the stream's profile_tier_level structure into a string. The profiel_tier_level is expected to have the same format as for gst_codec_utils_h264_get_profile().

parameter.name: profile_tier_level
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to the profile_tier_level structure for the stream

parameter.name: len
parameter.parameter_description: Length of the data available in @profile_tier_level.

function.return: The level as a const string, or %NULL if there is an error.

function.name: gst_codec_utils_h265_get_level_idc
function.description: Transform a level string from the caps into the level_idc
function.return: the level_idc or 0 if the level is unknown

function.name: gst_codec_utils_h265_get_profile
function.description:
Converts the profile indication (general_profile_idc) in the stream's profile_level_tier structure into a string. The profile_tier_level is expected to have the following format, as defined in the H.265 specification. The profile_tier_level is viewed as a bitstream here, with bit 0 being the most significant bit of the first byte.
<itemizedlist> <listitem><para>Bit 0:1 - general_profile_space</para></listitem> <listitem><para>Bit 2 - general_tier_flag</para></listitem> <listitem><para>Bit 3:7 - general_profile_idc</para></listitem> <listitem><para>Bit 8:39 - gernal_profile_compatibility_flags</para></listitem> <listitem><para>Bit 40 - general_progressive_source_flag</para></listitem> <listitem><para>Bit 41 - general_interlaced_source_flag</para></listitem> <listitem><para>Bit 42 - general_non_packed_constraint_flag</para></listitem> <listitem><para>Bit 43 - general_frame_only_constraint_flag</para></listitem> <listitem><para>Bit 44:87 - general_reserved_zero_44bits</para></listitem> <listitem><para>Bit 88:95 - general_level_idc</para></listitem> </itemizedlist>

parameter.name: profile_tier_level
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to the profile_tier_level structure for the stream.

parameter.name: len
parameter.parameter_description: Length of the data available in @profile_tier_level

function.return: The profile as a const string, or %NULL if there is an error.

function.name: gst_codec_utils_h265_get_tier
function.description: Converts the tier indication (general_tier_flag) in the stream's profile_tier_level structure into a string. The profile_tier_level is expected to have the same format as for gst_codec_utils_h264_get_profile().

parameter.name: profile_tier_level
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to the profile_tier_level structure for the stream.

parameter.name: len
parameter.parameter_description: Length of the data available in @profile_tier_level.

function.return: The tier as a const string, or %NULL if there is an error.

function.name: gst_codec_utils_mpeg4video_caps_set_level_and_profile
function.description: Sets the level and profile in @caps if it can be determined from @vis_obj_seq. See gst_codec_utils_mpeg4video_get_level() and gst_codec_utils_mpeg4video_get_profile() for more details on the parameters.

parameter.name: caps
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstCaps to which the level and profile are to be added

parameter.name: vis_obj_seq
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to the visual object sequence for the stream.

parameter.name: len

function.return: %TRUE if the level and profile could be set, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_codec_utils_mpeg4video_get_level
function.description: Converts the level indication in the stream's visual object sequence into a string. @vis_obj_seq is expected to be the data following the visual object sequence start code. Only the first byte (profile_and_level_indication) is used.

parameter.name: vis_obj_seq
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to the visual object sequence for the stream.

parameter.name: len
parameter.parameter_description: Length of the data available in @sps.

function.return: The level as a const string, or NULL if there is an error.

function.name: gst_codec_utils_mpeg4video_get_profile
function.description: Converts the profile indication in the stream's visual object sequence into a string. @vis_obj_seq is expected to be the data following the visual object sequence start code. Only the first byte (profile_and_level_indication) is used.

parameter.name: vis_obj_seq
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to the visual object sequence for the stream.

parameter.name: len
parameter.parameter_description: Length of the data available in @sps.

function.return: The profile as a const string, or NULL if there is an error.

function.description: Creates Opus caps from the given parameters.
function.return: The #GstCaps.

function.name: gst_codec_utils_opus_create_caps_from_header
function.description: Creates Opus caps from the given OpusHead @header and comment header @comments.
function.return: The #GstCaps.

function.name: gst_codec_utils_opus_create_header
function.description: Creates OpusHead header from the given parameters.
function.return: The #GstBuffer containing the OpusHead.

function.name: gst_codec_utils_opus_parse_caps
function.description: Parses Opus caps and fills the different fields with defaults if possible.

parameter.name: caps
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstCaps to which the level and profile are to be added

function.return: %TRUE if parsing was successful, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_codec_utils_opus_parse_header
function.description: Parses the OpusHead header.
function.return: %TRUE if parsing was successful, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_collect_pads_add_pad
function.description:
Add a pad to the collection of collect pads. The pad has to be a sinkpad. The refcount of the pad is incremented. Use gst_collect_pads_remove_pad() to remove the pad from the collection again.
You specify a size for the returned #GstCollectData structure so that you can use it to store additional information.
You can also specify a #GstCollectDataDestroyNotify that will be called just before the #GstCollectData structure is freed. It is passed the pointer to the structure and should free any custom memory and resources allocated for it.
Keeping a pad locked in waiting state is only relevant when using the default collection algorithm (providing the oldest buffer). It ensures a buffer must be available on this pad for a collection to take place. This is of typical use to a muxer element where non-subtitle streams should always be in waiting state, e.g. to assure that caps information is available on all these streams when initial headers have to be written.
The pad will be automatically activated in push mode when @pads is started.
MT safe.

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: the size of the returned #GstCollectData structure

parameter.name: destroy_notify
parameter.parameter_description: function to be called before the returned #GstCollectData structure is freed

parameter.name: lock
parameter.parameter_description: whether to lock this pad in usual waiting state

function.return: a new #GstCollectData to identify the new pad. Or %NULL if wrong parameters are supplied.

function.name: gst_collect_pads_available
function.description:
Query how much bytes can be read from each queued buffer. This means that the result of this call is the maximum number of bytes that can be read from each of the pads.
This function should be called with @pads STREAM_LOCK held, such as in the callback.
MT safe.
function.return: The maximum number of bytes queued on all pads. This function returns 0 if a pad has no queued buffer.

function.name: gst_collect_pads_clip_running_time
function.description:
Convenience clipping function that converts incoming buffer's timestamp to running time, or clips the buffer if outside configured segment.
Since 1.6, this clipping function also sets the DTS parameter of the GstCollectData structure. This version of the running time DTS can be negative. G_MININT64 is used to indicate invalid value.

parameter.name: outbuf
parameter.parameter_description: output buffer with running time, or NULL if clipped

function.name: gst_collect_pads_event_default
function.description: Default #GstCollectPads event handling that elements should always chain up to to ensure proper operation. Element might however indicate event should not be forwarded downstream.

parameter.name: discard
parameter.parameter_description: process but do not send event downstream

function.name: gst_collect_pads_find_best_pad
function.description:
Find the oldest/best pad, i.e. pad holding the oldest buffer and and return the corresponding #GstCollectData and buffertime.
This function should be called with STREAM_LOCK held, such as in the callback.

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: returns the collectdata for earliest data

function.name: gst_collect_pads_flush
function.description:
Flush @size bytes from the pad @data.
This function should be called with @pads STREAM_LOCK held, such as in the callback.
MT safe.

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: the number of bytes to flush

function.return: The number of bytes flushed This can be less than @size and is 0 if the pad was end-of-stream.

function.name: gst_collect_pads_new
function.description:
Create a new instance of #GstCollectPads.
MT safe.
function.return: a new #GstCollectPads, or %NULL in case of an error.

function.name: gst_collect_pads_peek
function.description:
Peek at the buffer currently queued in @data. This function should be called with the @pads STREAM_LOCK held, such as in the callback handler.
MT safe.
function.return: The buffer in @data or %NULL if no buffer is queued. should unref the buffer after usage.

function.name: gst_collect_pads_pop
function.description:
Pop the buffer currently queued in @data. This function should be called with the @pads STREAM_LOCK held, such as in the callback handler.
MT safe.
function.return: The buffer in @data or %NULL if no buffer was queued. You should unref the buffer after usage.

function.name: gst_collect_pads_query_default
function.description: Default #GstCollectPads query handling that elements should always chain up to to ensure proper operation. Element might however indicate query should not be forwarded downstream.

parameter.name: discard
parameter.parameter_description: process but do not send event downstream

function.name: gst_collect_pads_read_buffer
function.description:
Get a subbuffer of @size bytes from the given pad @data.
This function should be called with @pads STREAM_LOCK held, such as in the callback.
MT safe.

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: the number of bytes to read

function.return: A sub buffer. The size of the buffer can be less that requested. A return of %NULL signals that the pad is end-of-stream. Unref the buffer after use.

function.name: gst_collect_pads_remove_pad
function.description:
Remove a pad from the collection of collect pads. This function will also free the #GstCollectData and all the resources that were allocated with gst_collect_pads_add_pad().
The pad will be deactivated automatically when @pads is stopped.
MT safe.
function.return: %TRUE if the pad could be removed.

function.name: gst_collect_pads_set_buffer_function
function.description:
Set the callback function and user data that will be called with the oldest buffer when all pads have been collected, or %NULL on EOS. If a buffer is passed, the callback owns a reference and must unref it.
MT safe.

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: user data passed to the function

function.name: gst_collect_pads_set_clip_function
function.description: Install a clipping function that is called right after a buffer is received on a pad managed by @pads. See #GstCollectPadsClipFunction for more info.

function.name: gst_collect_pads_set_compare_function
function.description:
Set the timestamp comparison function.
MT safe.

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: user data passed to the function

function.name: gst_collect_pads_set_event_function
function.description:
Set the event callback function and user data that will be called when collectpads has received an event originating from one of the collected pads. If the event being processed is a serialized one, this callback is called with @pads STREAM_LOCK held, otherwise not. As this lock should be held when calling a number of CollectPads functions, it should be acquired if so (unusually) needed.
MT safe.

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: user data passed to the function

function.name: gst_collect_pads_set_flush_function
function.description: Install a flush function that is called when the internal state of all pads should be flushed as part of flushing seek handling. See #GstCollectPadsFlushFunction for more info.

function.name: gst_collect_pads_set_flushing
function.description:
Change the flushing state of all the pads in the collection. No pad is able to accept anymore data when @flushing is %TRUE. Calling this function with @flushing %FALSE makes @pads accept data again. Caller must ensure that downstream streaming (thread) is not blocked, e.g. by sending a FLUSH_START downstream.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_collect_pads_set_function
function.description:
CollectPads provides a default collection algorithm that will determine the oldest buffer available on all of its pads, and then delegate to a configured callback. However, if circumstances are more complicated and/or more control is desired, this sets a callback that will be invoked instead when all the pads added to the collection have buffers queued. Evidently, this callback is not compatible with gst_collect_pads_set_buffer_function() callback. If this callback is set, the former will be unset.
MT safe.

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: user data passed to the function

function.name: gst_collect_pads_set_query_function
function.description:
Set the query callback function and user data that will be called after collectpads has received a query originating from one of the collected pads. If the query being processed is a serialized one, this callback is called with @pads STREAM_LOCK held, otherwise not. As this lock should be held when calling a number of CollectPads functions, it should be acquired if so (unusually) needed.
MT safe.

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: user data passed to the function

function.name: gst_collect_pads_set_waiting
function.description:
Sets a pad to waiting or non-waiting mode, if at least this pad has not been created with locked waiting state, in which case nothing happens.
This function should be called with @pads STREAM_LOCK held, such as in the callback.
MT safe.

parameter.name: waiting
parameter.parameter_description: boolean indicating whether this pad should operate in waiting or non-waiting mode

function.name: gst_collect_pads_src_event_default
function.description: Default #GstCollectPads event handling for the src pad of elements. Elements can chain up to this to let flushing seek event handling be done by #GstCollectPads.

function.name: gst_collect_pads_start
function.description:
Starts the processing of data in the collect_pads.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_collect_pads_stop
function.description:
Stops the processing of data in the collect_pads. this function will also unblock any blocking operations.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_collect_pads_take_buffer
function.description:
Get a subbuffer of @size bytes from the given pad @data. Flushes the amount of read bytes.
This function should be called with @pads STREAM_LOCK held, such as in the callback.
MT safe.

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: the number of bytes to read

function.return: A sub buffer. The size of the buffer can be less that requested. A return of %NULL signals that the pad is end-of-stream. Unref the buffer after use.

function.name: gst_color_balance_get_balance_type
function.description: Get the #GstColorBalanceType of this implementation.
function.return: A the #GstColorBalanceType.

function.name: gst_color_balance_get_value
function.description:
Retrieve the current value of the indicated channel, between min_value and max_value.
See Also: The #GstColorBalanceChannel.min_value and #GstColorBalanceChannel.max_value members of the #GstColorBalanceChannel object.
function.return: The current value of the channel.

function.name: gst_color_balance_list_channels
function.description: Retrieve a list of the available channels.
function.return: A GList containing pointers to #GstColorBalanceChannel objects. The list is owned by the #GstColorBalance instance and must not be freed.

function.name: gst_color_balance_set_value
function.description:
Sets the current value of the channel to the passed value, which must be between min_value and max_value.
See Also: The #GstColorBalanceChannel.min_value and #GstColorBalanceChannel.max_value members of the #GstColorBalanceChannel object.

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: The new value for the channel.

function.name: gst_color_balance_value_changed
function.description: A helper function called by implementations of the GstColorBalance interface. It fires the #GstColorBalance::value-changed signal on the instance, and the #GstColorBalanceChannel::value-changed signal on the channel object.

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: The new value of the channel

function.name: gst_consistency_checker_add_pad
function.description: Sets up a data probe on the given pad which will raise assertions if the data flow is inconsistent.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: The #GstPad on which the dataflow will be checked.

function.return: %TRUE if the pad was added

function.name: gst_consistency_checker_free
function.description: Frees the allocated data and probes associated with @consist.

function.name: gst_consistency_checker_new
function.description: Sets up a data probe on the given pad which will raise assertions if the data flow is inconsistent.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: The #GstPad on which the dataflow will be checked.

function.return: A #GstStreamConsistency structure used to track data flow.

function.name: gst_consistency_checker_reset
function.description: Reset the stream checker's internal variables.

function.name: gst_context_copy
function.description: Creates a copy of the context. Returns a copy of the context.
function.return:
a new copy of @context.
MT safe

function.name: gst_context_get_context_type
function.description: Get the type of @context.
function.return: The type of the context.

function.name: gst_context_get_structure
function.description: Access the structure of the context.
function.return: The structure of the context. The structure is still owned by the context, which means that you should not modify it, free it and that the pointer becomes invalid when you free the context.

function.name: gst_context_has_context_type
function.description: Checks if @context has @context_type.
function.return: %TRUE if @context has @context_type.

function.name: gst_context_is_persistent
function.description: Check if @context is persistent.
function.return: %TRUE if the context is persistent.

function.name: gst_context_is_writable
function.description: Tests if you can safely write into a context's structure or validly modify the seqnum and timestamp fields.

function.name: gst_context_make_writable
function.description: Checks if a context is writable. If not, a writable copy is made and returned.
function.return:
a context (possibly a duplicate) that is writable.
MT safe

function.name: gst_context_new
function.description: Create a new context.
function.return: The new context.

function.name: gst_context_ref
function.description: Convenience macro to increase the reference count of the context.
function.return: @context (for convenience when doing assignments)

function.name: gst_context_replace
function.description:
Modifies a pointer to a #GstContext to point to a different #GstContext. The modification is done atomically (so this is useful for ensuring thread safety in some cases), and the reference counts are updated appropriately (the old context is unreffed, the new one is reffed).
Either @new_context or the #GstContext pointed to by @old_context may be %NULL.

parameter.name: old_context
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a pointer to a #GstContext to be replaced.

parameter.name: new_context
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a #GstContext that will replace the context pointed to by @old_context.

function.return: %TRUE if @new_context was different from @old_context

function.name: gst_context_unref
function.description: Convenience macro to decrease the reference count of the context, possibly freeing it.

function.name: gst_context_writable_structure
function.description: Get a writable version of the structure.
function.return: The structure of the context. The structure is still owned by the context, which means that you should not free it and that the pointer becomes invalid when you free the context. This function checks if @context is writable.

function.name: gst_control_binding_get_g_value_array
function.description:
Gets a number of #GValues for the given controlled property starting at the requested time. The array @values need to hold enough space for @n_values of #GValue.
This function is useful if one wants to e.g. draw a graph of the control curve or apply a control curve sample by sample.

parameter.name: timestamp
parameter.parameter_description: the time that should be processed

parameter.name: interval
parameter.parameter_description: the time spacing between subsequent values

function.return: %TRUE if the given array could be filled, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gst_control_binding_get_value
function.description: Gets the value for the given controlled property at the requested time.

parameter.name: timestamp
parameter.parameter_description: the time the control-change should be read from

function.return: the GValue of the property at the given time, or %NULL if the property isn't controlled.

function.name: gst_control_binding_get_value_array
function.description:
Gets a number of values for the given controlled property starting at the requested time. The array @values need to hold enough space for @n_values of the same type as the objects property's type.
This function is useful if one wants to e.g. draw a graph of the control curve or apply a control curve sample by sample.
The values are unboxed and ready to be used. The similar function gst_control_binding_get_g_value_array() returns the array as #GValues and is more suitable for bindings.

parameter.name: timestamp
parameter.parameter_description: the time that should be processed

parameter.name: interval
parameter.parameter_description: the time spacing between subsequent values

function.return: %TRUE if the given array could be filled, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gst_control_binding_is_disabled
function.description: Check if the control binding is disabled.
function.return: %TRUE if the binding is inactive

function.name: gst_control_binding_set_disabled
function.description: This function is used to disable a control binding for some time, i.e. gst_object_sync_values() will do nothing.

parameter.name: disabled
parameter.parameter_description: boolean that specifies whether to disable the controller or not.

function.name: gst_control_binding_sync_values
function.description:
Sets the property of the @object, according to the #GstControlSources that handle them and for the given timestamp.
If this function fails, it is most likely the application developers fault. Most probably the control sources are not setup correctly.

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: the object that has controlled properties

parameter.name: timestamp
parameter.parameter_description: the time that should be processed

parameter.name: last_sync
parameter.parameter_description: the last time this was called

function.return: %TRUE if the controller value could be applied to the object property, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gst_control_source_get_value
function.description: Gets the value for this #GstControlSource at a given timestamp.

parameter.name: timestamp
parameter.parameter_description: the time for which the value should be returned

function.return: %FALSE if the value couldn't be returned, %TRUE otherwise.

function.name: gst_control_source_get_value_array
function.description: Gets an array of values for for this #GstControlSource. Values that are undefined contain NANs.

parameter.name: n_values
parameter.parameter_description: the number of values to fetch

function.return: %TRUE if the given array could be filled, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gst_data_queue_drop_head
function.description: Pop and unref the head-most #GstMiniObject with the given #GType.

parameter.name: queue
parameter.parameter_description: The #GstDataQueue to drop an item from.

parameter.name: type
parameter.parameter_description: The #GType of the item to drop.

function.return: %TRUE if an element was removed.

function.name: gst_data_queue_flush
function.description: Flushes all the contents of the @queue. Any call to #gst_data_queue_push and #gst_data_queue_pop will be released. MT safe.

function.name: gst_data_queue_get_level
function.description: Get the current level of the queue.

parameter.name: level
parameter.parameter_description: the location to store the result

function.name: gst_data_queue_is_empty
function.description: Queries if there are any items in the @queue. MT safe.
function.return: %TRUE if @queue is empty.

function.name: gst_data_queue_is_full
function.description: Queries if @queue is full. This check will be done using the #GstDataQueueCheckFullFunction registered with @queue. MT safe.
function.return: %TRUE if @queue is full.

function.name: gst_data_queue_limits_changed
function.description: Inform the queue that the limits for the fullness check have changed and that any blocking gst_data_queue_push() should be unblocked to recheck the limits.

function.name: gst_data_queue_new
function.description: Creates a new #GstDataQueue. If @fullcallback or @emptycallback are supplied, then the #GstDataQueue will call the respective callback to signal full or empty condition. If the callbacks are NULL the #GstDataQueue will instead emit 'full' and 'empty' signals.

parameter.name: checkfull
parameter.parameter_description: the callback used to tell if the element considers the queue full or not.

parameter.name: fullcallback
parameter.parameter_description: the callback which will be called when the queue is considered full.

parameter.name: emptycallback
parameter.parameter_description: the callback which will be called when the queue is considered empty.

parameter.name: checkdata
parameter.parameter_description: a #gpointer that will be passed to the @checkfull, @fullcallback, and @emptycallback callbacks.

function.return: a new #GstDataQueue.

function.name: gst_data_queue_peek
function.description: Retrieves the first @item available on the @queue without removing it. If the queue is currently empty, the call will block until at least one item is available, OR the @queue is set to the flushing state. MT safe.
function.return: %TRUE if an @item was successfully retrieved from the @queue.

function.name: gst_data_queue_pop
function.description: Retrieves the first @item available on the @queue. If the queue is currently empty, the call will block until at least one item is available, OR the @queue is set to the flushing state. MT safe.
function.return: %TRUE if an @item was successfully retrieved from the @queue.

function.name: gst_data_queue_push
