function.description:
Pushes a #GstDataQueueItem (or a structure that begins with the same fields) on the @queue. If the @queue is full, the call will block until space is available, OR the @queue is set to flushing state. MT safe.
Note that this function has slightly different semantics than gst_pad_push() and gst_pad_push_event(): this function only takes ownership of @item and the #GstMiniObject contained in @item if the push was successful. If %FALSE is returned, the caller is responsible for freeing @item and its contents.
function.return: %TRUE if the @item was successfully pushed on the @queue.

function.name: gst_data_queue_push_force
function.description:
Pushes a #GstDataQueueItem (or a structure that begins with the same fields) on the @queue. It ignores if the @queue is full or not and forces the @item to be pushed anyway. MT safe.
Note that this function has slightly different semantics than gst_pad_push() and gst_pad_push_event(): this function only takes ownership of @item and the #GstMiniObject contained in @item if the push was successful. If %FALSE is returned, the caller is responsible for freeing @item and its contents.
function.return: %TRUE if the @item was successfully pushed on the @queue.

function.name: gst_data_queue_set_flushing
function.description:
Sets the queue to flushing state if @flushing is %TRUE. If set to flushing state, any incoming data on the @queue will be discarded. Any call currently blocking on #gst_data_queue_push or #gst_data_queue_pop will return straight away with a return value of %FALSE. While the @queue is in flushing state, all calls to those two functions will return %FALSE.
MT Safe.

parameter.name: flushing
parameter.parameter_description: a #gboolean stating if the queue will be flushing or not.

function.name: gst_date_time_get_day
function.description: Returns the day of the month of this #GstDateTime. Call gst_date_time_has_day before, to avoid warnings.
function.return: The day of this #GstDateTime

function.name: gst_date_time_get_hour
function.description: Retrieves the hour of the day represented by @datetime in the gregorian calendar. The return is in the range of 0 to 23. Call gst_date_time_has_haur before, to avoid warnings.
function.return: the hour of the day

function.name: gst_date_time_get_microsecond
function.description: Retrieves the fractional part of the seconds in microseconds represented by @datetime in the gregorian calendar.
function.return: the microsecond of the second

function.name: gst_date_time_get_minute
function.description: Retrieves the minute of the hour represented by @datetime in the gregorian calendar. Call gst_date_time_has_minute before, to avoid warnings.
function.return: the minute of the hour

function.name: gst_date_time_get_month
function.description: Returns the month of this #GstDateTime. January is 1, February is 2, etc.. Call gst_date_time_has_month before, to avoid warnings.
function.return: The month of this #GstDateTime

function.name: gst_date_time_get_second
function.description: Retrieves the second of the minute represented by @datetime in the gregorian calendar. Call gst_date_time_has_second before, to avoid warnings.
function.return: the second represented by @datetime

function.name: gst_date_time_get_time_zone_offset
function.description: Retrieves the offset from UTC in hours that the timezone specified by @datetime represents. Timezones ahead (to the east) of UTC have positive values, timezones before (to the west) of UTC have negative values. If @datetime represents UTC time, then the offset is zero.
function.return: the offset from UTC in hours

function.name: gst_date_time_get_year
function.description: Returns the year of this #GstDateTime Call gst_date_time_has_year before, to avoid warnings.
function.return: The year of this #GstDateTime

function.name: gst_date_time_has_day
function.return: %TRUE if @datetime<!-- -->'s day field is set, otherwise %FALSE

function.name: gst_date_time_has_month
function.return: %TRUE if @datetime<!-- -->'s month field is set, otherwise %FALSE

function.name: gst_date_time_has_second
function.return: %TRUE if @datetime<!-- -->'s second field is set, otherwise %FALSE

function.name: gst_date_time_has_time
function.return: %TRUE if @datetime<!-- -->'s hour and minute fields are set, otherwise %FALSE

function.name: gst_date_time_has_year
function.return: %TRUE if @datetime<!-- -->'s year field is set (which should always be the case), otherwise %FALSE

function.name: gst_date_time_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GstDateTime using the date and times in the gregorian calendar in the supplied timezone.
@year should be from 1 to 9999, @month should be from 1 to 12, @day from 1 to 31, @hour from 0 to 23, @minutes and @seconds from 0 to 59.
Note that @tzoffset is a float and was chosen so for being able to handle some fractional timezones, while it still keeps the readability of representing it in hours for most timezones.
If value is -1 then all over value will be ignored. For example if @month == -1, then #GstDateTime will created only for @year. If @day == -1, then #GstDateTime will created for @year and @month and so on.
Free-function: gst_date_time_unref

parameter.name: day
parameter.parameter_description: the day of the gregorian month

function.return: the newly created #GstDateTime

function.name: gst_date_time_new_from_g_date_time
function.description:
Creates a new #GstDateTime from a #GDateTime object.
Free-function: gst_date_time_unref
function.return: a newly created #GstDateTime, or %NULL on error

function.name: gst_date_time_new_from_iso8601_string
function.description:
Tries to parse common variants of ISO-8601 datetime strings into a #GstDateTime. Possible input formats are (for example): 2012-06-30T22:46:43Z, 2012, 2012-06, 2012-06-30, 2012-06-30T22:46:43-0430, 2012-06-30T22:46Z, 2012-06-30T22:46-0430, 2012-06-30 22:46, 2012-06-30 22:46:43, 2012-06-00, 2012-00-00, 2012-00-30, 22:46:43Z, 22:46Z, 22:46:43-0430, 22:46-0430, 22:46:30, 22:46 If no date is provided, it is assumed to be "today" in the timezone provided (if any), otherwise UTC.
Free-function: gst_date_time_unref
function.return: a newly created #GstDateTime, or %NULL on error

function.name: gst_date_time_new_from_unix_epoch_local_time
function.return: the newly created #GstDateTime

function.name: gst_date_time_new_from_unix_epoch_utc
function.return: the newly created #GstDateTime

function.name: gst_date_time_new_local_time
function.description:
Creates a new #GstDateTime using the date and times in the gregorian calendar in the local timezone.
@year should be from 1 to 9999, @month should be from 1 to 12, @day from 1 to 31, @hour from 0 to 23, @minutes and @seconds from 0 to 59.
If @month is -1, then the #GstDateTime created will only contain @year, and all other fields will be considered not set.
If @day is -1, then the #GstDateTime created will only contain @year and @month and all other fields will be considered not set.
If @hour is -1, then the #GstDateTime created will only contain @year and @month and @day, and the time fields will be considered not set. In this case @minute and @seconds should also be -1.
Free-function: gst_date_time_unref

parameter.name: day
parameter.parameter_description: the day of the gregorian month, or -1

parameter.name: hour
parameter.parameter_description: the hour of the day, or -1

parameter.name: minute
parameter.parameter_description: the minute of the hour, or -1

parameter.name: seconds
parameter.parameter_description: the second of the minute, or -1

function.return: the newly created #GstDateTime

function.name: gst_date_time_new_now_local_time
function.description:
Creates a new #GstDateTime representing the current date and time.
Free-function: gst_date_time_unref
function.return: the newly created #GstDateTime which should be freed with gst_date_time_unref().

function.name: gst_date_time_new_now_utc
function.description:
Creates a new #GstDateTime that represents the current instant at Universal coordinated time.
Free-function: gst_date_time_unref
function.return: the newly created #GstDateTime which should be freed with gst_date_time_unref().

function.name: gst_date_time_new_y
function.return: the newly created #GstDateTime

function.name: gst_date_time_new_ym
function.description:
Creates a new #GstDateTime using the date and times in the gregorian calendar in the local timezone.
@year should be from 1 to 9999, @month should be from 1 to 12.
If value is -1 then all over value will be ignored. For example if @month == -1, then #GstDateTime will created only for @year.
Free-function: gst_date_time_unref
function.return: the newly created #GstDateTime

function.name: gst_date_time_new_ymd
function.description:
Creates a new #GstDateTime using the date and times in the gregorian calendar in the local timezone.
@year should be from 1 to 9999, @month should be from 1 to 12, @day from 1 to 31.
If value is -1 then all over value will be ignored. For example if @month == -1, then #GstDateTime will created only for @year. If @day == -1, then #GstDateTime will created for @year and @month and so on.
Free-function: gst_date_time_unref

parameter.name: day
parameter.parameter_description: the day of the gregorian month

function.return: the newly created #GstDateTime

function.name: gst_date_time_ref
function.description: Atomically increments the reference count of @datetime by one.
function.return: the reference @datetime

function.name: gst_date_time_to_g_date_time
function.description:
Creates a new #GDateTime from a fully defined #GstDateTime object.
Free-function: g_date_time_unref
function.return: a newly created #GDateTime, or %NULL on error

function.name: gst_date_time_to_iso8601_string
function.description: Create a minimal string compatible with ISO-8601. Possible output formats are (for example): 2012, 2012-06, 2012-06-23, 2012-06-23T23:30Z, 2012-06-23T23:30+0100, 2012-06-23T23:30:59Z, 2012-06-23T23:30:59+0100
function.return: a newly allocated string formatted according to ISO 8601 and only including the datetime fields that are valid, or %NULL in case there was an error. The string should be freed with g_free().

function.name: gst_date_time_unref
function.description: Atomically decrements the reference count of @datetime by one. When the reference count reaches zero, the structure is freed.

function.name: gst_debug_add_log_function
function.description: Adds the logging function to the list of logging functions. Be sure to use #G_GNUC_NO_INSTRUMENT on that function, it is needed.

parameter.name: notify
parameter.parameter_description: called when @user_data is not used anymore

function.name: gst_debug_category_free
function.description: Removes and frees the category and all associated resources.

function.name: gst_debug_category_get_color
function.description: Returns the color of a debug category used when printing output in this category.

parameter.name: category
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstDebugCategory to get the color of.

function.return: the color of the category.

function.name: gst_debug_category_get_description
function.description: Returns the description of a debug category.

parameter.name: category
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstDebugCategory to get the description of.

function.return: the description of the category.

function.name: gst_debug_category_get_name
function.description: Returns the name of a debug category.
function.return: the name of the category.

function.name: gst_debug_category_get_threshold
function.description: Returns the threshold of a #GstDebugCategory.
function.return: the #GstDebugLevel that is used as threshold.

function.name: gst_debug_category_reset_threshold
function.description: Resets the threshold of the category to the default level. Debug information will only be output if the threshold is lower or equal to the level of the debugging message. Use this function to set the threshold back to where it was after using gst_debug_category_set_threshold().

function.name: gst_debug_category_set_threshold
function.description: Sets the threshold of the category to the given level. Debug information will only be output if the threshold is lower or equal to the level of the debugging message. <note><para> Do not use this function in production code, because other functions may change the threshold of categories as side effect. It is however a nice function to use when debugging (even from gdb). </para></note>

function.name: gst_debug_construct_term_color
function.description: Constructs a string that can be used for getting the desired color in color terminals. You need to free the string after use.
function.return: a string containing the color definition

function.name: gst_debug_construct_win_color
function.description:
Constructs an integer that can be used for getting the desired color in windows' terminals (cmd.exe). As there is no mean to underline, we simply ignore this attribute.
This function returns 0 on non-windows machines.
function.return: an integer containing the color definition

function.name: gst_debug_get_all_categories
function.description: Returns a snapshot of a all categories that are currently in use . This list may change anytime. The caller has to free the list after use.
function.return: the list of debug categories

function.name: gst_debug_get_color_mode
function.description: Changes the coloring mode for debug output.
function.return: see @GstDebugColorMode for possible values.

function.name: gst_debug_get_default_threshold
function.description: Returns the default threshold that is used for new categories.
function.return: the default threshold level

function.name: gst_debug_is_active
function.description: Checks if debugging output is activated.
function.return: %TRUE, if debugging is activated

function.name: gst_debug_is_colored
function.description: Checks if the debugging output should be colored.
function.return: %TRUE, if the debug output should be colored.

function.name: gst_debug_level_get_name
function.description: Get the string representation of a debugging level

parameter.name: level
parameter.parameter_description: the level to get the name for

function.return: the name

function.name: gst_debug_log
function.description: Logs the given message using the currently registered debugging handlers.

parameter.name: level
parameter.parameter_description: level of the message is in

parameter.name: file
parameter.parameter_description: the file that emitted the message, usually the __FILE__ identifier

parameter.name: function
parameter.parameter_description: the function that emitted the message

parameter.name: line
parameter.parameter_description: the line from that the message was emitted, usually __LINE__

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: the object this message relates to, or %NULL if none

function.name: gst_debug_log_default
function.description:
The default logging handler used by GStreamer. Logging functions get called whenever a macro like GST_DEBUG or similar is used. By default this function is setup to output the message and additional info to stderr (or the log file specified via the GST_DEBUG_FILE environment variable) as received via @user_data.
You can add other handlers by using gst_debug_add_log_function(). And you can remove this handler by calling gst_debug_remove_log_function(gst_debug_log_default);

parameter.name: file
parameter.parameter_description: the file that emitted the message, usually the __FILE__ identifier

parameter.name: function
parameter.parameter_description: the function that emitted the message

parameter.name: line
parameter.parameter_description: the line from that the message was emitted, usually __LINE__

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: the object this message relates to, or %NULL if none

function.name: gst_debug_log_valist
function.description: Logs the given message using the currently registered debugging handlers.

parameter.name: level
parameter.parameter_description: level of the message is in

parameter.name: file
parameter.parameter_description: the file that emitted the message, usually the __FILE__ identifier

parameter.name: function
parameter.parameter_description: the function that emitted the message

parameter.name: line
parameter.parameter_description: the line from that the message was emitted, usually __LINE__

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: the object this message relates to, or %NULL if none

function.name: gst_debug_message_get
function.description: Gets the string representation of a #GstDebugMessage. This function is used in debug handlers to extract the message.
function.return: the string representation of a #GstDebugMessage.

function.name: gst_debug_print_stack_trace
function.description: If GST_ENABLE_FUNC_INSTRUMENTATION is defined a stacktrace is available for gstreamer code, which can be printed with this function.

function.name: gst_debug_remove_log_function
function.description: Removes all registered instances of the given logging functions.
function.return: How many instances of the function were removed

function.name: gst_debug_remove_log_function_by_data
function.description: Removes all registered instances of log functions with the given user data.

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: user data of the log function to remove

function.return: How many instances of the function were removed

function.name: gst_debug_set_active
function.description: If activated, debugging messages are sent to the debugging handlers. It makes sense to deactivate it for speed issues. <note><para>This function is not threadsafe. It makes sense to only call it during initialization.</para></note>

parameter.name: active
parameter.parameter_description: Whether to use debugging output or not

function.name: gst_debug_set_color_mode
function.description:
Changes the coloring mode for debug output.
This function may be called before gst_init().

parameter.name: mode
parameter.parameter_description: The coloring mode for debug output. See @GstDebugColorMode.

function.name: gst_debug_set_color_mode_from_string
function.description:
Changes the coloring mode for debug output.
This function may be called before gst_init().

parameter.name: mode
parameter.parameter_description: The coloring mode for debug output. One of the following: "on", "auto", "off", "disable", "unix".

function.name: gst_debug_set_colored
function.description:
Sets or unsets the use of coloured debugging output. Same as gst_debug_set_color_mode () with the argument being being GST_DEBUG_COLOR_MODE_ON or GST_DEBUG_COLOR_MODE_OFF.
This function may be called before gst_init().

parameter.name: colored
parameter.parameter_description: Whether to use colored output or not

function.name: gst_debug_set_default_threshold
function.description:
Sets the default threshold to the given level and updates all categories to use this threshold.
This function may be called before gst_init().

function.name: gst_debug_set_threshold_for_name
function.description: Sets all categories which match the given glob style pattern to the given level.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: name of the categories to set

function.name: gst_debug_set_threshold_from_string
function.description: Sets the debug logging wanted in the same form as with the GST_DEBUG environment variable. You can use wildcards such as '*', but note that the order matters when you use wild cards, e.g. "foosrc:6,*src:3,*:2" sets everything to log level 2.

parameter.name: list
parameter.parameter_description: comma-separated list of "category:level" pairs to be used as debug logging levels

parameter.name: reset
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE to clear all previously-set debug levels before setting new thresholds %FALSE if adding the threshold described by @list to the one already set.

function.name: gst_debug_unset_threshold_for_name
function.description: Resets all categories with the given name back to the default level.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: name of the categories to set

function.name: gst_deinit
function.description:
Clean up any resources created by GStreamer in gst_init().
It is normally not needed to call this function in a normal application as the resources will automatically be freed when the program terminates. This function is therefore mostly used by testsuites and other memory profiling tools.
After this call GStreamer (including this method) should not be used anymore.

function.name: gst_device_create_element
function.description: Creates the element with all of the required paramaters set to use this device.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: name of new element, or %NULL to automatically create a unique name.

function.return: a new #GstElement configured to use this device

function.name: gst_device_get_caps
function.description: Getter for the #GstCaps that this device supports.
function.return: The #GstCaps supported by this device. Unref with gst_caps_unref() when done.

function.name: gst_device_get_device_class
function.description: Gets the "class" of a device. This is a "/" separated list of classes that represent this device. They are a subset of the classes of the #GstDeviceProvider that produced this device.
function.return: The device class. Free with g_free() after use.

function.name: gst_device_get_display_name
function.description: Gets the user-friendly name of the device.
function.return: The device name. Free with g_free() after use.

function.name: gst_device_get_properties
function.description: Gets the extra properties of a device.
function.return: The extra properties or %NULL when there are none. Free with gst_structure_free() after use.

function.name: gst_device_has_classes
function.description: Check if @device matches all of the given classes

parameter.name: classes
parameter.parameter_description: a "/"-separated list of device classes to match, only match if all classes are matched

function.return: %TRUE if @device matches.

function.name: gst_device_has_classesv
function.description: Check if @factory matches all of the given classes

parameter.name: classes
parameter.parameter_description: a %NULL terminated array of classes to match, only match if all classes are matched

function.return: %TRUE if @device matches.

function.name: gst_device_monitor_add_filter
function.description:
Adds a filter for which #GstDevice will be monitored, any device that matches all these classes and the #GstCaps will be returned.
If this function is called multiple times to add more filters, each will be matched independently. That is, adding more filters will not further restrict what devices are matched.
The #GstCaps supported by the device as returned by gst_device_get_caps() are not intersected with caps filters added using this function.
Filters must be added before the #GstDeviceMonitor is started.

parameter.name: classes
parameter.parameter_description: device classes to use as filter or %NULL for any class

parameter.name: caps
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstCaps to filter or %NULL for ANY

function.return: The id of the new filter or 0 if no provider matched the filter's classes.

function.name: gst_device_monitor_get_bus
function.description: Gets the #GstBus of this #GstDeviceMonitor
function.return: a #GstBus

function.name: gst_device_monitor_get_devices
function.description: Gets a list of devices from all of the relevant monitors. This may actually probe the hardware if the monitor is not currently started.
function.return: a #GList of #GstDevice

function.name: gst_device_monitor_get_providers
function.description:
Get a list of the currently selected device provider factories.
This
function.return: A list of device provider factory names that are currently being monitored by @monitor or %NULL when nothing is being monitored.

function.name: gst_device_monitor_get_show_all_devices
function.description: Get if @monitor is curretly showing all devices, even those from hidden providers.
function.return: %TRUE when all devices will be shown.

function.name: gst_device_monitor_new
function.description: Create a new #GstDeviceMonitor
function.return: a new device monitor.

function.name: gst_device_monitor_remove_filter
function.description: Removes a filter from the #GstDeviceMonitor using the id that was returned by gst_device_monitor_add_filter().
function.return: %TRUE of the filter id was valid, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gst_device_monitor_set_show_all_devices
function.description: Set if all devices should be visible, even those devices from hidden providers. Setting @show_all to true might show some devices multiple times.

function.name: gst_device_monitor_start
function.description: Starts monitoring the devices, one this has succeeded, the %GST_MESSAGE_DEVICE_ADDED and %GST_MESSAGE_DEVICE_REMOVED messages will be emitted on the bus when the list of devices changes.
function.return: %TRUE if the device monitoring could be started

function.name: gst_device_monitor_stop
function.description: Stops monitoring the devices.

function.name: gst_device_provider_can_provider
function.description: If this function returns %TRUE, then the device provider can provider if devices are added or removed. Otherwise, it can only do static probing.
function.return: %TRUE if the #GstDeviceProvider support providering, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gst_device_provider_class_add_metadata
function.description: Set @key with @value as metadata in @klass.

function.name: gst_device_provider_class_add_static_metadata
function.description:
Set @key with @value as metadata in @klass.
Same as gst_device_provider_class_add_metadata(), but @value must be a static string or an inlined string, as it will not be copied. (GStreamer plugins will be made resident once loaded, so this function can be used even from dynamically loaded plugins.)

function.name: gst_device_provider_class_get_metadata
function.description: Get metadata with @key in @klass.
function.return: the metadata for @key.

function.name: gst_device_provider_class_set_metadata
function.description: Sets the detailed information for a #GstDeviceProviderClass. <note>This function is for use in _class_init functions only.</note>

parameter.name: longname
parameter.parameter_description: The long English name of the device provider. E.g. "File Sink"

parameter.name: classification
parameter.parameter_description: String describing the type of device provider, as an unordered list separated with slashes ('/'). See draft-klass.txt of the design docs for more details and common types. E.g: "Sink/File"

parameter.name: description
parameter.parameter_description: Sentence describing the purpose of the device provider. E.g: "Write stream to a file"

parameter.name: author
parameter.parameter_description: Name and contact details of the author(s). Use \n to separate multiple author metadata. E.g: "Joe Bloggs <joe.blogs at foo.com>"

function.name: gst_device_provider_class_set_static_metadata
function.description:
Sets the detailed information for a #GstDeviceProviderClass. <note>This function is for use in _class_init functions only.</note>
Same as gst_device_provider_class_set_metadata(), but @longname, @classification, @description, and @author must be static strings or inlined strings, as they will not be copied. (GStreamer plugins will be made resident once loaded, so this function can be used even from dynamically loaded plugins.)

parameter.name: longname
parameter.parameter_description: The long English name of the element. E.g. "File Sink"

parameter.name: classification
parameter.parameter_description: String describing the type of element, as an unordered list separated with slashes ('/'). See draft-klass.txt of the design docs for more details and common types. E.g: "Sink/File"

parameter.name: description
parameter.parameter_description: Sentence describing the purpose of the element. E.g: "Write stream to a file"

parameter.name: author
parameter.parameter_description: Name and contact details of the author(s). Use \n to separate multiple author metadata. E.g: "Joe Bloggs <joe.blogs at foo.com>"

function.name: gst_device_provider_device_add
function.description:
Posts a message on the provider's #GstBus to inform applications that a new device has been added.
This is for use by subclasses.

function.name: gst_device_provider_device_remove
function.description:
Posts a message on the provider's #GstBus to inform applications that a device has been removed.
This is for use by subclasses.

function.name: gst_device_provider_factory_find
function.description: Search for an device provider factory of the given name. Refs the returned device provider factory; caller is responsible for unreffing.
function.return: #GstDeviceProviderFactory if found, %NULL otherwise

function.name: gst_device_provider_factory_get
function.description: Returns the device provider of the type defined by the given device providerfactory.
function.return: the #GstDeviceProvider or %NULL if the device provider couldn't be created

function.name: gst_device_provider_factory_get_by_name
function.description: Returns the device provider of the type defined by the given device provider factory.
function.return: a #GstDeviceProvider or %NULL if unable to create device provider

function.name: gst_device_provider_factory_get_device_provider_type
function.description: Get the #GType for device providers managed by this factory. The type can only be retrieved if the device provider factory is loaded, which can be assured with gst_plugin_feature_load().
function.return: the #GType for device providers managed by this factory.

function.name: gst_device_provider_factory_get_metadata
function.description: Get the metadata on @factory with @key.
function.return: the metadata with @key on @factory or %NULL when there was no metadata with the given @key.

function.name: gst_device_provider_factory_get_metadata_keys
function.description: Get the available keys for the metadata on @factory.
function.return: a %NULL-terminated array of key strings, or %NULL when there is no metadata. Free with g_strfreev() when no longer needed.

function.name: gst_device_provider_factory_has_classes
function.description: Check if @factory matches all of the given @classes

parameter.name: classes
parameter.parameter_description: a "/" separate list of classes to match, only match if all classes are matched

function.return: %TRUE if @factory matches or if @classes is %NULL.

function.name: gst_device_provider_factory_has_classesv
function.description: Check if @factory matches all of the given classes

parameter.name: classes
parameter.parameter_description: a %NULL terminated array of classes to match, only match if all classes are matched

function.return: %TRUE if @factory matches.

function.name: gst_device_provider_factory_list_get_device_providers
function.description: Get a list of factories with a rank greater or equal to @minrank. The list of factories is returned by decreasing rank.
function.return: a #GList of #GstDeviceProviderFactory device providers. Use gst_plugin_feature_list_free() after usage.

function.name: gst_device_provider_get_bus
function.description: Gets the #GstBus of this #GstDeviceProvider
function.return: a #GstBus

function.name: gst_device_provider_get_devices
function.description: Gets a list of devices that this provider understands. This may actually probe the hardware if the provider is not currently started.
function.return: a #GList of #GstDevice

function.name: gst_device_provider_get_factory
function.description: Retrieves the factory that was used to create this device provider.

parameter.name: provider
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstDeviceProvider to request the device provider factory of.

function.return: the #GstDeviceProviderFactory used for creating this device provider. no refcounting is needed.

function.name: gst_device_provider_get_hidden_providers
function.description: Get the provider factory names of the #GstDeviceProvider instances that are hidden by @provider.
function.return: a list of hidden providers factory names or %NULL when nothing is hidden by @provider. Free with g_strfreev.

function.name: gst_device_provider_hide_provider
function.description:
Make @provider hide the devices from the factory with @name.
This function is used when @provider will also provide the devices reported by provider factory @name. A monitor should stop monitoring the device provider with @name to avoid duplicate devices.

function.name: gst_device_provider_register
function.description: Create a new device providerfactory capable of instantiating objects of the @type and add the factory to @plugin.

parameter.name: plugin
parameter.parameter_description: #GstPlugin to register the device provider with, or %NULL for a static device provider.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: name of device providers of this type

parameter.name: rank
parameter.parameter_description: rank of device provider (higher rank means more importance when autoplugging)

parameter.name: type
parameter.parameter_description: GType of device provider to register

function.return: %TRUE, if the registering succeeded, %FALSE on error

function.name: gst_device_provider_start
function.description:
Starts providering the devices. This will cause #GST_MESSAGE_DEVICE_ADDED and #GST_MESSAGE_DEVICE_REMOVED messages to be posted on the provider's bus when devices are added or removed from the system.
Since the #GstDeviceProvider is a singleton, gst_device_provider_start() may already have been called by another user of the object, gst_device_provider_stop() needs to be called the same number of times.
function.return: %TRUE if the device providering could be started

function.name: gst_device_provider_stop
function.description: Decreases the use-count by one. If the use count reaches zero, this #GstDeviceProvider will stop providering the devices. This needs to be called the same number of times that gst_device_provider_start() was called.

function.name: gst_device_provider_unhide_provider
function.description:
Make @provider unhide the devices from factory @name.
This function is used when @provider will no longer provide the devices reported by provider factory @name. A monitor should start monitoring the devices from provider factory @name in order to see all devices again.

function.name: gst_device_reconfigure_element
function.description:
Tries to reconfigure an existing element to use the device. If this function fails, then one must destroy the element and create a new one using gst_device_create_element().
Note: This should only be implemented for elements can change their device in the PLAYING state.
function.return: %TRUE if the element could be reconfigured to use this device, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_direct_control_binding_new
function.description: Create a new control-binding that attaches the #GstControlSource to the #GObject property.

parameter.name: property_name
parameter.parameter_description: the property-name to attach the control source

function.return: the new #GstDirectControlBinding

function.name: gst_direct_control_binding_new_absolute
function.description: Create a new control-binding that attaches the #GstControlSource to the #GObject property.

parameter.name: property_name
parameter.parameter_description: the property-name to attach the control source

function.return: the new #GstDirectControlBinding

function.name: gst_discoverer_audio_info_get_bitrate
function.return: the average or nominal bitrate of the stream in bits/second.

function.name: gst_discoverer_audio_info_get_channels
function.return: the number of channels in the stream.

function.name: gst_discoverer_audio_info_get_depth
function.return: the number of bits used per sample in each channel.

function.name: gst_discoverer_audio_info_get_language
function.return: the language of the stream, or NULL if unknown.

function.name: gst_discoverer_audio_info_get_max_bitrate
function.return: the maximum bitrate of the stream in bits/second.

function.name: gst_discoverer_audio_info_get_sample_rate
function.return: the sample rate of the stream in Hertz.

function.name: gst_discoverer_container_info_get_streams
function.return: the list of #GstDiscovererStreamInfo this container stream offers. Free with gst_discoverer_stream_info_list_free() after usage.

function.name: gst_discoverer_discover_uri
function.description:
Synchronously discovers the given @uri.
A copy of @uri will be made internally, so the caller can safely g_free() afterwards.

parameter.name: err
parameter.parameter_description: If an error occurred, this field will be filled in.

function.return: the result of the scanning. Can be %NULL if an error occurred.

function.name: gst_discoverer_discover_uri_async
function.description:
Appends the given @uri to the list of URIs to discoverer. The actual discovery of the @uri will only take place if gst_discoverer_start() has been called.
A copy of @uri will be made internally, so the caller can safely g_free() afterwards.
function.return: %TRUE if the @uri was successfully appended to the list of pending uris, else %FALSE

function.name: gst_discoverer_info_copy
function.return: A copy of the #GstDiscovererInfo

function.name: gst_discoverer_info_from_variant
function.description: Parses a #GVariant as produced by gst_discoverer_info_to_variant() back to a #GstDiscovererInfo.
function.return: A newly-allocated #GstDiscovererInfo.

function.name: gst_discoverer_info_get_audio_streams
function.description: Finds all the #GstDiscovererAudioInfo contained in @info
function.return: A #GList of matching #GstDiscovererStreamInfo. The caller should free it with gst_discoverer_stream_info_list_free().

function.name: gst_discoverer_info_get_container_streams
function.description: Finds all the #GstDiscovererContainerInfo contained in @info
function.return: A #GList of matching #GstDiscovererStreamInfo. The caller should free it with gst_discoverer_stream_info_list_free().

function.name: gst_discoverer_info_get_duration
function.return: the duration of the URI in #GstClockTime (nanoseconds).

function.name: gst_discoverer_info_get_misc
function.description: Deprecated: This functions is deprecated since version 1.4, use #gst_discoverer_info_get_missing_elements_installer_details
function.return: Miscellaneous information stored as a #GstStructure (for example: information about missing plugins). If you wish to use the #GstStructure after the life-time of @info, you will need to copy it.

function.name: gst_discoverer_info_get_missing_elements_installer_details
function.description: Get the installer details for missing elements

parameter.name: info
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstDiscovererStreamInfo to retrieve installer detail for the missing element

function.return: An array of strings containing informations about how to install the various missing elements for @info to be usable. If you wish to use the strings after the life-time of @info, you will need to copy them.

function.name: gst_discoverer_info_get_result
function.return: the result of the discovery as a #GstDiscovererResult.

function.name: gst_discoverer_info_get_seekable
function.return: the whether the URI is seekable.

function.name: gst_discoverer_info_get_stream_info
function.return: the structure (or topology) of the URI as a #GstDiscovererStreamInfo. This structure can be traversed to see the original hierarchy. Unref with gst_discoverer_stream_info_unref() after usage.

function.name: gst_discoverer_info_get_stream_list
function.return: the list of all streams contained in the #info. Free after usage with gst_discoverer_stream_info_list_free().

function.name: gst_discoverer_info_get_streams
function.description: Finds the #GstDiscovererStreamInfo contained in @info that match the given @streamtype.
function.return: A #GList of matching #GstDiscovererStreamInfo. The caller should free it with gst_discoverer_stream_info_list_free().

function.name: gst_discoverer_info_get_subtitle_streams
function.description: Finds all the #GstDiscovererSubtitleInfo contained in @info
function.return: A #GList of matching #GstDiscovererStreamInfo. The caller should free it with gst_discoverer_stream_info_list_free().

function.name: gst_discoverer_info_get_tags
function.return: all tags contained in the URI. If you wish to use the tags after the life-time of @info, you will need to copy them.

function.name: gst_discoverer_info_get_toc
function.return: TOC contained in the URI. If you wish to use the TOC after the life-time of @info, you will need to copy it.

function.name: gst_discoverer_info_get_uri
function.return: the URI to which this information corresponds to. Copy it if you wish to use it after the life-time of @info.

function.name: gst_discoverer_info_get_video_streams
function.description: Finds all the #GstDiscovererVideoInfo contained in @info
function.return: A #GList of matching #GstDiscovererStreamInfo. The caller should free it with gst_discoverer_stream_info_list_free().

function.name: gst_discoverer_info_ref
function.description: Increments the reference count of @info.
function.return: the same #GstDiscovererInfo object

function.name: gst_discoverer_info_to_variant
function.description:
Serializes @info to a #GVariant that can be parsed again through gst_discoverer_info_from_variant().
Note that any #GstToc (s) that might have been discovered will not be serialized for now.

parameter.name: flags
parameter.parameter_description: A combination of #GstDiscovererSerializeFlags to specify what needs to be serialized.

function.return: A newly-allocated #GVariant representing @info.

function.name: gst_discoverer_info_unref
function.description: Decrements the reference count of @info.

function.name: gst_discoverer_new
function.description: Creates a new #GstDiscoverer with the provided timeout.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.parameter_description: timeout per file, in nanoseconds. Allowed are values between one second (#GST_SECOND) and one hour (3600 * #GST_SECOND)

parameter.name: err
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to a #GError. can be %NULL

function.return: The new #GstDiscoverer. If an error occurred when creating the discoverer, @err will be set accordingly and %NULL will be returned. If @err is set, the caller must free it when no longer needed using g_error_free().

function.name: gst_discoverer_start
function.description: Allow asynchronous discovering of URIs to take place. A #GMainLoop must be available for #GstDiscoverer to properly work in asynchronous mode.

function.name: gst_discoverer_stop
function.description: Stop the discovery of any pending URIs and clears the list of pending URIS (if any).

function.name: gst_discoverer_stream_info_get_caps
function.return: the #GstCaps of the stream. Unref with #gst_caps_unref after usage.

function.name: gst_discoverer_stream_info_get_misc
function.description: Deprecated: This functions is deprecated since version 1.4, use #gst_discoverer_info_get_missing_elements_installer_details
function.return: additional information regarding the stream (for example codec version, profile, etc..). If you wish to use the #GstStructure after the life-time of @info you will need to copy it.

function.name: gst_discoverer_stream_info_get_next
function.return: the next #GstDiscovererStreamInfo in a chain. %NULL for final streams. Unref with #gst_discoverer_stream_info_unref after usage.

function.name: gst_discoverer_stream_info_get_previous
function.return: the previous #GstDiscovererStreamInfo in a chain. %NULL for starting points. Unref with #gst_discoverer_stream_info_unref after usage.

function.name: gst_discoverer_stream_info_get_stream_id
function.return: the stream ID of this stream. If you wish to use the stream ID after the life-time of @info you will need to copy it.

function.name: gst_discoverer_stream_info_get_stream_type_nick
function.return: a human readable name for the stream type of the given @info (ex : "audio", "container",...).

function.name: gst_discoverer_stream_info_get_tags
function.return: the tags contained in this stream. If you wish to use the tags after the life-time of @info you will need to copy them.

function.name: gst_discoverer_stream_info_get_toc
function.return: the TOC contained in this stream. If you wish to use the TOC after the life-time of @info you will need to copy it.

function.name: gst_discoverer_stream_info_list_free
function.description: Decrements the reference count of all contained #GstDiscovererStreamInfo and fress the #GList.

function.name: gst_discoverer_stream_info_ref
function.description: Increments the reference count of @info.
function.return: the same #GstDiscovererStreamInfo object

function.name: gst_discoverer_stream_info_unref
function.description: Decrements the reference count of @info.

function.name: gst_discoverer_subtitle_info_get_language
function.return: the language of the stream, or NULL if unknown.

function.name: gst_discoverer_video_info_get_bitrate
function.return: the average or nominal bitrate of the video stream in bits/second.

function.name: gst_discoverer_video_info_get_depth
function.return: the depth in bits of the video stream.

function.name: gst_discoverer_video_info_get_framerate_denom
function.return: the framerate of the video stream (denominator).

function.name: gst_discoverer_video_info_get_framerate_num
function.return: the framerate of the video stream (numerator).

function.name: gst_discoverer_video_info_get_height
function.return: the height of the video stream in pixels.

function.name: gst_discoverer_video_info_get_max_bitrate
function.return: the maximum bitrate of the video stream in bits/second.

function.name: gst_discoverer_video_info_get_par_denom
function.return: the Pixel Aspect Ratio (PAR) of the video stream (denominator).

function.name: gst_discoverer_video_info_get_par_num
function.return: the Pixel Aspect Ratio (PAR) of the video stream (numerator).

function.name: gst_discoverer_video_info_get_width
function.return: the width of the video stream in pixels.

function.name: gst_discoverer_video_info_is_image
function.return: #TRUE if the video stream corresponds to an image (i.e. only contains one frame).

function.name: gst_discoverer_video_info_is_interlaced
function.return: %TRUE if the stream is interlaced, else %FALSE.

function.name: gst_dmabuf_allocator_alloc
function.description: Return a %GstMemory that wraps a dmabuf file descriptor.

parameter.name: allocator
parameter.parameter_description: allocator to be used for this memory

function.return: a GstMemory based on @allocator. When the buffer will be released dmabuf allocator will close the @fd. The memory is only mmapped on gst_buffer_mmap() request.

function.name: gst_dmabuf_allocator_new
function.description: Return a new dmabuf allocator.
function.return: a new dmabuf allocator, or NULL if the allocator isn't available. Use gst_object_unref() to release the allocator after usage

function.name: gst_dmabuf_memory_get_fd
function.description: Return the file descriptor associated with @mem.

parameter.name: mem
parameter.parameter_description: the memory to get the file descriptor

function.return: the file descriptor associated with the memory, or -1. The file descriptor is still owned by the GstMemory. Use dup to take a copy if you intend to use it beyond the lifetime of this GstMemory.

function.name: gst_element_abort_state
function.description:
Abort the state change of the element. This function is used by elements that do asynchronous state changes and find out something is wrong.
This function should be called with the STATE_LOCK held.
MT safe.

parameter.name: element
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstElement to abort the state of.

function.name: gst_element_add_pad
function.description:
Adds a pad (link point) to @element. @pad's parent will be set to @element; see gst_object_set_parent() for refcounting information.
Pads are not automatically activated so elements should perform the needed steps to activate the pad in case this pad is added in the PAUSED or PLAYING state. See gst_pad_set_active() for more information about activating pads.
The pad and the element should be unlocked when calling this function.
This function will emit the #GstElement::pad-added signal on the element.

parameter.name: element
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstElement to add the pad to.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstPad to add to the element.

function.return:
%TRUE if the pad could be added. This function can fail when a pad with the same name already existed or the pad already had another parent.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_element_change_state
function.description:
Perform @transition on @element.
This function must be called with STATE_LOCK held and is mainly used internally.
function.return: the #GstStateChangeReturn of the state transition.

function.name: gst_element_class_add_metadata
function.description: Set @key with @value as metadata in @klass.

function.name: gst_element_class_add_pad_template
function.description: Adds a padtemplate to an element class. This is mainly used in the _class_init functions of classes. If a pad template with the same name as an already existing one is added the old one is replaced by the new one.

parameter.name: klass
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstElementClass to add the pad template to.

parameter.name: templ
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPadTemplate to add to the element class.

function.name: gst_element_class_add_static_metadata
function.description:
Set @key with @value as metadata in @klass.
Same as gst_element_class_add_metadata(), but @value must be a static string or an inlined string, as it will not be copied. (GStreamer plugins will be made resident once loaded, so this function can be used even from dynamically loaded plugins.)

function.name: gst_element_class_add_static_pad_template
function.description: Adds a pad template to an element class based on the static pad template @templ. This is mainly used in the _class_init functions of element implementations. If a pad template with the same name already exists, the old one is replaced by the new one.

parameter.name: klass
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstElementClass to add the pad template to.

parameter.name: static_templ
parameter.parameter_description: #GstStaticPadTemplate to add as pad template to the element class.

function.name: gst_element_class_get_metadata
function.description: Get metadata with @key in @klass.
function.return: the metadata for @key.

function.name: gst_element_class_get_pad_template
function.description: Retrieves a padtemplate from @element_class with the given name. <note>If you use this function in the #GInstanceInitFunc of an object class that has subclasses, make sure to pass the g_class parameter of the #GInstanceInitFunc here.</note>

parameter.name: element_class
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstElementClass to get the pad template of.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the #GstPadTemplate to get.

function.return: the #GstPadTemplate with the given name, or %NULL if none was found. No unreferencing is necessary.

function.name: gst_element_class_get_pad_template_list
function.description: Retrieves a list of the pad templates associated with @element_class. The list must not be modified by the calling code. <note>If you use this function in the #GInstanceInitFunc of an object class that has subclasses, make sure to pass the g_class parameter of the #GInstanceInitFunc here.</note>

parameter.name: element_class
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstElementClass to get pad templates of.

function.return: the #GList of pad templates.

function.name: gst_element_class_set_metadata
function.description: Sets the detailed information for a #GstElementClass. <note>This function is for use in _class_init functions only.</note>

parameter.name: longname
parameter.parameter_description: The long English name of the element. E.g. "File Sink"

parameter.name: classification
parameter.parameter_description: String describing the type of element, as an unordered list separated with slashes ('/'). See draft-klass.txt of the design docs for more details and common types. E.g: "Sink/File"

parameter.name: description
parameter.parameter_description: Sentence describing the purpose of the element. E.g: "Write stream to a file"

parameter.name: author
parameter.parameter_description: Name and contact details of the author(s). Use \n to separate multiple author metadata. E.g: "Joe Bloggs <joe.blogs at foo.com>"

function.name: gst_element_class_set_static_metadata
function.description:
Sets the detailed information for a #GstElementClass. <note>This function is for use in _class_init functions only.</note>
Same as gst_element_class_set_metadata(), but @longname, @classification, @description, and @author must be static strings or inlined strings, as they will not be copied. (GStreamer plugins will be made resident once loaded, so this function can be used even from dynamically loaded plugins.)

parameter.name: longname
parameter.parameter_description: The long English name of the element. E.g. "File Sink"

parameter.name: classification
parameter.parameter_description: String describing the type of element, as an unordered list separated with slashes ('/'). See draft-klass.txt of the design docs for more details and common types. E.g: "Sink/File"

parameter.name: description
parameter.parameter_description: Sentence describing the purpose of the element. E.g: "Write stream to a file"

parameter.name: author
parameter.parameter_description: Name and contact details of the author(s). Use \n to separate multiple author metadata. E.g: "Joe Bloggs <joe.blogs at foo.com>"

function.name: gst_element_continue_state
function.description:
Commit the state change of the element and proceed to the next pending state if any. This function is used by elements that do asynchronous state changes. The core will normally call this method automatically when an element returned %GST_STATE_CHANGE_SUCCESS from the state change function.
If after calling this method the element still has not reached the pending state, the next state change is performed.
This method is used internally and should normally not be called by plugins or applications.

parameter.name: element
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstElement to continue the state change of.

function.return:
The result of the commit state change.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_element_create_all_pads
function.description: Creates a pad for each pad template that is always available. This function is only useful during object initialization of subclasses of #GstElement.

function.name: gst_element_factory_can_sink_all_caps
function.description: Checks if the factory can sink all possible capabilities.
function.return: %TRUE if the caps are fully compatible.

function.name: gst_element_factory_can_sink_any_caps
function.description: Checks if the factory can sink any possible capability.
function.return: %TRUE if the caps have a common subset.

function.name: gst_element_factory_can_src_all_caps
function.description: Checks if the factory can src all possible capabilities.
function.return: %TRUE if the caps are fully compatible.

function.name: gst_element_factory_can_src_any_caps
function.description: Checks if the factory can src any possible capability.
function.return: %TRUE if the caps have a common subset.

function.name: gst_element_factory_create
function.description: Create a new element of the type defined by the given elementfactory. It will be given the name supplied, since all elements require a name as their first argument.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: name of new element, or %NULL to automatically create a unique name

function.return: new #GstElement or %NULL if the element couldn't be created

function.name: gst_element_factory_find
function.description: Search for an element factory of the given name. Refs the returned element factory; caller is responsible for unreffing.
function.return: #GstElementFactory if found, %NULL otherwise

function.name: gst_element_factory_get_element_type
function.description: Get the #GType for elements managed by this factory. The type can only be retrieved if the element factory is loaded, which can be assured with gst_plugin_feature_load().
function.return: the #GType for elements managed by this factory or 0 if the factory is not loaded.

function.name: gst_element_factory_get_metadata
function.description: Get the metadata on @factory with @key.
function.return: the metadata with @key on @factory or %NULL when there was no metadata with the given @key.

function.name: gst_element_factory_get_metadata_keys
function.description: Get the available keys for the metadata on @factory.
function.return: a %NULL-terminated array of key strings, or %NULL when there is no metadata. Free with g_strfreev() when no longer needed.

function.name: gst_element_factory_get_num_pad_templates
function.description: Gets the number of pad_templates in this factory.
function.return: the number of pad_templates

function.name: gst_element_factory_get_static_pad_templates
function.description: Gets the #GList of #GstStaticPadTemplate for this factory.
function.return: the static pad templates

function.name: gst_element_factory_get_uri_protocols
function.description: Gets a %NULL-terminated array of protocols this element supports or %NULL if no protocols are supported. You may not change the contents of the returned array, as it is still owned by the element factory. Use g_strdupv() to make a copy of the protocol string array if you need to.
function.return: the supported protocols or %NULL

function.name: gst_element_factory_get_uri_type
function.description: Gets the type of URIs the element supports or #GST_URI_UNKNOWN if none.
function.return: type of URIs this element supports

function.name: gst_element_factory_has_interface
function.description: Check if @factory implements the interface with name @interfacename.
function.return: %TRUE when @factory implement the interface.

function.name: gst_element_factory_list_filter
function.description:
Filter out all the elementfactories in @list that can handle @caps in the given direction.
If @subsetonly is %TRUE, then only the elements whose pads templates are a complete superset of @caps will be returned. Else any element whose pad templates caps can intersect with @caps will be returned.

parameter.name: subsetonly
parameter.parameter_description: whether to filter on caps subsets or not.

function.return: a #GList of #GstElementFactory elements that match the given requisites. Use #gst_plugin_feature_list_free after usage.

function.name: gst_element_factory_list_get_elements
function.description: Get a list of factories that match the given @type. Only elements with a rank greater or equal to @minrank will be returned. The list of factories is returned by decreasing rank.
function.return: a #GList of #GstElementFactory elements. Use gst_plugin_feature_list_free() after usage.

function.name: gst_element_factory_list_is_type
function.description: Check if @factory is of the given types.
function.return: %TRUE if @factory is of @type.

function.name: gst_element_factory_make
function.description: Create a new element of the type defined by the given element factory. If name is %NULL, then the element will receive a guaranteed unique name, consisting of the element factory name and a number. If name is given, it will be given the name supplied.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: name of new element, or %NULL to automatically create a unique name

function.return: new #GstElement or %NULL if unable to create element

function.name: gst_element_get_base_time
function.description: Returns the base time of the element. The base time is the absolute time of the clock when this element was last put to PLAYING. Subtracting the base time from the clock time gives the running time of the element.
function.return:
the base time of the element.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_element_get_bus
function.description: Returns the bus of the element. Note that only a #GstPipeline will provide a bus for the application.

parameter.name: element
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstElement to get the bus of.

function.return:
the element's #GstBus. unref after usage.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_element_get_clock
function.description:
Gets the currently configured clock of the element. This is the clock as was last set with gst_element_set_clock().
Elements in a pipeline will only have their clock set when the pipeline is in the PLAYING state.

parameter.name: element
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstElement to get the clock of.

function.return:
the #GstClock of the element. unref after usage.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_element_get_compatible_pad
function.description:
Looks for an unlinked pad to which the given pad can link. It is not guaranteed that linking the pads will work, though it should work in most cases.
This function will first attempt to find a compatible unlinked ALWAYS pad, and if none can be found, it will request a compatible REQUEST pad by looking at the templates of @element.

parameter.name: element
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstElement in which the pad should be found.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstPad to find a compatible one for.

parameter.name: caps
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstCaps to use as a filter.

function.return: the #GstPad to which a link can be made, or %NULL if one cannot be found. gst_object_unref() after usage.

function.name: gst_element_get_compatible_pad_template
function.description: Retrieves a pad template from @element that is compatible with @compattempl. Pads from compatible templates can be linked together.

parameter.name: element
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstElement to get a compatible pad template for

parameter.name: compattempl
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstPadTemplate to find a compatible template for

function.return: a compatible #GstPadTemplate, or %NULL if none was found. No unreferencing is necessary.

function.name: gst_element_get_context
function.description:
Gets the context with @context_type set on the element or NULL.
MT safe.

parameter.name: element
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstElement to get the context of.

parameter.name: context_type
parameter.parameter_description: a name of a context to retrieve

function.return: A #GstContext or NULL

function.name: gst_element_get_context_unlocked
function.description: Gets the context with @context_type set on the element or NULL.

parameter.name: element
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstElement to get the context of.

parameter.name: context_type
parameter.parameter_description: a name of a context to retrieve

function.return: A #GstContext or NULL

function.name: gst_element_get_contexts
function.description:
Gets the contexts set on the element.
MT safe.

parameter.name: element
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstElement to set the context of.

function.return: List of #GstContext

function.name: gst_element_get_factory
function.description: Retrieves the factory that was used to create this element.

parameter.name: element
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstElement to request the element factory of.

function.return: the #GstElementFactory used for creating this element. no refcounting is needed.

function.name: gst_element_get_index
function.description: Gets the index from the element.
function.return:
a #GstIndex or %NULL when no index was set on the element. unref after usage.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_element_get_name
function.description: Returns a copy of the name of @elem. Caller should g_free() the return value after usage. For a nameless element, this returns %NULL, which you can safely g_free() as well.

parameter.name: elem
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstElement to get the name of @elem.

function.return: the name of @elem. g_free() after usage. MT safe.

function.name: gst_element_get_pad_from_template
function.description: Gets a pad from @element described by @templ. If the presence of @templ is #GST_PAD_REQUEST, requests a new pad. Can return %NULL for #GST_PAD_SOMETIMES templates.
function.return: the #GstPad, or %NULL if one could not be found or created.

function.name: gst_element_get_parent
function.description: Get the parent of an element.

parameter.name: elem
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstElement to get the parent of.

function.return: the parent of an element.

function.name: gst_element_get_request_pad
function.description:
Retrieves a pad from the element by name (e.g. "src_\%d"). This version only retrieves request pads. The pad should be released with gst_element_release_request_pad().
This method is slower than manually getting the pad template and calling gst_element_request_pad() if the pads should have a specific name (e.g. @name is "src_1" instead of "src_\%u").

parameter.name: element
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstElement to find a request pad of.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the request #GstPad to retrieve.

function.return: requested #GstPad if found, otherwise %NULL. Release after usage.

function.name: gst_element_get_start_time
function.description:
Returns the start time of the element. The start time is the running time of the clock when this element was last put to PAUSED.
Usually the start_time is managed by a toplevel element such as #GstPipeline.
MT safe.
function.return: the start time of the element.

function.name: gst_element_get_state
function.description:
Gets the state of the element.
For elements that performed an ASYNC state change, as reported by gst_element_set_state(), this function will block up to the specified timeout value for the state change to complete. If the element completes the state change or goes into an error, this function returns immediately with a return value of %GST_STATE_CHANGE_SUCCESS or %GST_STATE_CHANGE_FAILURE respectively.
For elements that did not return %GST_STATE_CHANGE_ASYNC, this function returns the current and pending state immediately.
This function returns %GST_STATE_CHANGE_NO_PREROLL if the element successfully changed its state but is not able to provide data yet. This mostly happens for live sources that only produce data in %GST_STATE_PLAYING. While the state change return is equivalent to %GST_STATE_CHANGE_SUCCESS, it is returned to the application to signal that some sink elements might not be able to complete their state change because an element is not producing data to complete the preroll. When setting the element to playing, the preroll will complete and playback will start.

parameter.name: element
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstElement to get the state of.

parameter.name: state
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to #GstState to hold the state. Can be %NULL.

parameter.name: pending
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to #GstState to hold the pending state. Can be %NULL.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstClockTime to specify the timeout for an async state change or %GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE for infinite timeout.

function.return:
%GST_STATE_CHANGE_SUCCESS if the element has no more pending state and the last state change succeeded, %GST_STATE_CHANGE_ASYNC if the element is still performing a state change or %GST_STATE_CHANGE_FAILURE if the last state change failed.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_element_get_static_pad
function.description: Retrieves a pad from @element by name. This version only retrieves already-existing (i.e. 'static') pads.

parameter.name: element
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstElement to find a static pad of.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the static #GstPad to retrieve.

function.return:
the requested #GstPad if found, otherwise %NULL. unref after usage.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_element_is_locked_state
function.description:
Checks if the state of an element is locked. If the state of an element is locked, state changes of the parent don't affect the element. This way you can leave currently unused elements inside bins. Just lock their state before changing the state from #GST_STATE_NULL.
MT safe.
function.return: %TRUE, if the element's state is locked.

function.name: gst_element_iterate_pads
function.description:
Retrieves an iterator of @element's pads. The iterator should be freed after usage. Also more specialized iterators exists such as gst_element_iterate_src_pads() or gst_element_iterate_sink_pads().
The order of pads returned by the iterator will be the order in which the pads were added to the element.
function.return:
the #GstIterator of #GstPad.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_element_iterate_sink_pads
function.description:
Retrieves an iterator of @element's sink pads.
The order of pads returned by the iterator will be the order in which the pads were added to the element.
function.return:
the #GstIterator of #GstPad.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_element_iterate_src_pads
function.description:
Retrieves an iterator of @element's source pads.
The order of pads returned by the iterator will be the order in which the pads were added to the element.
function.return:
the #GstIterator of #GstPad.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_element_link
function.description:
Links @src to @dest. The link must be from source to destination; the other direction will not be tried. The function looks for existing pads that aren't linked yet. It will request new pads if necessary. Such pads need to be released manually when unlinking. If multiple links are possible, only one is established.
Make sure you have added your elements to a bin or pipeline with gst_bin_add() before trying to link them.
function.return: %TRUE if the elements could be linked, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_element_link_filtered
function.description:
Links @src to @dest using the given caps as filtercaps. The link must be from source to destination; the other direction will not be tried. The function looks for existing pads that aren't linked yet. It will request new pads if necessary. If multiple links are possible, only one is established.
Make sure you have added your elements to a bin or pipeline with gst_bin_add() before trying to link them.

parameter.name: filter
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstCaps to filter the link, or %NULL for no filter.

function.return: %TRUE if the pads could be linked, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_element_link_many
function.description: Chain together a series of elements. Uses gst_element_link(). Make sure you have added your elements to a bin or pipeline with gst_bin_add() before trying to link them.

parameter.name: element_1
parameter.parameter_description: the first #GstElement in the link chain.

parameter.name: element_2
parameter.parameter_description: the second #GstElement in the link chain.

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: the %NULL-terminated list of elements to link in order.

function.return: %TRUE on success, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_element_link_pads
function.description: Links the two named pads of the source and destination elements. Side effect is that if one of the pads has no parent, it becomes a child of the parent of the other element. If they have different parents, the link fails.

parameter.name: srcpadname
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the #GstPad in source element or %NULL for any pad.

parameter.name: destpadname
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the #GstPad in destination element, or %NULL for any pad.

function.return: %TRUE if the pads could be linked, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_element_link_pads_filtered
function.description: Links the two named pads of the source and destination elements. Side effect is that if one of the pads has no parent, it becomes a child of the parent of the other element. If they have different parents, the link fails. If @caps is not %NULL, makes sure that the caps of the link is a subset of @caps.

parameter.name: srcpadname
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the #GstPad in source element or %NULL for any pad.

parameter.name: destpadname
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the #GstPad in destination element or %NULL for any pad.

parameter.name: filter
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstCaps to filter the link, or %NULL for no filter.

function.return: %TRUE if the pads could be linked, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_element_link_pads_full
function.description:
Links the two named pads of the source and destination elements. Side effect is that if one of the pads has no parent, it becomes a child of the parent of the other element. If they have different parents, the link fails.
Calling gst_element_link_pads_full() with @flags == %GST_PAD_LINK_CHECK_DEFAULT is the same as calling gst_element_link_pads() and the recommended way of linking pads with safety checks applied.
This is a convenience function for gst_pad_link_full().

parameter.name: srcpadname
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the #GstPad in source element or %NULL for any pad.

parameter.name: destpadname
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the #GstPad in destination element, or %NULL for any pad.

parameter.name: flags
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstPadLinkCheck to be performed when linking pads.

function.return: %TRUE if the pads could be linked, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_element_lost_state
function.description:
Brings the element to the lost state. The current state of the element is copied to the pending state so that any call to gst_element_get_state() will return %GST_STATE_CHANGE_ASYNC.
An ASYNC_START message is posted. If the element was PLAYING, it will go to PAUSED. The element will be restored to its PLAYING state by the parent pipeline when it prerolls again.
This is mostly used for elements that lost their preroll buffer in the %GST_STATE_PAUSED or %GST_STATE_PLAYING state after a flush, they will go to their pending state again when a new preroll buffer is queued. This function can only be called when the element is currently not in error or an async state change.
This function is used internally and should normally not be called from plugins or applications.

parameter.name: element
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstElement the state is lost of

function.name: gst_element_make_from_uri
function.description: Creates an element for handling the given URI.

parameter.name: type
parameter.parameter_description: Whether to create a source or a sink

parameter.name: uri
parameter.parameter_description: URI to create an element for

parameter.name: elementname
parameter.parameter_description: Name of created element, can be %NULL.

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: address where to store error information, or %NULL.

function.return: a new element or %NULL if none could be created

function.name: gst_element_message_full

parameter.name: domain
parameter.parameter_description: the GStreamer GError domain this message belongs to

parameter.name: code
parameter.parameter_description: the GError code belonging to the domain

parameter.name: text
parameter.parameter_description: an allocated text string to be used as a replacement for the default message connected to code, or %NULL

parameter.name: debug
parameter.parameter_description: an allocated debug message to be used as a replacement for the default debugging information, or %NULL

parameter.name: file
parameter.parameter_description: the source code file where the error was generated

parameter.name: function
parameter.parameter_description: the source code function where the error was generated

parameter.name: line
parameter.parameter_description: the source code line where the error was generated

function.name: gst_element_no_more_pads
function.description:
Use this function to signal that the element does not expect any more pads to show up in the current pipeline. This function should be called whenever pads have been added by the element itself. Elements with #GST_PAD_SOMETIMES pad templates use this in combination with autopluggers to figure out that the element is done initializing its pads.
This function emits the #GstElement::no-more-pads signal.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_element_post_message
function.description: Post a message on the element's #GstBus. This function takes ownership of the message; if you want to access the message after this call, you should add an additional reference before calling.
function.return:
%TRUE if the message was successfully posted. The function returns %FALSE if the element did not have a bus.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_element_provide_clock
function.description: Get the clock provided by the given element. <note>An element is only required to provide a clock in the PAUSED state. Some elements can provide a clock in other states.</note>
function.return:
the GstClock provided by the element or %NULL if no clock could be provided. Unref after usage.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_element_query
function.description:
Performs a query on the given element.
For elements that don't implement a query handler, this function forwards the query to a random srcpad or to the peer of a random linked sinkpad of this element.
Please note that some queries might need a running pipeline to work.

parameter.name: element
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstElement to perform the query on.

function.return:
%TRUE if the query could be performed.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_element_query_convert
function.description: Queries an element to convert @src_val in @src_format to @dest_format.

parameter.name: element
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstElement to invoke the convert query on.

function.return: %TRUE if the query could be performed.

function.name: gst_element_query_duration
function.description:
Queries an element (usually top-level pipeline or playbin element) for the total stream duration in nanoseconds. This query will only work once the pipeline is prerolled (i.e. reached PAUSED or PLAYING state). The application will receive an ASYNC_DONE message on the pipeline bus when that is the case.
If the duration changes for some reason, you will get a DURATION_CHANGED message on the pipeline bus, in which case you should re-query the duration using this function.

parameter.name: element
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstElement to invoke the duration query on.

parameter.name: duration
parameter.parameter_description: A location in which to store the total duration, or %NULL.

function.return: %TRUE if the query could be performed.

function.name: gst_element_query_position
function.description:
Queries an element (usually top-level pipeline or playbin element) for the stream position in nanoseconds. This will be a value between 0 and the stream duration (if the stream duration is known). This query will usually only work once the pipeline is prerolled (i.e. reached PAUSED or PLAYING state). The application will receive an ASYNC_DONE message on the pipeline bus when that is the case.
If one repeatedly calls this function one can also create a query and reuse it in gst_element_query().

parameter.name: element
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstElement to invoke the position query on.

parameter.name: cur
parameter.parameter_description: a location in which to store the current position, or %NULL.
