function.return: %TRUE if the query could be performed.

function.name: gst_element_register
function.description: Create a new elementfactory capable of instantiating objects of the @type and add the factory to @plugin.

parameter.name: plugin
parameter.parameter_description: #GstPlugin to register the element with, or %NULL for a static element.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: name of elements of this type

parameter.name: rank
parameter.parameter_description: rank of element (higher rank means more importance when autoplugging)

function.return: %TRUE, if the registering succeeded, %FALSE on error

function.name: gst_element_release_request_pad
function.description:
Makes the element free the previously requested pad as obtained with gst_element_request_pad().
This does not unref the pad. If the pad was created by using gst_element_request_pad(), gst_element_release_request_pad() needs to be followed by gst_object_unref() to free the @pad.
MT safe.

parameter.name: element
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstElement to release the request pad of.

function.name: gst_element_remove_pad
function.description:
Removes @pad from @element. @pad will be destroyed if it has not been referenced elsewhere using gst_object_unparent().
This function is used by plugin developers and should not be used by applications. Pads that were dynamically requested from elements with gst_element_request_pad() should be released with the gst_element_release_request_pad() function instead.
Pads are not automatically deactivated so elements should perform the needed steps to deactivate the pad in case this pad is removed in the PAUSED or PLAYING state. See gst_pad_set_active() for more information about deactivating pads.
The pad and the element should be unlocked when calling this function.
This function will emit the #GstElement::pad-removed signal on the element.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstPad to remove from the element.

function.return:
%TRUE if the pad could be removed. Can return %FALSE if the pad does not belong to the provided element.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_element_request_pad
function.description:
Retrieves a request pad from the element according to the provided template. Pad templates can be looked up using gst_element_factory_get_static_pad_templates().
The pad should be released with gst_element_release_request_pad().

parameter.name: element
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstElement to find a request pad of.

parameter.name: templ
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPadTemplate of which we want a pad of.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the request #GstPad to retrieve. Can be %NULL.

parameter.name: caps
parameter.parameter_description: the caps of the pad we want to request. Can be %NULL.

function.return: requested #GstPad if found, otherwise %NULL. Release after usage.

function.name: gst_element_seek
function.description:
Sends a seek event to an element. See gst_event_new_seek() for the details of the parameters. The seek event is sent to the element using gst_element_send_event().
MT safe.

parameter.name: element
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstElement to send the event to.

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: The format of the seek values

parameter.name: start_type
parameter.parameter_description: The type and flags for the new start position

parameter.name: start
parameter.parameter_description: The value of the new start position

parameter.name: stop_type
parameter.parameter_description: The type and flags for the new stop position

parameter.name: stop
parameter.parameter_description: The value of the new stop position

function.return: %TRUE if the event was handled. Flushing seeks will trigger a preroll, which will emit %GST_MESSAGE_ASYNC_DONE.

function.name: gst_element_seek_simple
function.description:
Simple API to perform a seek on the given element, meaning it just seeks to the given position relative to the start of the stream. For more complex operations like segment seeks (e.g. for looping) or changing the playback rate or seeking relative to the last configured playback segment you should use gst_element_seek().
In a completely prerolled PAUSED or PLAYING pipeline, seeking is always guaranteed to return %TRUE on a seekable media type or %FALSE when the media type is certainly not seekable (such as a live stream).
Some elements allow for seeking in the READY state, in this case they will store the seek event and execute it when they are put to PAUSED. If the element supports seek in READY, it will always return %TRUE when it receives the event in the READY state.

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstFormat to execute the seek in, such as #GST_FORMAT_TIME

parameter.name: seek_flags
parameter.parameter_description: seek options; playback applications will usually want to use GST_SEEK_FLAG_FLUSH | GST_SEEK_FLAG_KEY_UNIT here

parameter.name: seek_pos
parameter.parameter_description: position to seek to (relative to the start); if you are doing a seek in #GST_FORMAT_TIME this value is in nanoseconds - multiply with #GST_SECOND to convert seconds to nanoseconds or with #GST_MSECOND to convert milliseconds to nanoseconds.

function.return: %TRUE if the seek operation succeeded. Flushing seeks will trigger a preroll, which will emit %GST_MESSAGE_ASYNC_DONE.

function.name: gst_element_send_event
function.description:
Sends an event to an element. If the element doesn't implement an event handler, the event will be pushed on a random linked sink pad for downstream events or a random linked source pad for upstream events.
This function takes ownership of the provided event so you should gst_event_ref() it if you want to reuse the event after this call.
MT safe.

parameter.name: element
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstElement to send the event to.

parameter.name: event
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstEvent to send to the element.

function.return: %TRUE if the event was handled. Events that trigger a preroll (such as flushing seeks and steps) will emit %GST_MESSAGE_ASYNC_DONE.

function.name: gst_element_set_base_time
function.description:
Set the base time of an element. See gst_element_get_base_time().
MT safe.

function.name: gst_element_set_bus
function.description:
Sets the bus of the element. Increases the refcount on the bus. For internal use only, unless you're testing elements.
MT safe.

parameter.name: element
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstElement to set the bus of.

function.name: gst_element_set_clock
function.description: Sets the clock for the element. This function increases the refcount on the clock. Any previously set clock on the object is unreffed.

parameter.name: element
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstElement to set the clock for.

parameter.name: clock
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstClock to set for the element.

function.return:
%TRUE if the element accepted the clock. An element can refuse a clock when it, for example, is not able to slave its internal clock to the @clock or when it requires a specific clock to operate.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_element_set_context
function.description:
Sets the context of the element. Increases the refcount of the context.
MT safe.

parameter.name: element
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstElement to set the context of.

function.name: gst_element_set_index
function.description:
Set @index on the element. The refcount of the index will be increased, any previously set index is unreffed.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_element_set_locked_state
function.description:
Locks the state of an element, so state changes of the parent don't affect this element anymore.
MT safe.
function.return: %TRUE if the state was changed, %FALSE if bad parameters were given or the elements state-locking needed no change.

function.name: gst_element_set_name
function.description: Sets the name of the element, getting rid of the old name if there was one.

parameter.name: elem
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstElement to set the name of.

function.name: gst_element_set_parent
function.description: Sets the parent of an element.

parameter.name: elem
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstElement to set the parent of.

parameter.name: parent
parameter.parameter_description: the new parent #GstObject of the element.

function.name: gst_element_set_start_time
function.description:
Set the start time of an element. The start time of the element is the running time of the element when it last went to the PAUSED state. In READY or after a flushing seek, it is set to 0.
Toplevel elements like #GstPipeline will manage the start_time and base_time on its children. Setting the start_time to #GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE on such a toplevel element will disable the distribution of the base_time to the children and can be useful if the application manages the base_time itself, for example if you want to synchronize capture from multiple pipelines, and you can also ensure that the pipelines have the same clock.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_element_set_state
function.description:
Sets the state of the element. This function will try to set the requested state by going through all the intermediary states and calling the class's state change function for each.
This function can return #GST_STATE_CHANGE_ASYNC, in which case the element will perform the remainder of the state change asynchronously in another thread. An application can use gst_element_get_state() to wait for the completion of the state change or it can wait for a %GST_MESSAGE_ASYNC_DONE or %GST_MESSAGE_STATE_CHANGED on the bus.
State changes to %GST_STATE_READY or %GST_STATE_NULL never return #GST_STATE_CHANGE_ASYNC.
function.return:
Result of the state change using #GstStateChangeReturn.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_element_state_change_return_get_name
function.description: Gets a string representing the given state change result.

parameter.name: state_ret
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstStateChangeReturn to get the name of.

function.return: a string with the name of the state result.

function.name: gst_element_state_get_name
function.description: Gets a string representing the given state.

parameter.name: state
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstState to get the name of.

function.return: a string with the name of the state.

function.name: gst_element_sync_state_with_parent
function.description: Tries to change the state of the element to the same as its parent. If this function returns %FALSE, the state of element is undefined.
function.return:
%TRUE, if the element's state could be synced to the parent's state.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_element_unlink
function.description:
Unlinks all source pads of the source element with all sink pads of the sink element to which they are linked.
If the link has been made using gst_element_link(), it could have created an requestpad, which has to be released using gst_element_release_request_pad().

function.name: gst_element_unlink_many
function.description: Unlinks a series of elements. Uses gst_element_unlink().

parameter.name: element_1
parameter.parameter_description: the first #GstElement in the link chain.

parameter.name: element_2
parameter.parameter_description: the second #GstElement in the link chain.

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: the %NULL-terminated list of elements to unlink in order.

function.name: gst_element_unlink_pads
function.description:
Unlinks the two named pads of the source and destination elements.
This is a convenience function for gst_pad_unlink().

parameter.name: src
parameter.parameter_description: a (transfer none): #GstElement containing the source pad.

parameter.name: srcpadname
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the #GstPad in source element.

parameter.name: destpadname
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the #GstPad in destination element.

function.name: gst_encoding_audio_profile_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GstEncodingAudioProfile
All provided allocatable arguments will be internally copied, so can be safely freed/unreferenced after calling this method.

parameter.name: preset
parameter.parameter_description: the preset(s) to use on the encoder, can be #NULL

parameter.name: restriction
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstCaps used to restrict the input to the encoder, can be NULL. See gst_encoding_profile_get_restriction() for more details.

parameter.name: presence
parameter.parameter_description: the number of time this stream must be used. 0 means any number of times (including never)

function.return: the newly created #GstEncodingAudioProfile.

function.name: gst_encoding_container_profile_add_profile
function.description:
Add a #GstEncodingProfile to the list of profiles handled by @container.
No copy of @profile will be made, if you wish to use it elsewhere after this method you should increment its reference count.
function.return: %TRUE if the @stream was properly added, else %FALSE.

function.name: gst_encoding_container_profile_contains_profile
function.description: Checks if @container contains a #GstEncodingProfile identical to @profile.
function.return: %TRUE if @container contains a #GstEncodingProfile identical to @profile, else %FALSE.

function.name: gst_encoding_container_profile_get_profiles
function.return: the list of contained #GstEncodingProfile.

function.name: gst_encoding_container_profile_new
function.description: Creates a new #GstEncodingContainerProfile.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: The name of the container profile, can be %NULL

parameter.name: description
parameter.parameter_description: The description of the container profile, can be %NULL

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: The format to use for this profile

parameter.name: preset
parameter.parameter_description: The preset to use for this profile.

function.return: The newly created #GstEncodingContainerProfile.

function.name: gst_encoding_list_all_targets
function.description: List all available #GstEncodingTarget for the specified category, or all categories if @categoryname is %NULL.

parameter.name: categoryname
parameter.parameter_description: The category, for ex: #GST_ENCODING_CATEGORY_DEVICE. Can be %NULL.

function.return: The list of #GstEncodingTarget

function.name: gst_encoding_list_available_categories
function.description: Lists all #GstEncodingTarget categories present on disk.
function.return: A list of #GstEncodingTarget categories.

function.name: gst_encoding_profile_find
function.description: Find the #GstEncodingProfile with the specified name and category.

parameter.name: profilename
parameter.parameter_description: The name of the profile, if %NULL provided, it will default to the encoding profile called `default`.

function.return: The matching #GstEncodingProfile or %NULL.

function.name: gst_encoding_profile_from_discoverer
function.description: Creates a #GstEncodingProfile matching the formats from the given #GstDiscovererInfo. Streams other than audio or video (eg, subtitles), are currently ignored.
function.return: The new #GstEncodingProfile or %NULL.

function.name: gst_encoding_profile_get_allow_dynamic_output
function.description: Get whether the format that has been negotiated in at some point can be renegotiated later during the encoding.

function.name: gst_encoding_profile_get_description
function.return: the description of the profile, can be %NULL.

function.name: gst_encoding_profile_get_enabled
function.return: Whther @profile is enabled or not

function.name: gst_encoding_profile_get_file_extension
function.return: a suitable file extension for @profile, or NULL.

function.name: gst_encoding_profile_get_format
function.return: the #GstCaps corresponding to the media format used in the profile. Unref after usage.

function.name: gst_encoding_profile_get_input_caps
function.description: Computes the full output caps that this @profile will be able to consume.
function.return: The full caps the given @profile can consume. Call gst_caps_unref() when you are done with the caps.

function.name: gst_encoding_profile_get_name
function.return: the name of the profile, can be %NULL.

function.name: gst_encoding_profile_get_presence
function.return: The number of times the profile is used in its parent container profile. If 0, it is not a mandatory stream.

function.name: gst_encoding_profile_get_preset
function.return: the name of the #GstPreset to be used in the profile. This is the name that has been set when saving the preset.

function.name: gst_encoding_profile_get_preset_name
function.return: the name of the #GstPreset factory to be used in the profile.

function.name: gst_encoding_profile_get_restriction
function.return: The restriction #GstCaps to apply before the encoder that will be used in the profile. The fields present in restriction caps are properties of the raw stream (that is before encoding), such as height and width for video and depth and sampling rate for audio. Does not apply to #GstEncodingContainerProfile (since there is no corresponding raw stream). Can be %NULL. Unref after usage.

function.name: gst_encoding_profile_get_type_nick
function.return: the human-readable name of the type of @profile.

function.name: gst_encoding_profile_is_equal
function.description: Checks whether the two #GstEncodingProfile are equal
function.return: %TRUE if @a and @b are equal, else %FALSE.

function.name: gst_encoding_profile_ref
function.description: Increases the reference count of the @profile.

function.name: gst_encoding_profile_set_allow_dynamic_output
function.description: Sets whether the format that has been negotiated in at some point can be renegotiated later during the encoding.

parameter.name: allow_dynamic_output
parameter.parameter_description: Whether the format that has been negotiated first can be renegotiated during the encoding

function.name: gst_encoding_profile_set_description
function.description: Set @description as the given description for the @profile. A copy of @description will be made internally.

parameter.name: description
parameter.parameter_description: the description to set on the profile

function.name: gst_encoding_profile_set_enabled
function.description: Set whether the profile should be used or not.

function.name: gst_encoding_profile_set_format
function.description: Sets the media format used in the profile.

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: the media format to use in the profile.

function.name: gst_encoding_profile_set_name
function.description: Set @name as the given name for the @profile. A copy of @name will be made internally.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name to set on the profile

function.name: gst_encoding_profile_set_presence
function.description: Set the number of time the profile is used in its parent container profile. If 0, it is not a mandatory stream

parameter.name: presence
parameter.parameter_description: the number of time the profile can be used

function.name: gst_encoding_profile_set_preset
function.description: Sets the name of the #GstElement that implements the #GstPreset interface to use for the profile. This is the name that has been set when saving the preset.

function.name: gst_encoding_profile_set_preset_name
function.description: Sets the name of the #GstPreset's factory to be used in the profile.

parameter.name: preset_name
parameter.parameter_description: The name of the preset to use in this @profile.

function.name: gst_encoding_profile_set_restriction
function.description: Set the restriction #GstCaps to apply before the encoder that will be used in the profile. See gst_encoding_profile_get_restriction() for more about restrictions. Does not apply to #GstEncodingContainerProfile.

function.name: gst_encoding_profile_unref
function.description: Decreases the reference count of the @profile, possibly freeing the @profile.

function.name: gst_encoding_target_add_profile
function.description:
Adds the given @profile to the @target. Each added profile must have a unique name within the profile.
The @target will steal a reference to the @profile. If you wish to use the profile after calling this method, you should increase its reference count.

parameter.name: target
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstEncodingTarget to add a profile to

function.return: %TRUE if the profile was added, else %FALSE.

function.name: gst_encoding_target_get_category
function.return: The category of the @target. For example: #GST_ENCODING_CATEGORY_DEVICE.

function.name: gst_encoding_target_get_description
function.return: The description of the @target.

function.name: gst_encoding_target_get_name
function.return: The name of the @target.

function.name: gst_encoding_target_get_profile

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the profile to retrieve

function.return: The matching #GstEncodingProfile, or %NULL.

function.name: gst_encoding_target_get_profiles
function.return: A list of #GstEncodingProfile(s) this @target handles.

function.name: gst_encoding_target_load
function.description:
Searches for the #GstEncodingTarget with the given name, loads it and returns it.
If the category name is specified only targets from that category will be searched for.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the #GstEncodingTarget to load.

parameter.name: category
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the target category, like #GST_ENCODING_CATEGORY_DEVICE. Can be %NULL

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: If an error occured, this field will be filled in.

function.return: The #GstEncodingTarget if available, else %NULL.

function.name: gst_encoding_target_load_from_file
function.description: Opens the provided file and returns the contained #GstEncodingTarget.

parameter.name: filepath
parameter.parameter_description: The file location to load the #GstEncodingTarget from

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: If an error occured, this field will be filled in.

function.return: The #GstEncodingTarget contained in the file, else %NULL

function.name: gst_encoding_target_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GstEncodingTarget.
The name and category can only consist of lowercase ASCII letters for the first character, followed by either lowercase ASCII letters, digits or hyphens ('-').
The @category <emphasis>should</emphasis> be one of the existing well-defined categories, like #GST_ENCODING_CATEGORY_DEVICE, but it <emphasis>can</emphasis> be a application or user specific category if needed.

parameter.name: category
parameter.parameter_description: The name of the category to which this @target belongs. For example: #GST_ENCODING_CATEGORY_DEVICE.

parameter.name: description
parameter.parameter_description: A description of #GstEncodingTarget in the current locale.

function.return: The newly created #GstEncodingTarget or %NULL if there was an error.

function.name: gst_encoding_target_ref
function.description: Increases the reference count of the @target.

function.name: gst_encoding_target_save
function.description: Saves the @target to a default user-local directory.

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: If an error occured, this field will be filled in.

function.return: %TRUE if the target was correctly saved, else %FALSE.

function.name: gst_encoding_target_save_to_file
function.description: Saves the @target to the provided file location.

parameter.name: filepath
parameter.parameter_description: the location to store the @target at.

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: If an error occured, this field will be filled in.

function.return: %TRUE if the target was correctly saved, else %FALSE.

function.name: gst_encoding_target_unref
function.description: Decreases the reference count of the @target, possibly freeing it.

function.name: gst_encoding_video_profile_get_pass
function.description: Get the pass number if this is part of a multi-pass profile.
function.return: The pass number. Starts at 1 for multi-pass. 0 if this is not a multi-pass profile

function.name: gst_encoding_video_profile_get_variableframerate
function.return: Whether non-constant video framerate is allowed for encoding.

function.name: gst_encoding_video_profile_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GstEncodingVideoProfile
All provided allocatable arguments will be internally copied, so can be safely freed/unreferenced after calling this method.
If you wish to control the pass number (in case of multi-pass scenarios), please refer to the gst_encoding_video_profile_set_pass() documentation.
If you wish to use/force a constant framerate please refer to the gst_encoding_video_profile_set_variableframerate() documentation.

parameter.name: preset
parameter.parameter_description: the preset(s) to use on the encoder, can be #NULL

parameter.name: restriction
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstCaps used to restrict the input to the encoder, can be NULL. See gst_encoding_profile_get_restriction() for more details.

parameter.name: presence
parameter.parameter_description: the number of time this stream must be used. 0 means any number of times (including never)

function.return: the newly created #GstEncodingVideoProfile.

function.name: gst_encoding_video_profile_set_pass
function.description: Sets the pass number of this video profile. The first pass profile should have this value set to 1. If this video profile isn't part of a multi-pass profile, you may set it to 0 (the default value).

parameter.name: pass
parameter.parameter_description: the pass number for this profile

function.name: gst_encoding_video_profile_set_variableframerate
function.description: If set to %TRUE, then the incoming stream will be allowed to have non-constant framerate. If set to %FALSE (default value), then the incoming stream will be normalized by dropping/duplicating frames in order to produce a constance framerate.

function.name: gst_error_get_message
function.description: Get a string describing the error message in the current locale.

parameter.name: domain
parameter.parameter_description: the GStreamer error domain this error belongs to.

parameter.name: code
parameter.parameter_description: the error code belonging to the domain.

function.return: a newly allocated string describing the error message (in UTF-8 encoding)

function.name: gst_event_copy
function.description: Copy the event using the event specific copy function.
function.return: the new event

function.name: gst_event_copy_segment
function.description: Parses a segment @event and copies the #GstSegment into the location given by @segment.

function.name: gst_event_get_running_time_offset
function.description:
Retrieve the accumulated running time offset of the event.
Events passing through #GstPads that have a running time offset set via gst_pad_set_offset() will get their offset adjusted according to the pad's offset.
If the event contains any information that related to the running time, this information will need to be updated before usage with this offset.
function.return:
The event's running time offset
MT safe.

function.name: gst_event_get_seqnum
function.description:
Retrieve the sequence number of a event.
Events have ever-incrementing sequence numbers, which may also be set explicitly via gst_event_set_seqnum(). Sequence numbers are typically used to indicate that a event corresponds to some other set of events or messages, for example an EOS event corresponding to a SEEK event. It is considered good practice to make this correspondence when possible, though it is not required.
Note that events and messages share the same sequence number incrementor; two events or messages will never have the same sequence number unless that correspondence was made explicitly.
function.return:
The event's sequence number.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_event_get_structure
function.description: Access the structure of the event.
function.return:
The structure of the event. The structure is still owned by the event, which means that you should not free it and that the pointer becomes invalid when you free the event.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_event_has_name
function.description: Checks if @event has the given @name. This function is usually used to check the name of a custom event.
function.return: %TRUE if @name matches the name of the event structure.

function.name: gst_event_is_writable
function.description: Tests if you can safely write data into a event's structure or validly modify the seqnum and timestamp field.

function.name: gst_event_make_writable
function.description: Makes a writable event from the given event. If the source event is already writable, this will simply return the same event. A copy will otherwise be made using gst_event_copy().
function.return: a writable event which may or may not be the same as @ev

function.name: gst_event_new_buffer_size
function.description:
Create a new buffersize event. The event is sent downstream and notifies elements that they should provide a buffer of the specified dimensions.
When the @async flag is set, a thread boundary is preferred.
function.return: a new #GstEvent

function.name: gst_event_new_caps
function.description: Create a new CAPS event for @caps. The caps event can only travel downstream synchronized with the buffer flow and contains the format of the buffers that will follow after the event.
function.return: the new CAPS event.

function.name: gst_event_new_custom
function.description:
Create a new custom-typed event. This can be used for anything not handled by other event-specific functions to pass an event to another element.
Make sure to allocate an event type with the #GST_EVENT_MAKE_TYPE macro, assigning a free number and filling in the correct direction and serialization flags.
New custom events can also be created by subclassing the event type if needed.

parameter.name: type
parameter.parameter_description: The type of the new event

parameter.name: structure
parameter.parameter_description: the structure for the event. The event will take ownership of the structure.

function.return: the new custom event.

function.name: gst_event_new_eos
function.description:
Create a new EOS event. The eos event can only travel downstream synchronized with the buffer flow. Elements that receive the EOS event on a pad can return #GST_FLOW_EOS as a #GstFlowReturn when data after the EOS event arrives.
The EOS event will travel down to the sink elements in the pipeline which will then post the #GST_MESSAGE_EOS on the bus after they have finished playing any buffered data.
When all sinks have posted an EOS message, an EOS message is forwarded to the application.
The EOS event itself will not cause any state transitions of the pipeline.
function.return: the new EOS event.

function.name: gst_event_new_flush_start
function.description:
Allocate a new flush start event. The flush start event can be sent upstream and downstream and travels out-of-bounds with the dataflow.
It marks pads as being flushing and will make them return #GST_FLOW_FLUSHING when used for data flow with gst_pad_push(), gst_pad_chain(), gst_pad_get_range() and gst_pad_pull_range(). Any event (except a #GST_EVENT_FLUSH_STOP) received on a flushing pad will return %FALSE immediately.
Elements should unlock any blocking functions and exit their streaming functions as fast as possible when this event is received.
This event is typically generated after a seek to flush out all queued data in the pipeline so that the new media is played as soon as possible.
function.return: a new flush start event.

function.name: gst_event_new_flush_stop
function.description:
Allocate a new flush stop event. The flush stop event can be sent upstream and downstream and travels serialized with the dataflow. It is typically sent after sending a FLUSH_START event to make the pads accept data again.
Elements can process this event synchronized with the dataflow since the preceding FLUSH_START event stopped the dataflow.
This event is typically generated to complete a seek and to resume dataflow.
function.return: a new flush stop event.

function.name: gst_event_new_gap
function.description: Create a new GAP event. A gap event can be thought of as conceptually equivalent to a buffer to signal that there is no data for a certain amount of time. This is useful to signal a gap to downstream elements which may wait for data, such as muxers or mixers or overlays, especially for sparse streams such as subtitle streams.

parameter.name: timestamp
parameter.parameter_description: the start time (pts) of the gap

function.return: the new GAP event.

function.name: gst_event_new_latency
function.description:
Create a new latency event. The event is sent upstream from the sinks and notifies elements that they should add an additional @latency to the running time before synchronising against the clock.
The latency is mostly used in live sinks and is always expressed in the time format.
function.return: a new #GstEvent

function.name: gst_event_new_navigation
function.description: Create a new navigation event from the given description.

parameter.name: structure
parameter.parameter_description: description of the event. The event will take ownership of the structure.

function.return: a new #GstEvent

function.name: gst_event_new_protection
function.description:
Creates a new event containing information specific to a particular protection system (uniquely identified by @system_id), by which that protection system can acquire key(s) to decrypt a protected stream.
In order for a decryption element to decrypt media protected using a specific system, it first needs all the protection system specific information necessary to acquire the decryption key(s) for that stream. The functions defined here enable this information to be passed in events from elements that extract it (e.g., ISOBMFF demuxers, MPEG DASH demuxers) to protection decrypter elements that use it.
Events containing protection system specific information are created using #gst_event_new_protection, and they can be parsed by downstream elements using #gst_event_parse_protection.
In Common Encryption, protection system specific information may be located within ISOBMFF files, both in movie (moov) boxes and movie fragment (moof) boxes; it may also be contained in ContentProtection elements within MPEG DASH MPDs. The events created by #gst_event_new_protection contain data identifying from which of these locations the encapsulated protection system specific information originated. This origin information is required as some protection systems use different encodings depending upon where the information originates.
The events returned by gst_event_new_protection() are implemented in such a way as to ensure that the most recently-pushed protection info event of a particular @origin and @system_id will be stuck to the output pad of the sending element.

parameter.name: system_id
parameter.parameter_description: a string holding a UUID that uniquely identifies a protection system.

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstBuffer holding protection system specific information. The reference count of the buffer will be incremented by one.

parameter.name: origin
parameter.parameter_description: a string indicating where the protection information carried in the event was extracted from. The allowed values of this string will depend upon the protection scheme.

function.return: a #GST_EVENT_PROTECTION event, if successful; %NULL if unsuccessful.

function.name: gst_event_new_qos

parameter.name: proportion
parameter.parameter_description: the proportion of the qos message

parameter.name: diff
parameter.parameter_description: The time difference of the last Clock sync

function.return: a new QOS event.

function.name: gst_event_new_reconfigure
function.description: Create a new reconfigure event. The purpose of the reconfigure event is to travel upstream and make elements renegotiate their caps or reconfigure their buffer pools. This is useful when changing properties on elements or changing the topology of the pipeline.
function.return: a new #GstEvent

function.name: gst_event_new_seek
function.description:
Allocate a new seek event with the given parameters.
The seek event configures playback of the pipeline between @start to @stop at the speed given in @rate, also called a playback segment. The @start and @stop values are expressed in @format.
A @rate of 1.0 means normal playback rate, 2.0 means double speed. Negatives values means backwards playback. A value of 0.0 for the rate is not allowed and should be accomplished instead by PAUSING the pipeline.
A pipeline has a default playback segment configured with a start position of 0, a stop position of -1 and a rate of 1.0. The currently configured playback segment can be queried with #GST_QUERY_SEGMENT.
@start_type and @stop_type specify how to adjust the currently configured start and stop fields in playback segment. Adjustments can be made relative or absolute to the last configured values. A type of #GST_SEEK_TYPE_NONE means that the position should not be updated.
When the rate is positive and @start has been updated, playback will start from the newly configured start position.
For negative rates, playback will start from the newly configured stop position (if any). If the stop position is updated, it must be different from -1 (#GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE) for negative rates.
It is not possible to seek relative to the current playback position, to do this, PAUSE the pipeline, query the current playback position with #GST_QUERY_POSITION and update the playback segment current position with a #GST_SEEK_TYPE_SET to the desired position.

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: The format of the seek values

parameter.name: start_type
parameter.parameter_description: The type and flags for the new start position

parameter.name: start
parameter.parameter_description: The value of the new start position

parameter.name: stop_type
parameter.parameter_description: The type and flags for the new stop position

parameter.name: stop
parameter.parameter_description: The value of the new stop position

function.return: a new seek event.

function.name: gst_event_new_segment
function.description:
Create a new SEGMENT event for @segment. The segment event can only travel downstream synchronized with the buffer flow and contains timing information and playback properties for the buffers that will follow.
The segment event marks the range of buffers to be processed. All data not within the segment range is not to be processed. This can be used intelligently by plugins to apply more efficient methods of skipping unneeded data. The valid range is expressed with the @start and @stop values.
The time value of the segment is used in conjunction with the start value to convert the buffer timestamps into the stream time. This is usually done in sinks to report the current stream_time. @time represents the stream_time of a buffer carrying a timestamp of @start. @time cannot be -1.
@start cannot be -1, @stop can be -1. If there is a valid @stop given, it must be greater or equal the @start, including when the indicated playback @rate is < 0.
The @applied_rate value provides information about any rate adjustment that has already been made to the timestamps and content on the buffers of the stream. (@rate * @applied_rate) should always equal the rate that has been requested for playback. For example, if an element has an input segment with intended playback @rate of 2.0 and applied_rate of 1.0, it can adjust incoming timestamps and buffer content by half and output a segment event with @rate of 1.0 and @applied_rate of 2.0
After a segment event, the buffer stream time is calculated with:
time + (TIMESTAMP(buf) - start) * ABS (rate * applied_rate)
function.return: the new SEGMENT event.

function.name: gst_event_new_segment_done
function.description: Create a new segment-done event. This event is sent by elements that finish playback of a segment as a result of a segment seek.

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: The format of the position being done

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: The position of the segment being done

function.return: a new #GstEvent

function.name: gst_event_new_sink_message
function.description:
Create a new sink-message event. The purpose of the sink-message event is to instruct a sink to post the message contained in the event synchronized with the stream.
@name is used to store multiple sticky events on one pad.
function.return: a new #GstEvent

function.name: gst_event_new_step
function.description:
Create a new step event. The purpose of the step event is to instruct a sink to skip @amount (expressed in @format) of media. It can be used to implement stepping through the video frame by frame or for doing fast trick modes.
A rate of <= 0.0 is not allowed. Pause the pipeline, for the effect of rate = 0.0 or first reverse the direction of playback using a seek event to get the same effect as rate < 0.0.
The @flush flag will clear any pending data in the pipeline before starting the step operation.
The @intermediate flag instructs the pipeline that this step operation is part of a larger step operation.

parameter.name: amount
parameter.parameter_description: the amount of data to step

function.return: a new #GstEvent

function.name: gst_event_new_stream_start
function.description:
Create a new STREAM_START event. The stream start event can only travel downstream synchronized with the buffer flow. It is expected to be the first event that is sent for a new stream.
Source elements, demuxers and other elements that create new streams are supposed to send this event as the first event of a new stream. It should not be sent after a flushing seek or in similar situations and is used to mark the beginning of a new logical stream. Elements combining multiple streams must ensure that this event is only forwarded downstream once and not for every single input stream.
The @stream_id should be a unique string that consists of the upstream stream-id, / as separator and a unique stream-id for this specific stream. A new stream-id should only be created for a stream if the upstream stream is split into (potentially) multiple new streams, e.g. in a demuxer, but not for every single element in the pipeline. gst_pad_create_stream_id() or gst_pad_create_stream_id_printf() can be used to create a stream-id. There are no particular semantics for the stream-id, though it should be deterministic (to support stream matching) and it might be used to order streams (besides any information conveyed by stream flags).
function.return: the new STREAM_START event.

function.name: gst_event_new_tag
function.description:
Generates a metadata tag event from the given @taglist.
The scope of the taglist specifies if the taglist applies to the complete medium or only to this specific stream. As the tag event is a sticky event, elements should merge tags received from upstream with a given scope with their own tags with the same scope and create a new tag event from it.

parameter.name: taglist
parameter.parameter_description: metadata list. The event will take ownership of the taglist.

function.return: a new #GstEvent

function.name: gst_event_new_toc
function.description: Generate a TOC event from the given @toc. The purpose of the TOC event is to inform elements that some kind of the TOC was found.
function.return: a new #GstEvent.

function.name: gst_event_new_toc_select
function.description: Generate a TOC select event with the given @uid. The purpose of the TOC select event is to start playback based on the TOC's entry with the given @uid.

parameter.name: uid
parameter.parameter_description: UID in the TOC to start playback from.

function.return: a new #GstEvent.

function.name: gst_event_parse_buffer_size
function.description: Get the format, minsize, maxsize and async-flag in the buffersize event.

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to store the format in

parameter.name: minsize
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to store the minsize in

parameter.name: maxsize
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to store the maxsize in

parameter.name: async
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to store the async-flag in

function.name: gst_event_parse_caps
function.description: Get the caps from @event. The caps remains valid as long as @event remains valid.

function.name: gst_event_parse_flush_stop
function.description: Parse the FLUSH_STOP event and retrieve the @reset_time member.

function.name: gst_event_parse_gap
function.description: Extract timestamp and duration from a new GAP event.

parameter.name: timestamp
parameter.parameter_description: location where to store the start time (pts) of the gap, or %NULL

parameter.name: duration
parameter.parameter_description: location where to store the duration of the gap, or %NULL

function.name: gst_event_parse_group_id

parameter.name: group_id
parameter.parameter_description: address of variable where to store the group id

function.return: %TRUE if a group id was set on the event and could be parsed, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_event_parse_latency
function.description: Get the latency in the latency event.

parameter.name: latency
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to store the latency in.

function.name: gst_event_parse_protection

parameter.name: system_id
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to store the UUID string uniquely identifying a content protection system.

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to store a #GstBuffer holding protection system specific information.

parameter.name: origin
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to store a value that indicates where the protection information carried by @event was extracted from.

function.name: gst_event_parse_qos

parameter.name: type
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to store the QoS type in

parameter.name: proportion
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to store the proportion in

parameter.name: diff
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to store the diff in

parameter.name: timestamp
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to store the timestamp in

function.name: gst_event_parse_seek
function.description: Parses a seek @event and stores the results in the given result locations.

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: result location for the stream format

parameter.name: start_type
parameter.parameter_description: result location for the #GstSeekType of the start position

parameter.name: start
parameter.parameter_description: result location for the start position expressed in @format

parameter.name: stop_type
parameter.parameter_description: result location for the #GstSeekType of the stop position

parameter.name: stop
parameter.parameter_description: result location for the stop position expressed in @format

function.name: gst_event_parse_segment
gst_event_parse_segment_done
function.description: Extracts the position and format from the segment done message.

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: Result location for the format, or %NULL

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: Result location for the position, or %NULL

function.name: gst_event_parse_sink_message
function.description: Parse the sink-message event. Unref @msg after usage.

parameter.name: msg
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to store the #GstMessage in.

function.name: gst_event_parse_step
function.description: Parse the step event.

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to store the format in

parameter.name: amount
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to store the amount in

parameter.name: rate
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to store the rate in

parameter.name: flush
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to store the flush boolean in

parameter.name: intermediate
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to store the intermediate boolean in

parameter.name: flags
parameter.parameter_description: address of variable where to store the stream flags

function.name: gst_event_parse_stream_start
function.description: Parse a stream-id @event and store the result in the given @stream_id location. The string stored in @stream_id must not be modified and will remain valid only until @event gets freed. Make a copy if you want to modify it or store it for later use.

function.name: gst_event_parse_tag
function.description: Parses a tag @event and stores the results in the given @taglist location. No reference to the taglist will be returned, it remains valid only until the @event is freed. Don't modify or free the taglist, make a copy if you want to modify it or store it for later use.

function.name: gst_event_parse_toc
function.description: Parse a TOC @event and store the results in the given @toc and @updated locations.

parameter.name: updated
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to store TOC updated flag.

function.name: gst_event_parse_toc_select
function.description: Parse a TOC select @event and store the results in the given @uid location.

function.name: gst_event_ref
function.description: Increase the refcount of this event.
function.return: @event (for convenience when doing assignments)

function.name: gst_event_replace
function.description:
Modifies a pointer to a #GstEvent to point to a different #GstEvent. The modification is done atomically (so this is useful for ensuring thread safety in some cases), and the reference counts are updated appropriately (the old event is unreffed, the new one is reffed).
Either @new_event or the #GstEvent pointed to by @old_event may be %NULL.

parameter.name: old_event
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a pointer to a #GstEvent to be replaced.

parameter.name: new_event
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a #GstEvent that will replace the event pointed to by @old_event.

function.return: %TRUE if @new_event was different from @old_event

function.name: gst_event_set_group_id
function.description:
All streams that have the same group id are supposed to be played together, i.e. all streams inside a container file should have the same group id but different stream ids. The group id should change each time the stream is started, resulting in different group ids each time a file is played for example.
Use gst_util_group_id_next() to get a new group id.

function.name: gst_event_set_running_time_offset
function.description:
Set the running time offset of a event. See gst_event_get_running_time_offset() for more information.
MT safe.

parameter.name: offset
parameter.parameter_description: A the new running time offset

function.name: gst_event_set_seqnum
function.description:
Set the sequence number of a event.
This function might be called by the creator of a event to indicate that the event relates to other events or messages. See gst_event_get_seqnum() for more information.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_event_steal
function.description: Atomically replace the #GstEvent pointed to by @old_event with %NULL and return the original event.

parameter.name: old_event
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a pointer to a #GstEvent to be stolen.

function.return: the #GstEvent that was in @old_event

function.name: gst_event_take
function.description:
Modifies a pointer to a #GstEvent to point to a different #GstEvent. This function is similar to gst_event_replace() except that it takes ownership of @new_event.
Either @new_event or the #GstEvent pointed to by @old_event may be %NULL.

parameter.name: old_event
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a pointer to a #GstEvent to be stolen.

parameter.name: new_event
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a #GstEvent that will replace the event pointed to by @old_event.

function.return: %TRUE if @new_event was different from @old_event

function.name: gst_event_type_get_flags
function.description: Gets the #GstEventTypeFlags associated with @type.
function.return: a #GstEventTypeFlags.

function.name: gst_event_type_get_name
function.description: Get a printable name for the given event type. Do not modify or free.
function.return: a reference to the static name of the event.

function.name: gst_event_type_to_quark
function.description: Get the unique quark for the given event type.
function.return: the quark associated with the event type

function.name: gst_event_unref
function.description: Decrease the refcount of an event, freeing it if the refcount reaches 0.

function.name: gst_event_writable_structure
function.description: Get a writable version of the structure.
function.return:
The structure of the event. The structure is still owned by the event, which means that you should not free it and that the pointer becomes invalid when you free the event. This function checks if @event is writable and will never return %NULL.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_fd_allocator_alloc
function.description: Return a %GstMemory that wraps a generic file descriptor.

parameter.name: allocator
parameter.parameter_description: allocator to be used for this memory

function.return: a GstMemory based on @allocator. When the buffer will be released the allocator will close the @fd. The memory is only mmapped on gst_buffer_mmap() request.

function.name: gst_fd_allocator_new
function.description: Return a new fd allocator.
function.return: a new fd allocator, or NULL if the allocator isn't available. Use gst_object_unref() to release the allocator after usage

function.name: gst_fd_memory_get_fd
function.description: Get the fd from @mem. Call gst_is_fd_memory() to check if @mem has an fd.
function.return: the fd of @mem or -1 when there is no fd on @mem

parameter.name: timedata

parameter.name: freqdata

function.name: gst_fft_f32_new
function.description:
This returns a new #GstFFTF32 instance with the given parameters. It makes sense to keep one instance for several calls for speed reasons.
@len must be even and to get the best performance a product of 2, 3 and 5. To get the next number with this characteristics use gst_fft_next_fast_length().

parameter.name: len
parameter.parameter_description: Length of the FFT in the time domain

parameter.name: inverse
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the #GstFFTF32 instance should be used for the inverse FFT

function.return: a new #GstFFTF32 instance.

function.name: gst_fft_f32_window
function.description: This calls the window function @window on the @timedata sample buffer.

function.name: gst_filename_to_uri
function.description:
Similar to g_filename_to_uri(), but attempts to handle relative file paths as well. Before converting @filename into an URI, it will be prefixed by the current working directory if it is a relative path, and then the path will be canonicalised so that it doesn't contain any './' or '../' segments.
On Windows #filename should be in UTF-8 encoding.

parameter.name: filename
parameter.parameter_description: absolute or relative file name path

function.return: newly-allocated URI string, or NULL on error. The caller must free the URI string with g_free() when no longer needed.

function.name: gst_flagset_register
function.description: Create a new sub-class of #GST_TYPE_FLAG_SET which will pretty-print the human-readable flags when serializing, for easier debugging.

function.name: gst_flow_combiner_add_pad
function.description: Adds a new #GstPad to the #GstFlowCombiner.

function.name: gst_flow_combiner_clear
function.description: Removes all pads from a #GstFlowCombiner and resets it to its initial state.

function.name: gst_flow_combiner_free
function.description: Frees a #GstFlowCombiner struct and all its internal data.

function.name: gst_flow_combiner_new
function.description: Creates a new #GstFlowCombiner, use gst_flow_combiner_free() to free it.
function.return: A new #GstFlowCombiner

function.name: gst_flow_combiner_remove_pad
function.description: Removes a #GstPad from the #GstFlowCombiner.

function.name: gst_flow_combiner_reset
function.description: Removes all pads from a #GstFlowCombiner and resets it to its initial state.

function.name: gst_flow_combiner_update_flow
function.description:
Computes the combined flow return for the pads in it.
The #GstFlowReturn parameter should be the last flow return update for a pad in this #GstFlowCombiner. It will use this value to be able to shortcut some combinations and avoid looking over all pads again. e.g. The last combined return is the same as the latest obtained #GstFlowReturn.

parameter.name: fret
parameter.parameter_description: the latest #GstFlowReturn received for a pad in this #GstFlowCombiner

function.return: The combined #GstFlowReturn

function.name: gst_flow_combiner_update_pad_flow
function.description:
Sets the provided pad's last flow return to provided value and computes the combined flow return for the pads in it.
The #GstFlowReturn parameter should be the last flow return update for a pad in this #GstFlowCombiner. It will use this value to be able to shortcut some combinations and avoid looking over all pads again. e.g. The last combined return is the same as the latest obtained #GstFlowReturn.

parameter.name: fret
parameter.parameter_description: the latest #GstFlowReturn received for a pad in this #GstFlowCombiner

function.return: The combined #GstFlowReturn

function.name: gst_flow_get_name
function.description: Gets a string representing the given flow return.

parameter.name: ret
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstFlowReturn to get the name of.

function.return: a static string with the name of the flow return.

function.name: gst_flow_to_quark
function.description: Get the unique quark for the given GstFlowReturn.

parameter.name: ret
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstFlowReturn to get the quark of.

function.return: the quark associated with the flow return or 0 if an invalid return was specified.

function.name: gst_format_get_by_nick

parameter.parameter_description: The format to get details of

function.return:
The #GstFormatDefinition for @format or %NULL on failure.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_format_get_name
function.description: Get a printable name for the given format. Do not modify or free.
function.return: a reference to the static name of the format or %NULL if the format is unknown.

function.name: gst_format_iterate_definitions
function.description: Iterate all the registered formats. The format definition is read only.
function.return: a GstIterator of #GstFormatDefinition.

function.name: gst_format_register
function.description: Create a new GstFormat based on the nick or return an already registered format with that nick.

parameter.name: description
parameter.parameter_description: The description of the new format

function.return:
A new GstFormat or an already registered format with the same nick.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_format_to_quark
function.description: Get the unique quark for the given format.
function.return: the quark associated with the format or 0 if the format is unknown.

function.name: gst_formats_contains
function.description: See if the given format is inside the format array.
function.return: %TRUE if the format is found inside the array

function.name: gst_gdouble_to_guint64
function.description: Convert @value to a guint64.
function.return: @value converted to a #guint64.
