gst_message_parse_step_done

function.name: gst_message_parse_structure_change
function.description:
Extracts the change type and completion status from the GstMessage.

parameter.name: type
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to hold the change type

parameter.name: owner
parameter.parameter_description: The owner element of the message source

parameter.name: busy
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to hold whether the change is in progress or has been completed

function.name: gst_message_parse_tag
gst_message_parse_toc
function.description:
Extract the TOC from the #GstMessage. The TOC returned in the output argument is a copy; the caller must free it with gst_toc_unref() when done.
MT safe.

parameter.name: updated
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the updated flag.

function.name: gst_message_parse_warning
function.description:
Extracts the GError and debug string from the GstMessage. The values returned in the output arguments are copies; the caller must free them when done.
MT safe.

parameter.name: debug
parameter.parameter_description: location for the debug message, or %NULL

function.name: gst_message_ref
function.description: Convenience macro to increase the reference count of the message.
function.return: @msg (for convenience when doing assignments)

function.name: gst_message_replace
function.description:
Modifies a pointer to a #GstMessage to point to a different #GstMessage. The modification is done atomically (so this is useful for ensuring thread safety in some cases), and the reference counts are updated appropriately (the old message is unreffed, the new one is reffed).
Either @new_message or the #GstMessage pointed to by @old_message may be %NULL.

parameter.name: old_message
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a pointer to a #GstMessage to be replaced.

parameter.name: new_message
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a #GstMessage that will replace the message pointed to by @old_message.

function.return: %TRUE if @new_message was different from @old_message

function.name: gst_message_set_buffering_stats
function.description: Configures the buffering stats values in @message.

parameter.name: buffering_left
parameter.parameter_description: amount of buffering time left in milliseconds

function.name: gst_message_set_group_id
function.description:
Sets the group id on the stream-start message.
All streams that have the same group id are supposed to be played together, i.e. all streams inside a container file should have the same group id but different stream ids. The group id should change each time the stream is started, resulting in different group ids each time a file is played for example.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_message_set_qos_stats
function.description:
Set the QoS stats representing the history of the current continuous pipeline playback period.
When @format is @GST_FORMAT_UNDEFINED both @dropped and @processed are invalid. Values of -1 for either @processed or @dropped mean unknown values.
MT safe.

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: Units of the 'processed' and 'dropped' fields. Video sinks and video filters will use GST_FORMAT_BUFFERS (frames). Audio sinks and audio filters will likely use GST_FORMAT_DEFAULT (samples).

parameter.name: processed
parameter.parameter_description: Total number of units correctly processed since the last state change to READY or a flushing operation.

parameter.name: dropped
parameter.parameter_description: Total number of units dropped since the last state change to READY or a flushing operation.

function.name: gst_message_set_qos_values
function.description:
Set the QoS values that have been calculated/analysed from the QoS data
MT safe.

parameter.name: jitter
parameter.parameter_description: The difference of the running-time against the deadline.

parameter.name: proportion
parameter.parameter_description: Long term prediction of the ideal rate relative to normal rate to get optimal quality.

parameter.name: quality
parameter.parameter_description: An element dependent integer value that specifies the current quality level of the element. The default maximum quality is 1000000.

function.name: gst_message_set_seqnum
function.description:
Set the sequence number of a message.
This function might be called by the creator of a message to indicate that the message relates to other messages or events. See gst_message_get_seqnum() for more information.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_message_set_stream_status_object
function.description: Configures the object handling the streaming thread. This is usually a GstTask object but other objects might be added in the future.

function.name: gst_message_type_get_name
function.description: Get a printable name for the given message type. Do not modify or free.
function.return: a reference to the static name of the message.

function.name: gst_message_type_to_quark
function.description: Get the unique quark for the given message type.

function.description: Convenience macro to decrease the reference count of the message, possibly freeing it.

function.name: gst_mini_object_copy
function.description:
Creates a copy of the mini-object.
MT safe
function.return: the new mini-object.

function.name: gst_mini_object_get_qdata
function.description: This function gets back user data pointers stored via gst_mini_object_set_qdata().

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: The GstMiniObject to get a stored user data pointer from

parameter.name: quark
parameter.parameter_description: A #GQuark, naming the user data pointer

function.return: The user data pointer set, or %NULL

function.name: gst_mini_object_init
function.description: Initializes a mini-object with the desired type and copy/dispose/free functions.

parameter.name: type
parameter.parameter_description: the #GType of the mini-object to create

function.name: gst_mini_object_is_writable
function.description:
If @mini_object has the LOCKABLE flag set, check if the current EXCLUSIVE lock on @object is the only one, this means that changes to the object will not be visible to any other object.
If the LOCKABLE flag is not set, check if the refcount of @mini_object is exactly 1, meaning that no other reference exists to the object and that the object is therefore writable.
Modification of a mini-object should only be done after verifying that it is writable.
function.return: %TRUE if the object is writable.

function.name: gst_mini_object_lock
function.description: Lock the mini-object with the specified access mode in @flags.
function.return: %TRUE if @object could be locked.

function.name: gst_mini_object_make_writable
function.description:
Checks if a mini-object is writable. If not, a writable copy is made and returned. This gives away the reference to the original mini object, and returns a reference to the new object.
MT safe
function.return: a mini-object (possibly the same pointer) that is writable.

function.name: gst_mini_object_ref
function.description:
Increase the reference count of the mini-object.
Note that the refcount affects the writability of @mini-object, see gst_mini_object_is_writable(). It is important to note that keeping additional references to GstMiniObject instances can potentially increase the number of memcpy operations in a pipeline, especially if the miniobject is a #GstBuffer.
function.return: the mini-object.

function.name: gst_mini_object_replace
function.description:
Atomically modifies a pointer to point to a new mini-object. The reference count of @olddata is decreased and the reference count of @newdata is increased.
Either @newdata and the value pointed to by @olddata may be %NULL.

parameter.name: olddata
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a pointer to a mini-object to be replaced

function.return: %TRUE if @newdata was different from @olddata

function.name: gst_mini_object_set_qdata
function.description:
This sets an opaque, named pointer on a miniobject. The name is specified through a #GQuark (retrieved e.g. via g_quark_from_static_string()), and the pointer can be gotten back from the @object with gst_mini_object_get_qdata() until the @object is disposed. Setting a previously set user data pointer, overrides (frees) the old pointer set, using %NULL as pointer essentially removes the data stored.
@destroy may be specified which is called with @data as argument when the @object is disposed, or the data is being overwritten by a call to gst_mini_object_set_qdata() with the same @quark.

parameter.name: quark
parameter.parameter_description: A #GQuark, naming the user data pointer

parameter.name: destroy
parameter.parameter_description: Function to invoke with @data as argument, when @data needs to be freed

function.name: gst_mini_object_steal
function.description: Replace the current #GstMiniObject pointer to by @olddata with %NULL and return the old value.

parameter.name: olddata
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a pointer to a mini-object to be stolen

function.return: the #GstMiniObject at @oldata

function.name: gst_mini_object_steal_qdata
function.description: This function gets back user data pointers stored via gst_mini_object_set_qdata() and removes the data from @object without invoking its destroy() function (if any was set).

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: The GstMiniObject to get a stored user data pointer from

parameter.name: quark
parameter.parameter_description: A #GQuark, naming the user data pointer

function.return: The user data pointer set, or %NULL

function.name: gst_mini_object_take
function.description:
Modifies a pointer to point to a new mini-object. The modification is done atomically. This version is similar to gst_mini_object_replace() except that it does not increase the refcount of @newdata and thus takes ownership of @newdata.
Either @newdata and the value pointed to by @olddata may be %NULL.

parameter.name: olddata
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a pointer to a mini-object to be replaced

function.return: %TRUE if @newdata was different from @olddata

function.name: gst_mini_object_unlock
function.description: Unlock the mini-object with the specified access mode in @flags.

function.name: gst_mini_object_unref
function.description: Decreases the reference count of the mini-object, possibly freeing the mini-object.

function.name: gst_mini_object_weak_ref
function.description: Adds a weak reference callback to a mini object. Weak references are used for notification when a mini object is finalized. They are called "weak references" because they allow you to safely hold a pointer to the mini object without calling gst_mini_object_ref() (gst_mini_object_ref() adds a strong reference, that is, forces the object to stay alive).

parameter.name: notify
parameter.parameter_description: callback to invoke before the mini object is freed

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: extra data to pass to notify

function.name: gst_mini_object_weak_unref
function.description: Removes a weak reference callback from a mini object.

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: #GstMiniObject to remove a weak reference from

function.name: gst_missing_decoder_installer_detail_new
function.description:
Returns an opaque string containing all the details about the missing element to be passed to an external installer called via gst_install_plugins_async() or gst_install_plugins_sync().
This function is mainly for applications that call external plugin installation mechanisms using one of the two above-mentioned functions in the case where the application knows exactly what kind of plugin it is missing.

parameter.name: decode_caps
parameter.parameter_description: the (fixed) caps for which a decoder element is needed

function.return: a newly-allocated detail string, or NULL on error. Free string with g_free() when not needed any longer.

function.name: gst_missing_decoder_message_new
function.description: Creates a missing-plugin message for @element to notify the application that a decoder element for a particular set of (fixed) caps is missing. This function is mainly for use in plugins.

parameter.name: decode_caps
parameter.parameter_description: the (fixed) caps for which a decoder element is needed

function.return: a new #GstMessage, or NULL on error

Returns an opaque string containing all the details about the missing element to be passed to an external installer called via gst_install_plugins_async() or gst_install_plugins_sync().
This function is mainly for applications that call external plugin installation mechanisms using one of the two above-mentioned functions in the case where the application knows exactly what kind of plugin it is missing.

function.return: a newly-allocated detail string, or NULL on error. Free string with g_free() when not needed any longer.

parameter.name: factory_name

Returns a localised string describing the missing feature, for use in error dialogs and the like. Should never return NULL unless @msg is not a valid missing-plugin message.
This function is mainly for applications that need a human-readable string describing a missing plugin, given a previously collected missing-plugin message
function.return: a newly-allocated description string, or NULL on error. Free string with g_free() when not needed any longer.

function.name: gst_navigation_event_get_type
function.description: Inspect a #GstEvent and return the #GstNavigationEventType of the event, or #GST_NAVIGATION_EVENT_INVALID if the event is not a #GstNavigation event.

function.name: gst_navigation_event_parse_command
function.description: Inspect a #GstNavigation command event and retrieve the enum value of the associated command.

parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to GstNavigationCommand to receive the type of the navigation event.

function.return: TRUE if the navigation command could be extracted, otherwise FALSE.

parameter.name: key
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to a location to receive the string identifying the key press. The returned string is owned by the event, and valid only until the event is unreffed.

function.name: gst_navigation_event_parse_mouse_button_event
function.description: Retrieve the details of either a #GstNavigation mouse button press event or a mouse button release event. Determine which type the event is using gst_navigation_event_get_type() to retrieve the #GstNavigationEventType.

parameter.name: x

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to a gdouble to receive the y coordinate of the mouse button event.

function.return: TRUE if the button number and both coordinates could be extracted, otherwise FALSE.

function.name: gst_navigation_event_parse_mouse_move_event

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to a gdouble to receive the y coordinate of the mouse movement.

function.return: TRUE if both coordinates could be extracted, otherwise FALSE.

function.name: gst_navigation_message_get_type
function.description: Check a bus message to see if it is a #GstNavigation event, and return the #GstNavigationMessageType identifying the type of the message if so.
function.return: The type of the #GstMessage, or #GST_NAVIGATION_MESSAGE_INVALID if the message is not a #GstNavigation notification.

function.name: gst_navigation_message_new_angles_changed
function.description: Creates a new #GstNavigation message with type #GST_NAVIGATION_MESSAGE_ANGLES_CHANGED for notifying an application that the current angle, or current number of angles available in a multiangle video has changed.

parameter.name: src
parameter.parameter_description: A #GstObject to set as source of the new message.

parameter.name: n_angles
parameter.parameter_description: The number of viewing angles now available.

function.return: The new #GstMessage.

function.name: gst_navigation_message_new_commands_changed
function.description: Creates a new #GstNavigation message with type #GST_NAVIGATION_MESSAGE_COMMANDS_CHANGED

parameter.name: src
parameter.parameter_description: A #GstObject to set as source of the new message.

function.return: The new #GstMessage.

function.name: gst_navigation_message_new_event
function.description: Creates a new #GstNavigation message with type #GST_NAVIGATION_MESSAGE_EVENT.

parameter.name: src
parameter.parameter_description: A #GstObject to set as source of the new message.

function.return: The new #GstMessage.

function.name: gst_navigation_message_new_mouse_over
function.description: Creates a new #GstNavigation message with type #GST_NAVIGATION_MESSAGE_MOUSE_OVER.

parameter.name: src
parameter.parameter_description: A #GstObject to set as source of the new message.

parameter.name: active
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the mouse has entered a clickable area of the display. %FALSE if it over a non-clickable area.

function.return: The new #GstMessage.

function.name: gst_navigation_message_parse_angles_changed
function.description: Parse a #GstNavigation message of type GST_NAVIGATION_MESSAGE_ANGLES_CHANGED and extract the @cur_angle and @n_angles parameters.

parameter.name: cur_angle
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to a #guint to receive the new current angle number, or NULL

parameter.name: n_angles
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to a #guint to receive the new angle count, or NULL.

function.return: %TRUE if the message could be successfully parsed. %FALSE if not.

function.name: gst_navigation_message_parse_event
function.description: Parse a #GstNavigation message of type #GST_NAVIGATION_MESSAGE_EVENT and extract contained #GstEvent. The caller must unref the @event when done with it.

parameter.name: event
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to a #GstEvent to receive the contained navigation event.

function.return: %TRUE if the message could be successfully parsed. %FALSE if not.

function.name: gst_navigation_message_parse_mouse_over
function.description: Parse a #GstNavigation message of type #GST_NAVIGATION_MESSAGE_MOUSE_OVER and extract the active/inactive flag. If the mouse over event is marked active, it indicates that the mouse is over a clickable area.

parameter.name: active
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to a gboolean to receive the active/inactive state, or NULL.

function.return: %TRUE if the message could be successfully parsed. %FALSE if not.

function.name: gst_navigation_query_get_type
function.description: Inspect a #GstQuery and return the #GstNavigationQueryType associated with it if it is a #GstNavigation query.
function.return: The #GstNavigationQueryType of the query, or #GST_NAVIGATION_QUERY_INVALID

function.name: gst_navigation_query_new_angles
function.description: Create a new #GstNavigation angles query. When executed, it will query the pipeline for the set of currently available angles, which may be greater than one in a multiangle video.
function.return: The new query.

function.name: gst_navigation_query_new_commands
function.description: Create a new #GstNavigation commands query. When executed, it will query the pipeline for the set of currently available commands.
function.return: The new query.

function.name: gst_navigation_query_parse_angles
function.description: Parse the current angle number in the #GstNavigation angles @query into the #guint pointed to by the @cur_angle variable, and the number of available angles into the #guint pointed to by the @n_angles variable.

parameter.name: cur_angle
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to a #guint into which to store the currently selected angle value from the query, or NULL

parameter.name: n_angles
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to a #guint into which to store the number of angles value from the query, or NULL

function.return: %TRUE if the query could be successfully parsed. %FALSE if not.

function.name: gst_navigation_query_parse_commands_length
function.description: Parse the number of commands in the #GstNavigation commands @query.

parameter.name: n_cmds
parameter.parameter_description: the number of commands in this query.

function.return: %TRUE if the query could be successfully parsed. %FALSE if not.

function.name: gst_navigation_query_parse_commands_nth
function.description: Parse the #GstNavigation command query and retrieve the @nth command from it into @cmd. If the list contains less elements than @nth, @cmd will be set to #GST_NAVIGATION_COMMAND_INVALID.

parameter.name: cmd
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to store the nth command into.

function.return: %TRUE if the query could be successfully parsed. %FALSE if not.

function.name: gst_navigation_query_set_angles
function.description: Set the #GstNavigation angles query result field in @query.

parameter.name: cur_angle
parameter.parameter_description: the current viewing angle to set.

parameter.name: n_angles
parameter.parameter_description: the number of viewing angles to set.

function.name: gst_navigation_query_set_commands
function.description: Set the #GstNavigation command query result fields in @query. The number of commands passed must be equal to @n_commands.

parameter.name: n_cmds
parameter.parameter_description: the number of commands to set.

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: A list of @GstNavigationCommand values, @n_cmds entries long.

function.name: gst_navigation_query_set_commandsv
function.description: Set the #GstNavigation command query result fields in @query. The number of commands passed must be equal to @n_commands.

parameter.name: n_cmds
parameter.parameter_description: the number of commands to set.

function.name: gst_navigation_send_command
function.description: Sends the indicated command to the navigation interface.

parameter.name: event
parameter.parameter_description: The type of the key event. Recognised values are "key-press" and "key-release"

parameter.name: key
parameter.parameter_description: Character representation of the key. This is typically as produced by XKeysymToString.

function.name: gst_navigation_send_mouse_event
function.description: Sends a mouse event to the navigation interface. Mouse event coordinates are sent relative to the display space of the related output area. This is usually the size in pixels of the window associated with the element implementing the #GstNavigation interface.

parameter.name: event
parameter.parameter_description: The type of mouse event, as a text string. Recognised values are "mouse-button-press", "mouse-button-release" and "mouse-move".

parameter.name: button
parameter.parameter_description: The button number of the button being pressed or released. Pass 0 for mouse-move events.

parameter.name: x
parameter.parameter_description: The x coordinate of the mouse event.

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: The y coordinate of the mouse event.

function.name: gst_net_client_clock_new

parameter.name: remote_address
parameter.parameter_description: the address or hostname of the remote clock provider

parameter.name: remote_port
parameter.parameter_description: the port of the remote clock provider

function.return: a new #GstClock that receives a time from the remote clock.

function.name: gst_net_time_packet_copy
function.description: Make a copy of @packet.
function.return: a copy of @packet, free with gst_net_time_packet_free().

function.name: gst_net_time_packet_free
function.description: Free @packet.

function.name: gst_net_time_packet_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GstNetTimePacket from a buffer received over the network. The caller is responsible for ensuring that @buffer is at least #GST_NET_TIME_PACKET_SIZE bytes long.
If @buffer is #NULL, the local and remote times will be set to #GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE.
MT safe. Caller owns return value (gst_net_time_packet_free to free).

parameter.name: buffer
parameter.parameter_description: a buffer from which to construct the packet, or NULL

function.return: The new #GstNetTimePacket.

function.name: gst_net_time_packet_receive
function.description: Receives a #GstNetTimePacket over a socket. Handles interrupted system calls, but otherwise returns NULL on error.

parameter.name: socket
parameter.parameter_description: socket to receive the time packet on

parameter.name: src_address
parameter.parameter_description: address of variable to return sender address

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: return address for a #GError, or NULL

function.return: a new #GstNetTimePacket, or NULL on error. Free with gst_net_time_packet_free() when done.

function.name: gst_net_time_packet_send
function.description:
Sends a #GstNetTimePacket over a socket.
MT safe.

parameter.name: socket
parameter.parameter_description: socket to send the time packet on

parameter.name: dest_address
parameter.parameter_description: address to send the time packet to

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: return address for a #GError, or NULL

function.return: TRUE if successful, FALSE in case an error occurred.

function.name: gst_net_time_packet_serialize
function.description:
Serialized a #GstNetTimePacket into a newly-allocated sequence of #GST_NET_TIME_PACKET_SIZE bytes, in network byte order. The value returned is suitable for passing to write(2) or sendto(2) for communication over the network.
MT safe. Caller owns return value (g_free to free).
function.return: A newly allocated sequence of #GST_NET_TIME_PACKET_SIZE bytes.

function.name: gst_net_time_provider_new
function.description: Allows network clients to get the current time of @clock.

parameter.name: clock
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstClock to export over the network

parameter.name: address
parameter.parameter_description: an address to bind on as a dotted quad (xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx), IPv6 address, or NULL to bind to all addresses

parameter.name: port
parameter.parameter_description: a port to bind on, or 0 to let the kernel choose

function.return: the new #GstNetTimeProvider, or NULL on error

function.name: gst_ntp_clock_new
function.description: Create a new #GstNtpClock that will report the time provided by the NTPv4 server on @remote_address and @remote_port.

parameter.name: remote_address
parameter.parameter_description: the address or hostname of the remote clock provider

parameter.name: remote_port
parameter.parameter_description: the port of the remote clock provider

function.return: a new #GstClock that receives a time from the remote clock.

function.name: gst_ntp_packet_copy
function.description: Make a copy of @packet.
function.return: a copy of @packet, free with gst_ntp_packet_free().

function.name: gst_ntp_packet_free
function.description: Free @packet.

function.name: gst_ntp_packet_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GstNtpPacket from a buffer received over the network. The caller is responsible for ensuring that @buffer is at least #GST_NTP_PACKET_SIZE bytes long.
If @buffer is #NULL, the local and remote times will be set to #GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE.
MT safe. Caller owns return value (gst_ntp_packet_free to free).

parameter.name: buffer
parameter.parameter_description: a buffer from which to construct the packet, or NULL

function.return: The new #GstNtpPacket.

function.name: gst_ntp_packet_receive
function.description: Receives a #GstNtpPacket over a socket. Handles interrupted system calls, but otherwise returns NULL on error.

parameter.name: socket
parameter.parameter_description: socket to receive the time packet on

parameter.name: src_address
parameter.parameter_description: address of variable to return sender address

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: return address for a #GError, or NULL

function.return: a new #GstNtpPacket, or NULL on error. Free with gst_ntp_packet_free() when done.

function.name: gst_ntp_packet_send
function.description:
Sends a #GstNtpPacket over a socket.
MT safe.

parameter.name: socket
parameter.parameter_description: socket to send the time packet on

parameter.name: dest_address
parameter.parameter_description: address to send the time packet to

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: return address for a #GError, or NULL

function.return: TRUE if successful, FALSE in case an error occurred.

function.name: gst_ntp_packet_serialize
function.description:
Serialized a #GstNtpPacket into a newly-allocated sequence of #GST_NTP_PACKET_SIZE bytes, in network byte order. The value returned is suitable for passing to write(2) or sendto(2) for communication over the network.
MT safe. Caller owns return value (g_free to free).
function.return: A newly allocated sequence of #GST_NTP_PACKET_SIZE bytes.

function.name: gst_object_add_control_binding
function.description:
Attach the #GstControlBinding to the object. If there already was a #GstControlBinding for this property it will be replaced.
The @object will take ownership of the @binding.
function.return: %FALSE if the given @binding has not been setup for this object or has been setup for a non suitable property, %TRUE otherwise.

function.name: gst_object_check_uniqueness
function.description: Checks to see if there is any object named @name in @list. This function does not do any locking of any kind. You might want to protect the provided list with the lock of the owner of the list. This function will lock each #GstObject in the list to compare the name, so be careful when passing a list with a locked object.

parameter.name: list
parameter.parameter_description: a list of #GstObject to check through

function.return:
%TRUE if a #GstObject named @name does not appear in @list, %FALSE if it does.
MT safe. Grabs and releases the LOCK of each object in the list.

function.name: gst_object_default_deep_notify
function.description:
A default deep_notify signal callback for an object. The user data should contain a pointer to an array of strings that should be excluded from the notify. The default handler will print the new value of the property using g_print.
MT safe. This function grabs and releases @object's LOCK for getting its path string.

parameter.name: excluded_props
parameter.parameter_description: a set of user-specified properties to exclude or %NULL to show all changes.

function.name: gst_object_default_error
function.description:
A default error function that uses g_printerr() to display the error message and the optional debug sting..
The default handler will simply print the error string using g_print.

parameter.name: debug
parameter.parameter_description: an additional debug information string, or %NULL

function.name: gst_object_get_control_binding
function.description: Gets the corresponding #GstControlBinding for the property. This should be unreferenced again after use.
function.return: the #GstControlBinding for @property_name or %NULL if the property is not controlled.

function.name: gst_object_get_control_rate
function.description:
Obtain the control-rate for this @object. Audio processing #GstElement objects will use this rate to sub-divide their processing loop and call gst_object_sync_values() inbetween. The length of the processing segment should be up to @control-rate nanoseconds.
If the @object is not under property control, this will return %GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE. This allows the element to avoid the sub-dividing.
The control-rate is not expected to change if the element is in %GST_STATE_PAUSED or %GST_STATE_PLAYING.

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: the object that has controlled properties

function.return: the control rate in nanoseconds

function.name: gst_object_get_g_value_array
function.description:
Gets a number of #GValues for the given controlled property starting at the requested time. The array @values need to hold enough space for @n_values of #GValue.
This function is useful if one wants to e.g. draw a graph of the control curve or apply a control curve sample by sample.

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: the object that has controlled properties

parameter.name: property_name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the property to get

parameter.name: timestamp
parameter.parameter_description: the time that should be processed

parameter.name: interval
parameter.parameter_description: the time spacing between subsequent values

function.return: %TRUE if the given array could be filled, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gst_object_get_name
function.description:
Returns a copy of the name of @object. Caller should g_free() the return value after usage. For a nameless object, this returns %NULL, which you can safely g_free() as well.
Free-function: g_free
function.return:
the name of @object. g_free() after usage.
MT safe. This function grabs and releases @object's LOCK.

function.name: gst_object_get_parent
function.description: Returns the parent of @object. This function increases the refcount of the parent object so you should gst_object_unref() it after usage.
function.return:
parent of @object, this can be %NULL if @object has no parent. unref after usage.
MT safe. Grabs and releases @object's LOCK.

function.name: gst_object_get_path_string
function.description:
Generates a string describing the path of @object in the object hierarchy. Only useful (or used) for debugging.
Free-function: g_free
function.return:
a string describing the path of @object. You must g_free() the string after usage.
MT safe. Grabs and releases the #GstObject's LOCK for all objects in the hierarchy.

function.name: gst_object_get_value
function.description: Gets the value for the given controlled property at the requested time.

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: the object that has controlled properties

parameter.name: property_name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the property to get

parameter.name: timestamp
parameter.parameter_description: the time the control-change should be read from

function.return: the GValue of the property at the given time, or %NULL if the property isn't controlled.

function.name: gst_object_get_value_array
function.description:
Gets a number of values for the given controlled property starting at the requested time. The array @values need to hold enough space for @n_values of the same type as the objects property's type.
This function is useful if one wants to e.g. draw a graph of the control curve or apply a control curve sample by sample.
The values are unboxed and ready to be used. The similar function gst_object_get_g_value_array() returns the array as #GValues and is better suites for bindings.

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: the object that has controlled properties

parameter.name: property_name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the property to get

parameter.name: timestamp
parameter.parameter_description: the time that should be processed

parameter.name: interval
parameter.parameter_description: the time spacing between subsequent values

function.return: %TRUE if the given array could be filled, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gst_object_has_active_control_bindings
function.description: Check if the @object has an active controlled properties.

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: the object that has controlled properties

function.return: %TRUE if the object has active controlled properties

function.name: gst_object_has_ancestor
function.description:
Check if @object has an ancestor @ancestor somewhere up in the hierarchy. One can e.g. check if a #GstElement is inside a #GstPipeline.
Deprecated: Use gst_object_has_as_ancestor() instead.
MT safe. Grabs and releases @object's locks.
function.return: %TRUE if @ancestor is an ancestor of @object.

function.name: gst_object_has_as_ancestor
function.description: Check if @object has an ancestor @ancestor somewhere up in the hierarchy. One can e.g. check if a #GstElement is inside a #GstPipeline.
function.return:
%TRUE if @ancestor is an ancestor of @object.
MT safe. Grabs and releases @object's locks.

function.name: gst_object_has_as_parent
function.description: Check if @parent is the parent of @object. E.g. a #GstElement can check if it owns a given #GstPad.
function.return:
%FALSE if either @object or @parent is %NULL. %TRUE if @parent is the parent of @object. Otherwise %FALSE.
MT safe. Grabs and releases @object's locks.

function.name: gst_object_ref
function.description:
Increments the reference count on @object. This function does not take the lock on @object because it relies on atomic refcounting.
This object returns the input parameter to ease writing constructs like : result = gst_object_ref (object->parent);
function.return: A pointer to @object

function.name: gst_object_ref_sink
function.description:
Increase the reference count of @object, and possibly remove the floating reference, if @object has a floating reference.
In other words, if the object is floating, then this call "assumes ownership" of the floating reference, converting it to a normal reference by clearing the floating flag while leaving the reference count unchanged. If the object is not floating, then this call adds a new normal reference increasing the reference count by one.

function.name: gst_object_remove_control_binding
function.description: Removes the corresponding #GstControlBinding. If it was the last ref of the binding, it will be disposed.
function.return: %TRUE if the binding could be removed.

function.name: gst_object_replace
function.description:
Atomically modifies a pointer to point to a new object. The reference count of @oldobj is decreased and the reference count of @newobj is increased.
Either @newobj and the value pointed to by @oldobj may be %NULL.

parameter.name: oldobj
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a place of a #GstObject to replace

function.return: %TRUE if @newobj was different from @oldobj

function.name: gst_object_set_control_binding_disabled
function.description: This function is used to disable the control bindings on a property for some time, i.e. gst_object_sync_values() will do nothing for the property.

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: the object that has controlled properties

parameter.name: disabled
parameter.parameter_description: boolean that specifies whether to disable the controller or not.

function.name: gst_object_set_control_bindings_disabled
function.description: This function is used to disable all controlled properties of the @object for some time, i.e. gst_object_sync_values() will do nothing.

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: the object that has controlled properties

parameter.name: disabled
parameter.parameter_description: boolean that specifies whether to disable the controller or not.

function.name: gst_object_set_control_rate
function.description:
Change the control-rate for this @object. Audio processing #GstElement objects will use this rate to sub-divide their processing loop and call gst_object_sync_values() inbetween. The length of the processing segment should be up to @control-rate nanoseconds.
The control-rate should not change if the element is in %GST_STATE_PAUSED or %GST_STATE_PLAYING.

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: the object that has controlled properties

function.name: gst_object_set_name
function.description: Sets the name of @object, or gives @object a guaranteed unique name (if @name is %NULL). This function makes a copy of the provided name, so the caller retains ownership of the name it sent.
function.return:
%TRUE if the name could be set. Since Objects that have a parent cannot be renamed, this function returns %FALSE in those cases.
MT safe. This function grabs and releases @object's LOCK.

function.name: gst_object_set_parent
function.description: Sets the parent of @object to @parent. The object's reference count will be incremented, and any floating reference will be removed (see gst_object_ref_sink()).
function.return:
%TRUE if @parent could be set or %FALSE when @object already had a parent or @object and @parent are the same.
MT safe. Grabs and releases @object's LOCK.

function.name: gst_object_suggest_next_sync
function.description: Returns a suggestion for timestamps where buffers should be split to get best controller results.

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: the object that has controlled properties

function.return: Returns the suggested timestamp or %GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE if no control-rate was set.

function.name: gst_object_sync_values
function.description:
Sets the properties of the object, according to the #GstControlSources that (maybe) handle them and for the given timestamp.
If this function fails, it is most likely the application developers fault. Most probably the control sources are not setup correctly.

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: the object that has controlled properties

parameter.name: timestamp
parameter.parameter_description: the time that should be processed

function.return: %TRUE if the controller values could be applied to the object properties, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gst_object_unparent
function.description:
Clear the parent of @object, removing the associated reference. This function decreases the refcount of @object.
MT safe. Grabs and releases @object's lock.

function.name: gst_object_unref
function.description:
Decrements the reference count on @object. If reference count hits zero, destroy @object. This function does not take the lock on @object as it relies on atomic refcounting.
The unref method should never be called with the LOCK held since this might deadlock the dispose function.

function.name: gst_pad_activate_mode
function.description:
Activates or deactivates the given pad in @mode via dispatching to the pad's activatemodefunc. For use from within pad activation functions only.
If you don't know what this is, you probably don't want to call it.

parameter.name: active
parameter.parameter_description: whether or not the pad should be active.

function.return:
%TRUE if the operation was successful.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_add_probe
function.description:
Be notified of different states of pads. The provided callback is called for every state that matches @mask.
Probes are called in groups: First GST_PAD_PROBE_TYPE_BLOCK probes are called, then others, then finally GST_PAD_PROBE_TYPE_IDLE. The only exception here are GST_PAD_PROBE_TYPE_IDLE probes that are called immediately if the pad is already idle while calling gst_pad_add_probe(). In each of the groups, probes are called in the order in which they were added.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstPad to add the probe to

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: #GstPadProbeCallback that will be called with notifications of the pad state

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: user data passed to the callback

function.return:
an id or 0 if no probe is pending. The id can be used to remove the probe with gst_pad_remove_probe(). When using GST_PAD_PROBE_TYPE_IDLE it can happen that the probe can be run immediately and if the probe returns GST_PAD_PROBE_REMOVE this functions returns 0.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_can_link
function.description: Checks if the source pad and the sink pad are compatible so they can be linked.
function.return: %TRUE if the pads can be linked.

function.name: gst_pad_chain
function.description:
Chain a buffer to @pad.
The function returns #GST_FLOW_FLUSHING if the pad was flushing.
If the buffer type is not acceptable for @pad (as negotiated with a preceding GST_EVENT_CAPS event), this function returns #GST_FLOW_NOT_NEGOTIATED.
The function proceeds calling the chain function installed on @pad (see gst_pad_set_chain_function()) and the return value of that function is returned to the caller. #GST_FLOW_NOT_SUPPORTED is returned if @pad has no chain function.
In all cases, success or failure, the caller loses its reference to @buffer after calling this function.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a sink #GstPad, returns GST_FLOW_ERROR if not.

parameter.name: buffer
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstBuffer to send, return GST_FLOW_ERROR if not.

function.return:
a #GstFlowReturn from the pad.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_chain_list
function.description:
Chain a bufferlist to @pad.
The function returns #GST_FLOW_FLUSHING if the pad was flushing.
If @pad was not negotiated properly with a CAPS event, this function returns #GST_FLOW_NOT_NEGOTIATED.
The function proceeds calling the chainlist function installed on @pad (see gst_pad_set_chain_list_function()) and the return value of that function is returned to the caller. #GST_FLOW_NOT_SUPPORTED is returned if @pad has no chainlist function.
In all cases, success or failure, the caller loses its reference to @list after calling this function.
MT safe.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a sink #GstPad, returns GST_FLOW_ERROR if not.

parameter.name: list
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstBufferList to send, return GST_FLOW_ERROR if not.

function.return: a #GstFlowReturn from the pad.

function.name: gst_pad_check_reconfigure
function.description: Check and clear the #GST_PAD_FLAG_NEED_RECONFIGURE flag on @pad and return %TRUE if the flag was set.
function.return: %TRUE is the GST_PAD_FLAG_NEED_RECONFIGURE flag was set on @pad.

function.name: gst_pad_create_stream_id
function.description:
Creates a stream-id for the source #GstPad @pad by combining the upstream information with the optional @stream_id of the stream of @pad. @pad must have a parent #GstElement and which must have zero or one sinkpad. @stream_id can only be %NULL if the parent element of @pad has only a single source pad.
This function generates an unique stream-id by getting the upstream stream-start event stream ID and appending @stream_id to it. If the element has no sinkpad it will generate an upstream stream-id by doing an URI query on the element and in the worst case just uses a random number. Source elements that don't implement the URI handler interface should ideally generate a unique, deterministic stream-id manually instead.
Since stream IDs are sorted alphabetically, any numbers in the stream ID should be printed with a fixed number of characters, preceded by 0's, such as by using the format \%03u instead of \%u.
function.return: A stream-id for @pad. g_free() after usage.

function.name: gst_pad_create_stream_id_printf
function.description:
Creates a stream-id for the source #GstPad @pad by combining the upstream information with the optional @stream_id of the stream of @pad. @pad must have a parent #GstElement and which must have zero or one sinkpad. @stream_id can only be %NULL if the parent element of @pad has only a single source pad.
This function generates an unique stream-id by getting the upstream stream-start event stream ID and appending @stream_id to it. If the element has no sinkpad it will generate an upstream stream-id by doing an URI query on the element and in the worst case just uses a random number. Source elements that don't implement the URI handler interface should ideally generate a unique, deterministic stream-id manually instead.
function.return: A stream-id for @pad. g_free() after usage.

function.name: gst_pad_create_stream_id_printf_valist
function.description:
Creates a stream-id for the source #GstPad @pad by combining the upstream information with the optional @stream_id of the stream of @pad. @pad must have a parent #GstElement and which must have zero or one sinkpad. @stream_id can only be %NULL if the parent element of @pad has only a single source pad.
This function generates an unique stream-id by getting the upstream stream-start event stream ID and appending @stream_id to it. If the element has no sinkpad it will generate an upstream stream-id by doing an URI query on the element and in the worst case just uses a random number. Source elements that don't implement the URI handler interface should ideally generate a unique, deterministic stream-id manually instead.
function.return: A stream-id for @pad. g_free() after usage.

function.name: gst_pad_event_default
function.description:
Invokes the default event handler for the given pad.
The EOS event will pause the task associated with @pad before it is forwarded to all internally linked pads,
The event is sent to all pads internally linked to @pad. This function takes ownership of @event.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad to call the default event handler on.

function.return: %TRUE if the event was sent successfully.

function.name: gst_pad_forward
function.description:
Calls @forward for all internally linked pads of @pad. This function deals with dynamically changing internal pads and will make sure that the @forward function is only called once for each pad.
When @forward returns %TRUE, no further pads will be processed.
function.return: %TRUE if one of the dispatcher functions returned %TRUE.

function.name: gst_pad_get_allowed_caps
function.description:
Gets the capabilities of the allowed media types that can flow through @pad and its peer.
The allowed capabilities is calculated as the intersection of the results of calling gst_pad_query_caps() on @pad and its peer. The caller owns a reference on the resulting caps.
function.return:
the allowed #GstCaps of the pad link. Unref the caps when you no longer need it. This function returns %NULL when @pad has no peer.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_get_current_caps
function.description: Gets the capabilities currently configured on @pad with the last #GST_EVENT_CAPS event.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad to get the current capabilities of.

function.return: the current caps of the pad with incremented ref-count or %NULL when pad has no caps. Unref after usage.

function.name: gst_pad_get_direction
function.description: Gets the direction of the pad. The direction of the pad is decided at construction time so this function does not take the LOCK.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad to get the direction of.

function.return:
the #GstPadDirection of the pad.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_get_element_private
function.description: Gets the private data of a pad. No locking is performed in this function.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstPad to get the private data of.

function.return: a #gpointer to the private data.

function.name: gst_pad_get_last_flow_return
function.description: Gets the #GstFlowReturn return from the last data passed by this pad.

function.name: gst_pad_get_name
function.description:
Get a copy of the name of the pad. g_free() after usage.
MT safe.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: the pad to get the name from

function.name: gst_pad_get_offset
function.description: Get the offset applied to the running time of @pad. @pad has to be a source pad.
function.return: the offset.

function.name: gst_pad_get_pad_template
function.description: Gets the template for @pad.
function.return: the #GstPadTemplate from which this pad was instantiated, or %NULL if this pad has no template. Unref after usage.

function.name: gst_pad_get_pad_template_caps
function.description: Gets the capabilities for @pad's template.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad to get the template capabilities from.

function.return: the #GstCaps of this pad template. Unref after usage.

function.name: gst_pad_get_parent
function.description:
Get the parent of @pad. This function increases the refcount of the parent object so you should gst_object_unref() it after usage. Can return %NULL if the pad did not have a parent.
MT safe.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: the pad to get the parent of

function.return: the parent

function.name: gst_pad_get_parent_element
function.description: Gets the parent of @pad, cast to a #GstElement. If a @pad has no parent or its parent is not an element, return %NULL.
function.return:
the parent of the pad. The caller has a reference on the parent, so unref when you're finished with it.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_get_peer
function.description: Gets the peer of @pad. This function refs the peer pad so you need to unref it after use.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad to get the peer of.

function.return:
the peer #GstPad. Unref after usage.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_get_range
function.description:
When @pad is flushing this function returns #GST_FLOW_FLUSHING immediately and @buffer is %NULL.
Calls the getrange function of @pad, see #GstPadGetRangeFunction for a description of a getrange function. If @pad has no getrange function installed (see gst_pad_set_getrange_function()) this function returns #GST_FLOW_NOT_SUPPORTED.
If @buffer points to a variable holding %NULL, a valid new #GstBuffer will be placed in @buffer when this function returns #GST_FLOW_OK. The new buffer must be freed with gst_buffer_unref() after usage.
When @buffer points to a variable that points to a valid #GstBuffer, the buffer will be filled with the result data when this function returns #GST_FLOW_OK. If the provided buffer is larger than @size, only @size bytes will be filled in the result buffer and its size will be updated accordingly.
Note that less than @size bytes can be returned in @buffer when, for example, an EOS condition is near or when @buffer is not large enough to hold @size bytes. The caller should check the result buffer size to get the result size.
When this function returns any other result value than #GST_FLOW_OK, @buffer will be unchanged.
This is a lowlevel function. Usually gst_pad_pull_range() is used.

parameter.name: offset
parameter.parameter_description: The start offset of the buffer

parameter.name: buffer
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to hold the #GstBuffer, returns #GST_FLOW_ERROR if %NULL.

function.return:
a #GstFlowReturn from the pad.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_get_sticky_event
function.description: Returns a new reference of the sticky event of type @event_type from the event.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstPad to get the event from.

function.name: gst_pad_get_stream_id
function.description:
Returns the current stream-id for the @pad, or %NULL if none has been set yet, i.e. the pad has not received a stream-start event yet.
This is a convenience wrapper around gst_pad_get_sticky_event() and gst_event_parse_stream_start().
The returned stream-id string should be treated as an opaque string, its contents should not be interpreted.

function.name: gst_pad_has_current_caps
function.description: Check if @pad has caps set on it with a #GST_EVENT_CAPS event.
function.return: %TRUE when @pad has caps associated with it.

function.name: gst_pad_is_active
function.description: Query if a pad is active
function.return:
%TRUE if the pad is active.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_is_blocked
function.description: Checks if the pad is blocked or not. This function returns the last requested state of the pad. It is not certain that the pad is actually blocking at this point (see gst_pad_is_blocking()).
function.return:
%TRUE if the pad is blocked.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_is_blocking
function.description: Checks if the pad is blocking or not. This is a guaranteed state of whether the pad is actually blocking on a #GstBuffer or a #GstEvent.
function.return:
%TRUE if the pad is blocking.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_is_linked
function.description: Checks if a @pad is linked to another pad or not.
function.return:
%TRUE if the pad is linked, %FALSE otherwise.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_iterate_internal_links
function.description:
Gets an iterator for the pads to which the given pad is linked to inside of the parent element.
Each #GstPad element yielded by the iterator will have its refcount increased, so unref after use.
Free-function: gst_iterator_free

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: the GstPad to get the internal links of.

function.return: a new #GstIterator of #GstPad or %NULL when the pad does not have an iterator function configured. Use gst_iterator_free() after usage.

function.name: gst_pad_iterate_internal_links_default
function.description:
Iterate the list of pads to which the given pad is linked to inside of the parent element. This is the default handler, and thus returns an iterator of all of the pads inside the parent element with opposite direction.
The caller must free this iterator after use with gst_iterator_free().

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstPad to get the internal links of.

function.return: a #GstIterator of #GstPad, or %NULL if @pad has no parent. Unref each returned pad with gst_object_unref().

function.name: gst_pad_link
function.description: Links the source pad and the sink pad.
function.return:
A result code indicating if the connection worked or what went wrong.
MT Safe.

function.name: gst_pad_link_full
function.description:
Links the source pad and the sink pad.
This variant of #gst_pad_link provides a more granular control on the checks being done when linking. While providing some considerable speedups the caller of this method must be aware that wrong usage of those flags can cause severe issues. Refer to the documentation of #GstPadLinkCheck for more information.
MT Safe.

parameter.name: flags
parameter.parameter_description: the checks to validate when linking

function.return: A result code indicating if the connection worked or what went wrong.

function.name: gst_pad_link_get_name
function.description: Gets a string representing the given pad-link return.

parameter.name: ret
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPadLinkReturn to get the name of.

function.return: a static string with the name of the pad-link return.

function.name: gst_pad_mark_reconfigure
function.description: Mark a pad for needing reconfiguration. The next call to gst_pad_check_reconfigure() will return %TRUE after this call.

function.name: gst_pad_mode_get_name
function.description: Return the name of a pad mode, for use in debug messages mostly.
function.return: short mnemonic for pad mode @mode

function.name: gst_pad_needs_reconfigure
function.description: Check the #GST_PAD_FLAG_NEED_RECONFIGURE flag on @pad and return %TRUE if the flag was set.
function.return: %TRUE is the GST_PAD_FLAG_NEED_RECONFIGURE flag is set on @pad.

function.name: gst_pad_new
function.description: Creates a new pad with the given name in the given direction. If name is %NULL, a guaranteed unique name (across all pads) will be assigned. This function makes a copy of the name so you can safely free the name.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the new pad.

function.return:
a new #GstPad, or %NULL in case of an error.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_new_from_static_template
function.description: Creates a new pad with the given name from the given static template. If name is %NULL, a guaranteed unique name (across all pads) will be assigned. This function makes a copy of the name so you can safely free the name.
function.return: a new #GstPad, or %NULL in case of an error.

function.name: gst_pad_new_from_template
function.description: Creates a new pad with the given name from the given template. If name is %NULL, a guaranteed unique name (across all pads) will be assigned. This function makes a copy of the name so you can safely free the name.
function.return: a new #GstPad, or %NULL in case of an error.

function.name: gst_pad_pause_task
function.description: Pause the task of @pad. This function will also wait until the function executed by the task is finished if this function is not called from the task function.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstPad to pause the task of

function.return: a %TRUE if the task could be paused or %FALSE when the pad has no task.

function.name: gst_pad_peer_query
function.description:
Performs gst_pad_query() on the peer of @pad.
The caller is responsible for both the allocation and deallocation of the query structure.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad to invoke the peer query on.

function.return: %TRUE if the query could be performed. This function returns %FALSE if @pad has no peer.

function.name: gst_pad_peer_query_accept_caps
function.description: Check if the peer of @pad accepts @caps. If @pad has no peer, this function returns %TRUE.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad to check the peer of

parameter.name: caps
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstCaps to check on the pad

function.return: %TRUE if the peer of @pad can accept the caps or @pad has no peer.

function.name: gst_pad_peer_query_caps
function.description:
Gets the capabilities of the peer connected to this pad. Similar to gst_pad_query_caps().
When called on srcpads @filter contains the caps that upstream could produce in the order preferred by upstream. When called on sinkpads @filter contains the caps accepted by downstream in the preferred order. @filter might be %NULL but if it is not %NULL the returned caps will be a subset of @filter.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad to get the capabilities of.

function.return: the caps of the peer pad with incremented ref-count. When there is no peer pad, this function returns @filter or, when @filter is %NULL, ANY caps.

function.name: gst_pad_peer_query_convert
function.description: Queries the peer pad of a given sink pad to convert @src_val in @src_format to @dest_format.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad, on whose peer pad to invoke the convert query on. Must be a sink pad.

function.return: %TRUE if the query could be performed.

function.name: gst_pad_peer_query_duration
function.description: Queries the peer pad of a given sink pad for the total stream duration.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad on whose peer pad to invoke the duration query on. Must be a sink pad.

parameter.name: duration
parameter.parameter_description: a location in which to store the total duration, or %NULL.

function.return: %TRUE if the query could be performed.

function.name: gst_pad_peer_query_position
function.description: Queries the peer of a given sink pad for the stream position.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad on whose peer to invoke the position query on. Must be a sink pad.

parameter.name: cur
parameter.parameter_description: a location in which to store the current position, or %NULL.

function.return: %TRUE if the query could be performed.

function.name: gst_pad_probe_info_get_buffer
function.return: The #GstBuffer from the probe

function.name: gst_pad_probe_info_get_buffer_list
function.return: The #GstBufferList from the probe

function.name: gst_pad_probe_info_get_event
function.return: The #GstEvent from the probe

function.name: gst_pad_probe_info_get_query
function.return: The #GstQuery from the probe

function.name: gst_pad_proxy_query_accept_caps
function.description:
Checks if all internally linked pads of @pad accepts the caps in @query and returns the intersection of the results.
This function is useful as a default accept caps query function for an element that can handle any stream format, but requires caps that are acceptable for all opposite pads.
function.return: %TRUE if @query could be executed

function.name: gst_pad_proxy_query_caps
function.description:
Calls gst_pad_query_caps() for all internally linked pads of @pad and returns the intersection of the results.
This function is useful as a default caps query function for an element that can handle any stream format, but requires all its pads to have the same caps. Two such elements are tee and adder.
function.return: %TRUE if @query could be executed

function.name: gst_pad_pull_range
function.description:
Pulls a @buffer from the peer pad or fills up a provided buffer.
This function will first trigger the pad block signal if it was installed.
When @pad is not linked #GST_FLOW_NOT_LINKED is returned else this function returns the result of gst_pad_get_range() on the peer pad. See gst_pad_get_range() for a list of return values and for the semantics of the arguments of this function.
If @buffer points to a variable holding %NULL, a valid new #GstBuffer will be placed in @buffer when this function returns #GST_FLOW_OK. The new buffer must be freed with gst_buffer_unref() after usage. When this function returns any other result value, @buffer will still point to %NULL.
When @buffer points to a variable that points to a valid #GstBuffer, the buffer will be filled with the result data when this function returns #GST_FLOW_OK. When this function returns any other result value, @buffer will be unchanged. If the provided buffer is larger than @size, only @size bytes will be filled in the result buffer and its size will be updated accordingly.
Note that less than @size bytes can be returned in @buffer when, for example, an EOS condition is near or when @buffer is not large enough to hold @size bytes. The caller should check the result buffer size to get the result size.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a sink #GstPad, returns GST_FLOW_ERROR if not.

parameter.name: offset
parameter.parameter_description: The start offset of the buffer

parameter.name: buffer
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to hold the #GstBuffer, returns GST_FLOW_ERROR if %NULL.

function.return:
a #GstFlowReturn from the peer pad.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_push
function.description:
Pushes a buffer to the peer of @pad.
This function will call installed block probes before triggering any installed data probes.
The function proceeds calling gst_pad_chain() on the peer pad and returns the value from that function. If @pad has no peer, #GST_FLOW_NOT_LINKED will be returned.
In all cases, success or failure, the caller loses its reference to @buffer after calling this function.

parameter.name: buffer
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstBuffer to push returns GST_FLOW_ERROR if not.

function.return:
a #GstFlowReturn from the peer pad.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_push_event
function.description:
Sends the event to the peer of the given pad. This function is mainly used by elements to send events to their peer elements.
This function takes ownership of the provided event so you should gst_event_ref() it if you want to reuse the event after this call.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad to push the event to.

parameter.name: event
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstEvent to send to the pad.

function.return:
%TRUE if the event was handled.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_push_list
function.description:
Pushes a buffer list to the peer of @pad.
This function will call installed block probes before triggering any installed data probes.
The function proceeds calling the chain function on the peer pad and returns the value from that function. If @pad has no peer, #GST_FLOW_NOT_LINKED will be returned. If the peer pad does not have any installed chainlist function every group buffer of the list will be merged into a normal #GstBuffer and chained via gst_pad_chain().
In all cases, success or failure, the caller loses its reference to @list after calling this function.

parameter.name: list
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstBufferList to push returns GST_FLOW_ERROR if not.

function.return:
a #GstFlowReturn from the peer pad.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_query
function.description:
Dispatches a query to a pad. The query should have been allocated by the caller via one of the type-specific allocation functions. The element that the pad belongs to is responsible for filling the query with an appropriate response, which should then be parsed with a type-specific query parsing function.
Again, the caller is responsible for both the allocation and deallocation of the query structure.
Please also note that some queries might need a running pipeline to work.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad to invoke the default query on.

function.return: %TRUE if the query could be performed.

function.name: gst_pad_query_accept_caps
function.description: Check if the given pad accepts the caps.

parameter.name: caps
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstCaps to check on the pad

function.return: %TRUE if the pad can accept the caps.

function.name: gst_pad_query_caps
function.description:
Gets the capabilities this pad can produce or consume. Note that this method doesn't necessarily return the caps set by sending a gst_event_new_caps() - use gst_pad_get_current_caps() for that instead. gst_pad_query_caps returns all possible caps a pad can operate with, using the pad's CAPS query function, If the query fails, this function will return @filter, if not %NULL, otherwise ANY.
When called on sinkpads @filter contains the caps that upstream could produce in the order preferred by upstream. When called on srcpads @filter contains the caps accepted by downstream in the preferred order. @filter might be %NULL but if it is not %NULL the returned caps will be a subset of @filter.
Note that this function does not return writable #GstCaps, use gst_caps_make_writable() before modifying the caps.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad to get the capabilities of.

function.return: the caps of the pad with incremented ref-count.

function.name: gst_pad_query_convert
function.description: Queries a pad to convert @src_val in @src_format to @dest_format.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad to invoke the convert query on.

function.return: %TRUE if the query could be performed.

function.name: gst_pad_query_default
function.description: Invokes the default query handler for the given pad. The query is sent to all pads internally linked to @pad. Note that if there are many possible sink pads that are internally linked to @pad, only one will be sent the query. Multi-sinkpad elements should implement custom query handlers.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad to call the default query handler on.

function.return: %TRUE if the query was performed successfully.

function.name: gst_pad_query_duration
function.description: Queries a pad for the total stream duration.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad to invoke the duration query on.

parameter.name: duration
parameter.parameter_description: a location in which to store the total duration, or %NULL.

function.return: %TRUE if the query could be performed.

function.name: gst_pad_query_position
function.description: Queries a pad for the stream position.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad to invoke the position query on.

parameter.name: cur
parameter.parameter_description: A location in which to store the current position, or %NULL.

function.return: %TRUE if the query could be performed.

function.name: gst_pad_remove_probe
function.description:
Remove the probe with @id from @pad.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_send_event
function.description:
Sends the event to the pad. This function can be used by applications to send events in the pipeline.
If @pad is a source pad, @event should be an upstream event. If @pad is a sink pad, @event should be a downstream event. For example, you would not send a #GST_EVENT_EOS on a src pad; EOS events only propagate downstream. Furthermore, some downstream events have to be serialized with data flow, like EOS, while some can travel out-of-band, like #GST_EVENT_FLUSH_START. If the event needs to be serialized with data flow, this function will take the pad's stream lock while calling its event function.
To find out whether an event type is upstream, downstream, or downstream and serialized, see #GstEventTypeFlags, gst_event_type_get_flags(), #GST_EVENT_IS_UPSTREAM, #GST_EVENT_IS_DOWNSTREAM, and #GST_EVENT_IS_SERIALIZED. Note that in practice that an application or plugin doesn't need to bother itself with this information; the core handles all necessary locks and checks.
This function takes ownership of the provided event so you should gst_event_ref() it if you want to reuse the event after this call.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad to send the event to.

parameter.name: event
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstEvent to send to the pad.

function.return: %TRUE if the event was handled.

function.name: gst_pad_set_activate_function
function.description: Calls gst_pad_set_activate_function_full() with %NULL for the user_data and notify.

function.name: gst_pad_set_activate_function_full
function.description:
Sets the given activate function for @pad. The activate function will dispatch to gst_pad_activate_mode() to perform the actual activation. Only makes sense to set on sink pads.
Call this function if your sink pad can start a pull-based task.

parameter.name: notify
parameter.parameter_description: notify called when @activate will not be used anymore.

function.name: gst_pad_set_activatemode_function
function.description: Calls gst_pad_set_activatemode_function_full() with %NULL for the user_data and notify.

function.name: gst_pad_set_activatemode_function_full
function.description: Sets the given activate_mode function for the pad. An activate_mode function prepares the element for data passing.

parameter.name: notify
parameter.parameter_description: notify called when @activatemode will not be used anymore.

function.name: gst_pad_set_active
function.description:
Activates or deactivates the given pad. Normally called from within core state change functions.
If @active, makes sure the pad is active. If it is already active, either in push or pull mode, just return. Otherwise dispatches to the pad's activate function to perform the actual activation.
If not @active, calls gst_pad_activate_mode() with the pad's current mode and a %FALSE argument.

parameter.name: active
parameter.parameter_description: whether or not the pad should be active.

function.return:
%TRUE if the operation was successful.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_set_chain_function
function.description: Calls gst_pad_set_chain_function_full() with %NULL for the user_data and notify.

function.name: gst_pad_set_chain_function_full
function.description: Sets the given chain function for the pad. The chain function is called to process a #GstBuffer input buffer. see #GstPadChainFunction for more details.

parameter.name: notify
parameter.parameter_description: notify called when @chain will not be used anymore.

function.name: gst_pad_set_chain_list_function
function.description: Calls gst_pad_set_chain_list_function_full() with %NULL for the user_data and notify.

function.name: gst_pad_set_chain_list_function_full
function.description: Sets the given chain list function for the pad. The chainlist function is called to process a #GstBufferList input buffer list. See #GstPadChainListFunction for more details.

parameter.name: notify
parameter.parameter_description: notify called when @chainlist will not be used anymore.

function.name: gst_pad_set_element_private
function.description: Set the given private data gpointer on the pad. This function can only be used by the element that owns the pad. No locking is performed in this function.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstPad to set the private data of.

parameter.name: priv
parameter.parameter_description: The private data to attach to the pad.

function.name: gst_pad_set_event_full_function
function.description: Calls gst_pad_set_event_full_function_full() with %NULL for the user_data and notify.

function.name: gst_pad_set_event_full_function_full
function.description: Sets the given event handler for the pad.

parameter.name: notify
parameter.parameter_description: notify called when @event will not be used anymore.

function.name: gst_pad_set_event_function
function.description: Calls gst_pad_set_event_function_full() with %NULL for the user_data and notify.

function.name: gst_pad_set_event_function_full
function.description: Sets the given event handler for the pad.

parameter.name: notify
parameter.parameter_description: notify called when @event will not be used anymore.

function.name: gst_pad_set_getrange_function
function.description: Calls gst_pad_set_getrange_function_full() with %NULL for the user_data and notify.

function.name: gst_pad_set_getrange_function_full
function.description: Sets the given getrange function for the pad. The getrange function is called to produce a new #GstBuffer to start the processing pipeline. see #GstPadGetRangeFunction for a description of the getrange function.

parameter.name: notify
parameter.parameter_description: notify called when @get will not be used anymore.

function.name: gst_pad_set_iterate_internal_links_function
function.description: Calls gst_pad_set_iterate_internal_links_function_full() with %NULL for the user_data and notify.

function.name: gst_pad_set_iterate_internal_links_function_full
function.description: Sets the given internal link iterator function for the pad.

parameter.name: notify
parameter.parameter_description: notify called when @iterintlink will not be used anymore.

function.name: gst_pad_set_link_function
function.description: Calls gst_pad_set_link_function_full() with %NULL for the user_data and notify.

function.name: gst_pad_set_link_function_full
function.description:
Sets the given link function for the pad. It will be called when the pad is linked with another pad.
The return value #GST_PAD_LINK_OK should be used when the connection can be made.
The return value #GST_PAD_LINK_REFUSED should be used when the connection cannot be made for some reason.
If @link is installed on a source pad, it should call the #GstPadLinkFunction of the peer sink pad, if present.

parameter.name: notify
parameter.parameter_description: notify called when @link will not be used anymore.

function.name: gst_pad_set_offset
function.description: Set the offset that will be applied to the running time of @pad.

function.name: gst_pad_set_query_function
function.description: Calls gst_pad_set_query_function_full() with %NULL for the user_data and notify.

function.name: gst_pad_set_query_function_full
function.description: Set the given query function for the pad.

parameter.name: notify
parameter.parameter_description: notify called when @query will not be used anymore.

function.name: gst_pad_set_unlink_function
function.description: Calls gst_pad_set_unlink_function_full() with %NULL for the user_data and notify.

function.name: gst_pad_set_unlink_function_full
function.description: Sets the given unlink function for the pad. It will be called when the pad is unlinked.

parameter.name: notify
parameter.parameter_description: notify called when @unlink will not be used anymore.

function.name: gst_pad_start_task
function.description: Starts a task that repeatedly calls @func with @user_data. This function is mostly used in pad activation functions to start the dataflow. The #GST_PAD_STREAM_LOCK of @pad will automatically be acquired before @func is called.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstPad to start the task of

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: user data passed to the task function

parameter.name: notify
parameter.parameter_description: called when @user_data is no longer referenced

function.return: a %TRUE if the task could be started.

function.name: gst_pad_sticky_events_foreach
