function.description: Get a printable name for the given query type. Do not modify or free.
function.return: a reference to the static name of the query.

function.name: gst_query_type_to_quark
function.description: Get the unique quark for the given query type.
function.return: the quark associated with the query type

function.name: gst_query_unref
function.description: Decreases the refcount of the query. If the refcount reaches 0, the query will be freed.

parameter.name: q
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstQuery to decrease the refcount of.

function.name: gst_query_writable_structure
function.description: Get the structure of a query. This method should be called with a writable @query so that the returned structure is guaranteed to be writable.
function.return: the #GstStructure of the query. The structure is still owned by the query and will therefore be freed when the query is unreffed.

function.name: gst_queue_array_drop_element
function.description: Drops the queue element at position @idx from queue @array.
function.return: the dropped element

function.name: gst_queue_array_drop_struct

parameter.name: p_struct
parameter.parameter_description: address into which to store the data of the dropped structure, or NULL

function.return: TRUE on success, or FALSE on error

function.name: gst_queue_array_find
function.description:
Finds an element in the queue @array, either by comparing every element with @func or by looking up @data if no compare function @func is provided, and returning the index of the found element.
Note that the index is not 0-based, but an internal index number with a random offset. The index can be used in connection with gst_queue_array_drop_element(). FIXME: return index 0-based and make gst_queue_array_drop_element() take a 0-based index.

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: comparison function, or %NULL to find @data by value

function.return: Index of the found element or -1 if nothing was found.

function.name: gst_queue_array_free
function.description: Frees queue @array and all memory associated to it.

function.name: gst_queue_array_get_length
function.description: Returns the length of the queue @array
function.return: the length of the queue @array.

function.name: gst_queue_array_is_empty
function.description: Checks if the queue @array is empty.
function.return: %TRUE if the queue @array is empty

function.name: gst_queue_array_new
function.description: Allocates a new #GstQueueArray object with an initial queue size of @initial_size.

parameter.name: initial_size
parameter.parameter_description: Initial size of the new queue

function.return: a new #GstQueueArray object

function.name: gst_queue_array_new_for_struct
function.description: Allocates a new #GstQueueArray object for elements (e.g. structures) of size @struct_size, with an initial queue size of @initial_size.

parameter.name: struct_size
parameter.parameter_description: Size of each element (e.g. structure) in the array

parameter.name: initial_size
parameter.parameter_description: Initial size of the new queue

function.return: a new #GstQueueArray object

function.name: gst_queue_array_peek_head
function.description: Returns the head of the queue @array and does not remove it from the queue.
function.return: The head of the queue

function.name: gst_queue_array_peek_head_struct
function.description: Returns the head of the queue @array without removing it from the queue.
function.return: pointer to element or struct, or NULL if @array was empty. The data pointed to by the returned pointer stays valid only as long as the queue array is not modified further!

function.name: gst_queue_array_pop_head
function.description: Returns and head of the queue @array and removes it from the queue.
function.return: The head of the queue

function.name: gst_queue_array_pop_head_struct
function.description: Returns the head of the queue @array and removes it from the queue.
function.return: pointer to element or struct, or NULL if @array was empty. The data pointed to by the returned pointer stays valid only as long as the queue array is not modified further!

function.name: gst_queue_array_push_element_tail
function.description: Pushes the element at address @p_struct to the tail of the queue @array (Copies the contents of a structure of the struct_size specified when creating the queue into the array).

parameter.name: p_struct
parameter.parameter_description: address of element or structure to push to the tail of the queue

function.name: gst_queue_array_push_tail
function.description: Pushes @data to the tail of the queue @array.

function.name: gst_registry_add_feature
function.description: Add the feature to the registry. The feature-added signal will be emitted. This function sinks @feature.

parameter.name: registry
parameter.parameter_description: the registry to add the plugin to

function.return:
%TRUE on success.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_registry_add_path
function.description: Add the given path to the registry. The syntax of the path is specific to the registry. If the path has already been added, do nothing.

parameter.name: registry
parameter.parameter_description: the registry to add the path to

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: the path to add to the registry

function.name: gst_registry_add_plugin
function.description: Add the plugin to the registry. The plugin-added signal will be emitted. This function will sink @plugin.

parameter.name: registry
parameter.parameter_description: the registry to add the plugin to

function.return:
%TRUE on success.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_registry_binary_read_cache
function.description: Read the contents of the binary cache file at @location into @registry.
function.return: %TRUE on success.

function.name: gst_registry_binary_write_cache
function.description: Write the @registry to a cache to file at given @location.
function.return: %TRUE on success.

function.name: gst_registry_check_feature_version
function.return: %TRUE if the feature could be found and the version is the same as the required version or newer, and %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_registry_feature_filter
function.description: Runs a filter against all features of the plugins in the registry and returns a GList with the results. If the first flag is set, only the first match is returned (as a list with a single object).

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: user data passed to the filter function

function.return:
a #GList of #GstPluginFeature. Use gst_plugin_feature_list_free() after usage.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_registry_find_feature
function.description: Find the pluginfeature with the given name and type in the registry.
function.return:
the pluginfeature with the given name and type or %NULL if the plugin was not found. gst_object_unref() after usage.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_registry_find_plugin
function.description: Find the plugin with the given name in the registry. The plugin will be reffed; caller is responsible for unreffing.
function.return:
the plugin with the given name or %NULL if the plugin was not found. gst_object_unref() after usage.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_registry_fork_is_enabled
function.description:
By default GStreamer will perform scanning and rebuilding of the registry file using a helper child process.
Applications might want to disable this behaviour with the gst_registry_fork_set_enabled() function, in which case new plugins are scanned (and loaded) into the application process.
function.return: %TRUE if GStreamer will use the child helper process when rebuilding the registry.

function.name: gst_registry_fork_set_enabled
function.description: Applications might want to disable/enable spawning of a child helper process when rebuilding the registry. See gst_registry_fork_is_enabled() for more information.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.parameter_description: whether rebuilding the registry can use a temporary child helper process.

function.name: gst_registry_get
function.description: Retrieves the singleton plugin registry. The caller does not own a reference on the registry, as it is alive as long as GStreamer is initialized.
function.return: the #GstRegistry.

function.name: gst_registry_get_feature_list
function.description: Retrieves a #GList of #GstPluginFeature of @type.
function.return:
a #GList of #GstPluginFeature of @type. Use gst_plugin_feature_list_free() after use
MT safe.

function.name: gst_registry_get_feature_list_by_plugin
function.description: Retrieves a #GList of features of the plugin with name @name.
function.return: a #GList of #GstPluginFeature. Use gst_plugin_feature_list_free() after usage.

function.name: gst_registry_get_feature_list_cookie
function.description: Returns the registry's feature list cookie. This changes every time a feature is added or removed from the registry.
function.return: the feature list cookie.

function.name: gst_registry_get_path_list
function.description: Get the list of paths for the given registry.

parameter.name: registry
parameter.parameter_description: the registry to get the pathlist of

function.return:
A #GList of paths as strings. g_list_free after use.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_registry_get_plugin_list
function.description: Get a copy of all plugins registered in the given registry. The refcount of each element in the list in incremented.
function.return:
a #GList of #GstPlugin. Use gst_plugin_list_free() after usage.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_registry_lookup
function.description: Look up a plugin in the given registry with the given filename. If found, plugin is reffed.

parameter.name: registry
parameter.parameter_description: the registry to look up in

parameter.name: filename
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the file to look up

function.return: the #GstPlugin if found, or %NULL if not. gst_object_unref() after usage.

function.name: gst_registry_lookup_feature
function.description: Find a #GstPluginFeature with @name in @registry.
function.return:
a #GstPluginFeature with its refcount incremented, use gst_object_unref() after usage.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_registry_plugin_filter
function.description: Runs a filter against all plugins in the registry and returns a #GList with the results. If the first flag is set, only the first match is returned (as a list with a single object). Every plugin is reffed; use gst_plugin_list_free() after use, which will unref again.

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: user data passed to the filter function

function.return:
a #GList of #GstPlugin. Use gst_plugin_list_free() after usage.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_registry_remove_feature
function.description:
Remove the feature from the registry.
MT safe.

parameter.name: registry
parameter.parameter_description: the registry to remove the feature from

function.name: gst_registry_remove_plugin
function.description:
Remove the plugin from the registry.
MT safe.

parameter.name: registry
parameter.parameter_description: the registry to remove the plugin from

function.name: gst_registry_scan_path
function.description: Scan the given path for plugins to add to the registry. The syntax of the path is specific to the registry.

parameter.name: registry
parameter.parameter_description: the registry to add found plugins to

function.return: %TRUE if registry changed

parameter.name: strh
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to the strh stream header structure.

parameter.name: strf
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to the strf stream header structure, including any data that is within the range of strf.size, but excluding any additional data withint this chunk but outside strf.size.

parameter.name: strf_data
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstBuffer containing the additional data in the strf chunk outside reach of strf.size. Ususally a palette.

parameter.name: strd_data
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstBuffer containing the data in the strd stream header chunk. Usually codec initialization data.

parameter.name: codec_name
parameter.parameter_description: if given, will be filled with a human-readable codec name.

function.name: gst_riff_init
function.description: Initialize riff library.

function.name: gst_riff_parse_chunk
function.description: Reads a single chunk.

parameter.name: offset
parameter.parameter_description: offset in the buffer in the caller. Is incremented by the read size by this function.

parameter.name: fourcc
parameter.parameter_description: fourcc (returned by this function0 of the chunk.

parameter.name: chunk_data
parameter.parameter_description: buffer (returned by the function) containing the chunk data, which may be NULL if chunksize == 0

function.return: FALSE on error, TRUE otherwise

function.name: gst_riff_parse_file_header
function.description: Reads the first few bytes from the provided buffer, checks if this stream is a RIFF stream, and determines document type. This function takes ownership of @buf so it should not be used anymore after calling this function.

parameter.name: buf
parameter.parameter_description: input buffer from which the file header will be parsed, should be at least 12 bytes long.

parameter.name: doctype
parameter.parameter_description: a fourcc (returned by this function) to indicate the type of document (according to the header).

function.return: FALSE if this is not a RIFF stream (in which case the caller should error out; we already throw an error), or TRUE if it is.

function.name: gst_riff_parse_info
function.description: Parses stream metadata from input data.

parameter.name: buf
parameter.parameter_description: input data to be used for parsing, stripped from header.

parameter.name: taglist
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to a taglist (returned by this function) containing information about this stream. May be NULL if no supported tags were found.

function.name: gst_riff_parse_strf_auds
function.description: Parses an audio streams strf structure plus optionally some extradata from input data. This function takes ownership of @buf. use.

parameter.name: buf
parameter.parameter_description: input data to be used for parsing, stripped from header.

parameter.name: strf
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer (returned by this function) to a filled-in strf/auds structure. Caller should free it.

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer (returned by this function) to a buffer containing extradata for this particular stream (e.g. codec initialization data).

function.return: TRUE if parsing succeeded, otherwise FALSE. The stream should be skipped on error, but it is not fatal.

function.name: gst_riff_parse_strf_iavs
function.description: Parses a interleaved (also known as "complex") streams strf structure plus optionally some extradata from input data. This function takes ownership of @buf.

parameter.name: buf
parameter.parameter_description: input data to be used for parsing, stripped from header.

parameter.name: strf
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer (returned by this function) to a filled-in strf/iavs structure. Caller should free it.

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer (returned by this function) to a buffer containing extradata for this particular stream (e.g. codec initialization data).

function.return: TRUE if parsing succeeded, otherwise FALSE.

function.name: gst_riff_parse_strf_vids
function.description: Parses a video streams strf structure plus optionally some extradata from input data. This function takes ownership of @buf.

parameter.name: buf
parameter.parameter_description: input data to be used for parsing, stripped from header.

parameter.name: strf
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer (returned by this function) to a filled-in strf/vids structure. Caller should free it.

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer (returned by this function) to a buffer containing extradata for this particular stream (e.g. palette, codec initialization data).

function.return: TRUE if parsing succeeded, otherwise FALSE. The stream should be skipped on error, but it is not fatal.

function.name: gst_riff_parse_strh
function.description: Parses a strh structure from input data. Takes ownership of @buf.

parameter.name: buf
parameter.parameter_description: input data to be used for parsing, stripped from header.

parameter.name: strh
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer (returned by this function) to a filled-in strh structure. Caller should free it.

function.return: TRUE if parsing succeeded, otherwise FALSE. The stream should be skipped on error, but it is not fatal.

function.name: gst_riff_read_chunk
function.description: Reads a single chunk of data. 'JUNK' chunks are skipped automatically.

parameter.name: offset
parameter.parameter_description: offset to pull from, incremented by this function.

parameter.name: tag
parameter.parameter_description: fourcc of the chunk (returned by this function).

function.return: flow status.

function.name: gst_ring_buffer_set_timestamp
function.description:
Set a new timestamp on the buffer.
MT safe.

parameter.name: timestamp
parameter.parameter_description: The new timestamp of the buffer.

function.name: gst_rtcp_buffer_add_packet
function.description: Add a new packet of @type to @rtcp. @packet will point to the newly created packet.
function.return: %TRUE if the packet could be created. This function returns %FALSE if the max mtu is exceeded for the buffer.

function.name: gst_rtcp_buffer_get_first_packet
function.description: Initialize a new #GstRTCPPacket pointer that points to the first packet in @rtcp.
function.return: TRUE if the packet existed in @rtcp.

function.name: gst_rtcp_buffer_get_packet_count
function.description: Get the number of RTCP packets in @rtcp.
function.return: the number of RTCP packets in @rtcp.

function.name: gst_rtcp_buffer_map
function.description: Open @buffer for reading or writing, depending on @flags. The resulting RTCP buffer state is stored in @rtcp.

parameter.name: buffer
parameter.parameter_description: a buffer with an RTCP packet

function.name: gst_rtcp_buffer_new
function.description: Create a new buffer for constructing RTCP packets. The packet will have a maximum size of @mtu.
function.return: A newly allocated buffer.

function.name: gst_rtcp_buffer_new_copy_data
function.description: Create a new buffer and set the data to a copy of @len bytes of @data and the size to @len. The data will be freed when the buffer is freed.
function.return: A newly allocated buffer with a copy of @data and of size @len.

function.name: gst_rtcp_buffer_new_take_data
function.description: Create a new buffer and set the data and size of the buffer to @data and @len respectively. @data will be freed when the buffer is unreffed, so this function transfers ownership of @data to the new buffer.
function.return: A newly allocated buffer with @data and of size @len.

function.name: gst_rtcp_buffer_unmap
function.description:
Finish @rtcp after being constructed. This function is usually called after gst_rtcp_buffer_map() and after adding the RTCP items to the new buffer.
The function adjusts the size of @rtcp with the total length of all the added packets.

parameter.name: rtcp
parameter.parameter_description: a buffer with an RTCP packet

function.name: gst_rtcp_buffer_validate
function.description: Check if the data pointed to by @buffer is a valid RTCP packet using gst_rtcp_buffer_validate_data().
function.return: TRUE if @buffer is a valid RTCP packet.

function.name: gst_rtcp_buffer_validate_data
function.description: Check if the @data and @size point to the data of a valid compound, non-reduced size RTCP packet. Use this function to validate a packet before using the other functions in this module.
function.return: TRUE if the data points to a valid RTCP packet.

function.name: gst_rtcp_buffer_validate_data_reduced
function.description:
Check if the @data and @size point to the data of a valid RTCP packet. Use this function to validate a packet before using the other functions in this module.
This function is updated to support reduced size rtcp packets according to RFC 5506 and will validate full compound RTCP packets as well as reduced size RTCP packets.
function.return: TRUE if the data points to a valid RTCP packet.

function.name: gst_rtcp_buffer_validate_reduced
function.description: Check if the data pointed to by @buffer is a valid RTCP packet using gst_rtcp_buffer_validate_reduced().
function.return: TRUE if @buffer is a valid RTCP packet.

function.name: gst_rtcp_ntp_to_unix
function.description: Converts an NTP time to UNIX nanoseconds. @ntptime can typically be the NTP time of an SR RTCP message and contains, in the upper 32 bits, the number of seconds since 1900 and, in the lower 32 bits, the fractional seconds. The resulting value will be the number of nanoseconds since 1970.
function.return: the UNIX time for @ntptime in nanoseconds.

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_add_rb
function.description: Add a new report block to @packet with the given values.

parameter.name: packetslost
parameter.parameter_description: the cumululative number of packets lost

parameter.name: exthighestseq
parameter.parameter_description: the extended last sequence number received

parameter.name: lsr
parameter.parameter_description: the last SR packet from this source

parameter.name: dlsr
parameter.parameter_description: the delay since last SR packet

function.return: %TRUE if the packet was created. This function can return %FALSE if the max MTU is exceeded or the number of report blocks is greater than #GST_RTCP_MAX_RB_COUNT.

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_bye_add_ssrc
function.description: Add @ssrc to the BYE @packet.
function.return: %TRUE if the ssrc was added. This function can return %FALSE if the max MTU is exceeded or the number of sources blocks is greater than #GST_RTCP_MAX_BYE_SSRC_COUNT.

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_bye_add_ssrcs
function.description: Adds @len SSRCs in @ssrc to BYE @packet.

parameter.name: ssrc
parameter.parameter_description: an array of SSRCs to add

function.return: %TRUE if the all the SSRCs were added. This function can return %FALSE if the max MTU is exceeded or the number of sources blocks is greater than #GST_RTCP_MAX_BYE_SSRC_COUNT.

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_bye_get_nth_ssrc
function.description: Get the @nth SSRC of the BYE @packet.
function.return: The @nth SSRC of @packet.

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_bye_get_reason
function.description: Get the reason in @packet.
function.return: The reason for the BYE @packet or NULL if the packet did not contain a reason string. The string must be freed with g_free() after usage.

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_bye_get_reason_len
function.description: Get the length of the reason string.
function.return: The length of the reason string or 0 when there is no reason string present.

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_bye_get_ssrc_count
function.description: Get the number of SSRC fields in @packet.
function.return: The number of SSRC fields in @packet.

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_bye_set_reason
function.description: Set the reason string to @reason in @packet.
function.return: TRUE if the string could be set.

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_fb_get_fci
function.description: Get the Feedback Control Information attached to a RTPFB or PSFB @packet.
function.return: a pointer to the FCI

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_fb_get_fci_length
function.description: Get the length of the Feedback Control Information attached to a RTPFB or PSFB @packet.
function.return: The length of the FCI in 32-bit words.

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_fb_get_media_ssrc
function.description: Get the media SSRC field of the RTPFB or PSFB @packet.
function.return: the media SSRC.

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_fb_get_sender_ssrc
function.description: Get the sender SSRC field of the RTPFB or PSFB @packet.
function.return: the sender SSRC.

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_fb_get_type
function.description: Get the feedback message type of the FB @packet.
function.return: The feedback message type.

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_fb_set_fci_length
function.description: Set the length of the Feedback Control Information attached to a RTPFB or PSFB @packet.

parameter.name: wordlen
parameter.parameter_description: Length of the FCI in 32-bit words

function.return: %TRUE if there was enough space in the packet to add this much FCI

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_fb_set_media_ssrc
function.description: Set the media SSRC field of the RTPFB or PSFB @packet.

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_fb_set_sender_ssrc
function.description: Set the sender SSRC field of the RTPFB or PSFB @packet.

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_fb_set_type
function.description: Set the feedback message type of the FB @packet.

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_get_count
function.description: Get the count field in @packet.
function.return: The count field in @packet or -1 if @packet does not point to a valid packet.

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_get_length
function.description: Get the length field of @packet. This is the length of the packet in 32-bit words minus one.
function.return: The length field of @packet.

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_get_padding
function.description: Get the packet padding of the packet pointed to by @packet.
function.return: If the packet has the padding bit set.

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_get_rb
function.description: Parse the values of the @nth report block in @packet and store the result in the values.

parameter.name: ssrc
parameter.parameter_description: result for data source being reported

parameter.name: fractionlost
parameter.parameter_description: result for fraction lost since last SR/RR

parameter.name: packetslost
parameter.parameter_description: result for the cumululative number of packets lost

parameter.name: exthighestseq
parameter.parameter_description: result for the extended last sequence number received

parameter.name: lsr
parameter.parameter_description: result for the last SR packet from this source

parameter.name: dlsr
parameter.parameter_description: result for the delay since last SR packet

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_get_rb_count
function.description: Get the number of report blocks in @packet.
function.return: The number of report blocks in @packet.

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_get_type
function.description: Get the packet type of the packet pointed to by @packet.
function.return: The packet type or GST_RTCP_TYPE_INVALID when @packet is not pointing to a valid packet.

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_move_to_next
function.description: Move the packet pointer @packet to the next packet in the payload. Use gst_rtcp_buffer_get_first_packet() to initialize @packet.
function.return: TRUE if @packet is pointing to a valid packet after calling this function.

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_remove
function.description: Removes the packet pointed to by @packet and moves pointer to the next one
function.return: TRUE if @packet is pointing to a valid packet after calling this function.

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_rr_get_ssrc
function.description: Get the ssrc field of the RR @packet.
function.return: the ssrc.

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_rr_set_ssrc
function.description: Set the ssrc field of the RR @packet.

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_sdes_add_entry
function.description: Add a new SDES entry to the current item in @packet.
function.return: %TRUE if the item could be added, %FALSE if the MTU has been reached.

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_sdes_add_item
function.description: Add a new SDES item for @ssrc to @packet.

parameter.name: ssrc
parameter.parameter_description: the SSRC of the new item to add

function.return: %TRUE if the item could be added, %FALSE if the maximum amount of items has been exceeded for the SDES packet or the MTU has been reached.

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_sdes_copy_entry
function.description: This function is like gst_rtcp_packet_sdes_get_entry() but it returns a null-terminated copy of the data instead. use g_free() after usage.

parameter.name: len
parameter.parameter_description: result length of the entry data

function.return: %TRUE if there was valid data.

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_sdes_first_entry
function.description: Move to the first SDES entry in the current item.
function.return: %TRUE if there was a first entry.

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_sdes_first_item
function.description: Move to the first SDES item in @packet.
function.return: TRUE if there was a first item.

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_sdes_get_entry
function.description:
Get the data of the current SDES item entry. @type (when not NULL) will contain the type of the entry. @data (when not NULL) will point to @len bytes.
When @type refers to a text item, @data will point to a UTF8 string. Note that this UTF8 string is NOT null-terminated. Use gst_rtcp_packet_sdes_copy_entry() to get a null-terminated copy of the entry.

parameter.name: len
parameter.parameter_description: result length of the entry data

function.return: %TRUE if there was valid data.

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_sdes_get_item_count
function.description: Get the number of items in the SDES packet @packet.
function.return: The number of items in @packet.

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_sdes_get_ssrc
function.description: Get the SSRC of the current SDES item.
function.return: the SSRC of the current item.

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_sdes_next_entry
function.description: Move to the next SDES entry in the current item.
function.return: %TRUE if there was a next entry.

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_sdes_next_item
function.description: Move to the next SDES item in @packet.
function.return: TRUE if there was a next item.

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_set_rb
function.description:
Set the @nth new report block in @packet with the given values.
Note: Not implemented.

parameter.name: nth
parameter.parameter_description: the nth report block to set

parameter.name: packetslost
parameter.parameter_description: the cumululative number of packets lost

parameter.name: exthighestseq
parameter.parameter_description: the extended last sequence number received

parameter.name: lsr
parameter.parameter_description: the last SR packet from this source

parameter.name: dlsr
parameter.parameter_description: the delay since last SR packet

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_sr_get_sender_info
function.description: Parse the SR sender info and store the values.

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_sr_set_sender_info
function.description: Set the given values in the SR packet @packet.

function.name: gst_rtcp_sdes_name_to_type
function.description: Convert @name into a @GstRTCPSDESType. @name is typically a key in a #GstStructure containing SDES items.
function.return: the #GstRTCPSDESType for @name or #GST_RTCP_SDES_PRIV when @name is a private sdes item.

function.name: gst_rtcp_sdes_type_to_name
function.description: Converts @type to the string equivalent. The string is typically used as a key in a #GstStructure containing SDES items.
function.return: the string equivalent of @type

function.name: gst_rtcp_unix_to_ntp
function.description: Converts a UNIX timestamp in nanoseconds to an NTP time. The caller should pass a value with nanoseconds since 1970. The NTP time will, in the upper 32 bits, contain the number of seconds since 1900 and, in the lower 32 bits, the fractional seconds. The resulting value can be used as an ntptime for constructing SR RTCP packets.
function.return: the NTP time for @unixtime.

function.name: gst_rtp_base_audio_payload_flush
function.description:
Create an RTP buffer and store @payload_len bytes of the adapter as the payload. Set the timestamp on the new buffer to @timestamp before pushing the buffer downstream.
If @payload_len is -1, all pending bytes will be flushed. If @timestamp is -1, the timestamp will be calculated automatically.
function.return: a #GstFlowReturn

function.name: gst_rtp_base_audio_payload_get_adapter
function.description: Gets the internal adapter used by the depayloader.
function.return: a #GstAdapter.

function.name: gst_rtp_base_audio_payload_push
function.description: Create an RTP buffer and store @payload_len bytes of @data as the payload. Set the timestamp on the new buffer to @timestamp before pushing the buffer downstream.
function.return: a #GstFlowReturn

function.name: gst_rtp_base_audio_payload_set_frame_based
function.description: Tells #GstRTPBaseAudioPayload that the child element is for a frame based audio codec

function.name: gst_rtp_base_audio_payload_set_frame_options
function.description: Sets the options for frame based audio codecs.

parameter.name: frame_duration
parameter.parameter_description: The duraction of an audio frame in milliseconds.

parameter.name: frame_size
parameter.parameter_description: The size of an audio frame in bytes.

function.name: gst_rtp_base_audio_payload_set_sample_based
function.description: Tells #GstRTPBaseAudioPayload that the child element is for a sample based audio codec

function.name: gst_rtp_base_audio_payload_set_sample_options
function.description: Sets the options for sample based audio codecs.

function.name: gst_rtp_base_audio_payload_set_samplebits_options
function.description: Sets the options for sample based audio codecs.

function.name: gst_rtp_base_depayload_push
function.description:
Push @out_buf to the peer of @filter. This function takes ownership of @out_buf.
This function will by default apply the last incomming timestamp on the outgoing buffer when it didn't have a timestamp already.
function.return: a #GstFlowReturn.

function.name: gst_rtp_base_depayload_push_list
function.description: Push @out_list to the peer of @filter. This function takes ownership of @out_list.
function.return: a #GstFlowReturn.

function.name: gst_rtp_base_payload_is_filled
function.description: Check if the packet with @size and @duration would exceed the configured maximum size.
function.return: %TRUE if the packet of @size and @duration would exceed the configured MTU or max_ptime.

function.name: gst_rtp_base_payload_push
function.description:
Push @buffer to the peer element of the payloader. The SSRC, payload type, seqnum and timestamp of the RTP buffer will be updated first.
This function takes ownership of @buffer.
function.return: a #GstFlowReturn.

function.name: gst_rtp_base_payload_push_list
function.description:
Push @list to the peer element of the payloader. The SSRC, payload type, seqnum and timestamp of the RTP buffer will be updated first.
This function takes ownership of @list.
function.return: a #GstFlowReturn.

function.name: gst_rtp_base_payload_set_options
function.description: Set the rtp options of the payloader. These options will be set in the caps of the payloader. Subclasses must call this method before calling gst_rtp_base_payload_push() or gst_rtp_base_payload_set_outcaps().

parameter.name: dynamic
parameter.parameter_description: if the payload type is dynamic

parameter.name: clock_rate
parameter.parameter_description: the clock rate of the media

function.name: gst_rtp_base_payload_set_outcaps
function.description:
Configure the output caps with the optional parameters.
Variable arguments should be in the form field name, field type (as a GType), value(s). The last variable argument should be NULL.
function.return: %TRUE if the caps could be set.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_add_extension_onebyte_header
function.description: Adds a RFC 5285 header extension with a one byte header to the end of the RTP header. If there is already a RFC 5285 header extension with a one byte header, the new extension will be appended. It will not work if there is already a header extension that does not follow the mecanism described in RFC 5285 or if there is a header extension with a two bytes header as described in RFC 5285. In that case, use gst_rtp_buffer_add_extension_twobytes_header()

parameter.name: id
parameter.parameter_description: The ID of the header extension (between 1 and 14).

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: the size of the data in bytes

function.return: %TRUE if header extension could be added

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_add_extension_twobytes_header
function.description: Adds a RFC 5285 header extension with a two bytes header to the end of the RTP header. If there is already a RFC 5285 header extension with a two bytes header, the new extension will be appended. It will not work if there is already a header extension that does not follow the mecanism described in RFC 5285 or if there is a header extension with a one byte header as described in RFC 5285. In that case, use gst_rtp_buffer_add_extension_onebyte_header()

parameter.name: id
parameter.parameter_description: The ID of the header extension

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: the size of the data in bytes

function.return: %TRUE if header extension could be added

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_allocate_data
function.description: Allocate enough data in @buffer to hold an RTP packet with @csrc_count CSRCs, a payload length of @payload_len and padding of @pad_len. @buffer must be writable and all previous memory in @buffer will be freed. If @pad_len is >0, the padding bit will be set. All other RTP header fields will be set to 0/FALSE.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_calc_header_len
function.description: Calculate the header length of an RTP packet with @csrc_count CSRC entries. An RTP packet can have at most 15 CSRC entries.
function.return: The length of an RTP header with @csrc_count CSRC entries.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_calc_packet_len
function.description: Calculate the total length of an RTP packet with a payload size of @payload_len, a padding of @pad_len and a @csrc_count CSRC entries.
function.return: The total length of an RTP header with given parameters.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_calc_payload_len
function.description: Calculate the length of the payload of an RTP packet with size @packet_len, a padding of @pad_len and a @csrc_count CSRC entries.

parameter.name: packet_len
parameter.parameter_description: the length of the total RTP packet

function.return: The length of the payload of an RTP packet with given parameters.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_compare_seqnum
function.description: Compare two sequence numbers, taking care of wraparounds. This function returns the difference between @seqnum1 and @seqnum2.
function.return: a negative value if @seqnum1 is bigger than @seqnum2, 0 if they are equal or a positive value if @seqnum1 is smaller than @segnum2.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_default_clock_rate
function.description: Get the default clock-rate for the static payload type @payload_type.
function.return: the default clock rate or -1 if the payload type is not static or the clock-rate is undefined.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_ext_timestamp
function.description:
Update the @exttimestamp field with @timestamp. For the first call of the method, @exttimestamp should point to a location with a value of -1.
This function makes sure that the returned value is a constantly increasing value even in the case where there is a timestamp wraparound.
function.return: The extended timestamp of @timestamp.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_get_csrc
function.description: Get the CSRC at index @idx in @buffer.

parameter.name: idx
parameter.parameter_description: the index of the CSRC to get

function.return: the CSRC at index @idx in host order.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_get_csrc_count
function.description: Get the CSRC count of the RTP packet in @buffer.
function.return: the CSRC count of @buffer.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_get_extension
function.description: Check if the extension bit is set on the RTP packet in @buffer.
function.return: TRUE if @buffer has the extension bit set.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_get_extension_bytes
function.description:
Similar to gst_rtp_buffer_get_extension_data, but more suitable for language bindings usage. @bits will contain the extension 16 bits of custom data and the extension data (not including the extension header) is placed in a new #GBytes structure.
If @rtp did not contain an extension, this function will return %NULL, with @bits unchanged. If there is an extension header but no extension data then an empty #GBytes will be returned.
function.return: A new #GBytes if an extension header was present and %NULL otherwise.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_get_extension_data
function.description:
Get the extension data. @bits will contain the extension 16 bits of custom data. @data will point to the data in the extension and @wordlen will contain the length of @data in 32 bits words.
If @buffer did not contain an extension, this function will return %FALSE with @bits, @data and @wordlen unchanged.

parameter.name: wordlen
parameter.parameter_description: location for length of @data in 32 bits words

function.return: TRUE if @buffer had the extension bit set.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_get_extension_onebyte_header
function.description: Parses RFC 5285 style header extensions with a one byte header. It will return the nth extension with the requested id.

parameter.name: id
parameter.parameter_description: The ID of the header extension to be read (between 1 and 14).

parameter.name: nth
parameter.parameter_description: Read the nth extension packet with the requested ID

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: the size of the data in bytes

function.return: TRUE if @buffer had the requested header extension

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_get_extension_twobytes_header
function.description: Parses RFC 5285 style header extensions with a two bytes header. It will return the nth extension with the requested id.

parameter.name: id
parameter.parameter_description: The ID of the header extension to be read (between 1 and 14).

parameter.name: nth
parameter.parameter_description: Read the nth extension packet with the requested ID

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: the size of the data in bytes

function.return: TRUE if @buffer had the requested header extension

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_get_header_len
function.description: Return the total length of the header in @buffer. This include the length of the fixed header, the CSRC list and the extension header.
function.return: The total length of the header in @buffer.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_get_marker
function.description: Check if the marker bit is set on the RTP packet in @buffer.
function.return: TRUE if @buffer has the marker bit set.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_get_packet_len
function.description: Return the total length of the packet in @buffer.
function.return: The total length of the packet in @buffer.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_get_padding
function.description: Check if the padding bit is set on the RTP packet in @buffer.
function.return: TRUE if @buffer has the padding bit set.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_get_payload
function.description: Get a pointer to the payload data in @buffer. This pointer is valid as long as a reference to @buffer is held.
function.return: A pointer to the payload data in @buffer.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_get_payload_buffer
function.description: Create a buffer of the payload of the RTP packet in @buffer. This function will internally create a subbuffer of @buffer so that a memcpy can be avoided.
function.return: A new buffer with the data of the payload.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_get_payload_bytes
function.description: Similar to gst_rtp_buffer_get_payload, but more suitable for language bindings usage. The return value is a pointer to a #GBytes structure containing the payload data in @rtp.
function.return: A new #GBytes containing the payload data in @rtp.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_get_payload_len
function.description: Get the length of the payload of the RTP packet in @buffer.
function.return: The length of the payload in @buffer.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_get_payload_subbuffer
function.description: Create a subbuffer of the payload of the RTP packet in @buffer. @offset bytes are skipped in the payload and the subbuffer will be of size @len. If @len is -1 the total payload starting from @offset is subbuffered.
function.return: A new buffer with the specified data of the payload.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_get_payload_type
function.description: Get the payload type of the RTP packet in @buffer.
function.return: The payload type.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_get_seq
function.description: Get the sequence number of the RTP packet in @buffer.
function.return: The sequence number in host order.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_get_ssrc
function.description: Get the SSRC of the RTP packet in @buffer.
function.return: the SSRC of @buffer in host order.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_get_timestamp
function.description: Get the timestamp of the RTP packet in @buffer.
function.return: The timestamp in host order.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_get_version
function.description: Get the version number of the RTP packet in @buffer.
function.return: The version of @buffer.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_map
function.description: Map the contents of @buffer into @rtp.
function.return: %TRUE if @buffer could be mapped.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_new_allocate
function.return: A newly allocated buffer that can hold an RTP packet with given parameters.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_new_allocate_len

parameter.name: packet_len
parameter.parameter_description: the total length of the packet

function.return: A newly allocated buffer that can hold an RTP packet of @packet_len.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_new_copy_data
function.description: Create a new buffer and set the data to a copy of @len bytes of @data and the size to @len. The data will be freed when the buffer is freed.
function.return: A newly allocated buffer with a copy of @data and of size @len.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_new_take_data
function.description: Create a new buffer and set the data and size of the buffer to @data and @len respectively. @data will be freed when the buffer is unreffed, so this function transfers ownership of @data to the new buffer.
function.return: A newly allocated buffer with @data and of size @len.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_pad_to
gst_rtp_buffer_set_csrc
function.description: Modify the CSRC at index @idx in @buffer to @csrc.

parameter.name: csrc
parameter.parameter_description: the CSRC in host order to set at @idx

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_set_extension
function.description: Set the extension bit on the RTP packet in @buffer to @extension.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_set_extension_data
function.description: Set the extension bit of the rtp buffer and fill in the @bits and @length of the extension header. If the existing extension data is not large enough, it will be made larger.

parameter.name: bits
parameter.parameter_description: the bits specific for the extension

parameter.name: length
parameter.parameter_description: the length that counts the number of 32-bit words in the extension, excluding the extension header ( therefore zero is a valid length)

function.return: True if done.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_set_marker
function.description: Set the marker bit on the RTP packet in @buffer to @marker.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_set_packet_len
function.description: Set the total @rtp size to @len. The data in the buffer will be made larger if needed. Any padding will be removed from the packet.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_set_padding
function.description: Set the padding bit on the RTP packet in @buffer to @padding.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_set_payload_type
function.description: Set the payload type of the RTP packet in @buffer to @payload_type.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_set_seq
function.description: Set the sequence number of the RTP packet in @buffer to @seq.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_set_ssrc
function.description: Set the SSRC on the RTP packet in @buffer to @ssrc.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_set_timestamp
function.description: Set the timestamp of the RTP packet in @buffer to @timestamp.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_set_version
function.description: Set the version of the RTP packet in @buffer to @version.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_unmap
function.description: Unmap @rtp previously mapped with gst_rtp_buffer_map().

function.name: gst_rtp_hdrext_get_ntp_56
function.description: Reads the NTP time from the @size NTP-56 extension bytes in @data and store the result in @ntptime.
function.return: %TRUE on success.

function.name: gst_rtp_hdrext_get_ntp_64
function.description: Reads the NTP time from the @size NTP-64 extension bytes in @data and store the result in @ntptime.
function.return: %TRUE on success.

function.name: gst_rtp_hdrext_set_ntp_56
function.description: Writes the NTP time in @ntptime to the format required for the NTP-56 header extension. @data must hold at least #GST_RTP_HDREXT_NTP_56_SIZE bytes.
function.return: %TRUE on success.

function.name: gst_rtp_hdrext_set_ntp_64
function.description: Writes the NTP time in @ntptime to the format required for the NTP-64 header extension. @data must hold at least #GST_RTP_HDREXT_NTP_64_SIZE bytes.
function.return: %TRUE on success.

function.name: gst_rtp_payload_info_for_name
function.description:
Get the #GstRTPPayloadInfo for @media and @encoding_name. This function is mostly used to get the default clock-rate and bandwidth for dynamic payload types specified with @media and @encoding name.
The search for @encoding_name will be performed in a case insensitve way.
function.return: a #GstRTPPayloadInfo or NULL when no info could be found.

function.name: gst_rtp_payload_info_for_pt
function.description: Get the #GstRTPPayloadInfo for @payload_type. This function is mostly used to get the default clock-rate and bandwidth for static payload types specified with @payload_type.
function.return: a #GstRTPPayloadInfo or NULL when no info could be found.

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_accept
function.description: Accept a new connection on @socket and create a new #GstRTSPConnection for handling communication on new socket.
function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK when @conn contains a valid connection.

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_clear_auth_params
function.description: Clear the list of authentication directives stored in @conn.

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_close
function.description: Close the connected @conn. After this call, the connection is in the same state as when it was first created.
function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK on success.

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_connect
function.description:
Attempt to connect to the url of @conn made with gst_rtsp_connection_create(). If @timeout is #NULL this function can block forever. If @timeout contains a valid timeout, this function will return #GST_RTSP_ETIMEOUT after the timeout expired.
This function can be cancelled with gst_rtsp_connection_flush().
function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK when a connection could be made.

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_connect_with_response
function.description:
Attempt to connect to the url of @conn made with gst_rtsp_connection_create(). If @timeout is #NULL this function can block forever. If @timeout contains a valid timeout, this function will return #GST_RTSP_ETIMEOUT after the timeout expired. If @conn is set to tunneled, @response will contain a response to the tunneling request messages.
This function can be cancelled with gst_rtsp_connection_flush().
function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK when a connection could be made.

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_create
function.description:
Create a newly allocated #GstRTSPConnection from @url and store it in @conn. The connection will not yet attempt to connect to @url, use gst_rtsp_connection_connect().
A copy of @url will be made.
function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK when @conn contains a valid connection.

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_create_from_socket
function.description: Create a new #GstRTSPConnection for handling communication on the existing socket @socket. The @initial_buffer contains zero terminated data already read from @socket which should be used before starting to read new data.

parameter.name: ip
parameter.parameter_description: the IP address of the other end

parameter.name: port
parameter.parameter_description: the port used by the other end

function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK when @conn contains a valid connection.

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_do_tunnel
function.description:
If @conn received the first tunnel connection and @conn2 received the second tunnel connection, link the two connections together so that @conn manages the tunneled connection.
After this call, @conn2 cannot be used anymore and must be freed with gst_rtsp_connection_free().
If @conn2 is %NULL then only the base64 decoding context will be setup for @conn.
function.return: return GST_RTSP_OK on success.

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_flush
function.description: Start or stop the flushing action on @conn. When flushing, all current and future actions on @conn will return #GST_RTSP_EINTR until the connection is set to non-flushing mode again.
function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK.

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_free
function.description: Close and free @conn.
function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK on success.

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_get_ip
function.description: Retrieve the IP address of the other end of @conn.
function.return: The IP address as a string. this value remains valid until the connection is closed.

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_get_read_socket
function.description: Get the file descriptor for reading.
function.return: the file descriptor used for reading or %NULL on error. The file descriptor remains valid until the connection is closed.

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_get_remember_session_id
function.return: %TRUE if the #GstRTSPConnection remembers the session id in the last response to set it on any further request.

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_get_tls
function.description:
Get the TLS connection of @conn.
For client side this will return the #GTlsClientConnection when connected over TLS.
For server side connections, this function will create a GTlsServerConnection when called the first time and will return that same connection on subsequent calls. The server is then responsible for configuring the TLS connection.

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: #GError for error reporting, or NULL to ignore.

function.return: the TLS connection for @conn.

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_get_tls_database
function.description: Gets the anchor certificate authorities database that will be used after a server certificate can't be verified with the default certificate database.
function.return: the anchor certificate authorities database, or NULL if no database has been previously set. Use g_object_unref() to release the certificate database.

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_get_tls_interaction
function.description: Gets a #GTlsInteraction object to be used when the connection or certificate database need to interact with the user. This will be used to prompt the user for passwords where necessary.
function.return: a reference on the #GTlsInteraction. Use g_object_unref() to release.

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_get_tls_validation_flags
function.description: Gets the TLS validation flags used to verify the peer certificate when a TLS connection is established.
function.return: the validationg flags.

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_get_tunnelid
function.description: Get the tunnel session id the connection.
function.return: returns a non-empty string if @conn is being tunneled over HTTP.

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_get_url
function.description: Retrieve the URL of the other end of @conn.
function.return: The URL. This value remains valid until the connection is freed.

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_get_write_socket
function.description: Get the file descriptor for writing.
function.return: the file descriptor used for writing or NULL on error. The file descriptor remains valid until the connection is closed.

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_is_tunneled
function.description: Get the tunneling state of the connection.
function.return: if @conn is using HTTP tunneling.

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_next_timeout
function.description: Calculate the next timeout for @conn, storing the result in @timeout.
function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK.

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_poll

parameter.name: events
parameter.parameter_description: a bitmask of #GstRTSPEvent flags to check

function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK on success.

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_read
function.description:
Attempt to read @size bytes into @data from the connected @conn, blocking up to the specified @timeout. @timeout can be #NULL, in which case this function might block forever.
This function can be cancelled with gst_rtsp_connection_flush().
function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK on success.

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_receive
function.description:
Attempt to read into @message from the connected @conn, blocking up to the specified @timeout. @timeout can be #NULL, in which case this function might block forever.
This function can be cancelled with gst_rtsp_connection_flush().
function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK on success.

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_reset_timeout
function.description: Reset the timeout of @conn.
function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK.

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_send
function.description:
Attempt to send @message to the connected @conn, blocking up to the specified @timeout. @timeout can be #NULL, in which case this function might block forever.
This function can be cancelled with gst_rtsp_connection_flush().
function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK on success.

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_set_auth
function.description: Configure @conn for authentication mode @method with @user and @pass as the user and password respectively.
function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK.

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_set_auth_param
function.description: Setup @conn with authentication directives. This is not necesary for methods #GST_RTSP_AUTH_NONE and #GST_RTSP_AUTH_BASIC. For #GST_RTSP_AUTH_DIGEST, directives should be taken from the digest challenge in the WWW-Authenticate response header and can include realm, domain, nonce, opaque, stale, algorithm, qop as per RFC2617.

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_set_http_mode
function.description: By setting the HTTP mode to %TRUE the message parsing will support HTTP messages in addition to the RTSP messages. It will also disable the automatic handling of setting up an HTTP tunnel.

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_set_ip
function.description: Set the IP address of the server.

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_set_proxy
function.description: Set the proxy host and port.
function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK.

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_set_qos_dscp
function.description: Configure @conn to use the specified DSCP value.
function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK on success.

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_set_remember_session_id
function.description:
Sets if the #GstRTSPConnection should remember the session id from the last response received and force it onto any further requests.
The default value is %TRUE

parameter.name: remember
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the connection should remember the session id

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_set_tls_database
function.description: Sets the anchor certificate authorities database. This certificate database will be used to verify the server's certificate in case it can't be verified with the default certificate database first.

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_set_tls_interaction
function.description: Sets a #GTlsInteraction object to be used when the connection or certificate database need to interact with the user. This will be used to prompt the user for passwords where necessary.

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_set_tls_validation_flags
function.description: Sets the TLS validation flags to be used to verify the peer certificate when a TLS connection is established.
function.return: TRUE if the validation flags are set correctly, or FALSE if @conn is NULL or is not a TLS connection.

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_set_tunneled
function.description: Set the HTTP tunneling state of the connection. This must be configured before the @conn is connected.

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_write
function.description:
Attempt to write @size bytes of @data to the connected @conn, blocking up to the specified @timeout. @timeout can be #NULL, in which case this function might block forever.
This function can be cancelled with gst_rtsp_connection_flush().
function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK on success.

function.name: gst_rtsp_find_header_field
function.description: Convert @header to a #GstRTSPHeaderField.
function.return: a #GstRTSPHeaderField for @header or #GST_RTSP_HDR_INVALID if the header field is unknown.

function.name: gst_rtsp_find_method
function.description: Convert @method to a #GstRTSPMethod.
function.return: a #GstRTSPMethod for @method or #GST_RTSP_INVALID if the method is unknown.

function.name: gst_rtsp_header_allow_multiple
function.description: Check whether @field may appear multiple times in a message.
function.return: %TRUE if multiple headers are allowed.

function.name: gst_rtsp_header_as_text
function.description: Convert @field to a string.
function.return: a string representation of @field.

function.name: gst_rtsp_message_add_header
function.description: Add a header with key @field and @value to @msg. This function takes a copy of @value.
function.return: a #GstRTSPResult.

function.name: gst_rtsp_message_add_header_by_name
function.description: Add a header with key @header and @value to @msg. This function takes a copy of @value.
function.return: a #GstRTSPResult.

function.name: gst_rtsp_message_append_headers
function.description: Append the currently configured headers in @msg to the #GString @str suitable for transmission.
function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK.

function.name: gst_rtsp_message_dump
function.description: Dump the contents of @msg to stdout.
function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK.

function.name: gst_rtsp_message_free
function.description: Free the memory used by @msg.
function.return: a #GstRTSPResult.

function.name: gst_rtsp_message_get_body
function.description: Get the body of @msg. @data remains valid for as long as @msg is valid and unchanged.
function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK.

function.name: gst_rtsp_message_get_header
function.description: Get the @indx header value with key @field from @msg. The result in @value stays valid as long as it remains present in @msg.
function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK when @field was found, #GST_RTSP_ENOTIMPL if the key was not found.

function.name: gst_rtsp_message_get_header_by_name
function.description: Get the @index header value with key @header from @msg. The result in @value stays valid as long as it remains present in @msg.
function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK when @field was found, #GST_RTSP_ENOTIMPL if the key was not found.

function.name: gst_rtsp_message_get_type
function.description: Get the message type of @msg.
function.return: the message type.

function.name: gst_rtsp_message_init
function.description: Initialize @msg. This function is mostly used when @msg is allocated on the stack. The reverse operation of this is gst_rtsp_message_unset().
function.return: a #GstRTSPResult.

function.name: gst_rtsp_message_init_data
function.description: Initialize a new data #GstRTSPMessage for @channel.
function.return: a #GstRTSPResult.

function.name: gst_rtsp_message_init_request
function.description: Initialize @msg as a request message with @method and @uri. To clear @msg again, use gst_rtsp_message_unset().
function.return: a #GstRTSPResult.

function.name: gst_rtsp_message_init_response
function.description:
Initialize @msg with @code and @reason.
When @reason is #NULL, the default reason for @code will be used.
When @request is not #NULL, the relevant headers will be copied to the new response message.

parameter.name: request
parameter.parameter_description: the request that triggered the response or %NULL

function.return: a #GstRTSPResult.

function.name: gst_rtsp_message_new
function.description: Create a new initialized #GstRTSPMessage. Free with gst_rtsp_message_free().
function.return: a #GstRTSPResult.

function.name: gst_rtsp_message_new_data
function.description: Create a new data #GstRTSPMessage with @channel and store the result message in @msg. Free with gst_rtsp_message_free().
function.return: a #GstRTSPResult.

function.name: gst_rtsp_message_new_request
function.description: Create a new #GstRTSPMessage with @method and @uri and store the result request message in @msg. Free with gst_rtsp_message_free().
function.return: a #GstRTSPResult.

function.name: gst_rtsp_message_new_response
function.description:
Create a new response #GstRTSPMessage with @code and @reason and store the result message in @msg. Free with gst_rtsp_message_free().
When @reason is #NULL, the default reason for @code will be used.
When @request is not #NULL, the relevant headers will be copied to the new response message.

parameter.name: request
parameter.parameter_description: the request that triggered the response or %NULL

function.return: a #GstRTSPResult.

function.name: gst_rtsp_message_parse_data
function.description: Parse the data message @msg and store the channel in @channel.
function.return: a #GstRTSPResult.

function.name: gst_rtsp_message_parse_request
function.return: a #GstRTSPResult.

function.name: gst_rtsp_message_parse_response

parameter.name: code
parameter.parameter_description: location to hold the status code

parameter.name: reason
parameter.parameter_description: location to hold the status reason

function.return: a #GstRTSPResult.

function.name: gst_rtsp_message_remove_header
function.description: Remove the @indx header with key @field from @msg. If @indx equals -1, all headers will be removed.
function.return: a #GstRTSPResult.

function.name: gst_rtsp_message_remove_header_by_name
function.description: Remove the @index header with key @header from @msg. If @index equals -1, all matching headers will be removed.
function.return: a #GstRTSPResult

function.name: gst_rtsp_message_set_body
function.description: Set the body of @msg to a copy of @data.
function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK.

function.name: gst_rtsp_message_steal_body
function.description: Take the body of @msg and store it in @data and @size. After this method, the body and size of @msg will be set to #NULL and 0 respectively.
function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK.

function.name: gst_rtsp_message_take_body
function.description: Set the body of @msg to @data and @size. This method takes ownership of @data.
function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK.

function.name: gst_rtsp_message_take_header
function.description: Add a header with key @field and @value to @msg. This function takes ownership of @value.
function.return: a #GstRTSPResult.

function.name: gst_rtsp_message_take_header_by_name
function.description: Add a header with key @header and @value to @msg. This function takes ownership of @value, but not of @header.
function.return: a #GstRTSPResult.

function.name: gst_rtsp_message_unset
function.description: Unset the contents of @msg so that it becomes an uninitialized #GstRTSPMessage again. This function is mostly used in combination with gst_rtsp_message_init_request(), gst_rtsp_message_init_response() and gst_rtsp_message_init_data() on stack allocated #GstRTSPMessage structures.
function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK.

function.name: gst_rtsp_method_as_text
function.description: Convert @method to a string.
function.return: a string representation of @method.

function.name: gst_rtsp_options_as_text
function.description: Convert @options to a string.
function.return: a new string of @options. g_free() after usage.

function.name: gst_rtsp_options_from_text
function.description: Convert the comma separated list @options to a #GstRTSPMethod bitwise or of methods. This functions is the reverse of gst_rtsp_options_as_text().

parameter.name: options
parameter.parameter_description: a comma separated list of options

function.return: a #GstRTSPMethod

function.name: gst_rtsp_range_convert_units
function.description: Converts the range in-place between different types of units. Ranges containing the special value #GST_RTSP_TIME_NOW can not be converted as these are only valid for #GST_RTSP_RANGE_NPT.

parameter.name: unit
parameter.parameter_description: the unit to convert the range into

function.return: %TRUE if the range could be converted

function.name: gst_rtsp_range_free
function.description: Free the memory allocated by @range.

function.name: gst_rtsp_range_get_times
function.description:
Retrieve the minimum and maximum values from @range converted to #GstClockTime in @min and @max.
A value of %GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE will be used to signal #GST_RTSP_TIME_NOW and #GST_RTSP_TIME_END for @min and @max respectively.
UTC times will be converted to nanoseconds since 1900.
function.return: %TRUE on success.

function.name: gst_rtsp_range_parse
function.description: Parse @rangestr to a #GstRTSPTimeRange.
function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK on success.

function.name: gst_rtsp_range_to_string
function.description: Convert @range into a string representation.
function.return: The string representation of @range. g_free() after usage.

function.name: gst_rtsp_status_as_text
function.description: Convert @code to a string.
function.return: a string representation of @code.

function.name: gst_rtsp_strresult
function.description: Convert @result in a human readable string.
function.return: a newly allocated string. g_free() after usage.

function.name: gst_rtsp_transport_as_text
function.description: Convert @transport into a string that can be used to signal the transport in an RTSP SETUP response.
function.return: a string describing the RTSP transport or #NULL when the transport is invalid.

function.name: gst_rtsp_transport_free
function.description: Free the memory used by @transport.
function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK.

function.name: gst_rtsp_transport_get_manager
function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK.

function.name: gst_rtsp_transport_get_media_type
function.description: Get the media type of @transport. This media type is typically used to generate #GstCaps events.
function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK.

function.name: gst_rtsp_transport_get_mime
function.description:
Get the mime type of the transport mode @trans. This mime type is typically used to generate #GstCaps events.
Deprecated: This functions only deals with the GstRTSPTransMode and only returns the mime type for #GST_RTSP_PROFILE_AVP. Use gst_rtsp_transport_get_media_type() instead.
function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK.

function.name: gst_rtsp_transport_init
function.description: Initialize @transport so that it can be used.
function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK.

function.name: gst_rtsp_transport_new
function.description: Allocate a new initialized #GstRTSPTransport. Use gst_rtsp_transport_free() after usage.
function.return: a #GstRTSPResult.

function.name: gst_rtsp_transport_parse
function.description: Parse the RTSP transport string @str into @transport.
function.return: a #GstRTSPResult.

function.name: gst_rtsp_url_copy
function.description: Make a copy of @url.
function.return: a copy of @url. Free with gst_rtsp_url_free () after usage.

function.name: gst_rtsp_url_decode_path_components
function.description:
Splits the path of @url on '/' boundaries, decoding the resulting components,
The decoding performed by this routine is "URI decoding", as defined in RFC 3986, commonly known as percent-decoding. For example, a string "foo\%2fbar" will decode to "foo/bar" -- the \%2f being replaced by the corresponding byte with hex value 0x2f. Note that there is no guarantee that the resulting byte sequence is valid in any given encoding. As a special case, \%00 is not unescaped to NUL, as that would prematurely terminate the string.
Also note that since paths usually start with a slash, the first component will usually be the empty string.
function.return: %NULL-terminated array of URL components. Free with g_strfreev() when no longer needed.

function.name: gst_rtsp_url_free
function.description: Free the memory used by @url.

function.name: gst_rtsp_url_get_port
function.description: Get the port number of @url.
function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK.

function.name: gst_rtsp_url_get_request_uri
function.description: Get a newly allocated string describing the request URI for @url.
function.return: a string with the request URI. g_free() after usage.

function.name: gst_rtsp_url_parse
function.description: Parse the RTSP @urlstr into a newly allocated #GstRTSPUrl. Free after usage with gst_rtsp_url_free().
function.return: a #GstRTSPResult.

function.name: gst_rtsp_url_set_port
function.description: Set the port number in @url to @port.
function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK.

function.name: gst_rtsp_version_as_text
function.description: Convert @version to a string.
function.return: a string representation of @version.

function.name: gst_rtsp_watch_attach
function.description: Adds a #GstRTSPWatch to a context so that it will be executed within that context.

parameter.name: context
parameter.parameter_description: a GMainContext (if NULL, the default context will be used)

function.return: the ID (greater than 0) for the watch within the GMainContext.

function.name: gst_rtsp_watch_get_send_backlog
function.description: Get the maximum amount of bytes and messages that will be queued in @watch. See gst_rtsp_watch_set_send_backlog().

function.name: gst_rtsp_watch_new

parameter.name: notify
parameter.parameter_description: notify when @user_data is not referenced anymore

function.return: a #GstRTSPWatch that can be used for asynchronous RTSP communication. Free with gst_rtsp_watch_unref () after usage.

function.name: gst_rtsp_watch_reset
function.description: Reset @watch, this is usually called after gst_rtsp_connection_do_tunnel() when the file descriptors of the connection might have changed.

function.name: gst_rtsp_watch_send_message

parameter.name: id
parameter.parameter_description: location for a message ID or %NULL

function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK on success.

function.name: gst_rtsp_watch_set_flushing
function.description: When @flushing is %TRUE, abort a call to gst_rtsp_watch_wait_backlog() and make sure gst_rtsp_watch_write_data() returns immediately with #GST_RTSP_EINTR. And empty the queue.

function.name: gst_rtsp_watch_set_send_backlog
function.description:
Set the maximum amount of bytes and messages that will be queued in @watch. When the maximum amounts are exceeded, gst_rtsp_watch_write_data() and gst_rtsp_watch_send_message() will return #GST_RTSP_ENOMEM.
A value of 0 for @bytes or @messages means no limits.

function.name: gst_rtsp_watch_unref
function.description: Decreases the reference count of @watch by one. If the resulting reference count is zero the watch and associated memory will be destroyed.

function.name: gst_rtsp_watch_wait_backlog
function.description:
Wait until there is place in the backlog queue, @timeout is reached or @watch is set to flushing.
If @timeout is %NULL this function can block forever. If @timeout contains a valid timeout, this function will return %GST_RTSP_ETIMEOUT after the timeout expired.
The typically use of this function is when gst_rtsp_watch_write_data returns %GST_RTSP_ENOMEM. The caller then calls this function to wait for free space in the backlog queue and try again.
function.return: %GST_RTSP_OK when if there is room in queue. %GST_RTSP_ETIMEOUT when @timeout was reached. %GST_RTSP_EINTR when @watch is flushing %GST_RTSP_EINVAL when called with invalid parameters.

function.name: gst_rtsp_watch_write_data

parameter.name: id
parameter.parameter_description: location for a message ID or %NULL

function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK on success. #GST_RTSP_ENOMEM when the backlog limits are reached. #GST_RTSP_EINTR when @watch was flushing.

function.name: gst_sample_copy
function.description: Create a copy of the given sample. This will also make a newly allocated copy of the data the source sample contains.
function.return: a new copy of @buf.

function.name: gst_sample_get_buffer
function.description: Get the buffer associated with @sample
function.return: the buffer of @sample or %NULL when there is no buffer. The buffer remains valid as long as @sample is valid. If you need to hold on to it for longer than that, take a ref to the buffer with gst_buffer_ref().

function.name: gst_sample_get_buffer_list
function.description: Get the buffer list associated with @sample
function.return: the buffer list of @sample or %NULL when there is no buffer list. The buffer list remains valid as long as @sample is valid. If you need to hold on to it for longer than that, take a ref to the buffer list with gst_mini_object_ref ().

function.name: gst_sample_get_caps
function.description: Get the caps associated with @sample
function.return: the caps of @sample or %NULL when there is no caps. The caps remain valid as long as @sample is valid. If you need to hold on to the caps for longer than that, take a ref to the caps with gst_caps_ref().

function.name: gst_sample_get_info
function.description: Get extra information associated with @sample.
function.return: the extra info of @sample. The info remains valid as long as @sample is valid.

function.name: gst_sample_get_segment
function.description: Get the segment associated with @sample
function.return: the segment of @sample. The segment remains valid as long as @sample is valid.

function.name: gst_sample_new
function.description:
Create a new #GstSample with the provided details.
Free-function: gst_sample_unref
function.return: the new #GstSample. gst_sample_unref() after usage.

function.name: gst_sample_ref
function.description: Increases the refcount of the given sample by one.
function.return: @sample

function.name: gst_sample_set_buffer_list
function.description: Set the buffer list associated with @sample

function.name: gst_sample_unref
function.description: Decreases the refcount of the sample. If the refcount reaches 0, the sample will be freed.

function.name: gst_sdp_message_parse_uri
function.description:
Parse the null-terminated @uri and store the result in @msg.
The uri should be of the form:
scheme://[address[:ttl=ttl][:noa=noa]]/[sessionname] [#type=value *[&type=value]]
where value is url encoded. This looslely resembles http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-fujikawa-sdp-url-01
function.return: #GST_SDP_OK on success.
