function.name: gst_sdp_message_times_len
function.description: Get the number of time information entries in @msg.
function.return: the number of time information entries in @msg.

function.name: gst_sdp_message_uninit
function.description: Free all resources allocated in @msg. @msg should not be used anymore after this function. This function should be used when @msg was allocated on the stack and initialized with gst_sdp_message_init().
function.return: a #GstSDPResult.

function.name: gst_sdp_message_zones_len
function.description: Get the number of time zone information entries in @msg.
function.return: the number of time zone information entries in @msg.

function.name: gst_sdp_time_clear
function.description: Reset the time information in @t.
function.return: a #GstSDPResult.

function.name: gst_sdp_time_set
function.description: Set time information @start, @stop and @repeat in @t.
function.return: a #GstSDPResult.

function.name: gst_sdp_zone_clear
function.description: Reset the zone information in @zone.
function.return: a #GstSDPResult.

function.name: gst_sdp_zone_set
function.description: Set zone information in @zone.

parameter.name: adj_time
parameter.parameter_description: the NTP time that a time zone adjustment happens

parameter.name: typed_time
parameter.parameter_description: the offset from the time when the session was first scheduled

function.return: a #GstSDPResult.

function.name: gst_segment_clip
function.description:
Clip the given @start and @stop values to the segment boundaries given in @segment. @start and @stop are compared and clipped to @segment start and stop values.
If the function returns %FALSE, @start and @stop are known to fall outside of @segment and @clip_start and @clip_stop are not updated.
When the function returns %TRUE, @clip_start and @clip_stop will be updated. If @clip_start or @clip_stop are different from @start or @stop respectively, the region fell partially in the segment.
Note that when @stop is -1, @clip_stop will be set to the end of the segment. Depending on the use case, this may or may not be what you want.

parameter.name: start
parameter.parameter_description: the start position in the segment

parameter.name: stop
parameter.parameter_description: the stop position in the segment

parameter.name: clip_start
parameter.parameter_description: the clipped start position in the segment

parameter.name: clip_stop
parameter.parameter_description: the clipped stop position in the segment

function.return: %TRUE if the given @start and @stop times fall partially or completely in @segment, %FALSE if the values are completely outside of the segment.

function.name: gst_segment_copy
function.description:
Create a copy of given @segment.
Free-function: gst_segment_free
function.return: a new #GstSegment, free with gst_segment_free().

function.name: gst_segment_copy_into
function.description: Copy the contents of @src into @dest.

function.name: gst_segment_do_seek
function.description:
Update the segment structure with the field values of a seek event (see gst_event_new_seek()).
After calling this method, the segment field position and time will contain the requested new position in the segment. The new requested position in the segment depends on @rate and @start_type and @stop_type.
For positive @rate, the new position in the segment is the new @segment start field when it was updated with a @start_type different from #GST_SEEK_TYPE_NONE. If no update was performed on @segment start position (#GST_SEEK_TYPE_NONE), @start is ignored and @segment position is unmodified.
For negative @rate, the new position in the segment is the new @segment stop field when it was updated with a @stop_type different from #GST_SEEK_TYPE_NONE. If no stop was previously configured in the segment, the duration of the segment will be used to update the stop position. If no update was performed on @segment stop position (#GST_SEEK_TYPE_NONE), @stop is ignored and @segment position is unmodified.
The applied rate of the segment will be set to 1.0 by default. If the caller can apply a rate change, it should update @segment rate and applied_rate after calling this function.
@update will be set to %TRUE if a seek should be performed to the segment position field. This field can be %FALSE if, for example, only the @rate has been changed but not the playback position.

parameter.name: flags
parameter.parameter_description: the segment flags for the segment

parameter.name: update
parameter.parameter_description: boolean holding whether position was updated.

function.return: %TRUE if the seek could be performed.

function.name: gst_segment_free
function.description: Free the allocated segment @segment.

function.name: gst_segment_init
function.description:
The start/position fields are set to 0 and the stop/duration fields are set to -1 (unknown). The default rate of 1.0 and no flags are set.
Initialize @segment to its default values.

function.name: gst_segment_is_equal
function.description: Checks for two segments being equal. Equality here is defined as perfect equality, including floating point values.
function.return: %TRUE if the segments are equal, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_segment_new
function.description:
Allocate a new #GstSegment structure and initialize it using gst_segment_init().
Free-function: gst_segment_free
function.return: a new #GstSegment, free with gst_segment_free().

function.name: gst_segment_offset_running_time
function.description: Adjust the values in @segment so that @offset is applied to all future running-time calculations.

parameter.name: offset
parameter.parameter_description: the offset to apply in the segment

function.return: %TRUE if the segment could be updated successfully. If %FALSE is returned, @offset is not in @segment.

function.name: gst_segment_position_from_running_time
function.description: Convert @running_time into a position in the segment so that gst_segment_to_running_time() with that position returns @running_time.
function.return: the position in the segment for @running_time. This function returns -1 when @running_time is -1 or when it is not inside @segment.

function.name: gst_segment_position_from_running_time_full
function.description:
Translate @running_time to the segment position using the currently configured segment. Compared to gst_segment_position_from_running_time() this function can return negative segment position.
This function is typically used by elements that need to synchronize buffers against the clock or each other.
@running_time can be any value and the result of this function for values outside of the segment is extrapolated.
When 1 is returned, @running_time resulted in a positive position returned in @position.
When this function returns -1, the returned @position should be negated to get the real negative segment position.

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: the resulting position in the segment

function.return: a 1 or -1 on success, 0 on failure.

function.name: gst_segment_position_from_stream_time
function.description: Convert @stream_time into a position in the segment so that gst_segment_to_stream_time() with that position returns @stream_time.
function.return: the position in the segment for @stream_time. This function returns -1 when @stream_time is -1 or when it is not inside @segment.

function.name: gst_segment_position_from_stream_time_full
function.description:
Translate @stream_time to the segment position using the currently configured segment. Compared to gst_segment_position_from_stream_time() this function can return negative segment position.
This function is typically used by elements that need to synchronize buffers against the clock or each other.
@stream_time can be any value and the result of this function for values outside of the segment is extrapolated.
When 1 is returned, @stream_time resulted in a positive position returned in @position.
When this function returns -1, the returned @position should be negated to get the real negative segment position.

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: the resulting position in the segment

function.return: a 1 or -1 on success, 0 on failure.

function.name: gst_segment_set_running_time
function.description: Adjust the start/stop and base values of @segment such that the next valid buffer will be one with @running_time.
function.return: %TRUE if the segment could be updated successfully. If %FALSE is returned, @running_time is -1 or not in @segment.

function.name: gst_segment_to_position
function.description: Convert @running_time into a position in the segment so that gst_segment_to_running_time() with that position returns @running_time.
function.return:
the position in the segment for @running_time. This function returns -1 when @running_time is -1 or when it is not inside @segment.
Deprecated. Use gst_segment_position_from_running_time() instead.

function.name: gst_segment_to_running_time
function.description:
Translate @position to the total running time using the currently configured segment. Position is a value between @segment start and stop time.
This function is typically used by elements that need to synchronize to the global clock in a pipeline. The running time is a constantly increasing value starting from 0. When gst_segment_init() is called, this value will reset to 0.
This function returns -1 if the position is outside of @segment start and stop.
function.return: the position as the total running time or -1 when an invalid position was given.

function.name: gst_segment_to_running_time_full
function.description:
Translate @position to the total running time using the currently configured segment. Compared to gst_segment_to_running_time() this function can return negative running-time.
This function is typically used by elements that need to synchronize buffers against the clock or eachother.
@position can be any value and the result of this function for values outside of the segment is extrapolated.
When 1 is returned, @position resulted in a positive running-time returned in @running_time.
When this function returns -1, the returned @running_time should be negated to get the real negative running time.
function.return: a 1 or -1 on success, 0 on failure.

function.name: gst_segment_to_stream_time
function.description:
Translate @position to stream time using the currently configured segment. The @position value must be between @segment start and stop value.
This function is typically used by elements that need to operate on the stream time of the buffers it receives, such as effect plugins. In those use cases, @position is typically the buffer timestamp or clock time that one wants to convert to the stream time. The stream time is always between 0 and the total duration of the media stream.
function.return: the position in stream_time or -1 when an invalid position was given.

function.name: gst_segment_to_stream_time_full
function.description:
Translate @position to the total stream time using the currently configured segment. Compared to gst_segment_to_stream_time() this function can return negative stream-time.
This function is typically used by elements that need to synchronize buffers against the clock or eachother.
@position can be any value and the result of this function for values outside of the segment is extrapolated.
When 1 is returned, @position resulted in a positive stream-time returned in @stream_time.
When this function returns -1, the returned @stream_time should be negated to get the real negative stream time.
function.return: a 1 or -1 on success, 0 on failure.

function.name: gst_segtrap_is_enabled
function.description:
Some functions in the GStreamer core might install a custom SIGSEGV handler to better catch and report errors to the application. Currently this feature is enabled by default when loading plugins.
Applications might want to disable this behaviour with the gst_segtrap_set_enabled() function. This is typically done if the application wants to install its own handler without GStreamer interfering.
function.return: %TRUE if GStreamer is allowed to install a custom SIGSEGV handler.

function.name: gst_segtrap_set_enabled
function.description: Applications might want to disable/enable the SIGSEGV handling of the GStreamer core. See gst_segtrap_is_enabled() for more information.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.parameter_description: whether a custom SIGSEGV handler should be installed.

function.name: gst_static_caps_cleanup
function.description: Clean up the cached caps contained in @static_caps.

function.name: gst_static_caps_get
function.description: Converts a #GstStaticCaps to a #GstCaps.
function.return: a pointer to the #GstCaps. Unref after usage. Since the core holds an additional ref to the returned caps, use gst_caps_make_writable() on the returned caps to modify it.

function.name: gst_static_pad_template_get
function.description: Converts a #GstStaticPadTemplate into a #GstPadTemplate.
function.return: a new #GstPadTemplate.

function.name: gst_static_pad_template_get_caps
function.description: Gets the capabilities of the static pad template.
function.return: the #GstCaps of the static pad template. Unref after usage. Since the core holds an additional ref to the returned caps, use gst_caps_make_writable() on the returned caps to modify it.

function.name: gst_structure_copy
function.description:
Duplicates a #GstStructure and all its fields and values.
Free-function: gst_structure_free
function.return: a new #GstStructure.

function.name: gst_structure_filter_and_map_in_place
function.description: Calls the provided function once for each field in the #GstStructure. In contrast to gst_structure_foreach(), the function may modify the fields. In contrast to gst_structure_map_in_place(), the field is removed from the structure if %FALSE is returned from the function. The structure must be mutable.

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: a function to call for each field

function.name: gst_structure_fixate
function.description: Fixate all values in @structure using gst_value_fixate(). @structure will be modified in-place and should be writable.

function.name: gst_structure_fixate_field

function.return: %TRUE if the structure field could be fixated

function.description: Fixates a #GstStructure by changing the given field to the nearest double to @target that is a subset of the existing field.

function.return: %TRUE if the structure could be fixated

function.name: gst_structure_fixate_field_nearest_fraction
function.description: Fixates a #GstStructure by changing the given field to the nearest fraction to @target_numerator/@target_denominator that is a subset of the existing field.

parameter.name: target_numerator
parameter.parameter_description: The numerator of the target value of the fixation

parameter.name: target_denominator
parameter.parameter_description: The denominator of the target value of the fixation

function.return: %TRUE if the structure could be fixated

function.name: gst_structure_fixate_field_nearest_int
function.description: Fixates a #GstStructure by changing the given field to the nearest integer to @target that is a subset of the existing field.

parameter.name: target
parameter.parameter_description: the target value of the fixation

function.return: %TRUE if the structure could be fixated

function.name: gst_structure_fixate_field_string
function.description: Fixates a #GstStructure by changing the given @field_name field to the given @target string if that field is not fixed yet.

parameter.name: target
parameter.parameter_description: the target value of the fixation

function.return: %TRUE if the structure could be fixated

function.name: gst_structure_foreach

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: a function to call for each field

function.return: %TRUE if the supplied function returns %TRUE For each of the fields, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_structure_free
function.description: Frees a #GstStructure and all its fields and values. The structure must not have a parent when this function is called.

function.name: gst_structure_from_string
function.description:
Creates a #GstStructure from a string representation. If end is not %NULL, a pointer to the place inside the given string where parsing ended will be returned.
Free-function: gst_structure_free

parameter.name: end
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to store the end of the string in.

function.return: a new #GstStructure or %NULL when the string could not be parsed. Free with gst_structure_free() after use.

function.name: gst_structure_get
function.description:
Parses the variable arguments and reads fields from @structure accordingly. Variable arguments should be in the form field name, field type (as a GType), pointer(s) to a variable(s) to hold the return value(s). The last variable argument should be %NULL.
For refcounted (mini)objects you will receive a new reference which you must release with a suitable _unref() when no longer needed. For strings and boxed types you will receive a copy which you will need to release with either g_free() or the suitable function for the boxed type.

parameter.name: first_fieldname
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the first field to read

function.return: %FALSE if there was a problem reading any of the fields (e.g. because the field requested did not exist, or was of a type other than the type specified), otherwise %TRUE.

function.name: gst_structure_get_boolean
function.description: Sets the boolean pointed to by @value corresponding to the value of the given field. Caller is responsible for making sure the field exists and has the correct type.

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to a #gboolean to set

function.return: %TRUE if the value could be set correctly. If there was no field with @fieldname or the existing field did not contain a boolean, this function returns %FALSE.

function.name: gst_structure_get_clock_time
function.description: Sets the clock time pointed to by @value corresponding to the clock time of the given field. Caller is responsible for making sure the field exists and has the correct type.

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to a #GstClockTime to set

function.return: %TRUE if the value could be set correctly. If there was no field with @fieldname or the existing field did not contain a #GstClockTime, this function returns %FALSE.

function.name: gst_structure_get_date
function.description:
Sets the date pointed to by @value corresponding to the date of the given field. Caller is responsible for making sure the field exists and has the correct type.
On success @value will point to a newly-allocated copy of the date which should be freed with g_date_free() when no longer needed (note: this is inconsistent with e.g. gst_structure_get_string() which doesn't return a copy of the string).

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to a #GDate to set

function.return: %TRUE if the value could be set correctly. If there was no field with @fieldname or the existing field did not contain a data, this function returns %FALSE.

function.name: gst_structure_get_date_time
function.description:
Sets the datetime pointed to by @value corresponding to the datetime of the given field. Caller is responsible for making sure the field exists and has the correct type.
On success @value will point to a reference of the datetime which should be unreffed with gst_date_time_unref() when no longer needed (note: this is inconsistent with e.g. gst_structure_get_string() which doesn't return a copy of the string).

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to a #GstDateTime to set

function.return: %TRUE if the value could be set correctly. If there was no field with @fieldname or the existing field did not contain a data, this function returns %FALSE.

function.name: gst_structure_get_double
function.description: Sets the double pointed to by @value corresponding to the value of the given field. Caller is responsible for making sure the field exists and has the correct type.

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to a gdouble to set

function.return: %TRUE if the value could be set correctly. If there was no field with @fieldname or the existing field did not contain a double, this function returns %FALSE.

function.name: gst_structure_get_enum
function.description: Sets the int pointed to by @value corresponding to the value of the given field. Caller is responsible for making sure the field exists, has the correct type and that the enumtype is correct.

parameter.name: enumtype
parameter.parameter_description: the enum type of a field

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to an int to set

function.return: %TRUE if the value could be set correctly. If there was no field with @fieldname or the existing field did not contain an enum of the given type, this function returns %FALSE.

function.name: gst_structure_get_field_type
function.description: Finds the field with the given name, and returns the type of the value it contains. If the field is not found, G_TYPE_INVALID is returned.
function.return: the #GValue of the field

function.name: gst_structure_get_flagset
function.description: Read the GstFlagSet flags and mask out of the structure into the provided pointers.

parameter.name: value_flags
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to a guint for the flags field

parameter.name: value_mask
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to a guint for the mask field

function.return: %TRUE if the values could be set correctly. If there was no field with @fieldname or the existing field did not contain a GstFlagSet, this function returns %FALSE.

function.name: gst_structure_get_fraction
function.description: Sets the integers pointed to by @value_numerator and @value_denominator corresponding to the value of the given field. Caller is responsible for making sure the field exists and has the correct type.

parameter.name: value_numerator
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to an int to set

parameter.name: value_denominator
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to an int to set

function.return: %TRUE if the values could be set correctly. If there was no field with @fieldname or the existing field did not contain a GstFraction, this function returns %FALSE.

function.name: gst_structure_get_int
function.description: Sets the int pointed to by @value corresponding to the value of the given field. Caller is responsible for making sure the field exists and has the correct type.

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to an int to set

function.return: %TRUE if the value could be set correctly. If there was no field with @fieldname or the existing field did not contain an int, this function returns %FALSE.

function.name: gst_structure_get_int64
function.description: Sets the #gint64 pointed to by @value corresponding to the value of the given field. Caller is responsible for making sure the field exists and has the correct type.

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to a #gint64 to set

function.return: %TRUE if the value could be set correctly. If there was no field with @fieldname or the existing field did not contain a #gint64, this function returns %FALSE.

function.name: gst_structure_get_name

function.return: the name of the structure.

function.name: gst_structure_get_name_id
function.description: Get the name of @structure as a GQuark.
function.return: the quark representing the name of the structure.

function.name: gst_structure_get_string
function.description:
Finds the field corresponding to @fieldname, and returns the string contained in the field's value. Caller is responsible for making sure the field exists and has the correct type.
The string should not be modified, and remains valid until the next call to a gst_structure_*() function with the given structure.
function.return: a pointer to the string or %NULL when the field did not exist or did not contain a string.

function.name: gst_structure_get_uint
function.description: Sets the uint pointed to by @value corresponding to the value of the given field. Caller is responsible for making sure the field exists and has the correct type.

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to a uint to set

function.return: %TRUE if the value could be set correctly. If there was no field with @fieldname or the existing field did not contain a uint, this function returns %FALSE.

function.name: gst_structure_get_uint64
function.description: Sets the #guint64 pointed to by @value corresponding to the value of the given field. Caller is responsible for making sure the field exists and has the correct type.

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to a #guint64 to set

function.return: %TRUE if the value could be set correctly. If there was no field with @fieldname or the existing field did not contain a #guint64, this function returns %FALSE.

function.name: gst_structure_get_valist
function.description: Parses the variable arguments and reads fields from @structure accordingly. valist-variant of gst_structure_get(). Look at the documentation of gst_structure_get() for more details.

parameter.name: first_fieldname
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the first field to read

function.return: %TRUE, or %FALSE if there was a problem reading any of the fields

function.name: gst_structure_get_value
function.description: Get the value of the field with name @fieldname.

parameter.name: fieldname
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the field to get

function.return: the #GValue corresponding to the field with the given name.

function.name: gst_structure_has_field
function.description: Check if @structure contains a field named @fieldname.
function.return: %TRUE if the structure contains a field with the given name

function.name: gst_structure_has_field_typed
function.description: Check if @structure contains a field named @fieldname and with GType @type.
function.return: %TRUE if the structure contains a field with the given name and type

function.name: gst_structure_has_name
function.description: Checks if the structure has the given name
function.return: %TRUE if @name matches the name of the structure.

function.name: gst_structure_id_get
function.description:
Parses the variable arguments and reads fields from @structure accordingly. Variable arguments should be in the form field id quark, field type (as a GType), pointer(s) to a variable(s) to hold the return value(s). The last variable argument should be %NULL (technically it should be a 0 quark, but we require %NULL so compilers that support it can check for the %NULL terminator and warn if it's not there).
This function is just like gst_structure_get() only that it is slightly more efficient since it saves the string-to-quark lookup in the global quark hashtable.
For refcounted (mini)objects you will receive a new reference which you must release with a suitable _unref() when no longer needed. For strings and boxed types you will receive a copy which you will need to release with either g_free() or the suitable function for the boxed type.

parameter.name: first_field_id
parameter.parameter_description: the quark of the first field to read

function.return: %FALSE if there was a problem reading any of the fields (e.g. because the field requested did not exist, or was of a type other than the type specified), otherwise %TRUE.

function.name: gst_structure_id_get_valist
function.description: Parses the variable arguments and reads fields from @structure accordingly. valist-variant of gst_structure_id_get(). Look at the documentation of gst_structure_id_get() for more details.

parameter.name: first_field_id
parameter.parameter_description: the quark of the first field to read

function.return: %TRUE, or %FALSE if there was a problem reading any of the fields

function.name: gst_structure_id_get_value
function.description: Get the value of the field with GQuark @field.

parameter.name: field
parameter.parameter_description: the #GQuark of the field to get

function.return: the #GValue corresponding to the field with the given name identifier.

function.name: gst_structure_id_has_field
function.description: Check if @structure contains a field named @field.
function.return: %TRUE if the structure contains a field with the given name

function.name: gst_structure_id_has_field_typed
function.description: Check if @structure contains a field named @field and with GType @type.
function.return: %TRUE if the structure contains a field with the given name and type

function.name: gst_structure_id_set
function.description: Identical to gst_structure_set, except that field names are passed using the GQuark for the field name. This allows more efficient setting of the structure if the caller already knows the associated quark values. The last variable argument must be %NULL.

parameter.parameter_description: the GQuark for the name of the field to set

function.name: gst_structure_id_set_valist

parameter.name: fieldname
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the field to set

function.name: gst_structure_id_set_value

function.name: gst_structure_id_take_value
function.description: Sets the field with the given GQuark @field to @value. If the field does not exist, it is created. If the field exists, the previous value is replaced and freed.

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: the new value of the field

function.name: gst_structure_intersect
function.description: Intersects @struct1 and @struct2 and returns the intersection.
function.return: Intersection of @struct1 and @struct2

function.name: gst_structure_is_equal
function.description: Tests if the two #GstStructure are equal.
function.return: %TRUE if the two structures have the same name and field.

function.name: gst_structure_is_subset
function.return: %TRUE if @subset is a subset of @superset

function.name: gst_structure_map_in_place
function.description: Calls the provided function once for each field in the #GstStructure. In contrast to gst_structure_foreach(), the function may modify but not delete the fields. The structure must be mutable.

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: a function to call for each field

function.return: %TRUE if the supplied function returns %TRUE For each of the fields, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_structure_n_fields
function.description: Get the number of fields in the structure.
function.return: the number of fields in the structure

function.name: gst_structure_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GstStructure with the given name. Parses the list of variable arguments and sets fields to the values listed. Variable arguments should be passed as field name, field type, and value. Last variable argument should be %NULL.
Free-function: gst_structure_free

parameter.name: firstfield
parameter.parameter_description: name of first field to set

function.return: a new #GstStructure

function.name: gst_structure_new_empty
function.description:
Creates a new, empty #GstStructure with the given @name.
See gst_structure_set_name() for constraints on the @name parameter.
Free-function: gst_structure_free
function.return: a new, empty #GstStructure

function.name: gst_structure_new_from_string
function.description:
Creates a #GstStructure from a string representation. If end is not %NULL, a pointer to the place inside the given string where parsing ended will be returned.
The current implementation of serialization will lead to unexpected results when there are nested #GstCaps / #GstStructure deeper than one level.
Free-function: gst_structure_free
function.return: a new #GstStructure or %NULL when the string could not be parsed. Free with gst_structure_free() after use.

function.name: gst_structure_new_id
function.description:
Creates a new #GstStructure with the given name as a GQuark, followed by fieldname quark, GType, argument(s) "triplets" in the same format as gst_structure_id_set(). Basically a convenience wrapper around gst_structure_new_id_empty() and gst_structure_id_set().
The last variable argument must be %NULL (or 0).
Free-function: gst_structure_free

parameter.name: field_quark
parameter.parameter_description: the GQuark for the name of the field to set

function.return: a new #GstStructure

function.name: gst_structure_new_id_empty
function.description:
Creates a new, empty #GstStructure with the given name as a GQuark.
Free-function: gst_structure_free
function.return: a new, empty #GstStructure

function.name: gst_structure_new_valist
function.description:
Creates a new #GstStructure with the given @name. Structure fields are set according to the varargs in a manner similar to gst_structure_new().
See gst_structure_set_name() for constraints on the @name parameter.
Free-function: gst_structure_free

parameter.name: firstfield
parameter.parameter_description: name of first field to set

function.return: a new #GstStructure

function.name: gst_structure_nth_field_name
function.description: Get the name of the given field number, counting from 0 onwards.

parameter.name: index
parameter.parameter_description: the index to get the name of

function.return: the name of the given field number

function.name: gst_structure_remove_all_fields
function.description: Removes all fields in a GstStructure.

function.name: gst_structure_remove_field
function.description: Removes the field with the given name. If the field with the given name does not exist, the structure is unchanged.

parameter.name: fieldname
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the field to remove

function.name: gst_structure_remove_fields
function.description: Removes the fields with the given names. If a field does not exist, the argument is ignored.

parameter.name: fieldname
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the field to remove

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: %NULL-terminated list of more fieldnames to remove

function.name: gst_structure_remove_fields_valist
function.description: va_list form of gst_structure_remove_fields().

parameter.name: fieldname
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the field to remove

parameter.name: varargs
parameter.parameter_description: %NULL-terminated list of more fieldnames to remove

function.name: gst_structure_set
function.description: Parses the variable arguments and sets fields accordingly. Fields that weren't already part of the structure are added as needed. Variable arguments should be in the form field name, field type (as a GType), value(s). The last variable argument should be %NULL.

parameter.name: fieldname
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the field to set

function.name: gst_structure_set_name
function.description: Sets the name of the structure to the given @name. The string provided is copied before being used. It must not be empty, start with a letter and can be followed by letters, numbers and any of "/-_.:".

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the new name of the structure

function.name: gst_structure_set_parent_refcount
function.description: Sets the parent_refcount field of #GstStructure. This field is used to determine whether a structure is mutable or not. This function should only be called by code implementing parent objects of #GstStructure, as described in the MT Refcounting section of the design documents.

parameter.name: refcount
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to the parent's refcount

function.return: %TRUE if the parent refcount could be set.

function.name: gst_structure_set_valist
function.description: va_list form of gst_structure_set().

parameter.name: fieldname
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the field to set

function.name: gst_structure_set_value
function.description: Sets the field with the given name @field to @value. If the field does not exist, it is created. If the field exists, the previous value is replaced and freed.

parameter.name: fieldname
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the field to set

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: the new value of the field

function.name: gst_structure_take_value
function.description: Sets the field with the given name @field to @value. If the field does not exist, it is created. If the field exists, the previous value is replaced and freed. The function will take ownership of @value.

parameter.name: fieldname
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the field to set

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: the new value of the field

function.name: gst_structure_to_string
function.description:
Converts @structure to a human-readable string representation.
For debugging purposes its easier to do something like this: |[<!-- language="C" --> GST_LOG ("structure is %" GST_PTR_FORMAT, structure); ]| This prints the structure in human readable form.
The current implementation of serialization will lead to unexpected results when there are nested #GstCaps / #GstStructure deeper than one level.
Free-function: g_free
function.return: a pointer to string allocated by g_malloc(). g_free() after usage.

function.name: gst_system_clock_obtain
function.description: Get a handle to the default system clock. The refcount of the clock will be increased so you need to unref the clock after usage.
function.return:
the default clock.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_system_clock_set_default
function.description:
Sets the default system clock that can be obtained with gst_system_clock_obtain().
This is mostly used for testing and debugging purposes when you want to have control over the time reported by the default system clock.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_tag_check_language_code
function.description:
Check if a given string contains a known ISO 639 language code.
This is useful in situations where it's not clear whether a given string is a language code (which should be put into a #GST_TAG_LANGUAGE_CODE tag) or a free-form language name descriptor (which should be put into a #GST_TAG_LANGUAGE_NAME tag instead).
function.return: TRUE if the two- or three-letter language code in @lang_code is a valid ISO-639 language code.

function.name: gst_tag_exists
function.description: Checks if the given type is already registered.
function.return: %TRUE if the type is already registered

function.name: gst_tag_freeform_string_to_utf8
function.description: Convenience function to read a string with unknown character encoding. If the string is already in UTF-8 encoding, it will be returned right away. If not it tries to detect byte-order-mark for UTF-16/32 cases and use that. Otherwise, the environment will be searched for a number of environment variables (whose names are specified in the NULL-terminated string array @env_vars) containing a list of character encodings to try/use. If none are specified, the current locale will be tried. If that also doesn't work, WINDOWS-1252/ISO-8859-1 is assumed (which will almost always succeed).

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: length of string data, or -1 if the string is NUL-terminated

parameter.name: env_vars
parameter.parameter_description: a NULL-terminated string array of environment variable names, or NULL

function.return: a newly-allocated string in UTF-8 encoding, or NULL

function.name: gst_tag_from_id3_tag
function.description: Looks up the GStreamer tag for a ID3v2 tag.

parameter.name: id3_tag
parameter.parameter_description: ID3v2 tag to convert to GStreamer tag

function.return: The corresponding GStreamer tag or NULL if none exists.

function.name: gst_tag_from_id3_user_tag
function.description: Looks up the GStreamer tag for an ID3v2 user tag (e.g. description in TXXX frame or owner in UFID frame).

parameter.name: type
parameter.parameter_description: the type of ID3v2 user tag (e.g. "TXXX" or "UDIF")

parameter.name: id3_user_tag
parameter.parameter_description: ID3v2 user tag to convert to GStreamer tag

function.return: The corresponding GStreamer tag or NULL if none exists.

function.name: gst_tag_from_vorbis_tag
function.description: Looks up the GStreamer tag for a vorbiscomment tag.

parameter.name: vorbis_tag
parameter.parameter_description: vorbiscomment tag to convert to GStreamer tag

function.return: The corresponding GStreamer tag or NULL if none exists.

function.name: gst_tag_get_description
function.description: Returns the human-readable description of this tag, You must not change or free this string.
function.return: the human-readable description of this tag

function.name: gst_tag_get_flag
function.description: Gets the flag of @tag.
function.return: the flag of this tag.

function.name: gst_tag_get_id3v2_tag_size
function.description: Determines size of an ID3v2 tag on buffer containing at least ID3v2 header, i.e. at least #GST_TAG_ID3V2_HEADER_SIZE (10) bytes;

parameter.name: buffer
parameter.parameter_description: buffer holding ID3v2 tag (or at least the start of one)

function.return: Size of tag, or 0 if header is invalid or too small.

function.name: gst_tag_get_language_code
function.description: Convenience macro wrapping gst_tag_get_language_code_iso_639_1().

function.name: gst_tag_get_language_code_iso_639_1
function.description:
Returns two-letter ISO-639-1 language code given a three-letter ISO-639-2 language code or two-letter ISO-639-1 language code (both are accepted for convenience).
Language codes are case-sensitive and expected to be lower case.
function.return: two-letter ISO-639-1 language code string that maps to @lang_code, or NULL if no mapping is known. The returned string must not be modified or freed.

function.name: gst_tag_get_language_code_iso_639_2B
function.description:
Returns three-letter ISO-639-2 "bibliographic" language code given a two-letter ISO-639-1 language code or a three-letter ISO-639-2 language code (both are accepted for convenience).
The "bibliographic" code is derived from the English name of the language (e.g. "ger" for German instead of "de" or "deu"). In most scenarios, the "terminological" codes are prefered.
Language codes are case-sensitive and expected to be lower case.
function.return: three-letter ISO-639-2 language code string that maps to @lang_code, or NULL if no mapping is known. The returned string must not be modified or freed.

function.name: gst_tag_get_language_code_iso_639_2T
function.description:
Returns three-letter ISO-639-2 "terminological" language code given a two-letter ISO-639-1 language code or a three-letter ISO-639-2 language code (both are accepted for convenience).
The "terminological" code is derived from the local name of the language (e.g. "deu" for German instead of "ger"). In most scenarios, the "terminological" codes are prefered over the "bibliographic" ones.
Language codes are case-sensitive and expected to be lower case.
function.return: three-letter ISO-639-2 language code string that maps to @lang_code, or NULL if no mapping is known. The returned string must not be modified or freed.

function.name: gst_tag_get_language_codes
function.description: Returns a list of known language codes (in form of two-letter ISO-639-1 codes). This is useful for UIs to build a list of available languages for tagging purposes (e.g. to tag an audio track appropriately in a video or audio editor).
function.return: NULL-terminated string array with two-letter language codes. Free with g_strfreev() when no longer needed.

function.name: gst_tag_get_language_name
function.description:
Returns the name of the language given an ISO-639 language code as found in a GST_TAG_LANGUAGE_CODE tag. The name will be translated according to the current locale (if the library was built against the iso-codes package, otherwise the English name will be returned).
Language codes are case-sensitive and expected to be lower case.

parameter.name: language_code
parameter.parameter_description: two or three-letter ISO-639 language code

function.return: language name in UTF-8 format, or NULL if @language_code could not be mapped to a language name. The returned string must not be modified and does not need to freed; it will stay valid until the application is terminated.

function.name: gst_tag_get_license_description
function.description: Get the description of a license, which is a translated description of the license's main features.

parameter.name: license_ref
parameter.parameter_description: a license reference string in form of a URI, e.g. "http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/2.0/"

function.return: the description of the license, or NULL if the license is unknown or a description is not available.

function.name: gst_tag_get_license_flags
function.description: Get the flags of a license, which describe most of the features of a license in their most general form.

parameter.name: license_ref
parameter.parameter_description: a license reference string in form of a URI, e.g. "http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/2.0/"

function.return: the flags of the license, or 0 if the license is unknown

function.name: gst_tag_get_license_jurisdiction
function.description:
Get the jurisdiction code of a license. This is usually a two-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code, but there is also the special case of Scotland, for which no code exists and which is thus represented as "scotland".
Known jurisdictions: ar, at, au, be, bg, br, ca, ch, cl, cn, co, de, dk, es, fi, fr, hr, hu, il, in, it, jp, kr, mk, mt, mx, my, nl, pe, pl, pt, scotland, se, si, tw, uk, us, za.

parameter.name: license_ref
parameter.parameter_description: a license reference string in form of a URI, e.g. "http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/2.0/"

function.return: the jurisdiction code of the license, or NULL if the license is unknown or is not specific to a particular jurisdiction.

function.name: gst_tag_get_license_nick
function.description: Get the nick name of a license, which is a short (untranslated) string such as e.g. "CC BY-NC-ND 2.0 UK".

parameter.name: license_ref
parameter.parameter_description: a license reference string in form of a URI, e.g. "http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/2.0/"

function.return: the nick name of the license, or NULL if the license is unknown

function.name: gst_tag_get_license_title
function.description: Get the title of a license, which is a short translated description of the license's features (generally not very pretty though).

parameter.name: license_ref
parameter.parameter_description: a license reference string in form of a URI, e.g. "http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/2.0/"

function.return: the title of the license, or NULL if the license is unknown or no title is available.

function.name: gst_tag_get_license_version
function.description: Get the version of a license.

parameter.name: license_ref
parameter.parameter_description: a license reference string in form of a URI, e.g. "http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/2.0/"

function.return: the version of the license, or NULL if the license is not known or has no version

function.name: gst_tag_get_licenses
function.description: Returns a list of known license references (in form of URIs). This is useful for UIs to build a list of available licenses for tagging purposes (e.g. to tag an audio track appropriately in a video or audio editor, or an image in a camera application).
function.return: NULL-terminated array of license strings. Free with g_strfreev() when no longer needed.

function.name: gst_tag_get_nick
function.description: Returns the human-readable name of this tag, You must not change or free this string.
function.return: the human-readable name of this tag

function.name: gst_tag_get_type
function.description: Gets the #GType used for this tag.
function.return: the #GType of this tag

function.name: gst_tag_id3_genre_count
function.description: Gets the number of ID3v1 genres that can be identified. Winamp genres are included.
function.return: the number of ID3v1 genres that can be identified

function.name: gst_tag_id3_genre_get
function.description: Gets the ID3v1 genre name for a given ID.
function.return: the genre or NULL if no genre is associated with that ID.

function.name: gst_tag_image_data_to_image_sample
function.description:
Helper function for tag-reading plugins to create a #GstSample suitable to add to a #GstTagList as an image tag (such as #GST_TAG_IMAGE or #GST_TAG_PREVIEW_IMAGE) from the encoded image data and an (optional) image type.
Background: cover art and other images in tags are usually stored as a blob of binary image data, often accompanied by a MIME type or some other content type string (e.g. 'png', 'jpeg', 'jpg'). Sometimes there is also an 'image type' to indicate what kind of image this is (e.g. front cover, back cover, artist, etc.). The image data may also be an URI to the image rather than the image itself.
In GStreamer, image tags are #GstSample<!-- -->s containing the raw image data, with the sample caps describing the content type of the image (e.g. image/jpeg, image/png, text/uri-list). The sample info may contain an additional 'image-type' field of #GST_TYPE_TAG_IMAGE_TYPE to describe the type of image (front cover, back cover etc.). #GST_TAG_PREVIEW_IMAGE tags should not carry an image type, their type is already indicated via the special tag name.
This function will do various checks and typefind the encoded image data (we can't trust the declared mime type).

parameter.name: image_data_len
parameter.parameter_description: the length of the encoded image data at @image_data

parameter.name: image_type

function.return: a newly-allocated image sample for use in tag lists, or NULL

function.name: gst_tag_is_fixed
function.description: Checks if the given tag is fixed. A fixed tag can only contain one value. Unfixed tags can contain lists of values.
function.return: %TRUE, if the given tag is fixed.

function.name: gst_tag_list_add
function.description: Sets the values for the given tags using the specified mode.

function.name: gst_tag_list_add_id3_image
function.description: Adds an image from an ID3 APIC frame (or similar, such as used in FLAC) to the given tag list. Also see gst_tag_image_data_to_image_sample() for more information on image tags in GStreamer.

parameter.name: image_data_len
parameter.parameter_description: the length of the encoded image data at @image_data

parameter.name: id3_picture_type
parameter.parameter_description: picture type as per the ID3 (v2.4.0) specification for the APIC frame (0 = unknown/other)

function.return: %TRUE if the image was processed, otherwise %FALSE

function.name: gst_tag_list_add_valist
function.description: Sets the values for the given tags using the specified mode.

function.description: Sets the GValues for the given tags using the specified mode.

function.description: Sets the GValue for a given tag using the specified mode.

function.name: gst_tag_list_add_values
function.description: Sets the GValues for the given tags using the specified mode.

function.name: gst_tag_list_copy
function.description:
Creates a new #GstTagList as a copy of the old @taglist. The new taglist will have a refcount of 1, owned by the caller, and will be writable as a result.
Note that this function is the semantic equivalent of a gst_tag_list_ref() followed by a gst_tag_list_make_writable(). If you only want to hold on to a reference to the data, you should use gst_tag_list_ref().
When you are finished with the taglist, call gst_tag_list_unref() on it.
function.return: the new #GstTagList

function.name: gst_tag_list_copy_value
function.description: Copies the contents for the given tag into the value, merging multiple values into one if multiple values are associated with the tag. You must g_value_unset() the value after use.

parameter.name: list
parameter.parameter_description: list to get the tag from

function.return: %TRUE, if a value was copied, %FALSE if the tag didn't exist in the given list.

function.name: gst_tag_list_foreach
function.description: Calls the given function for each tag inside the tag list. Note that if there is no tag, the function won't be called at all.

parameter.parameter_description: function to be called for each tag

function.description: Parses the exif tags starting with a tiff header structure.

function.name: gst_tag_list_get_sample
function.description:
Copies the first sample for the given tag in the taglist into the variable pointed to by @sample. Free the sample with gst_sample_unref() when it is no longer needed. You can retrieve the buffer from the sample using gst_sample_get_buffer() and the associated caps (if any) with gst_sample_get_caps().
Free-function: gst_sample_unref

parameter.name: list
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstTagList to get the tag from

parameter.name: sample
parameter.parameter_description: address of a GstSample pointer variable to store the result into

function.return: %TRUE, if a sample was returned, %FALSE if the tag didn't exist in the given list or if it was %NULL.

function.name: gst_tag_list_get_sample_index
function.description:
Gets the sample that is at the given index for the given tag in the given list and copies it into the variable pointed to by @sample. Free the sample with gst_sample_unref() when it is no longer needed. You can retrieve the buffer from the sample using gst_sample_get_buffer() and the associated caps (if any) with gst_sample_get_caps().
Free-function: gst_sample_unref

parameter.name: list
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstTagList to get the tag from

parameter.name: index
parameter.parameter_description: number of entry to read out

parameter.name: sample
parameter.parameter_description: address of a GstSample pointer variable to store the result into

function.return: %TRUE, if a sample was copied, %FALSE if the tag didn't exist in the given list or if it was %NULL.

function.name: gst_tag_list_get_scope
function.description: Gets the scope of @list.
function.return: The scope of @list

function.name: gst_tag_list_get_string
function.description:
Copies the contents for the given tag into the value, possibly merging multiple values into one if multiple values are associated with the tag.
Use gst_tag_list_get_string_index (list, tag, 0, value) if you want to retrieve the first string associated with this tag unmodified.
The resulting string in @value will be in UTF-8 encoding and should be freed by the caller using g_free when no longer needed. The returned string is also guaranteed to be non-%NULL and non-empty.
Free-function: g_free

parameter.name: list
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstTagList to get the tag from

function.return: %TRUE, if a value was copied, %FALSE if the tag didn't exist in the given list.

The resulting string in @value will be in UTF-8 encoding and should be freed by the caller using g_free when no longer needed. The returned string is also guaranteed to be non-%NULL and non-empty.

parameter.name: list
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstTagList to get the tag from

parameter.name: index
parameter.parameter_description: number of entry to read out

function.return: %TRUE, if a value was copied, %FALSE if the tag didn't exist in the given list.

function.name: gst_tag_list_insert
function.description: Inserts the tags of the @from list into the first list using the given mode.

function.name: gst_tag_list_is_empty
function.description: Checks if the given taglist is empty.
function.return: %TRUE if the taglist is empty, otherwise %FALSE.

function.name: gst_tag_list_is_equal
function.description: Checks if the two given taglists are equal.
function.return: %TRUE if the taglists are equal, otherwise %FALSE

function.name: gst_tag_list_is_writable
function.description: Tests if you can safely modify @taglist. It is only safe to modify taglist when there is only one owner of the taglist - ie, the refcount is 1.

function.name: gst_tag_list_make_writable
function.description:
Returns a writable copy of @taglist.
If there is only one reference count on @taglist, the caller must be the owner, and so this function will return the taglist object unchanged. If on the other hand there is more than one reference on the object, a new taglist object will be returned (which will be a copy of @taglist). The caller's reference on @taglist will be removed, and instead the caller will own a reference to the returned object.
In short, this function unrefs the taglist in the argument and refs the taglist that it returns. Don't access the argument after calling this function. See also: gst_tag_list_ref().
function.return: a writable taglist which may or may not be the same as @taglist

function.name: gst_tag_list_merge
function.description:
Merges the two given lists into a new list. If one of the lists is %NULL, a copy of the other is returned. If both lists are %NULL, %NULL is returned.
Free-function: gst_tag_list_unref
function.return: the new list

function.name: gst_tag_list_n_tags
function.description: Get the number of tags in @list.
function.return: The number of tags in @list.

function.name: gst_tag_list_new
function.description:
Creates a new taglist and appends the values for the given tags. It expects tag-value pairs like gst_tag_list_add(), and a %NULL terminator after the last pair. The type of the values is implicit and is documented in the API reference, but can also be queried at runtime with gst_tag_get_type(). It is an error to pass a value of a type not matching the tag type into this function. The tag list will make copies of any arguments passed (e.g. strings, buffers).
After creation you might also want to set a #GstTagScope on the returned taglist to signal if the contained tags are global or stream tags. By default stream scope is assumes. See gst_tag_list_set_scope().
Free-function: gst_tag_list_unref
function.return: a new #GstTagList. Free with gst_tag_list_unref() when no longer needed.

function.name: gst_tag_list_new_empty
function.description:
Creates a new empty GstTagList.
Free-function: gst_tag_list_unref
function.return: An empty tag list

function.name: gst_tag_list_new_from_id3v1
function.description: Parses the data containing an ID3v1 tag and returns a #GstTagList from the parsed data.

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: 128 bytes of data containing the ID3v1 tag

function.return: A new tag list or NULL if the data was not an ID3v1 tag.

function.name: gst_tag_list_new_from_string
function.description: Deserializes a tag list.
function.return: a new #GstTagList, or %NULL in case of an error.

function.name: gst_tag_list_new_valist
function.description:
Just like gst_tag_list_new(), only that it takes a va_list argument. Useful mostly for language bindings.
Free-function: gst_tag_list_unref
function.return: a new #GstTagList. Free with gst_tag_list_unref() when no longer needed.

function.name: gst_tag_list_nth_tag_name
function.description: Get the name of the tag in @list at @index.
function.return: The name of the tag at @index.

function.name: gst_tag_list_peek_string_index
function.description:
Peeks at the value that is at the given index for the given tag in the given list.
The resulting string in @value will be in UTF-8 encoding and doesn't need to be freed by the caller. The returned string is also guaranteed to be non-%NULL and non-empty.

parameter.name: list
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstTagList to get the tag from

parameter.name: index
parameter.parameter_description: number of entry to read out

function.return: %TRUE, if a value was set, %FALSE if the tag didn't exist in the given list.

function.name: gst_tag_list_ref
function.description:
Add a reference to a #GstTagList mini object.
From this point on, until the caller calls gst_tag_list_unref() or gst_tag_list_make_writable(), it is guaranteed that the taglist object will not change. To use a #GstTagList object, you must always have a refcount on it -- either the one made implicitly by e.g. gst_tag_list_new(), or via taking one explicitly with this function.
function.return: the same #GstTagList mini object.

function.name: gst_tag_list_remove_tag
function.description: Removes the given tag from the taglist.

function.name: gst_tag_list_set_scope
function.description: Sets the scope of @list to @scope. By default the scope of a taglist is stream scope.

function.name: gst_tag_list_to_exif_buffer
function.description: Formats the tags in taglist on exif format. The resulting buffer contains the tags IFD and is followed by the data pointed by the tag entries.

parameter.name: byte_order
parameter.parameter_description: byte order used in writing (G_LITTLE_ENDIAN or G_BIG_ENDIAN)

parameter.name: base_offset
parameter.parameter_description: Offset from the tiff header first byte

function.return: A GstBuffer containing the tag entries followed by the tag data

function.name: gst_tag_list_to_exif_buffer_with_tiff_header
function.description: Formats the tags in taglist into exif structure, a tiff header is put in the beginning of the buffer.
function.return: A GstBuffer containing the data

function.name: gst_tag_list_to_string
function.description: Serializes a tag list to a string.
function.return: a newly-allocated string, or %NULL in case of an error. The string must be freed with g_free() when no longer needed.

function.name: gst_tag_list_to_vorbiscomment_buffer
function.description: Creates a new vorbiscomment buffer from a tag list.

parameter.name: id_data
parameter.parameter_description: identification data at start of stream

parameter.name: id_data_length
parameter.parameter_description: length of identification data, may be 0 if @id_data is NULL

parameter.name: vendor_string
parameter.parameter_description: string that describes the vendor string or NULL

function.return: A new #GstBuffer containing a vorbiscomment buffer with all tags that could be converted from the given tag list.

function.name: gst_tag_list_to_xmp_buffer
function.description: Formats a taglist as a xmp packet using only the selected schemas. An empty list (%NULL) means that all schemas should be used

parameter.name: read_only
parameter.parameter_description: does the container forbid inplace editing

parameter.name: schemas
parameter.parameter_description: %NULL terminated array of schemas to be used on serialization

function.return: new buffer or %NULL, unref the buffer when done

function.name: gst_tag_list_unref
function.description: Unref a #GstTagList, and and free all its memory when the refcount reaches 0.

function.name: gst_tag_merge_strings_with_comma
function.description: This is a convenience function for the func argument of gst_tag_register(). It concatenates all given strings using a comma. The tag must be registered as a G_TYPE_STRING or this function will fail.

parameter.name: dest
parameter.parameter_description: uninitialized GValue to store result in

function.name: gst_tag_merge_use_first
function.description: This is a convenience function for the func argument of gst_tag_register(). It creates a copy of the first value from the list.

parameter.name: dest
parameter.parameter_description: uninitialized GValue to store result in

function.name: gst_tag_parse_extended_comment
function.description:
Convenience function to parse a GST_TAG_EXTENDED_COMMENT string and separate it into its components.
If successful, @key, @lang and/or @value will be set to newly allocated strings that you need to free with g_free() when done. @key and @lang may also be set to NULL by this function if there is no key or no language code in the extended comment string.

parameter.name: key
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the comment description key, or NULL

parameter.name: lang
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the comment ISO-639 language code, or NULL

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the actual comment string, or NULL

parameter.name: fail_if_no_key
parameter.parameter_description: whether to fail if strings are not in key=value form

function.return: TRUE if the string could be parsed, otherwise FALSE

function.name: gst_tag_register
function.description:
Registers a new tag type for the use with GStreamer's type system. If a type with that name is already registered, that one is used. The old registration may have used a different type however. So don't rely on your supplied values.
Important: if you do not supply a merge function the implication will be that there can only be one single value for this tag in a tag list and any additional values will silently be discarded when being added (unless #GST_TAG_MERGE_REPLACE, #GST_TAG_MERGE_REPLACE_ALL, or #GST_TAG_MERGE_PREPEND is used as merge mode, in which case the new value will replace the old one in the list).
The merge function will be called from gst_tag_list_copy_value() when it is required that one or more values for a tag be condensed into one single value. This may happen from gst_tag_list_get_string(), gst_tag_list_get_int(), gst_tag_list_get_double() etc. What will happen exactly in that case depends on how the tag was registered and if a merge function was supplied and if so which one.
Two default merge functions are provided: gst_tag_merge_use_first() and gst_tag_merge_strings_with_comma().

parameter.name: flag
parameter.parameter_description: a flag describing the type of tag info

parameter.name: type
parameter.parameter_description: the type this data is in

parameter.name: blurb
parameter.parameter_description: a human-readable description about this tag

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: function for merging multiple values of this tag, or %NULL

function.name: gst_tag_register_musicbrainz_tags
function.description: Registers additional musicbrainz-specific tags with the GStreamer tag system. Plugins and applications that use these tags should call this function before using them. Can be called multiple times.

function.name: gst_tag_register_static
function.description:
Registers a new tag type for the use with GStreamer's type system.
Same as gst_tag_register(), but @name, @nick, and @blurb must be static strings or inlined strings, as they will not be copied. (GStreamer plugins will be made resident once loaded, so this function can be used even from dynamically loaded plugins.)

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name or identifier string (string constant)

parameter.name: flag
parameter.parameter_description: a flag describing the type of tag info

parameter.name: type
parameter.parameter_description: the type this data is in

parameter.name: nick
parameter.parameter_description: human-readable name or short description (string constant)

parameter.name: blurb
parameter.parameter_description: a human-readable description for this tag (string constant)

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: function for merging multiple values of this tag, or %NULL

function.name: gst_tag_setter_add_tag_valist
function.description: Adds the given tag / value pairs on the setter using the given merge mode. The list must be terminated with %NULL.

function.name: gst_tag_setter_add_tag_valist_values
function.description: Adds the given tag / GValue pairs on the setter using the given merge mode. The list must be terminated with %NULL.

function.name: gst_tag_setter_add_tag_value
function.description: Adds the given tag / GValue pair on the setter using the given merge mode.

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: GValue to set for the tag

function.name: gst_tag_setter_add_tag_values
function.description: Adds the given tag / GValue pairs on the setter using the given merge mode. The list must be terminated with %NULL.

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: more tag / GValue pairs to set

function.name: gst_tag_setter_add_tags
function.description: Adds the given tag / value pairs on the setter using the given merge mode. The list must be terminated with %NULL.

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: more tag / value pairs to set

function.name: gst_tag_setter_get_tag_list
function.description:
Returns the current list of tags the setter uses. The list should not be modified or freed.
This function is not thread-safe.
function.return: a current snapshot of the taglist used in the setter or %NULL if none is used.

function.name: gst_tag_setter_get_tag_merge_mode
function.description: Queries the mode by which tags inside the setter are overwritten by tags from events
function.return: the merge mode used inside the element.

function.name: gst_tag_setter_merge_tags
function.description: Merges the given list into the setter's list using the given mode.

parameter.name: list
parameter.parameter_description: a tag list to merge from

function.name: gst_tag_setter_reset_tags
function.description: Reset the internal taglist. Elements should call this from within the state-change handler.

function.name: gst_tag_setter_set_tag_merge_mode
function.description: Sets the given merge mode that is used for adding tags from events to tags specified by this interface. The default is #GST_TAG_MERGE_KEEP, which keeps the tags set with this interface and discards tags from events.

parameter.name: mode
parameter.parameter_description: The mode with which tags are added
