parameter.parameter_description: a GStreamer tag identifier, such as #GST_TAG_ARTIST

function.return: A #GList of newly-allocated key=value strings. Free with g_list_foreach (list, (GFunc) g_free, NULL) plus g_list_free (list)

function.name: gst_tag_to_vorbis_tag
function.description: Looks up the vorbiscomment tag for a GStreamer tag.

parameter.name: gst_tag
parameter.parameter_description: GStreamer tag to convert to vorbiscomment tag

function.return: The corresponding vorbiscomment tag or NULL if none exists.

function.name: gst_tag_xmp_list_schemas
function.description: Gets the list of supported schemas in the xmp lib
function.return: a %NULL terminated array of strings with the schema names

function.name: gst_tag_xmp_writer_add_all_schemas
function.description: Adds all available XMP schemas to the configuration. Meaning that all will be used.

function.name: gst_tag_xmp_writer_add_schema
function.description: Adds @schema to the list schemas

function.name: gst_tag_xmp_writer_has_schema
function.description: Checks if @schema is going to be used
function.return: %TRUE if it is going to be used

function.name: gst_tag_xmp_writer_remove_all_schemas
function.description: Removes all schemas from the list of schemas to use. Meaning that no XMP will be generated.

function.name: gst_tag_xmp_writer_remove_schema
function.description: Removes a schema from the list of schemas to use. Nothing is done if the schema wasn't in the list

function.name: gst_task_cleanup_all
function.description:
Wait for all tasks to be stopped. This is mainly used internally to ensure proper cleanup of internal data structures in test suites.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_task_get_pool
function.description:
Get the #GstTaskPool that this task will use for its streaming threads.
MT safe.
function.return: the #GstTaskPool used by @task. gst_object_unref() after usage.

function.name: gst_task_get_state
function.description: Get the current state of the task.
function.return:
The #GstTaskState of the task
MT safe.

function.name: gst_task_join
function.description:
Joins @task. After this call, it is safe to unref the task and clean up the lock set with gst_task_set_lock().
The task will automatically be stopped with this call.
This function cannot be called from within a task function as this would cause a deadlock. The function will detect this and print a g_warning.
function.return:
%TRUE if the task could be joined.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_task_new
function.description:
Create a new Task that will repeatedly call the provided @func with @user_data as a parameter. Typically the task will run in a new thread.
The function cannot be changed after the task has been created. You must create a new #GstTask to change the function.
This function will not yet create and start a thread. Use gst_task_start() or gst_task_pause() to create and start the GThread.
Before the task can be used, a #GRecMutex must be configured using the gst_task_set_lock() function. This lock will always be acquired while @func is called.

parameter.name: notify
parameter.parameter_description: the function to call when @user_data is no longer needed.

function.return:
A new #GstTask.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_task_pause
function.description: Pauses @task. This method can also be called on a task in the stopped state, in which case a thread will be started and will remain in the paused state. This function does not wait for the task to complete the paused state.
function.return:
%TRUE if the task could be paused.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_task_pool_cleanup
function.description:
Wait for all tasks to be stopped. This is mainly used internally to ensure proper cleanup of internal data structures in test suites.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_task_pool_join
function.description: Join a task and/or return it to the pool. @id is the id obtained from gst_task_pool_push().

function.name: gst_task_pool_new
function.description: Create a new default task pool. The default task pool will use a regular GThreadPool for threads.
function.return: a new #GstTaskPool. gst_object_unref() after usage.

function.name: gst_task_pool_prepare
function.description:
Prepare the taskpool for accepting gst_task_pool_push() operations.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_task_pool_push
function.description: Start the execution of a new thread from @pool.
function.return: a pointer that should be used for the gst_task_pool_join function. This pointer can be %NULL, you must check @error to detect errors.

function.name: gst_task_set_enter_callback
function.description: Call @enter_func when the task function of @task is entered. @user_data will be passed to @enter_func and @notify will be called when @user_data is no longer referenced.

parameter.name: notify
parameter.parameter_description: called when @user_data is no longer referenced

function.name: gst_task_set_leave_callback
function.description: Call @leave_func when the task function of @task is left. @user_data will be passed to @leave_func and @notify will be called when @user_data is no longer referenced.

parameter.name: notify
parameter.parameter_description: called when @user_data is no longer referenced

function.name: gst_task_set_lock
function.description:
Set the mutex used by the task. The mutex will be acquired before calling the #GstTaskFunction.
This function has to be called before calling gst_task_pause() or gst_task_start().
MT safe.

function.name: gst_task_set_pool
function.description:
Set @pool as the new GstTaskPool for @task. Any new streaming threads that will be created by @task will now use @pool.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_task_set_state
function.description:
Sets the state of @task to @state.
The @task must have a lock associated with it using gst_task_set_lock() when going to GST_TASK_STARTED or GST_TASK_PAUSED or this function will return %FALSE.
MT safe.
function.return: %TRUE if the state could be changed.

function.name: gst_task_start
function.description: Starts @task. The @task must have a lock associated with it using gst_task_set_lock() or this function will return %FALSE.
function.return:
%TRUE if the task could be started.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_task_stop
function.description: Stops @task. This method merely schedules the task to stop and will not wait for the task to have completely stopped. Use gst_task_join() to stop and wait for completion.
function.return:
%TRUE if the task could be stopped.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_test_clock_advance_time
function.description:
Advances the time of the @test_clock by the amount given by @delta. The time of @test_clock is monotonically increasing, therefore providing a @delta which is negative or zero is a programming error.
MT safe.

parameter.name: test_clock
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstTestClock for which to increase the time

parameter.name: delta
parameter.parameter_description: a positive #GstClockTimeDiff to be added to the time of the clock

function.name: gst_test_clock_crank
function.description:
A "crank" consists of three steps: 1: Wait for a #GstClockID to be registered with the #GstTestClock. 2: Advance the #GstTestClock to the time the #GstClockID is waiting for. 3: Release the #GstClockID wait. A "crank" can be though of as the notion of manually driving the clock forward to its next logical step.
Return: %TRUE if the crank was successful, %FALSE otherwise.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_test_clock_get_next_entry_time
function.description:
Retrieve the requested time for the next pending clock notification.
MT safe.

parameter.name: test_clock
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstTestClock to fetch the next clock notification time for

function.return: a #GstClockTime set to the time of the next pending clock notification. If no clock notifications have been requested %GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE will be returned.

function.name: gst_test_clock_has_id
function.description:
Checks whether @test_clock was requested to provide the clock notification given by @id.
MT safe.

parameter.name: test_clock
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstTestClock to ask if it provided the notification

function.return: %TRUE if the clock has been asked to provide the given clock notification, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_test_clock_id_list_get_latest_time
function.description:
Finds the latest time inside the list.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_test_clock_new
function.description:
Creates a new test clock with its time set to zero.
MT safe.
function.return: a #GstTestClock cast to #GstClock.

function.name: gst_test_clock_new_with_start_time
function.description:
Creates a new test clock with its time set to the specified time.
MT safe.

parameter.name: start_time
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstClockTime set to the desired start time of the clock.

function.return: a #GstTestClock cast to #GstClock.

function.name: gst_test_clock_peek_id_count
function.description:
Determine the number of pending clock notifications that have been requested from the @test_clock.
MT safe.

parameter.name: test_clock
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstTestClock for which to count notifications

function.return: the number of pending clock notifications.

function.name: gst_test_clock_peek_next_pending_id
function.description:
Determines if the @pending_id is the next clock notification scheduled to be triggered given the current time of the @test_clock.
MT safe.
Return: %TRUE if @pending_id is the next clock notification to be triggered, %FALSE otherwise.

parameter.name: test_clock
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstTestClock to check the clock notifications for

parameter.name: pending_id
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstClockID clock notification to look for

function.name: gst_test_clock_process_id_list
function.description:
Processes and releases the pending IDs in the list.
MT safe.

parameter.name: test_clock
parameter.parameter_description: #GstTestClock for which to process the pending IDs

function.name: gst_test_clock_process_next_clock_id
function.description: MT safe.

parameter.name: test_clock
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstTestClock for which to retrieve the next pending clock notification

function.return: a #GstClockID containing the next pending clock notification.

function.name: gst_test_clock_set_time
function.description:
Sets the time of @test_clock to the time given by @new_time. The time of @test_clock is monotonically increasing, therefore providing a @new_time which is earlier or equal to the time of the clock as given by gst_clock_get_time() is a programming error.
MT safe.

parameter.name: test_clock
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstTestClock of which to set the time

parameter.name: new_time
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstClockTime later than that returned by gst_clock_get_time()

function.name: gst_test_clock_wait_for_multiple_pending_ids
function.description:
Blocks until at least @count clock notifications have been requested from @test_clock. There is no timeout for this wait, see the main description of #GstTestClock.
MT safe.

parameter.name: test_clock
parameter.parameter_description: #GstTestClock for which to await having enough pending clock

parameter.name: count
parameter.parameter_description: the number of pending clock notifications to wait for

parameter.name: pending_list
parameter.parameter_description: Address of a #GList pointer variable to store the list of pending #GstClockIDs that expired, or %NULL

function.name: gst_test_clock_wait_for_next_pending_id
function.description:
Waits until a clock notification is requested from @test_clock. There is no timeout for this wait, see the main description of #GstTestClock. A reference to the pending clock notification is stored in @pending_id.
MT safe.

parameter.name: test_clock
parameter.parameter_description: #GstTestClock for which to get the pending clock notification

parameter.name: pending_id
parameter.parameter_description: #GstClockID with information about the pending clock notification

function.name: gst_test_clock_wait_for_pending_id_count
function.description:
Blocks until at least @count clock notifications have been requested from @test_clock. There is no timeout for this wait, see the main description of #GstTestClock.
Deprecated: use gst_test_clock_wait_for_multiple_pending_ids() instead.

parameter.name: test_clock
parameter.parameter_description: #GstTestClock for which to await having enough pending clock

parameter.name: count
parameter.parameter_description: the number of pending clock notifications to wait for

function.name: gst_tracer_factory_get_list
function.description:
Gets the list of all registered tracer factories. You must free the list using gst_plugin_feature_list_free().
The returned factories are sorted by factory name.
Free-function: gst_plugin_feature_list_free
function.return: the list of all registered #GstTracerFactory.

function.name: gst_tracer_record_log
function.description:
Serialzes the trace event into the log.
Right now this is using the gstreamer debug log with the level TRACE (7) and the category "GST_TRACER". <note><para> Please note that this is still under discussion and subject to change. </para></note>

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: the args as described in the spec-

function.name: gst_tracer_record_new
function.description:
Create a new tracer record. The record instance can be used to efficiently log entries using gst_tracer_record_log().
The @name without the ".class" suffix will be used for the log records. There must be fields for each value that gets logged where the field name is the value name. The field must be a #GstStructure describing the value. The sub structure must contain a field called 'type' of %G_TYPE_GTYPE that contains the GType of the value. The resulting #GstTracerRecord will take ownership of the field structures.
The way to deal with optional values is to log an additional boolean before the optional field, that if %TRUE signals that the optional field is valid and %FALSE signals that the optional field should be ignored. One must still log a placeholder value for the optional field though. Please also note, that pointer type values must not be NULL - the underlying serialisation can not handle that right now.
<note><para> Please note that this is still under discussion and subject to change. </para></note>

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: name of new record, must end on ".class".

parameter.name: firstfield
parameter.parameter_description: name of first field to set

function.return: a new #GstTracerRecord

function.name: gst_tracer_register
function.description: Create a new tracer-factory capable of instantiating objects of the @type and add the factory to @plugin.

parameter.name: plugin
parameter.parameter_description: A #GstPlugin, or %NULL for a static typefind function

function.return: %TRUE, if the registering succeeded, %FALSE on error

function.name: gst_tracing_register_hook
function.description: Register @func to be called when the trace hook @detail is getting invoked. Use %NULL for @detail to register to all hooks.

function.name: gst_trigger_control_source_new
function.description: This returns a new, unbound #GstTriggerControlSource.
function.return: a new, unbound #GstTriggerControlSource.

function.description: Calls the #GstTypeFindFunction associated with this factory.

function.name: gst_type_find_factory_get_caps
function.description: Gets the #GstCaps associated with a typefind factory.
function.return: the #GstCaps associated with this factory

function.name: gst_type_find_factory_get_extensions

function.return: a %NULL-terminated array of extensions associated with this factory

function.name: gst_type_find_factory_get_list
function.description:
Gets the list of all registered typefind factories. You must free the list using gst_plugin_feature_list_free().
The returned factories are sorted by highest rank first, and then by factory name.
Free-function: gst_plugin_feature_list_free
function.return: the list of all registered #GstTypeFindFactory.

function.name: gst_type_find_factory_has_function
function.description: Check whether the factory has a typefind function. Typefind factories without typefind functions are a last-effort fallback mechanism to e.g. assume a certain media type based on the file extension.
function.return: %TRUE if the factory has a typefind functions set, otherwise %FALSE

function.name: gst_type_find_get_length
function.description: Get the length of the data stream.

parameter.name: find
parameter.parameter_description: The #GstTypeFind the function was called with

function.return: The length of the data stream, or 0 if it is not available.

function.name: gst_type_find_helper
function.description:
Tries to find what type of data is flowing from the given source #GstPad.
Free-function: gst_caps_unref
function.return: the #GstCaps corresponding to the data stream. Returns %NULL if no #GstCaps matches the data stream.

function.name: gst_type_find_helper_for_buffer
function.description:
Tries to find what type of data is contained in the given #GstBuffer, the assumption being that the buffer represents the beginning of the stream or file.
All available typefinders will be called on the data in order of rank. If a typefinding function returns a probability of %GST_TYPE_FIND_MAXIMUM, typefinding is stopped immediately and the found caps will be returned right away. Otherwise, all available typefind functions will the tried, and the caps with the highest probability will be returned, or %NULL if the content of the buffer could not be identified.
Free-function: gst_caps_unref

parameter.name: obj
parameter.parameter_description: object doing the typefinding, or %NULL (used for logging)

parameter.name: prob
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the probability of the found caps, or %NULL

function.return: the #GstCaps corresponding to the data, or %NULL if no type could be found. The caller should free the caps returned with gst_caps_unref().

function.name: gst_type_find_helper_for_data
function.description:
Tries to find what type of data is contained in the given @data, the assumption being that the data represents the beginning of the stream or file.
All available typefinders will be called on the data in order of rank. If a typefinding function returns a probability of %GST_TYPE_FIND_MAXIMUM, typefinding is stopped immediately and the found caps will be returned right away. Otherwise, all available typefind functions will the tried, and the caps with the highest probability will be returned, or %NULL if the content of @data could not be identified.
Free-function: gst_caps_unref

parameter.name: obj
parameter.parameter_description: object doing the typefinding, or %NULL (used for logging)

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer with data to typefind

parameter.name: prob
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the probability of the found caps, or %NULL

function.return: the #GstCaps corresponding to the data, or %NULL if no type could be found. The caller should free the caps returned with gst_caps_unref().

function.name: gst_type_find_helper_for_extension
function.description:
Tries to find the best #GstCaps associated with @extension.
All available typefinders will be checked against the extension in order of rank. The caps of the first typefinder that can handle @extension will be returned.
Free-function: gst_caps_unref

parameter.name: obj
parameter.parameter_description: object doing the typefinding, or %NULL (used for logging)

function.name: gst_type_find_helper_get_range
function.description:
Utility function to do pull-based typefinding. Unlike gst_type_find_helper() however, this function will use the specified function @func to obtain the data needed by the typefind functions, rather than operating on a given source pad. This is useful mostly for elements like tag demuxers which strip off data at the beginning and/or end of a file and want to typefind the stripped data stream before adding their own source pad (the specified callback can then call the upstream peer pad with offsets adjusted for the tag size, for example).
When @extension is not %NULL, this function will first try the typefind functions for the given extension, which might speed up the typefinding in many cases.
Free-function: gst_caps_unref

parameter.name: obj
parameter.parameter_description: A #GstObject that will be passed as first argument to @func

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: A generic #GstTypeFindHelperGetRangeFunction that will be used to access data at random offsets when doing the typefinding

parameter.name: prob
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the probability of the found caps, or %NULL

function.return: the #GstCaps corresponding to the data stream. Returns %NULL if no #GstCaps matches the data stream.

function.name: gst_type_find_peek
function.description: Returns the @size bytes of the stream to identify beginning at offset. If offset is a positive number, the offset is relative to the beginning of the stream, if offset is a negative number the offset is relative to the end of the stream. The returned memory is valid until the typefinding function returns and must not be freed.

parameter.name: find
parameter.parameter_description: The #GstTypeFind object the function was called with

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: The number of bytes to return

function.return: the requested data, or %NULL if that data is not available.

function.name: gst_type_find_register
function.description: Registers a new typefind function to be used for typefinding. After registering this function will be available for typefinding. This function is typically called during an element's plugin initialization.

parameter.name: plugin
parameter.parameter_description: A #GstPlugin, or %NULL for a static typefind function

parameter.name: rank
parameter.parameter_description: The rank (or importance) of this typefind function

parameter.name: extensions
parameter.parameter_description: Optional comma-separated list of extensions that could belong to this type

parameter.name: possible_caps
parameter.parameter_description: Optionally the caps that could be returned when typefinding succeeds

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: Optional user data. This user data must be available until the plugin is unloaded.

parameter.name: data_notify
parameter.parameter_description: a #GDestroyNotify that will be called on @data when the plugin is unloaded.

function.return: %TRUE on success, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gst_type_find_suggest
function.description: If a #GstTypeFindFunction calls this function it suggests the caps with the given probability. A #GstTypeFindFunction may supply different suggestions in one call. It is up to the caller of the #GstTypeFindFunction to interpret these values.

parameter.name: find
parameter.parameter_description: The #GstTypeFind object the function was called with

parameter.name: probability
parameter.parameter_description: The probability in percent that the suggestion is right

function.name: gst_type_find_suggest_simple
function.description:
If a #GstTypeFindFunction calls this function it suggests the caps with the given probability. A #GstTypeFindFunction may supply different suggestions in one call. It is up to the caller of the #GstTypeFindFunction to interpret these values.
This function is similar to gst_type_find_suggest(), only that instead of passing a #GstCaps argument you can create the caps on the fly in the same way as you can with gst_caps_new_simple().
Make sure you terminate the list of arguments with a %NULL argument and that the values passed have the correct type (in terms of width in bytes when passed to the vararg function - this applies particularly to gdouble and guint64 arguments).

parameter.name: find
parameter.parameter_description: The #GstTypeFind object the function was called with

parameter.name: probability
parameter.parameter_description: The probability in percent that the suggestion is right

parameter.name: media_type
parameter.parameter_description: the media type of the suggested caps

parameter.name: fieldname
parameter.parameter_description: first field of the suggested caps, or %NULL

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: additional arguments to the suggested caps in the same format as the arguments passed to gst_structure_new() (ie. triplets of field name, field GType and field value)

function.name: gst_update_registry
function.description:
Forces GStreamer to re-scan its plugin paths and update the default plugin registry.
Applications will almost never need to call this function, it is only useful if the application knows new plugins have been installed (or old ones removed) since the start of the application (or, to be precise, the first call to gst_init()) and the application wants to make use of any newly-installed plugins without restarting the application.
Applications should assume that the registry update is neither atomic nor thread-safe and should therefore not have any dynamic pipelines running (including the playbin and decodebin elements) and should also not create any elements or access the GStreamer registry while the update is in progress.
Note that this function may block for a significant amount of time.
function.return: %TRUE if the registry has been updated successfully (does not imply that there were changes), otherwise %FALSE.

Constructs a URI for a given valid protocol and location.

function.return: a new string for this URI. Returns %NULL if the given URI protocol is not valid, or the given location is %NULL.

function.name: gst_uri_copy
function.description: Create a new #GstUri object with the same data as this #GstUri object. If @uri is %NULL then returns %NULL.
function.return: A new #GstUri object which is a copy of this #GstUri or %NULL.

parameter.parameter_description: The base URI to join the new URI with.

function.return: A new #GstUri object.

function.name: gst_uri_get_fragment
function.description: Get the fragment name from the URI or %NULL if it doesn't exist. If @uri is %NULL then returns %NULL.
function.return: The host name from the #GstUri object or %NULL.

function.name: gst_uri_get_host
function.description: Get the host name from the URI or %NULL if it doesn't exist. If @uri is %NULL then returns %NULL.
function.return: The host name from the #GstUri object or %NULL.

function.name: gst_uri_get_location
function.description:
Extracts the location out of a given valid URI, ie. the protocol and "://" are stripped from the URI, which means that the location returned includes the hostname if one is specified. The returned string must be freed using g_free().
Free-function: g_free
function.return: the location for this URI. Returns %NULL if the URI isn't valid. If the URI does not contain a location, an empty string is returned.

function.name: gst_uri_get_path
function.description: Extract the path string from the URI object.

parameter.name: uri
parameter.parameter_description: The #GstUri to get the path from.

function.return: The path from the URI. Once finished with the string should be g_free()'d.

function.name: gst_uri_get_path_segments
function.description: Get a list of path segments from the URI.

parameter.name: uri
parameter.parameter_description: The #GstUri to get the path from.

function.return: A #GList of path segment strings or %NULL if no path segments are available. Free the list when no longer needed with g_list_free_full(list, g_free).

function.name: gst_uri_get_path_string
function.description: Extract the path string from the URI object as a percent encoded URI path.

parameter.name: uri
parameter.parameter_description: The #GstUri to get the path from.

function.return: The path from the URI. Once finished with the string should be g_free()'d.

function.name: gst_uri_get_port
function.description: Get the port number from the URI or %GST_URI_NO_PORT if it doesn't exist. If @uri is %NULL then returns %GST_URI_NO_PORT.
function.return: The port number from the #GstUri object or %GST_URI_NO_PORT.

function.name: gst_uri_get_protocol
function.description: Extracts the protocol out of a given valid URI. The returned string must be freed using g_free().
function.return: The protocol for this URI.

function.name: gst_uri_get_query_keys
function.description: Get a list of the query keys from the URI.
function.return: A list of keys from the URI query. Free the list with g_list_free().

function.name: gst_uri_get_query_string
function.description: Get a percent encoded URI query string from the @uri.

parameter.name: uri
parameter.parameter_description: The #GstUri to get the query string from.

function.return: A percent encoded query string. Use g_free() when no longer needed.

function.name: gst_uri_get_query_table
function.description: Get the query table from the URI. Keys and values in the table are freed with g_free when they are deleted. A value may be %NULL to indicate that the key should appear in the query string in the URI, but does not have a value. Free the returned #GHashTable with #g_hash_table_unref() when it is no longer required. Modifying this hash table will modify the query in the URI.

parameter.name: uri
parameter.parameter_description: The #GstUri to get the query table from.

function.return: The query hash table from the URI.

function.name: gst_uri_get_query_value
function.description: Get the value associated with the @query_key key. Will return %NULL if the key has no value or if the key does not exist in the URI query table. Because %NULL is returned for both missing keys and keys with no value, you should use gst_uri_query_has_key() to determine if a key is present in the URI query.
function.return: The value for the given key, or %NULL if not found.

function.name: gst_uri_get_scheme
function.description: Get the scheme name from the URI or %NULL if it doesn't exist. If @uri is %NULL then returns %NULL.
function.return: The scheme from the #GstUri object or %NULL.

function.name: gst_uri_get_userinfo
function.description: Get the userinfo (usually in the form "username:password") from the URI or %NULL if it doesn't exist. If @uri is %NULL then returns %NULL.
function.return: The userinfo from the #GstUri object or %NULL.

function.name: gst_uri_handler_get_protocols
function.description: Gets the list of protocols supported by @handler. This list may not be modified.
function.return: the supported protocols. Returns %NULL if the @handler isn't implemented properly, or the @handler doesn't support any protocols.

function.name: gst_uri_handler_get_uri
function.description: Gets the currently handled URI.
function.return: the URI currently handled by the @handler. Returns %NULL if there are no URI currently handled. The returned string must be freed with g_free() when no longer needed.

function.name: gst_uri_handler_get_uri_type
function.description: Gets the type of the given URI handler
function.return: the #GstURIType of the URI handler. Returns #GST_URI_UNKNOWN if the @handler isn't implemented correctly.

function.name: gst_uri_handler_set_uri
function.description: Tries to set the URI of the given handler.

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: address where to store a #GError in case of an error, or %NULL

function.return: %TRUE if the URI was set successfully, else %FALSE.

function.name: gst_uri_has_protocol
function.description: Checks if the protocol of a given valid URI matches @protocol.
function.return: %TRUE if the protocol matches.

function.name: gst_uri_is_normalized
function.description: Tests the @uri to see if it is normalized. A %NULL @uri is considered to be normalized.

parameter.name: uri
parameter.parameter_description: The #GstUri to test to see if it is normalized.

function.return: TRUE if the URI is normalized or is %NULL.

function.name: gst_uri_is_valid
function.description: Tests if the given string is a valid URI identifier. URIs start with a valid scheme followed by ":" and maybe a string identifying the location.
function.return: %TRUE if the string is a valid URI

function.name: gst_uri_is_writable
function.description:
Check if it is safe to write to this #GstUri.
Check if the refcount of @uri is exactly 1, meaning that no other reference exists to the #GstUri and that the #GstUri is therefore writable.
Modification of a #GstUri should only be done after verifying that it is writable.
function.return: %TRUE if it is safe to write to the object.

function.name: gst_uri_join
function.description: Join a reference URI onto a base URI using the method from RFC 3986. If either URI is %NULL then the other URI will be returned with the ref count increased.

parameter.name: base_uri
parameter.parameter_description: The base URI to join another to.

parameter.name: ref_uri
parameter.parameter_description: The reference URI to join onto the base URI.

function.return: A #GstUri which represents the base with the reference URI joined on.

function.name: gst_uri_join_strings
function.description: This is a convenience function to join two URI strings and return the result. The returned string should be g_free()'d after use.

parameter.name: ref_uri
parameter.parameter_description: The percent-encoded reference URI to join to the @base_uri.

function.return: A string representing the percent-encoded join of the two URIs.

function.name: gst_uri_make_writable
function.description:
Make the #GstUri writable.
Checks if @uri is writable, and if so the original object is returned. If not, then a writable copy is made and returned. This gives away the reference to @uri and returns a reference to the new #GstUri. If @uri is %NULL then %NULL is returned.
function.return: A writable version of @uri.

function.name: gst_uri_new
function.description: Creates a new #GstUri object with the given URI parts. The path and query strings will be broken down into their elements. All strings should not be escaped except where indicated.

parameter.name: scheme
parameter.parameter_description: The scheme for the new URI.

parameter.name: userinfo
parameter.parameter_description: The user-info for the new URI.

parameter.name: host
parameter.parameter_description: The host name for the new URI.

parameter.name: port
parameter.parameter_description: The port number for the new URI or %GST_URI_NO_PORT.

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: The path for the new URI with '/' separating path elements.

parameter.name: query
parameter.parameter_description: The query string for the new URI with '&' separating query elements. Elements containing '&' characters should encode them as "%26".

parameter.name: fragment
parameter.parameter_description: The fragment name for the new URI.

function.return: A new #GstUri object.

function.name: gst_uri_new_with_base
function.description: Like gst_uri_new(), but joins the new URI onto a base URI.

parameter.name: base
parameter.parameter_description: The base URI to join the new URI to.

parameter.name: scheme
parameter.parameter_description: The scheme for the new URI.

parameter.name: userinfo
parameter.parameter_description: The user-info for the new URI.

parameter.name: host
parameter.parameter_description: The host name for the new URI.

parameter.name: port
parameter.parameter_description: The port number for the new URI or %GST_URI_NO_PORT.

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: The path for the new URI with '/' separating path elements.

parameter.name: query
parameter.parameter_description: The query string for the new URI with '&' separating query elements. Elements containing '&' characters should encode them as "%26".

parameter.name: fragment
parameter.parameter_description: The fragment name for the new URI.

function.return: The new URI joined onto @base.

function.name: gst_uri_normalize
function.description:
Normalization will remove extra path segments ("." and "..") from the URI. It will also convert the scheme and host name to lower case and any percent-encoded values to uppercase.
The #GstUri object must be writable. Check with gst_uri_is_writable() or use gst_uri_make_writable() first.
function.return: TRUE if the URI was modified.

function.name: gst_uri_protocol_is_supported
function.description: Checks if an element exists that supports the given URI protocol. Note that a positive return value does not imply that a subsequent call to gst_element_make_from_uri() is guaranteed to work.

parameter.name: type
parameter.parameter_description: Whether to check for a source or a sink

parameter.name: protocol
parameter.parameter_description: Protocol that should be checked for (e.g. "http" or "smb")

function.return: %TRUE

function.name: gst_uri_protocol_is_valid
function.description: Tests if the given string is a valid protocol identifier. Protocols must consist of alphanumeric characters, '+', '-' and '.' and must start with a alphabetic character. See RFC 3986 Section 3.1.
function.return: %TRUE if the string is a valid protocol identifier, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_uri_query_has_key
function.description: Check if there is a query table entry for the @query_key key.
function.return: %TRUE if @query_key exists in the URI query table.

function.name: gst_uri_ref
function.description: Add a reference to this #GstUri object. See gst_mini_object_ref() for further info.
function.return: This object with the reference count incremented.

function.name: gst_uri_remove_query_key
function.description: Remove an entry from the query table by key.
function.return: %TRUE if the key existed in the table and was removed.

function.name: gst_uri_set_fragment
function.description: Sets the fragment string in the URI. Use a value of %NULL in @fragment to unset the fragment string.
function.return: %TRUE if the fragment was set/unset successfully.

function.name: gst_uri_set_host
function.description: Set or unset the host for the URI.

parameter.name: host
parameter.parameter_description: The new host string to set or %NULL to unset.

function.return: %TRUE if the host was set/unset successfully.

function.name: gst_uri_set_path
function.description: Sets or unsets the path in the URI.

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: The new path to set with path segments separated by '/', or use %NULL to unset the path.

function.return: %TRUE if the path was set successfully.

function.name: gst_uri_set_path_segments
function.description: Replace the path segments list in the URI.

parameter.name: path_segments
parameter.parameter_description: The new path list to set.

function.return: %TRUE if the path segments were set successfully.

function.name: gst_uri_set_path_string
function.description: Sets or unsets the path in the URI.

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: The new percent encoded path to set with path segments separated by '/', or use %NULL to unset the path.

function.return: %TRUE if the path was set successfully.

function.name: gst_uri_set_port
function.description: Set or unset the port number for the URI.

parameter.name: port
parameter.parameter_description: The new port number to set or %GST_URI_NO_PORT to unset.

function.return: %TRUE if the port number was set/unset successfully.

function.name: gst_uri_set_query_string
function.description: Sets or unsets the query table in the URI.

parameter.name: query
parameter.parameter_description: The new percent encoded query string to use to populate the query table, or use %NULL to unset the query table.

function.return: %TRUE if the query table was set successfully.

function.name: gst_uri_set_query_table
function.description: Set the query table to use in the URI. The old table is unreferenced and a reference to the new one is used instead. A value if %NULL for @query_table will remove the query string from the URI.

parameter.name: query_table
parameter.parameter_description: The new query table to use.

function.return: %TRUE if the new table was sucessfully used for the query table.

function.name: gst_uri_set_query_value
function.description: This inserts or replaces a key in the query table. A @query_value of %NULL indicates that the key has no associated value, but will still be present in the query string.

parameter.name: query_key
parameter.parameter_description: The key for the query entry.

function.return: %TRUE if the query table was sucessfully updated.

function.name: gst_uri_set_scheme
function.description: Set or unset the scheme for the URI.

parameter.name: scheme
parameter.parameter_description: The new scheme to set or %NULL to unset the scheme.

function.return: %TRUE if the scheme was set/unset successfully.

function.name: gst_uri_set_userinfo
function.description: Set or unset the user information for the URI.

parameter.name: userinfo
parameter.parameter_description: The new user-information string to set or %NULL to unset.

function.return: %TRUE if the user information was set/unset successfully.

function.name: gst_uri_to_string
function.description: Convert the URI to a string.

parameter.name: uri
parameter.parameter_description: This #GstUri to convert to a string.

function.return: The string version of the URI.

function.name: gst_uri_unref
function.description:
Decrement the reference count to this #GstUri object.
If the reference count drops to 0 then finalize this object.
See gst_mini_object_unref() for further info.

function.name: gst_util_array_binary_search
function.description:
Searches inside @array for @search_data by using the comparison function @search_func. @array must be sorted ascending.
As @search_data is always passed as second argument to @search_func it's not required that @search_data has the same type as the array elements.
The complexity of this search function is O(log (num_elements)).

parameter.name: num_elements
parameter.parameter_description: number of elements in the array

parameter.name: element_size
parameter.parameter_description: size of every element in bytes

parameter.name: search_func
parameter.parameter_description: function to compare two elements, @search_data will always be passed as second argument

parameter.name: mode
parameter.parameter_description: search mode that should be used

function.return: The address of the found element or %NULL if nothing was found

function.name: gst_util_double_to_fraction
function.description: Transforms a #gdouble to a fraction and simplifies the result.

parameter.name: dest_n
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a #gint to hold the result numerator

parameter.name: dest_d
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a #gint to hold the result denominator

function.name: gst_util_dump_mem
function.description: Dumps the memory block into a hex representation. Useful for debugging.

parameter.name: mem
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to the memory to dump

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: the size of the memory block to dump

function.name: gst_util_fraction_add
function.description: Adds the fractions @a_n/@a_d and @b_n/@b_d and stores the result in @res_n and @res_d.

parameter.name: res_n
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to #gint to hold the result numerator

parameter.name: res_d
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to #gint to hold the result denominator

function.return: %FALSE on overflow, %TRUE otherwise.

function.name: gst_util_fraction_compare
function.description: Compares the fractions @a_n/@a_d and @b_n/@b_d and returns -1 if a < b, 0 if a = b and 1 if a > b.
function.return: -1 if a < b; 0 if a = b; 1 if a > b.

function.name: gst_util_fraction_multiply
function.description: Multiplies the fractions @a_n/@a_d and @b_n/@b_d and stores the result in @res_n and @res_d.

parameter.name: res_n
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to #gint to hold the result numerator

parameter.name: res_d
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to #gint to hold the result denominator

function.return: %FALSE on overflow, %TRUE otherwise.

function.name: gst_util_fraction_to_double
function.description: Transforms a fraction to a #gdouble.

parameter.name: dest
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a #gdouble for the result

function.name: gst_util_get_timestamp
function.description: Get a timestamp as GstClockTime to be used for interval measurements. The timestamp should not be interpreted in any other way.
function.return: the timestamp

function.name: gst_util_greatest_common_divisor
function.description: Calculates the greatest common divisor of @a and @b.
function.return: Greatest common divisor of @a and @b

function.name: gst_util_greatest_common_divisor_int64
function.description: Calculates the greatest common divisor of @a and @b.
function.return: Greatest common divisor of @a and @b

function.name: gst_util_group_id_next
function.description:
Return a constantly incrementing group id.
This function is used to generate a new group-id for the stream-start event.
function.return: A constantly incrementing unsigned integer, which might overflow back to 0 at some point.

function.name: gst_util_seqnum_compare
function.description:
Compare two sequence numbers, handling wraparound.
The current implementation just returns (gint32)(@s1 - @s2).
function.return: A negative number if @s1 is before @s2, 0 if they are equal, or a positive number if @s1 is after @s2.

function.name: gst_util_seqnum_next
function.description:
Return a constantly incrementing sequence number.
This function is used internally to GStreamer to be able to determine which events and messages are "the same". For example, elements may set the seqnum on a segment-done message to be the same as that of the last seek event, to indicate that event and the message correspond to the same segment.
function.return: A constantly incrementing 32-bit unsigned integer, which might overflow back to 0 at some point. Use gst_util_seqnum_compare() to make sure you handle wraparound correctly.

function.name: gst_util_set_object_arg
function.description:
Converts the string value to the type of the objects argument and sets the argument with it.
Note that this function silently returns if @object has no property named @name or when @value cannot be converted to the type of the property.

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: the object to set the argument of

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the argument to set

function.name: gst_util_set_value_from_string
function.description:
Converts the string to the type of the value and sets the value with it.
Note that this function is dangerous as it does not return any indication if the conversion worked or not.

parameter.name: value_str
parameter.parameter_description: the string to get the value from

function.name: gst_util_uint64_scale
function.description:
Scale @val by the rational number @num / @denom, avoiding overflows and underflows and without loss of precision.
This function can potentially be very slow if val and num are both greater than G_MAXUINT32.

parameter.name: num
parameter.parameter_description: the numerator of the scale ratio

parameter.name: denom
parameter.parameter_description: the denominator of the scale ratio

function.return: @val * @num / @denom. In the case of an overflow, this function returns G_MAXUINT64. If the result is not exactly representable as an integer it is truncated. See also gst_util_uint64_scale_round(), gst_util_uint64_scale_ceil(), gst_util_uint64_scale_int(), gst_util_uint64_scale_int_round(), gst_util_uint64_scale_int_ceil().

function.name: gst_util_uint64_scale_ceil
function.description:
Scale @val by the rational number @num / @denom, avoiding overflows and underflows and without loss of precision.
This function can potentially be very slow if val and num are both greater than G_MAXUINT32.

parameter.name: num
parameter.parameter_description: the numerator of the scale ratio

parameter.name: denom
parameter.parameter_description: the denominator of the scale ratio

function.return: @val * @num / @denom. In the case of an overflow, this function returns G_MAXUINT64. If the result is not exactly representable as an integer, it is rounded up. See also gst_util_uint64_scale(), gst_util_uint64_scale_round(), gst_util_uint64_scale_int(), gst_util_uint64_scale_int_round(), gst_util_uint64_scale_int_ceil().

function.name: gst_util_uint64_scale_int
function.return: @val * @num / @denom. In the case of an overflow, this function returns G_MAXUINT64. If the result is not exactly representable as an integer, it is truncated. See also gst_util_uint64_scale_int_round(), gst_util_uint64_scale_int_ceil(), gst_util_uint64_scale(), gst_util_uint64_scale_round(), gst_util_uint64_scale_ceil().

function.name: gst_util_uint64_scale_int_ceil
function.return: @val * @num / @denom. In the case of an overflow, this function returns G_MAXUINT64. If the result is not exactly representable as an integer, it is rounded up. See also gst_util_uint64_scale_int(), gst_util_uint64_scale_int_round(), gst_util_uint64_scale(), gst_util_uint64_scale_round(), gst_util_uint64_scale_ceil().

function.name: gst_util_uint64_scale_int_round
function.return: @val * @num / @denom. In the case of an overflow, this function returns G_MAXUINT64. If the result is not exactly representable as an integer, it is rounded to the nearest integer (half-way cases are rounded up). See also gst_util_uint64_scale_int(), gst_util_uint64_scale_int_ceil(), gst_util_uint64_scale(), gst_util_uint64_scale_round(), gst_util_uint64_scale_ceil().

function.name: gst_util_uint64_scale_round
function.description:
Scale @val by the rational number @num / @denom, avoiding overflows and underflows and without loss of precision.
This function can potentially be very slow if val and num are both greater than G_MAXUINT32.

parameter.name: num
parameter.parameter_description: the numerator of the scale ratio

parameter.name: denom
parameter.parameter_description: the denominator of the scale ratio

function.return: @val * @num / @denom. In the case of an overflow, this function returns G_MAXUINT64. If the result is not exactly representable as an integer, it is rounded to the nearest integer (half-way cases are rounded up). See also gst_util_uint64_scale(), gst_util_uint64_scale_ceil(), gst_util_uint64_scale_int(), gst_util_uint64_scale_int_round(), gst_util_uint64_scale_int_ceil().

function.name: gst_value_array_append_and_take_value
function.description: Appends @append_value to the GstValueArray in @value.

function.name: gst_value_array_append_value
function.description: Appends @append_value to the GstValueArray in @value.

function.name: gst_value_array_get_size
function.description: Gets the number of values contained in @value.
function.return: the number of values

function.name: gst_value_array_get_value
function.description: Gets the value that is a member of the array contained in @value and has the index @index.

parameter.name: index
parameter.parameter_description: index of value to get from the array

function.return: the value at the given index

function.name: gst_value_array_prepend_value
function.description: Prepends @prepend_value to the GstValueArray in @value.

function.name: gst_value_can_compare
function.description: Determines if @value1 and @value2 can be compared.
function.return: %TRUE if the values can be compared

function.name: gst_value_can_intersect
function.description: Determines if intersecting two values will produce a valid result. Two values will produce a valid intersection if they have the same type.
function.return: %TRUE if the values can intersect

function.name: gst_value_can_subtract
function.description: Checks if it's possible to subtract @subtrahend from @minuend.
function.return: %TRUE if a subtraction is possible

function.name: gst_value_can_union
function.description: Determines if @value1 and @value2 can be non-trivially unioned. Any two values can be trivially unioned by adding both of them to a GstValueList. However, certain types have the possibility to be unioned in a simpler way. For example, an integer range and an integer can be unioned if the integer is a subset of the integer range. If there is the possibility that two values can be unioned, this function returns %TRUE.
function.return: %TRUE if there is a function allowing the two values to be unioned.

function.name: gst_value_compare
function.description: Compares @value1 and @value2. If @value1 and @value2 cannot be compared, the function returns GST_VALUE_UNORDERED. Otherwise, if @value1 is greater than @value2, GST_VALUE_GREATER_THAN is returned. If @value1 is less than @value2, GST_VALUE_LESS_THAN is returned. If the values are equal, GST_VALUE_EQUAL is returned.
function.return: comparison result

function.name: gst_value_deserialize
function.description: Tries to deserialize a string into the type specified by the given GValue. If the operation succeeds, %TRUE is returned, %FALSE otherwise.

parameter.name: dest
parameter.parameter_description: #GValue to fill with contents of deserialization

function.return: %TRUE on success

function.name: gst_value_fixate
function.description: Fixate @src into a new value @dest. For ranges, the first element is taken. For lists and arrays, the first item is fixated and returned. If @src is already fixed, this function returns %FALSE.
function.return: %TRUE if @dest contains a fixated version of @src.

function.name: gst_value_fraction_multiply
function.description: Multiplies the two #GValue items containing a #GST_TYPE_FRACTION and sets @product to the product of the two fractions.
function.return: %FALSE in case of an error (like integer overflow), %TRUE otherwise.

function.name: gst_value_fraction_subtract
function.description: Subtracts the @subtrahend from the @minuend and sets @dest to the result.
function.return: %FALSE in case of an error (like integer overflow), %TRUE otherwise.

function.name: gst_value_get_bitmask
function.description: Gets the bitmask specified by @value.
function.return: the bitmask.

function.name: gst_value_get_buffer
function.description: Receives a #GstBuffer as the value of @v. Does not return a reference to the buffer, so the pointer is only valid for as long as the caller owns a reference to @v.
function.return: buffer

function.name: gst_value_get_caps
function.description: Gets the contents of @value. The reference count of the returned #GstCaps will not be modified, therefore the caller must take one before getting rid of the @value.
function.return: the contents of @value

function.name: gst_value_get_caps_features
function.description: Gets the contents of @value.
function.return: the contents of @value

function.name: gst_value_get_double_range_max
function.description: Gets the maximum of the range specified by @value.
function.return: the maximum of the range

function.name: gst_value_get_double_range_min
function.description: Gets the minimum of the range specified by @value.
function.return: the minimum of the range

function.name: gst_value_get_flagset_flags
function.description: Retrieve the flags field of a GstFlagSet @value.
function.return: the flags field of the flagset instance.

function.name: gst_value_get_flagset_mask
function.description: Retrieve the mask field of a GstFlagSet @value.
function.return: the mask field of the flagset instance.

function.name: gst_value_get_fraction_denominator
function.description: Gets the denominator of the fraction specified by @value.
function.return: the denominator of the fraction.

function.name: gst_value_get_fraction_numerator
function.description: Gets the numerator of the fraction specified by @value.
function.return: the numerator of the fraction.

function.name: gst_value_get_fraction_range_max
function.description: Gets the maximum of the range specified by @value.
function.return: the maximum of the range

function.name: gst_value_get_fraction_range_min
function.description: Gets the minimum of the range specified by @value.
function.return: the minimum of the range

function.name: gst_value_get_int64_range_max
function.description: Gets the maximum of the range specified by @value.
function.return: the maximum of the range

function.name: gst_value_get_int64_range_min
function.description: Gets the minimum of the range specified by @value.
function.return: the minimum of the range

function.name: gst_value_get_int64_range_step

function.description: Sets @b as the value of @v. Caller gives away reference to sample.

function.name: gst_video_blend_scale_linear_RGBA
function.description: Scales a buffer containing RGBA (or AYUV) video. This is an internal helper function which is used to scale subtitle overlays, and may be deprecated in the near future. Use #GstVideoScaler to scale video buffers instead.

parameter.name: src_buffer

parameter.name: dest_height
parameter.parameter_description: the height in pixels to scale the video data in @src_buffer to

parameter.name: dest_width
parameter.parameter_description: the width in pixels to scale the video data in @src_buffer to

parameter.name: dest
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a #GstVideoInfo structure that will be filled in with the details for @dest_buffer

parameter.name: dest_buffer
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to a #GstBuffer variable, which will be set to a newly-allocated buffer containing the scaled pixels.

function.name: gst_video_buffer_pool_new

function.return: a new #GstBufferPool to allocate video frames

parameter.name: video_width
parameter.parameter_description: Width of the video frame in pixels

parameter.name: video_height
parameter.parameter_description: Height of the video frame in pixels

parameter.name: video_par_n
parameter.parameter_description: Numerator of the pixel aspect ratio of the input video.

parameter.name: video_par_d
parameter.parameter_description: Denominator of the pixel aspect ratio of the input video.

parameter.name: display_par_n
parameter.parameter_description: Numerator of the pixel aspect ratio of the display device

parameter.name: display_par_d
parameter.parameter_description: Denominator of the pixel aspect ratio of the display device

function.return: A boolean indicating success and a calculated Display Ratio in the dar_n and dar_d parameters. The return value is FALSE in the case of integer overflow or other error.

function.name: gst_video_chroma_from_string
function.description: Convert @s to a #GstVideoChromaSite
function.return: a #GstVideoChromaSite or %GST_VIDEO_CHROMA_SITE_UNKNOWN when @s does not contain a valid chroma description.

function.name: gst_video_chroma_resample
function.description: Perform resampling of @width chroma pixels in @lines.

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: the number of pixels on one line

function.name: gst_video_chroma_resample_free
function.description: Free @resample

function.name: gst_video_chroma_resample_get_info
function.description: The resampler must be fed @n_lines at a time. The first line should be at @offset.

function.name: gst_video_chroma_resample_new
function.return: a new #GstVideoChromaResample that should be freed with gst_video_chroma_resample_free() after usage.

function.name: gst_video_chroma_to_string
function.description: Converts @site to its string representation.
function.return: a string describing @site.

function.name: gst_video_codec_frame_get_user_data
function.description: Gets private data set on the frame by the subclass via gst_video_codec_frame_set_user_data() previously.
function.return: The previously set user_data

function.name: gst_video_codec_frame_ref
function.description: Increases the refcount of the given frame by one.
function.return: @buf

function.name: gst_video_codec_frame_set_user_data
function.description:
Sets @user_data on the frame and the #GDestroyNotify that will be called when the frame is freed. Allows to attach private data by the subclass to frames.
If a @user_data was previously set, then the previous set @notify will be called before the @user_data is replaced.

function.name: gst_video_codec_frame_unref
function.description: Decreases the refcount of the frame. If the refcount reaches 0, the frame will be freed.

function.name: gst_video_codec_state_ref
function.description: Increases the refcount of the given state by one.
function.return: @buf

function.name: gst_video_codec_state_unref
function.description: Decreases the refcount of the state. If the refcount reaches 0, the state will be freed.

function.name: gst_video_color_matrix_get_Kr_Kb
function.description:
Get the coefficients used to convert between Y'PbPr and R'G'B' using @matrix.
When:
|[ 0.0 <= [Y',R',G',B'] <= 1.0) (-0.5 <= [Pb,Pr] <= 0.5) ]|
the general conversion is given by:
|[ Y' = Kr*R' + (1-Kr-Kb)*G' + Kb*B' Pb = (B'-Y')/(2*(1-Kb)) Pr = (R'-Y')/(2*(1-Kr)) ]|
and the other way around:
|[ R' = Y' + Cr*2*(1-Kr) G' = Y' - Cb*2*(1-Kb)*Kb/(1-Kr-Kb) - Cr*2*(1-Kr)*Kr/(1-Kr-Kb) B' = Y' + Cb*2*(1-Kb) ]|
function.return: TRUE if @matrix was a YUV color format and @Kr and @Kb contain valid values.

function.name: gst_video_color_primaries_get_info
function.description: Get information about the chromaticity coordinates of @primaries.
function.return: a #GstVideoColorPrimariesInfo for @primaries.

function.name: gst_video_color_range_offsets
function.description:
Compute the offset and scale values for each component of @info. For each component, (c[i] - offset[i]) / scale[i] will scale the component c[i] to the range [0.0 .. 1.0].
The reverse operation (c[i] * scale[i]) + offset[i] can be used to convert the component values in range [0.0 .. 1.0] back to their representation in @info and @range.

function.name: gst_video_color_transfer_decode
function.description:
Convert @val to its gamma decoded value. This is the inverse operation of @gst_video_color_transfer_encode().
For a non-linear value L' in the range [0..1], conversion to the linear L is in general performed with a power function like:
|[ L = L' ^ gamma ]|
Depending on @func, different formulas might be applied. Some formulas encode a linear segment in the lower range.
function.return: the gamme decoded value of @val

function.name: gst_video_color_transfer_encode
function.description:
Convert @val to its gamma encoded value.
For a linear value L in the range [0..1], conversion to the non-linear (gamma encoded) L' is in general performed with a power function like:
|[ L' = L ^ (1 / gamma) ]|
Depending on @func, different formulas might be applied. Some formulas encode a linear segment in the lower range.
function.return: the gamme encoded value of @val

function.name: gst_video_colorimetry_from_string
function.description: Parse the colorimetry string and update @cinfo with the parsed values.
function.return: #TRUE if @color points to valid colorimetry info.

function.name: gst_video_colorimetry_is_equal
function.description: Compare the 2 colorimetry sets for equality
function.return: #TRUE if @cinfo and @other are equal.

function.name: gst_video_colorimetry_matches
function.description: Check if the colorimetry information in @info matches that of the string @color.
function.return: #TRUE if @color conveys the same colorimetry info as the color information in @info.

function.name: gst_video_colorimetry_to_string
function.description: Make a string representation of @cinfo.
function.return: a string representation of @cinfo.

function.name: gst_video_convert_sample
function.description:
Converts a raw video buffer into the specified output caps.
The output caps can be any raw video formats or any image formats (jpeg, png, ...).
The width, height and pixel-aspect-ratio can also be specified in the output caps.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.parameter_description: the maximum amount of time allowed for the processing.

function.return: The converted #GstSample, or %NULL if an error happened (in which case @err will point to the #GError).

function.name: gst_video_convert_sample_async

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.parameter_description: the maximum amount of time allowed for the processing.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: %GstVideoConvertSampleCallback that will be called after conversion.

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: extra data that will be passed to the @callback

parameter.name: destroy_notify
parameter.parameter_description: %GDestroyNotify to be called after @user_data is not needed anymore

function.name: gst_video_converter_frame
function.description: Convert the pixels of @src into @dest using @convert.

function.name: gst_video_converter_free
function.description: Free @convert

function.name: gst_video_converter_get_config
function.description: Get the current configuration of @convert.
function.return: a #GstStructure that remains valid for as long as @convert is valid or until gst_video_converter_set_config() is called.

function.name: gst_video_converter_new
function.description: Create a new converter object to convert between @in_info and @out_info with @config.
function.return: a #GstVideoConverter or %NULL if conversion is not possible.

function.name: gst_video_converter_set_config
function.description:
Set @config as extra configuraion for @convert.
If the parameters in @config can not be set exactly, this function returns %FALSE and will try to update as much state as possible. The new state can then be retrieved and refined with gst_video_converter_get_config().
Look at the #GST_VIDEO_CONVERTER_OPT_* fields to check valid configuration option and values.
function.return: %TRUE when @config could be set.

function.name: gst_video_decoder_add_to_frame
function.description: Removes next @n_bytes of input data and adds it to currently parsed frame.

parameter.name: n_bytes
parameter.parameter_description: the number of bytes to add

function.name: gst_video_decoder_allocate_output_buffer
function.description:
Helper function that allocates a buffer to hold a video frame for @decoder's current #GstVideoCodecState.
You should use gst_video_decoder_allocate_output_frame() instead of this function, if possible at all.
function.return: allocated buffer, or NULL if no buffer could be allocated (e.g. when downstream is flushing or shutting down)

function.name: gst_video_decoder_allocate_output_frame
function.description:
Helper function that allocates a buffer to hold a video frame for @decoder's current #GstVideoCodecState. Subclass should already have configured video state and set src pad caps.
The buffer allocated here is owned by the frame and you should only keep references to the frame, not the buffer.
function.return: %GST_FLOW_OK if an output buffer could be allocated

function.name: gst_video_decoder_drop_frame
function.description: Similar to gst_video_decoder_finish_frame(), but drops @frame in any case and posts a QoS message with the frame's details on the bus. In any case, the frame is considered finished and released.
function.return: a #GstFlowReturn, usually GST_FLOW_OK.

function.name: gst_video_decoder_finish_frame
function.description:
@frame should have a valid decoded data buffer, whose metadata fields are then appropriately set according to frame data and pushed downstream. If no output data is provided, @frame is considered skipped. In any case, the frame is considered finished and released.
After calling this function the output buffer of the frame is to be considered read-only. This function will also change the metadata of the buffer.
function.return: a #GstFlowReturn resulting from sending data downstream

function.name: gst_video_decoder_get_allocator
function.description:
Lets #GstVideoDecoder sub-classes to know the memory @allocator used by the base class and its @params.
Unref the @allocator after use it.

function.name: gst_video_decoder_get_buffer_pool
function.return: the instance of the #GstBufferPool used by the decoder; free it after use it

function.name: gst_video_decoder_get_estimate_rate
function.return: currently configured byte to time conversion setting

function.name: gst_video_decoder_get_frame
function.description: Get a pending unfinished #GstVideoCodecFrame
function.return: pending unfinished #GstVideoCodecFrame identified by @frame_number.

function.name: gst_video_decoder_get_frames
function.description: Get all pending unfinished #GstVideoCodecFrame

function.name: gst_video_decoder_get_max_errors
