function.name: gst_video_decoder_merge_tags
function.description:
Sets the audio decoder tags and how they should be merged with any upstream stream tags. This will override any tags previously-set with gst_audio_decoder_merge_tags().
Note that this is provided for convenience, and the subclass is not required to use this and can still do tag handling on its own.
MT safe.

parameter.name: tags
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstTagList to merge, or NULL to unset previously-set tags

function.name: gst_video_decoder_negotiate
function.description: Negotiate with downstream elements to currently configured #GstVideoCodecState. Unmark GST_PAD_FLAG_NEED_RECONFIGURE in any case. But mark it again if negotiate fails.
function.return: #TRUE if the negotiation succeeded, else #FALSE.

function.name: gst_video_decoder_proxy_getcaps
function.description: Returns caps that express @caps (or sink template caps if @caps == NULL) restricted to resolution/format/... combinations supported by downstream elements.
function.return: a #GstCaps owned by caller

function.name: gst_video_decoder_release_frame
function.description: Similar to gst_video_decoder_drop_frame(), but simply releases @frame without any processing other than removing it from list of pending frames, after which it is considered finished and released.

function.name: gst_video_decoder_set_estimate_rate
function.description: Allows baseclass to perform byte to time estimated conversion.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.parameter_description: whether to enable byte to time conversion

function.name: gst_video_decoder_set_latency
function.description: Lets #GstVideoDecoder sub-classes tell the baseclass what the decoder latency is. Will also post a LATENCY message on the bus so the pipeline can reconfigure its global latency.

function.name: gst_video_decoder_set_max_errors
function.description:
Sets numbers of tolerated decoder errors, where a tolerated one is then only warned about, but more than tolerated will lead to fatal error. You can set -1 for never returning fatal errors. Default is set to GST_VIDEO_DECODER_MAX_ERRORS.
The '-1' option was added in 1.4

function.name: gst_video_decoder_set_needs_format
function.description: Configures decoder format needs. If enabled, subclass needs to be negotiated with format caps before it can process any data. It will then never be handed any data before it has been configured. Otherwise, it might be handed data without having been configured and is then expected being able to do so either by default or based on the input data.

function.name: gst_video_decoder_set_output_state
function.description:
Creates a new #GstVideoCodecState with the specified @fmt, @width and @height as the output state for the decoder. Any previously set output state on @decoder will be replaced by the newly created one.
If the subclass wishes to copy over existing fields (like pixel aspec ratio, or framerate) from an existing #GstVideoCodecState, it can be provided as a @reference.
If the subclass wishes to override some fields from the output state (like pixel-aspect-ratio or framerate) it can do so on the returned #GstVideoCodecState.
The new output state will only take effect (set on pads and buffers) starting from the next call to #gst_video_decoder_finish_frame().
function.return: the newly configured output state.

function.name: gst_video_decoder_set_packetized
function.description: Allows baseclass to consider input data as packetized or not. If the input is packetized, then the @parse method will not be called.

parameter.name: packetized
parameter.parameter_description: whether the input data should be considered as packetized.

function.name: gst_video_decoder_set_use_default_pad_acceptcaps
function.description:
Lets #GstVideoDecoder sub-classes decide if they want the sink pad to use the default pad query handler to reply to accept-caps queries.
By setting this to true it is possible to further customize the default handler with %GST_PAD_SET_ACCEPT_INTERSECT and %GST_PAD_SET_ACCEPT_TEMPLATE

parameter.name: use
parameter.parameter_description: if the default pad accept-caps query handling should be used

function.name: gst_video_dither_free
function.description: Free @dither

function.name: gst_video_dither_line
function.description:
Dither @width pixels starting from offset @x in @line using @dither.
@y is the line number of @line in the output image.

parameter.name: line
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to the pixels of the line

function.name: gst_video_dither_new
function.return: a new #GstVideoDither

function.name: gst_video_encoder_allocate_output_buffer
function.description: Helper function that allocates a buffer to hold an encoded video frame for @encoder's current #GstVideoCodecState.
function.return: allocated buffer

function.name: gst_video_encoder_allocate_output_frame
function.description:
Helper function that allocates a buffer to hold an encoded video frame for @encoder's current #GstVideoCodecState. Subclass should already have configured video state and set src pad caps.
The buffer allocated here is owned by the frame and you should only keep references to the frame, not the buffer.
function.return: %GST_FLOW_OK if an output buffer could be allocated

function.name: gst_video_encoder_finish_frame
function.description:
@frame must have a valid encoded data buffer, whose metadata fields are then appropriately set according to frame data or no buffer at all if the frame should be dropped. It is subsequently pushed downstream or provided to @pre_push. In any case, the frame is considered finished and released.
After calling this function the output buffer of the frame is to be considered read-only. This function will also change the metadata of the buffer.
function.return: a #GstFlowReturn resulting from sending data downstream

function.name: gst_video_encoder_get_allocator
function.description:
Lets #GstVideoEncoder sub-classes to know the memory @allocator used by the base class and its @params.
Unref the @allocator after use it.

function.name: gst_video_encoder_get_frame
function.description: Get a pending unfinished #GstVideoCodecFrame
function.return: pending unfinished #GstVideoCodecFrame identified by @frame_number.

function.name: gst_video_encoder_get_frames
function.description: Get all pending unfinished #GstVideoCodecFrame
function.return: pending unfinished #GstVideoCodecFrame.

function.name: gst_video_encoder_get_latency
function.description: Query the configured encoding latency. Results will be returned via @min_latency and @max_latency.

parameter.name: min_latency
parameter.parameter_description: address of variable in which to store the configured minimum latency, or %NULL

parameter.name: max_latency
parameter.parameter_description: address of variable in which to store the configured maximum latency, or %NULL

function.name: gst_video_encoder_get_oldest_frame
function.description: Get the oldest unfinished pending #GstVideoCodecFrame
function.return: oldest unfinished pending #GstVideoCodecFrame

function.name: gst_video_encoder_get_output_state
function.description: Get the current #GstVideoCodecState
function.return: #GstVideoCodecState describing format of video data.

function.name: gst_video_encoder_merge_tags
function.description:
Sets the video encoder tags and how they should be merged with any upstream stream tags. This will override any tags previously-set with gst_video_encoder_merge_tags().
Note that this is provided for convenience, and the subclass is not required to use this and can still do tag handling on its own.
MT safe.

parameter.name: tags
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstTagList to merge, or NULL to unset previously-set tags

function.name: gst_video_encoder_negotiate
function.description: Negotiate with downstream elements to currently configured #GstVideoCodecState. Unmark GST_PAD_FLAG_NEED_RECONFIGURE in any case. But mark it again if negotiate fails.
function.return: #TRUE if the negotiation succeeded, else #FALSE.

function.name: gst_video_encoder_proxy_getcaps
function.description: Returns caps that express @caps (or sink template caps if @caps == NULL) restricted to resolution/format/... combinations supported by downstream elements (e.g. muxers).
function.return: a #GstCaps owned by caller

function.name: gst_video_encoder_set_headers
function.description: Set the codec headers to be sent downstream whenever requested.

parameter.name: headers
parameter.parameter_description: a list of #GstBuffer containing the codec header

function.name: gst_video_encoder_set_latency
function.description: Informs baseclass of encoding latency.

function.name: gst_video_encoder_set_min_pts
function.description:
Request minimal value for PTS passed to handle_frame.
For streams with reordered frames this can be used to ensure that there is enough time to accomodate first DTS, which may be less than first PTS

parameter.name: min_pts
parameter.parameter_description: minimal PTS that will be passed to handle_frame

function.name: gst_video_encoder_set_output_state
function.description:
Creates a new #GstVideoCodecState with the specified caps as the output state for the encoder. Any previously set output state on @encoder will be replaced by the newly created one.
The specified @caps should not contain any resolution, pixel-aspect-ratio, framerate, codec-data, .... Those should be specified instead in the returned #GstVideoCodecState.
If the subclass wishes to copy over existing fields (like pixel aspect ratio, or framerate) from an existing #GstVideoCodecState, it can be provided as a @reference.
If the subclass wishes to override some fields from the output state (like pixel-aspect-ratio or framerate) it can do so on the returned #GstVideoCodecState.
The new output state will only take effect (set on pads and buffers) starting from the next call to #gst_video_encoder_finish_frame().

parameter.name: caps
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstCaps to use for the output

function.return: the newly configured output state.

function.name: gst_video_event_is_force_key_unit
function.description: Checks if an event is a force key unit event. Returns true for both upstream and downstream force key unit events.
function.return: %TRUE if the event is a valid force key unit event

function.name: gst_video_event_new_downstream_force_key_unit
function.description:
Creates a new downstream force key unit event. A downstream force key unit event can be sent down the pipeline to request downstream elements to produce a key unit. A downstream force key unit event must also be sent when handling an upstream force key unit event to notify downstream that the latter has been handled.
To parse an event created by gst_video_event_new_downstream_force_key_unit() use gst_video_event_parse_downstream_force_key_unit().

parameter.name: timestamp
parameter.parameter_description: the timestamp of the buffer that starts a new key unit

parameter.name: stream_time
parameter.parameter_description: the stream_time of the buffer that starts a new key unit

parameter.name: running_time
parameter.parameter_description: the running_time of the buffer that starts a new key unit

parameter.name: all_headers
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE to produce headers when starting a new key unit

parameter.name: count
parameter.parameter_description: integer that can be used to number key units

function.return: The new GstEvent

function.name: gst_video_event_new_still_frame
function.description:
Creates a new Still Frame event. If @in_still is %TRUE, then the event represents the start of a still frame sequence. If it is %FALSE, then the event ends a still frame sequence.
To parse an event created by gst_video_event_new_still_frame() use gst_video_event_parse_still_frame().

parameter.name: in_still
parameter.parameter_description: boolean value for the still-frame state of the event.

function.return: The new GstEvent

function.name: gst_video_event_new_upstream_force_key_unit

parameter.name: running_time
parameter.parameter_description: the running_time at which a new key unit should be produced

parameter.name: all_headers
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE to produce headers when starting a new key unit

parameter.name: count
parameter.parameter_description: integer that can be used to number key units

function.return: The new GstEvent

function.name: gst_video_event_parse_downstream_force_key_unit
function.description:
Get timestamp, stream-time, running-time, all-headers and count in the force key unit event. See gst_video_event_new_downstream_force_key_unit() for a full description of the downstream force key unit event.
@running_time will be adjusted for any pad offsets of pads it was passing through.

parameter.name: timestamp
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to the timestamp in the event

parameter.name: stream_time
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to the stream-time in the event

parameter.name: running_time
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to the running-time in the event

parameter.name: all_headers
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to the all_headers flag in the event

parameter.name: count
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to the count field of the event

function.return: %TRUE if the event is a valid downstream force key unit event.

function.name: gst_video_event_parse_still_frame
function.description:
Parse a #GstEvent, identify if it is a Still Frame event, and return the still-frame state from the event if it is. If the event represents the start of a still frame, the in_still variable will be set to TRUE, otherwise FALSE. It is OK to pass NULL for the in_still variable order to just check whether the event is a valid still-frame event.
Create a still frame event using gst_video_event_new_still_frame()

parameter.name: in_still
parameter.parameter_description: A boolean to receive the still-frame status from the event, or NULL

function.return: %TRUE if the event is a valid still-frame event. %FALSE if not

function.name: gst_video_event_parse_upstream_force_key_unit

parameter.name: running_time
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to the running_time in the event

parameter.name: all_headers
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to the all_headers flag in the event

parameter.name: count
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to the count field in the event

function.return: %TRUE if the event is a valid upstream force-key-unit event. %FALSE if not

function.name: gst_video_format_from_fourcc
function.description: Converts a FOURCC value into the corresponding #GstVideoFormat. If the FOURCC cannot be represented by #GstVideoFormat, #GST_VIDEO_FORMAT_UNKNOWN is returned.

parameter.name: fourcc
parameter.parameter_description: a FOURCC value representing raw YUV video

function.return: the #GstVideoFormat describing the FOURCC value

function.name: gst_video_format_from_masks
function.description: Find the #GstVideoFormat for the given parameters.

parameter.name: depth
parameter.parameter_description: the amount of bits used for a pixel

parameter.name: bpp
parameter.parameter_description: the amount of bits used to store a pixel. This value is bigger than @depth

parameter.name: endianness
parameter.parameter_description: the endianness of the masks, #G_LITTLE_ENDIAN or #G_BIG_ENDIAN

parameter.name: alpha_mask
parameter.parameter_description: the alpha mask, or 0 if no alpha mask

function.return: a #GstVideoFormat or GST_VIDEO_FORMAT_UNKNOWN when the parameters to not specify a known format.

function.name: gst_video_format_from_string
function.description: Convert the @format string to its #GstVideoFormat.
function.return: the #GstVideoFormat for @format or GST_VIDEO_FORMAT_UNKNOWN when the string is not a known format.

function.name: gst_video_format_get_info
function.description: Get the #GstVideoFormatInfo for @format
function.return: The #GstVideoFormatInfo for @format.

function.name: gst_video_format_get_palette
function.description: Get the default palette of @format. This the palette used in the pack function for paletted formats.

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: size of the palette in bytes

function.return: the default palette of @format or %NULL when @format does not have a palette.

function.name: gst_video_format_to_fourcc
function.description: Converts a #GstVideoFormat value into the corresponding FOURCC. Only a few YUV formats have corresponding FOURCC values. If @format has no corresponding FOURCC value, 0 is returned.
function.return: the FOURCC corresponding to @format

function.name: gst_video_format_to_string
function.description: Returns a string containing a descriptive name for the #GstVideoFormat if there is one, or NULL otherwise.
function.return: the name corresponding to @format

function.name: gst_video_frame_copy
function.description: Copy the contents from @src to @dest.
function.return: TRUE if the contents could be copied.

function.name: gst_video_frame_copy_plane
function.description: Copy the plane with index @plane from @src to @dest.
function.return: TRUE if the contents could be copied.

function.name: gst_video_frame_map
function.return: %TRUE on success.

function.name: gst_video_frame_map_id
function.description:
Use @info and @buffer to fill in the values of @frame with the video frame information of frame @id.
When @id is -1, the default frame is mapped. When @id != -1, this function will return %FALSE when there is no GstVideoMeta with that id.
All video planes of @buffer will be mapped and the pointers will be set in @frame->data.
function.return: %TRUE on success.

function.name: gst_video_frame_unmap
function.description: Unmap the memory previously mapped with gst_video_frame_map.

function.name: gst_video_gl_texture_upload_meta_upload
function.description: Uploads the buffer which owns the meta to a specific texture ID.

parameter.name: texture_id
parameter.parameter_description: the texture IDs to upload to

function.return: %TRUE if uploading succeeded, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_video_guess_framerate
function.description:
Given the nominal duration of one video frame, this function will check some standard framerates for a close match (within 0.1%) and return one if possible,
It will calculate an arbitrary framerate if no close match was found, and return %FALSE.
It returns %FALSE if a duration of 0 is passed.
function.return: %TRUE if a close "standard" framerate was recognised, and %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_video_info_align
function.description:
Adjust the offset and stride fields in @info so that the padding and stride alignment in @align is respected.
Extra padding will be added to the right side when stride alignment padding is required and @align will be updated with the new padding values.

function.name: gst_video_info_convert
function.description: Converts among various #GstFormat types. This function handles GST_FORMAT_BYTES, GST_FORMAT_TIME, and GST_FORMAT_DEFAULT. For raw video, GST_FORMAT_DEFAULT corresponds to video frames. This function can be used to handle pad queries of the type GST_QUERY_CONVERT.
function.return: TRUE if the conversion was successful.

function.name: gst_video_info_copy
function.description: Copy a GstVideoInfo structure.
function.return: a new #GstVideoInfo. free with gst_video_info_free.

function.name: gst_video_info_free
function.description: Free a GstVideoInfo structure previously allocated with gst_video_info_new() or gst_video_info_copy().

function.name: gst_video_info_from_caps
function.description: Parse @caps and update @info.
function.return: TRUE if @caps could be parsed

function.name: gst_video_info_init
function.description: Initialize @info with default values.

function.name: gst_video_info_is_equal
function.description: Compares two #GstVideoInfo and returns whether they are equal or not
function.return: %TRUE if @info and @other are equal, else %FALSE.

function.name: gst_video_info_new
function.description: Allocate a new #GstVideoInfo that is also initialized with gst_video_info_init().
function.return: a new #GstVideoInfo. free with gst_video_info_free().

function.name: gst_video_info_set_format
function.description:
Set the default info for a video frame of @format and @width and @height.
Note: This initializes @info first, no values are preserved. This function does not set the offsets correctly for interlaced vertically subsampled formats.

function.name: gst_video_info_to_caps
function.description: Convert the values of @info into a #GstCaps.
function.return: a new #GstCaps containing the info of @info.

function.name: gst_video_interlace_mode_from_string
function.description: Convert @mode to a #GstVideoInterlaceMode
function.return: the #GstVideoInterlaceMode of @mode or #GST_VIDEO_INTERLACE_MODE_PROGRESSIVE when @mode is not a valid string representation for a #GstVideoInterlaceMode.

function.name: gst_video_interlace_mode_to_string
function.description: Convert @mode to its string representation.
function.return: @mode as a string or NULL if @mode in invalid.

function.name: gst_video_meta_map
function.description: Map the video plane with index @plane in @meta and return a pointer to the first byte of the plane and the stride of the plane.
function.return: TRUE if the map operation was successful.

function.name: gst_video_meta_transform_scale
function.description: GQuark for the video "gst-video-scale" transform.

function.name: gst_video_meta_transform_scale_get_quark
function.description: Get the #GQuark for the "gst-video-scale" metadata transform operation.
function.return: a #GQuark

function.name: gst_video_meta_unmap
function.description: Unmap a previously mapped plane with gst_video_meta_map().
function.return: TRUE if the memory was successfully unmapped.

function.name: gst_video_multiview_get_doubled_height_modes
function.return:
A const #GValue containing a list of stereo video modes
Utility function that returns a #GValue with a GstList of packed stereo video modes with double the height of a single view for use in caps negotiations. Currently this is top-bottom and row-interleaved.

function.name: gst_video_multiview_get_doubled_size_modes
function.return:
A const #GValue containing a list of stereo video modes
Utility function that returns a #GValue with a GstList of packed stereo video modes that have double the width/height of a single view for use in caps negotiation. Currently this is just 'checkerboard' layout.

function.name: gst_video_multiview_get_doubled_width_modes
function.return:
A const #GValue containing a list of stereo video modes
Utility function that returns a #GValue with a GstList of packed stereo video modes with double the width of a single view for use in caps negotiations. Currently this is side-by-side, side-by-side-quincunx and column-interleaved.

function.name: gst_video_multiview_get_mono_modes
function.return:
A const #GValue containing a list of mono video modes
Utility function that returns a #GValue with a GstList of mono video modes (mono/left/right) for use in caps negotiations.

function.name: gst_video_multiview_get_unpacked_modes
function.return:
A const #GValue containing a list of 'unpacked' stereo video modes
Utility function that returns a #GValue with a GstList of unpacked stereo video modes (separated/frame-by-frame/frame-by-frame-multiview) for use in caps negotiations.

function.name: gst_video_multiview_guess_half_aspect
function.return:
A boolean indicating whether the #GST_VIDEO_MULTIVIEW_FLAG_HALF_ASPECT flag should be set.
Utility function that heuristically guess whether a frame-packed stereoscopic video contains half width/height encoded views, or full-frame views by looking at the overall display aspect ratio.

function.name: gst_video_multiview_mode_from_caps_string
function.return:
The #GstVideoMultiviewMode value
Given a string from a caps multiview-mode field, output the corresponding #GstVideoMultiviewMode or #GST_VIDEO_MULTIVIEW_MODE_NONE

function.name: gst_video_multiview_mode_to_caps_string
function.return:
The caps string representation of the mode, or NULL if invalid.
Given a #GstVideoMultiviewMode returns the multiview-mode caps string for insertion into a caps structure

function.name: gst_video_multiview_video_info_change_mode
function.description: Utility function that transforms the width/height/PAR and multiview mode and flags of a #GstVideoInfo into the requested mode.

function.name: gst_video_orientation_get_hcenter
function.description: Get the horizontal centering offset from the given object.
function.return: %TRUE in case the element supports centering

function.name: gst_video_orientation_get_hflip
function.description: Get the horizontal flipping state (%TRUE for flipped) from the given object.
function.return: %TRUE in case the element supports flipping

function.name: gst_video_orientation_get_vcenter
function.description: Get the vertical centering offset from the given object.
function.return: %TRUE in case the element supports centering

function.name: gst_video_orientation_get_vflip
function.description: Get the vertical flipping state (%TRUE for flipped) from the given object.
function.return: %TRUE in case the element supports flipping

function.name: gst_video_orientation_set_hcenter
function.description: Set the horizontal centering offset for the given object.
function.return: %TRUE in case the element supports centering

function.name: gst_video_orientation_set_hflip
function.description: Set the horizontal flipping state (%TRUE for flipped) for the given object.
function.return: %TRUE in case the element supports flipping

function.name: gst_video_orientation_set_vcenter
function.description: Set the vertical centering offset for the given object.
function.return: %TRUE in case the element supports centering

function.name: gst_video_orientation_set_vflip
function.description: Set the vertical flipping state (%TRUE for flipped) for the given object.
function.return: %TRUE in case the element supports flipping

function.name: gst_video_overlay_composition_add_rectangle
function.description: Adds an overlay rectangle to an existing overlay composition object. This must be done right after creating the overlay composition.

parameter.name: rectangle
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstVideoOverlayRectangle to add to the composition

function.name: gst_video_overlay_composition_blend
function.description: Blends the overlay rectangles in @comp on top of the raw video data contained in @video_buf. The data in @video_buf must be writable and mapped appropriately.

parameter.name: video_buf
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstVideoFrame containing raw video data in a supported format

function.name: gst_video_overlay_composition_copy
function.description: Makes a copy of @comp and all contained rectangles, so that it is possible to modify the composition and contained rectangles (e.g. add additional rectangles or change the render co-ordinates or render dimension). The actual overlay pixel data buffers contained in the rectangles are not copied.
function.return: a new #GstVideoOverlayComposition equivalent to @comp.

function.name: gst_video_overlay_composition_get_rectangle
function.description: Returns the @n-th #GstVideoOverlayRectangle contained in @comp.

parameter.name: n
parameter.parameter_description: number of the rectangle to get

function.return: the @n-th rectangle, or NULL if @n is out of bounds. Will not return a new reference, the caller will need to obtain her own reference using gst_video_overlay_rectangle_ref() if needed.

function.name: gst_video_overlay_composition_get_seqnum
function.description: Returns the sequence number of this composition. Sequence numbers are monotonically increasing and unique for overlay compositions and rectangles (meaning there will never be a rectangle with the same sequence number as a composition).
function.return: the sequence number of @comp

function.name: gst_video_overlay_composition_make_writable
function.description: Takes ownership of @comp and returns a version of @comp that is writable (i.e. can be modified). Will either return @comp right away, or create a new writable copy of @comp and unref @comp itself. All the contained rectangles will also be copied, but the actual overlay pixel data buffers contained in the rectangles are not copied.
function.return: a writable #GstVideoOverlayComposition equivalent to @comp.

function.name: gst_video_overlay_composition_n_rectangles
function.description: Returns the number of #GstVideoOverlayRectangle<!-- -->s contained in @comp.
function.return: the number of rectangles

function.name: gst_video_overlay_composition_new
function.description: Creates a new video overlay composition object to hold one or more overlay rectangles.

parameter.name: rectangle
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstVideoOverlayRectangle to add to the composition

function.return: a new #GstVideoOverlayComposition. Unref with gst_video_overlay_composition_unref() when no longer needed.

function.name: gst_video_overlay_composition_ref
function.description:
Increases the refcount of the given composition by one.
Note that the refcount affects the writeability of @comp, use gst_video_overlay_composition_make_writable() to ensure a composition and its rectangles can be modified.
function.return: @comp

function.name: gst_video_overlay_composition_unref
function.description: Decreases the refcount of the composition. If the refcount reaches 0, the composition will be freed.

function.name: gst_video_overlay_expose
function.description: Tell an overlay that it has been exposed. This will redraw the current frame in the drawable even if the pipeline is PAUSED.

function.name: gst_video_overlay_got_window_handle
function.description:
This will post a "have-window-handle" element message on the bus.
This function should only be used by video overlay plugin developers.

parameter.name: handle
parameter.parameter_description: a platform-specific handle referencing the window

function.name: gst_video_overlay_handle_events
function.description: Tell an overlay that it should handle events from the window system. These events are forwarded upstream as navigation events. In some window system, events are not propagated in the window hierarchy if a client is listening for them. This method allows you to disable events handling completely from the #GstVideoOverlay.

parameter.name: handle_events
parameter.parameter_description: a #gboolean indicating if events should be handled or not.

function.name: gst_video_overlay_prepare_window_handle
function.description:
This will post a "prepare-window-handle" element message on the bus to give applications an opportunity to call gst_video_overlay_set_window_handle() before a plugin creates its own window.
This function should only be used by video overlay plugin developers.

parameter.name: overlay
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstVideoOverlay which does not yet have an Window handle set

function.name: gst_video_overlay_rectangle_copy
function.description: Makes a copy of @rectangle, so that it is possible to modify it (e.g. to change the render co-ordinates or render dimension). The actual overlay pixel data buffers contained in the rectangle are not copied.
function.return: a new #GstVideoOverlayRectangle equivalent to @rectangle.

function.name: gst_video_overlay_rectangle_get_flags
function.description: Retrieves the flags associated with a #GstVideoOverlayRectangle. This is useful if the caller can handle both premultiplied alpha and non premultiplied alpha, for example. By knowing whether the rectangle uses premultiplied or not, it can request the pixel data in the format it is stored in, to avoid unnecessary conversion.
function.return: the #GstVideoOverlayFormatFlags associated with the rectangle.

function.name: gst_video_overlay_rectangle_get_global_alpha
function.description: Retrieves the global-alpha value associated with a #GstVideoOverlayRectangle.
function.return: the global-alpha value associated with the rectangle.

function.name: gst_video_overlay_rectangle_get_pixels_argb

parameter.name: flags
parameter.parameter_description: flags If a global_alpha value != 1 is set for the rectangle, the caller should set the #GST_VIDEO_OVERLAY_FORMAT_FLAG_GLOBAL_ALPHA flag if he wants to apply global-alpha himself. If the flag is not set global_alpha is applied internally before returning the pixel-data.

function.return: a #GstBuffer holding the ARGB pixel data with width and height of the render dimensions as per gst_video_overlay_rectangle_get_render_rectangle(). This function does not return a reference, the caller should obtain a reference of her own with gst_buffer_ref() if needed.

function.name: gst_video_overlay_rectangle_get_pixels_ayuv

parameter.name: flags
parameter.parameter_description: flags If a global_alpha value != 1 is set for the rectangle, the caller should set the #GST_VIDEO_OVERLAY_FORMAT_FLAG_GLOBAL_ALPHA flag if he wants to apply global-alpha himself. If the flag is not set global_alpha is applied internally before returning the pixel-data.

function.return: a #GstBuffer holding the AYUV pixel data with width and height of the render dimensions as per gst_video_overlay_rectangle_get_render_rectangle(). This function does not return a reference, the caller should obtain a reference of her own with gst_buffer_ref() if needed.

function.name: gst_video_overlay_rectangle_get_pixels_raw

parameter.name: flags
parameter.parameter_description: flags If a global_alpha value != 1 is set for the rectangle, the caller should set the #GST_VIDEO_OVERLAY_FORMAT_FLAG_GLOBAL_ALPHA flag if he wants to apply global-alpha himself. If the flag is not set global_alpha is applied internally before returning the pixel-data.

function.return: a #GstBuffer holding the pixel data with format as originally provided and specified in video meta with width and height of the render dimensions as per gst_video_overlay_rectangle_get_render_rectangle(). This function does not return a reference, the caller should obtain a reference of her own with gst_buffer_ref() if needed.

function.name: gst_video_overlay_rectangle_get_pixels_unscaled_argb
function.description: Retrieves the pixel data as it is. This is useful if the caller can do the scaling itself when handling the overlaying. The rectangle will need to be scaled to the render dimensions, which can be retrieved using gst_video_overlay_rectangle_get_render_rectangle().

parameter.name: flags
parameter.parameter_description: flags. If a global_alpha value != 1 is set for the rectangle, the caller should set the #GST_VIDEO_OVERLAY_FORMAT_FLAG_GLOBAL_ALPHA flag if he wants to apply global-alpha himself. If the flag is not set global_alpha is applied internally before returning the pixel-data.

function.return: a #GstBuffer holding the ARGB pixel data with #GstVideoMeta set. This function does not return a reference, the caller should obtain a reference of her own with gst_buffer_ref() if needed.

function.name: gst_video_overlay_rectangle_get_pixels_unscaled_ayuv
function.description: Retrieves the pixel data as it is. This is useful if the caller can do the scaling itself when handling the overlaying. The rectangle will need to be scaled to the render dimensions, which can be retrieved using gst_video_overlay_rectangle_get_render_rectangle().

parameter.name: flags
parameter.parameter_description: flags. If a global_alpha value != 1 is set for the rectangle, the caller should set the #GST_VIDEO_OVERLAY_FORMAT_FLAG_GLOBAL_ALPHA flag if he wants to apply global-alpha himself. If the flag is not set global_alpha is applied internally before returning the pixel-data.

function.return: a #GstBuffer holding the AYUV pixel data with #GstVideoMeta set. This function does not return a reference, the caller should obtain a reference of her own with gst_buffer_ref() if needed.

function.name: gst_video_overlay_rectangle_get_pixels_unscaled_raw
function.description: Retrieves the pixel data as it is. This is useful if the caller can do the scaling itself when handling the overlaying. The rectangle will need to be scaled to the render dimensions, which can be retrieved using gst_video_overlay_rectangle_get_render_rectangle().

parameter.name: flags
parameter.parameter_description: flags. If a global_alpha value != 1 is set for the rectangle, the caller should set the #GST_VIDEO_OVERLAY_FORMAT_FLAG_GLOBAL_ALPHA flag if he wants to apply global-alpha himself. If the flag is not set global_alpha is applied internally before returning the pixel-data.

function.return: a #GstBuffer holding the pixel data with #GstVideoMeta set. This function does not return a reference, the caller should obtain a reference of her own with gst_buffer_ref() if needed.

function.name: gst_video_overlay_rectangle_get_render_rectangle
function.description: Retrieves the render position and render dimension of the overlay rectangle on the video.

parameter.name: render_x
parameter.parameter_description: address where to store the X render offset

parameter.name: render_y
parameter.parameter_description: address where to store the Y render offset

parameter.name: render_width
parameter.parameter_description: address where to store the render width

parameter.name: render_height
parameter.parameter_description: address where to store the render height

function.return: TRUE if valid render dimensions were retrieved.

function.name: gst_video_overlay_rectangle_get_seqnum
function.description:
Returns the sequence number of this rectangle. Sequence numbers are monotonically increasing and unique for overlay compositions and rectangles (meaning there will never be a rectangle with the same sequence number as a composition).
Using the sequence number of a rectangle as an indicator for changed pixel-data of a rectangle is dangereous. Some API calls, like e.g. gst_video_overlay_rectangle_set_global_alpha(), automatically update the per rectangle sequence number, which is misleading for renderers/ consumers, that handle global-alpha themselves. For them the pixel-data returned by gst_video_overlay_rectangle_get_pixels_*() wont be different for different global-alpha values. In this case a renderer could also use the GstBuffer pointers as a hint for changed pixel-data.
function.return: the sequence number of @rectangle

function.name: gst_video_overlay_rectangle_new_raw
function.description: Creates a new video overlay rectangle with ARGB or AYUV pixel data. The layout in case of ARGB of the components in memory is B-G-R-A on little-endian platforms (corresponding to #GST_VIDEO_FORMAT_BGRA) and A-R-G-B on big-endian platforms (corresponding to #GST_VIDEO_FORMAT_ARGB). In other words, pixels are treated as 32-bit words and the lowest 8 bits then contain the blue component value and the highest 8 bits contain the alpha component value. Unless specified in the flags, the RGB values are non-premultiplied. This is the format that is used by most hardware, and also many rendering libraries such as Cairo, for example. The pixel data buffer must have #GstVideoMeta set.

parameter.name: pixels
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstBuffer pointing to the pixel memory

parameter.name: render_x
parameter.parameter_description: the X co-ordinate on the video where the top-left corner of this overlay rectangle should be rendered to

parameter.name: render_y
parameter.parameter_description: the Y co-ordinate on the video where the top-left corner of this overlay rectangle should be rendered to

parameter.name: render_width
parameter.parameter_description: the render width of this rectangle on the video

parameter.name: render_height
parameter.parameter_description: the render height of this rectangle on the video

function.return: a new #GstVideoOverlayRectangle. Unref with gst_video_overlay_rectangle_unref() when no longer needed.

function.name: gst_video_overlay_rectangle_ref
function.description:
Increases the refcount of the given rectangle by one.
Note that the refcount affects the writeability of @comp, use gst_video_overlay_rectangle_copy() to ensure a rectangle can be modified (there is no gst_video_overlay_rectangle_make_writable() because it is unlikely that someone will hold the single reference to the rectangle and not know that that's the case).
function.return: @comp

function.name: gst_video_overlay_rectangle_set_global_alpha
function.description:
Sets the global alpha value associated with a #GstVideoOverlayRectangle. Per- pixel alpha values are multiplied with this value. Valid values: 0 <= global_alpha <= 1; 1 to deactivate.
@rectangle must be writable, meaning its refcount must be 1. You can make the rectangles inside a #GstVideoOverlayComposition writable using gst_video_overlay_composition_make_writable() or gst_video_overlay_composition_copy().

function.name: gst_video_overlay_rectangle_set_render_rectangle
function.description:
Sets the render position and dimensions of the rectangle on the video. This function is mainly for elements that modify the size of the video in some way (e.g. through scaling or cropping) and need to adjust the details of any overlays to match the operation that changed the size.
@rectangle must be writable, meaning its refcount must be 1. You can make the rectangles inside a #GstVideoOverlayComposition writable using gst_video_overlay_composition_make_writable() or gst_video_overlay_composition_copy().

parameter.name: render_x
parameter.parameter_description: render X position of rectangle on video

parameter.name: render_y
parameter.parameter_description: render Y position of rectangle on video

function.name: gst_video_overlay_rectangle_unref
function.description: Decreases the refcount of the rectangle. If the refcount reaches 0, the rectangle will be freed.

function.name: gst_video_overlay_set_render_rectangle
function.description:
Configure a subregion as a video target within the window set by gst_video_overlay_set_window_handle(). If this is not used or not supported the video will fill the area of the window set as the overlay to 100%. By specifying the rectangle, the video can be overlayed to a specific region of that window only. After setting the new rectangle one should call gst_video_overlay_expose() to force a redraw. To unset the region pass -1 for the @width and @height parameters.
This method is needed for non fullscreen video overlay in UI toolkits that do not support subwindows.

parameter.name: x
parameter.parameter_description: the horizontal offset of the render area inside the window

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: the vertical offset of the render area inside the window

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: the width of the render area inside the window

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: the height of the render area inside the window

function.return: %FALSE if not supported by the sink.

function.name: gst_video_overlay_set_window_handle
function.description: This will call the video overlay's set_window_handle method. You should use this method to tell to an overlay to display video output to a specific window (e.g. an XWindow on X11). Passing 0 as the @handle will tell the overlay to stop using that window and create an internal one.

parameter.name: overlay
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstVideoOverlay to set the window on.

function.name: gst_video_resampler_clear
function.description: Clear a previously initialized #GstVideoResampler @resampler.

function.name: gst_video_resampler_new
function.description:
Make a new resampler. @in_size source elements will be resampled to @out_size destination elements.
@n_taps specifies the amount of elements to use from the source for one output element. If n_taps is 0, this function chooses a good value automatically based on the @method and @in_size/@out_size.
function.return: %TRUE on success

function.name: gst_video_scaler_2d

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: the number of output pixels to scale

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: the number of output lines to scale

function.name: gst_video_scaler_combine_packed_YUV
function.description: Combine a scaler for Y and UV into one scaler for the packed @format.

parameter.name: y_scale
parameter.parameter_description: a scaler for the Y component

parameter.name: uv_scale
parameter.parameter_description: a scaler for the U and V components

function.return: a new horizontal videoscaler for @format.

function.name: gst_video_scaler_free
function.description: Free a previously allocated #GstVideoScaler @scale.

function.name: gst_video_scaler_get_coeff
function.description:
For a given pixel at @out_offset, get the first required input pixel at @in_offset and the @n_taps filter coefficients.
Note that for interlaced content, @in_offset needs to be incremented with 2 to get the next input line.
function.return: an array of @n_tap gdouble values with filter coefficients.

function.name: gst_video_scaler_get_max_taps
function.description: Get the maximum number of taps for @scale.
function.return: the maximum number of taps

function.name: gst_video_scaler_horizontal
function.description: Horizontally scale the pixels in @src to @dest, starting from @dest_offset for @width samples.

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: the number of pixels to scale

function.name: gst_video_scaler_new
function.description:
Make a new @method video scaler. @in_size source lines/pixels will be scaled to @out_size destination lines/pixels.
@n_taps specifies the amount of pixels to use from the source for one output pixel. If n_taps is 0, this function chooses a good value automatically based on the @method and @in_size/@out_size.
function.return: a #GstVideoResample

function.name: gst_video_scaler_vertical

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: the number of pixels to scale

function.name: gst_video_sink_center_rect
function.description: Takes @src rectangle and position it at the center of @dst rectangle with or without @scaling. It handles clipping if the @src rectangle is bigger than the @dst one and @scaling is set to FALSE.

parameter.name: result
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to a #GstVideoRectangle which will receive the result area

parameter.name: scaling
parameter.parameter_description: a #gboolean indicating if scaling should be applied or not

function.name: gst_video_tile_get_index
function.description:
Get the tile index of the tile at coordinates @x and @y in the tiled image of @x_tiles by @y_tiles.
Use this method when @mode is of type %GST_VIDEO_TILE_MODE_INDEXED.
function.return: the index of the tile at @x and @y in the tiled image of @x_tiles by @y_tiles.

function.name: gst_vorbis_tag_add
function.description:
Convenience function using gst_tag_from_vorbis_tag(), parsing a vorbis comment string into the right type and adding it to the given taglist @list.
Unknown vorbiscomment tags will be added to the tag list in form of a #GST_TAG_EXTENDED_COMMENT.

parameter.name: tag
parameter.parameter_description: a vorbiscomment tag string (key in key=value), must be valid UTF-8

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: a vorbiscomment value string (value in key=value), must be valid UTF-8

parameter.name: parentprofilename
parameter.parameter_description: the parent profile name (including 'profile-' or 'streamprofile-' header)

parameter.name: profilename
parameter.parameter_description: the profile name group to parse

function.name: read_packet_header
function.description: Read the packet headers for the packet pointed to by @packet.
function.return: TRUE if @packet pointed to a valid header.

function.name: str_case_equal
function.description: Compares @v1 and @v2 in a case-insensitive manner
function.return: %TRUE if they are equal (modulo case)

function.name: str_case_hash
function.description: Hashes @key in a case-insensitive manner.
function.return: the hash code.
